Avian	B-Disease

.	O

Ducks	O
contract	O
avian	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
by	O
eating	O
bacteria	O
in	O
soil	O
that	O
turns	O
toxic	O
in	O
a	O
warm	O
environment	O
with	O
a	O
protein	O
source	O
,	O
said	O
Anne	O
Ballmann	O
,	O
wildlife-disease	O
specialist	O
with	O
the	O
U.S.	O
Geological	O

.	O

She	O
said	O
ducks	O
become	O
``	O
intoxicated	O
''	O
and	O
paralyzed	O
when	O
exposed	O
to	O
the	O
toxin	O
through	O
water	O
that	O
has	O
low	O
oxygen	O
levels	O
or	O
by	O
eating	O
as	O
few	O
as	O
5	O
toxin-ridden	O
maggots	O
.	O

Experts	O
recommend	O
proper	O
disposal	O
of	O
duck	O

to	O
prevent	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Algae	O
blooms	O
can	O
lower	O
oxygen	O
levels	O
in	O
ponds	O
where	O
ducks	O
congregate	O
.	O

die	O
annually	O
in	O
July	O
and	O
August	O
from	O
Type	O

botulism	O
,	O
but	O

said	O

occurs	O
more	O

in	O
California	O
and	O

,	O
where	O
there	O

.	O

Type	O

is	O
not	O

and	O
rarely	O
infects	O
humans	O
,	O
who	O
more	O

A	O
or	O

from	O

processed	O

goods	O
.	O

Laverbread	O

is	O

.	O

resistant	O
varieties	O
and	O
we	O
are	O
yet	O
to	O
understand	O
how	O
the	O
vector	O
thrives	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Osea	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
known	O
to	O
have	O
an	O
incidence	O
rate	O
of	O
20-30	O
percent	O
infection	O
of	O
a	O
whole	O
maize	B-Disease
garden	O
.	O

Experts	O

has	O

yet	O
and	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
little	O
wonder	O

has	O

in	O
Uganda	B-Country
.	O

Historically	O

country	O
seems	O
to	O

time	O

Mamey	O

``	O

''	O

``	O

,	O
''	O

foods	O

.	O

to	O
epidemiologists	O
,	O
the	O
symptoms	O
of	O
Zika	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
are	O
fever	O
,	O
non-purulent	O
conjunctivitis	O
(	O
without	O
pus	O
)	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
joint	O
pain	O
,	O
rash	O
,	O
weakness	O
,	O
and	O
sometimes	O
,	O
pain	O
behind	O
the	O
eyes	O
,	O
swelling	O
of	O
the	O
legs	O
,	O
loss	O
of	O
appetite	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
diarrhea	O

abdominal	O
pain	O
,	O
which	O

4-7	O
days	O
,	O
and	O
so	O
far	O
there	O
are	O
no	O

of	O
any	O

.	O

...	O

State	O
health	O

reported	O
on	O

_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
infection	O
outbreak	O

State	O

.	O

.	O

coli_	O

.	O

the	O

and	O

The	O
Saskatchewan	B-Province
Ministry	O
of	O
Environment	O
announced	O
that	O
a	O
case	O
of	O
chronic	B-Disease
wasting	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
(	O
CWD	O
)	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
for	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
in	O
a	O
Saskatchewan	O
wildlife	O
management	O
zone	O
near	O
Melfort	B-City
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
now	O
confirmed	O
in	O
45	O
of	O
83	O
zones	O
in	O
the	O
province	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
Saskatchewan	B-Province
Ministry	O
of	O
Environment	O
.	O

CWD	O
is	O
a	O
fatal	O
nervous	O
system	O
disease	O
threating	O
deer	O
,	O
elk	O

and	O
caribou	O
.	O

Officials	O
said	O
Wednesday	O
the	O
new	O
case	O
involved	O
a	O
3-year-old	O
elk	O
bull	O
in	O
zone	O
42E	O
,	O
south	O
of	O
Melfort	B-City
.	O

The	O
new	O
case	O
was	O
submitted	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
voluntary	O
CWD	O
surveillance	O
program	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
information	O
obtained	O
from	O
the	O
voluntary	O
testing	O
program	O
is	O
critical	O
to	O
evaluating	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
CWD	O
and	O
guiding	O
our	O
management	O
strategies	O
,	O
''	O
wildlife	O
health	O
specialist	O
Dr.	O
Iga	O
Stasiak	O
said	O
in	O
a	O
press	O

.	O

``	O
Hunters	O
are	O
encouraged	O
to	O
register	O
online	O
before	O
taking	O
their	O
cervid	O
heads	O
to	O
any	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Environment	O
field	O

.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O

,	O
and	O
you	O
will	O
get	O
your	O
results	O

2	O

8	O

.	O
''	O

The	O
disease	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
detected	O
in	O
humans	O
;	O
however	O

from	O
an	O

.	O

[	O
2018	O
]	O

of	O
CWD	O
have	O

in	O
the	O
province	O
.	O

a	O

)	O

66	O
.	O

of	O

,	O

``	O

''	O
.	O

A	O
(	O

)	O

.	O

at	O

.	O

Larimer	B-Province
County	I-Province

that	O

and	O

.	O

bison	O

at	O

at	O
CSU	O
's	O

Campus	O

an	O

.	O

Most	O

.	O

[	O
The	O
infection	O
]	O
is	O

with	O
a	O

test	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O

,	O

important	O
.	O

If	O

may	O

of	O
Barmah	B-Virus
Forest	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease

GP	O
.	O

on	O
1800	O
671	O
738	O
.	O

Tips	O
to	O
protect	O
against	O
mosquitoes	O
:	O
-	O
Avoid	O
mosquito-infested	O
areas	O
,	O
where	O
possible	O
.	O

-	O
Cover	O
up	O
with	O
a	O
loose-fitting	O
,	O
long-sleeved	O
shirt	O
and	O
long	O
pants	O
when	O
outside	O
.	O

-	O
Put	O
mosquito	O
repellent	O
on	O
exposed	O
skin	O
.	O

-	O
Take	O
special	O
care	O
during	O
peak	O
mosquito	O
biting	O
hours	O
,	O
especially	O
around	O
dawn	O
and	O

,	O
and	O
when	O
outdoors	O
or	O
camping	O
.	O

-	O

mosquito	O
breeding	O
sites	O
from	O
around	O
the	O
home	O
,	O
and	O
screen	O
windows	O
and	O
doors	O
.	O

A	O
fresh	O
case	O
of	O
Legionnaire	B-Disease
's	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
has	O
been	O
identified	O
.	O

latest	O
case	O
in	O
Renfrew	B-City
[	O

]	O

.	O

a	O

of	O
the	O

,	O

last	O
month	O
[	O

2013	O
]	O
.	O

They	O
have	O
treated	O
all	O

towers	O
within	O
4	O
miles	O
of	O
patients	O
'	O
homes	O
with	O

to	O
kill	O
any	O
_Legionella_	O
bacteria	O
as	O
a	O

.	O

Health	O

have	O

in	O
Peru	B-Country
's	O
northern	O
Amazon	O
jungle	O
region	O
following	O
the	O
outbreak	O
of	O
a	O
``	O
very	O
aggressive	O
''	O
dengue	B-Virus
strain	O
that	O
has	O
killed	O
14	O
people	O
and	O
sickened	O
thousands	O
.	O

Dengue	B-Virus
is	O
endemic	O
to	O
the	O
jungle	O
region	O
,	O
but	O
until	O
now	O
,	O
Peru	B-Country
has	O
largely	O
dealt	O
with	O
the	O
American	O
strain	O
of	O
the	O
disease.	O
``	O

a	O
new	O

that	O
we	O
did	O
not	O
know	O
in	O
Peru	B-Country
and	O
that	O

entered	O
from	O
Brazil	O

the	O
Amazon	O
,	O
''	O
health	O

Oscar	O

told	O
local	O
reporters	O
.	O

About	O
13	O
000	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
,	O
and	O
at	O
least	O
1600	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
hospitalised	O
for	O
treatment	O
,	O
a	O
health	O
official	O
in	O
Loreto	O
,	O
in	O
north-eastern	O
Peru	B-Country
,	O
told	O
AFP	O
.	O

A	O
senior	O
Loreto	O
health	O
official	O
,	O
Hugo	O
Rodriguez	O
,	O
says	O
this	O
dengue	B-Virus
strain	O
is	O
known	O
as	O
the	O
Asian-American	O
variety	O
and	O
,	O
unlike	O
the	O
American	O
variety	O
,	O
produces	O
severe	O
shock	O
among	O
victims	O
.	O

``	O

is	O
a	O
combination	O
of	O
both	O
varieties	O
,	O
''	O
Mr	O
Rodriguez	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
can	O
result	O
in	O
deadly	O
fevers	O
,	O
especially	O
among	O
children	O
:	O
Half	O
of	O
those	O
killed	O
were	O
minors	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
in	O
Iquitos	O
,	O
Peru	B-Country
's	O
main	O
city	O
on	O
the	O
Amazon	O
River	O
,	O
located	O
1000	O
km	O
[	O
621	O
mi	O
]	O
north	O
of	O
Lima	O
,	O
have	O
launched	O
a	O
fumigation	O
program	O
in	O
an	O
attempt	O
to	O
diminish	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

``	O

encephalitis	I-Disease

in	O

''	O
Dr	O
SK	O
Shahi	O
,	O

.	O

This	O
is	O

1st	O

the	O
district	O
this	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

[	O

]	O
,	O

to	O

.	O

at	O
the	O

district	O
,	O
while	O
21	O

the	O

.	O

AES	O
is	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
causes	O
flu-like	O
symptoms	O
such	O
as	O
high	O
fever	O

,	O
and	O
,	O
in	O
extreme	O
cases	O

,	O
seizure	O
,	O
and	O
inflammation	O
of	O
the	O
heart	O
and	O
kidney	O
.	O

A	O
total	O
of	O
5	O
people	O
have	O
fallen	O
ill	O
with	O
mumps	B-Virus
at	O
Kamaile	O
Academy	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
are	O
2	O
additional	O
suspect	O
cases	O
,	O

's	O

early	O

extend	O

5	O

.	O

said	O
winter	O

in	O
Waianae	B-City
would	O

and	O

through	O
.	O

said	O

2	O

early	O
and	O

by	O
a	O

``	O

to	O

past	O

''	O
for	O
mumps	B-Virus
.	O

So	O

2017	O
,	O

.	O

on	O
Oahu	O
.	O

2017	O
's	O
outbreak	O
is	O
by	O
far	O
the	O
largest	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
Hawaii	B-Province
has	O
seen	O
in	O
decades	O
.	O

In	O
all	O
of	O
2016	O
,	O
Hawaii	B-Province
saw	O
just	O
10	O
total	O
cases	O
of	O
mumps	B-Virus
.	O

To	O

growing	O

of	O
mumps	B-Virus
,	O

state	O
is	O
recommending	O
more	O
people	O
get	O

,	O
even	O
if	O
they	O
've	O
already	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
before	O
.	O

While	O

spreads	O
easily	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
mostly	O
preventable	O
with	O
a	O
2-dose	O

.	O

However	O

say	O
mumps	B-Virus
cases	O
this	O
year	O
have	O
been	O
seen	O
in	O
vaccinated	O
and	O
unvaccinated	O
individuals	O
.	O

Hawaii	B-Province
has	O
seen	O
an	O
influx	O
of	O
mumps	B-Virus
cases	O
since	O
March	O
2017	O
,	O
when	O
the	O
Health	O
Department	O
was	O
made	O
aware	O
of	O
9	O
people	O
with	O
the	O
viral	O
infection	O
.	O

Some	O
people	O
with	O
mumps	B-Virus
have	O
very	O
mild	O
or	O
no	O
symptoms	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
not	O
considered	O
life-threatening	O
,	O
but	O
there	O
are	O
some	O
prominent	O

,	O
especially	O
the	O

of	O
one	O

both	O

.	O

)	O

.	O

such	O
as	O
blurred	O
or	O
double	O
vision	O
,	O
difficulty	O
in	O
swallowing	O
and	O
speaking	O
and/or	O
inflammation	O
at	O
the	O
injection	O
site	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
important	O
for	O
injecting	O
drug	O
users	O
to	O
engage	O
with	O
the	O
wide	O
range	O
of	O
services	O
we	O
offer	O
designed	O
to	O
help	O
them	O
tackle	O
their	O
addictions	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
for	O
those	O
who	O
continue	O
to	O
inject	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
extremely	O
important	O
that	O
they	O
seek	O
urgent	O
medical	O
help	O
if	O
they	O
show	O
these	O
early	O
symptoms	O
.	O

Heroin	O
users	O
should	O
avoid	O
injecting	O
heroin	O
into	O
their	O
muscles	O
.	O

Injecting	O
heroin	O
into	O
a	O
vein	O
or	O
smoking	O
can	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
botulism	B-Disease
,	O
although	O
not	O
using	O
heroin	O
at	O
all	O
is	O
by	O
far	O
the	O
best	O
course	O
of	O
action	O
.	O
''	O

[	O

]	O

Pennsylvania	B-Province
in	O
2012	O
.	O

Chronic	B-Disease
wasting	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
attacks	O
the	O
brain	O
of	O
infected	O
deer	O
,	O

,	O
and	O
moose	O
.	O

The	O

and	O

is	O
no	O

or	O

the	O
disease	O
.	O

Avian	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
is	O
thought	O
to	O
have	O
killed	O
around	O
80	O
birds	O
in	O
the	O
Piako	O
River	O
in	O
Waikato	B-Province
and	O
more	O
than	O
150	O
are	O
displaying	O

of	O
the	O

disease	O
.	O

Gulls	O
,	O
black	O

,	O
grey	O

,	O

ducks	O
,	O

,	O

are	O

of	O
the	O
species	O
so	O
far	O
claimed	O
by	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Auckland	O
Waikato	B-Province
Fish	O
&	O
Game	O
has	O
planned	O
an	O
operation	O
to	O
stem	O
the	O
outbreak	O
near	O
the	O
river	O
's	O
outlet	O
into	O
the	O
Firth	O
of	O
Thames	O
.	O

The	O
botulism	O
is	O
a	O
form	O
of	O
food	O
poisoning	O
caused	O
in	O
water	O
birds	O
by	O
hot	O
weather	O
releasing	O
toxins	O
from	O
dead	O
weeds	O
or	O
other	O
pollutants	O
in	O
shallow	O
,	O
still	O
water	O
.	O

The	O
toxin	O
causes	O
birds	O
to	O
lose	O
control	O
of	O
their	O
head	O
and	O
necks	O
before	O
the	O
paralysis	O
spreads	O
to	O
the	O
rest	O
of	O
their	O
bodies	O
.	O

Fish	O
&	O
Game	O
southern	O
gamebird	O
manager	O
David	O
Klee	O
said	O
the	O
symptoms	O
exhibited	O
by	O
birds	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
were	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
it	O
was	O
impossible	O
to	O
accurately	O
establish	O
how	O
many	O
birds	O
have	O
died	O
because	O
the	O
site	O
was	O
subject	O
to	O
large	O
tidal	O
movements	O
which	O
may	O
have	O
washed	O
dead	O
or	O
dying	O
birds	O
out	O
into	O
the	O
Firth	O
of	O
Thames	O
,	O

&	O

's	O

.	O

``	O

''	O

China	B-Country
's	O
National	O
Health	O
Commission	O
(	O
NHC	O
)	O
has	O
urged	O
local	O

to	O

for	O
the	O
coronavirus	B-Virus
at	O
major	O
wholesale	O
markets	O
that	O
can	O
cover	O
extensive	O

areas	O
,	O
especially	O
those	O
with	O
stands	O
selling	O

and	O

and	O

,	O

comes	O

China	B-Country
's	O
capital	O
city	O
Beijing	B-City
reported	O
in	O
early	O

[	O
2020	O
]	O
a	O

of	O
coronavirus	B-Virus
infections	I-Disease
that	O

around	O
a	O
major	O

market	O
.	O

Local	O

in	O

of	O
coronavirus	B-Virus

and	O
prevention	O
must	O
collect	O

from	O
major	O

,	O
especially	O
those	O

and	O

,	O
for	O

.	O

can	O

once	O
a	O
month	O
.	O

at	O

that	O

,	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

China	B-Country
has	O
already	O

on	O
imported	O

and	O

.	O

is	O

.	O

Meningococcal	B-Disease
meningitis	I-Disease
is	O
a	O

form	O
of	O

,	O
a	O

infection	O
of	O

.	O

meningitis	I-Disease
is	O
fatal	O
in	O
[	O

than	O
]	O
50	O
percent	O
of	O

and	O

(	O

review	O
any	O

.	O

for	O

NCoV	O
should	O
be	O
considered	O
in	O

with	O
unexplained	O

complicated	O
respiratory	O
illness	O

to	O

in	O
persons	O
traveling	O
from	O
or	O
resident	O
in	O
areas	O
of	O
the	O
world	O

to	O
be	O
affected	O
.	O

SARI	O
or	O

in	O

workers	O
should	O

,	O

of	O
where	O

the	O
world	O
they	O
occur	O
.	O

All	O
MS	O
are	O
reminded	O
to	O
promptly	O
assess	O
and	O
notify	O
WHO	O
of	O
any	O
new	O
case	O
or	O
clusters	O
of	O
cases	O
with	O
NCoV	O
infection	O
.	O

WHO	O
does	O
not	O
advise	O
special	O
screening	O
at	O
points	O
of	O
entry	O
with	O
regard	O
to	O
this	O
event	O
nor	O
does	O
it	O
recommend	O
that	O
any	O
travel	O
or	O
trade	O
restrictions	O
be	O
applied	O
.	O

WHO	O
continues	O
to	O
closely	O
monitor	O
the	O
situation	O
.	O

Black	O
tar	O
heroin	O
use	O
is	O
believed	O
to	O
be	O
linked	O
to	O
3	O
recent	O
suspected	O
cases	O
of	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
,	O
the	O
L.A.	O
County	O
Department	O
of	O
Public	O
Health	O
reported	O
.	O

No	O
further	O
details	O
were	O
released	O
.	O

Drug	O
users	O
who	O
inject	O
heroin	O
under	O
their	O
skin	O
or	O
into	O
a	O
muscle	O
are	O
at	O
risk	O
of	O
contracting	O
the	O
illness	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
public	O
health	O
officials	O
.	O

This	O
comes	O
after	O
a	O
recent	O
outbreak	O
of	O
heroin-caused	O
botulism	O
in	O
San	O
Diego	O
.	O

Three	O
men	O
there	O
contracted	O
botulism	O
after	O
injecting	O
black	O
tar	O
heroin	O
over	O
the	O
span	O
of	O
a	O
month	O
,	O
the	O
San	O
Diego	O
County	O
Health	O
and	O
Human	O
Services	O
Agency	O
reported	O
in	O
April	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
.	O

Wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
bacterium	O
which	O
gets	O
into	O
a	O
wound	O
and	O
creates	O
a	O
toxin	O
which	O
attacks	O
a	O
body	O
's	O
nerves	O
and	O
can	O
lead	O
to	O
muscle	O
weakness	O
and	O
even	O
death	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
CDC	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
mistaken	O
for	O
an	O
overdose	O
,	O
can	O
include	O
drooping	O
eyelids	O
,	O
blurred	O
vision	O
,	O
difficulty	O
speaking	O
,	O
difficulty	O
swallowing	O
,	O
trouble	O
breathing	O
,	O
and	O
shortness	O
of	O
breath	O
.	O

Anyone	O
who	O
notices	O
these	O
symptoms	O
should	O
check	O
into	O
an	O
emergency	O
room	O
immediately	O
.	O

A	O
diphtheria	B-Disease
outbreak	O
has	O
killed	O
84	O
people	O
in	O
war-torn	O
Yemen	B-Country
since	O
late	O
October	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
,	O

to	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
(	O
WHO	O
)	O
on	O
.	O

In	O
a	O

,	O
the	O
UN	O
agency	O
said	O
some	O
1516	O
suspected	O
cases	O
of	O

have	O
been	O
registered	O
in	O
20	O
of	O
Yemen	B-Country
's	O
23	O
provinces	O
.	O

It	O
listed	O
Ibb	B-Province
and	O
al-Hodeidah	B-Province
provinces	O
in	O
central	O
and	O

Yemen	B-Country
as	O

.	O

.	O

Yemen	B-Country

2014	O
,	O
when	O

``	O

.	O
''	O

A	O

.	O

The	O

Professionals	O
Association	O
(	O
SPA	O
)	O
in	O
Northern	B-Province
State	I-Province
reported	O
a	O

of	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

In	O
a	O

,	O
the	O

.	O

The	O
SPA	O

that	O

situation	O
will	O

in	O
light	O
of	O
the	O

season	O
and	O

.	O

The	O
FDA	O
has	O
sent	O
a	O
Fresh	O
Express	O
_Cyclosporia_	O
warning	O
letter	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
investigation	O
into	O
the	O
multistate	O
foodborne	O
illness	O
outbreak	O
of	O
cyclosporiasis	B-Disease
in	O
the	O
summer	O
of	O
2020	O
.	O

The	O
outbreak	O
sickened	O
at	O
least	O
701	O
people	O
in	O
14	O
states	O
.	O

The	O
CDC	O
and	O
the	O
FDA	O
determined	O
that	O
Fresh	O
Express	O
bagged	O
salad	O
mixes	O
that	O
contained	O
iceberg	O
lettuce	O
,	O
carrots	O
,	O
and	O
red	O
cabbage	O
was	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
this	O
outbreak	O
.	O

There	O
was	O
also	O
a	O
Fresh	O
Express	O
_Cyclospora_	O
outbreak	O
in	O
2018	O
associated	O
with	O
McDonald	O
's	O
salads	O
that	O
sickened	O
more	O
than	O
500	O
people	O
.	O

The	O
product	O
in	O
question	O
was	O
manufactured	O
at	O
the	O
company	O
's	O
facility	O
in	O
Streamwood	O
,	O
Illinois	O
.	O

The	O
presence	O
of	O
_Cyclospora	O
cayetanensis_	O
in	O
the	O
bagged	O
salads	O
cause	O
them	O
to	O
be	O
adulterated	O
per	O
the	O
Federal	O
Food	O
,	O
Drug	O
,	O
and	O
Cosmetic	O
Act	O
.	O

Because	O
the	O
only	O
known	O
reservoir	O
of	O
this	O
parasite	O
is	O
in	O
the	O
human	O
gut	O
,	O
that	O
means	O
that	O
the	O
product	O
has	O
been	O
in	O
direct	O
or	O
indirect	O
contamination	O
with	O
human	O
feces	O
.	O

The	O
FDA	O
inspected	O
the	O
Streamwood	O
facility	O
and	O
issued	O
a	O
Form	O
FDA	O
483	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
filed	O
when	O
the	O
government	O
finds	O
violations	O
of	O
food	O
safety	O
regulations	O
.	O

The	O
government	O
found	O
that	O
the	O
company	O
tested	O
for	O
the	O
parasite	O
but	O
stated	O
that	O
``	O
this	O
testing	O
was	O
not	O
performed	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
your	O
verification	O
activities	O
for	O
the	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
hazard	O
of	O
_Cyclospora	O
cayetanensis_	O
,	O
but	O
rather	O
to	O
better	O
understand	O
the	O
parasite	O
and	O
potential	O
control	O
mechanisms	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
FDA	O
said	O
that	O
the	O
company	O
should	O
reanalyze	O
their	O
Food	O
Safety	O
Plan	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
the	O
preventive	O
controls	O
and	O
grower/harvester	O
verification	O
activities	O
are	O
enough	O
to	O
ensure	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
parasite	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
the	O
FDA	O
experienced	O
delays	O
in	O
Fresh	O
Express	O
's	O
response	O
to	O
requests	O
for	O
documents	O
used	O
in	O
the	O
traceback	O
investigation	O
.	O

It	O
took	O
a	O
week	O
after	O
the	O
FDA	O
asked	O
Fresh	O
Express	O
to	O
recall	O
the	O
product	O
and	O
share	O
tracing	O
information	O
for	O
them	O
to	O
comply	O
.	O

Fresh	O
Express	O
also	O
needs	O
to	O
improve	O
traceability	O
systems	O
and	O
processes	O
,	O
along	O
with	O
the	O
speed	O
and	O
accuracy	O
by	O
which	O
the	O
company	O
complies	O
with	O
records	O
and	O
information	O
requested	O
by	O
the	O
government	O
.	O

The	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
(	O
WHO	O
)	O
warned	O
that	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
people	O
affected	O
by	O
Ebola	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
[	O
disease	O
;	O
EVD	O
]	O
could	O
rise	O
to	O
20	O
000	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
9	O
months	O
and	O
a	O
projected	O
half	O
a	O

to	O

``	O

.	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O

that	O

a	O

1552	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

The	O
government	O
official	O
gave	O
details	O
on	O
disease	O
patterns	O
of	O
contamination	O
,	O
saying	O
``	O
there	O
are	O
2	O

.	O

The	O
1st	O

animals	O

.	O

is	O
from	O
a	O

dead	O
person	O
to	O
another	O
healthy	O
person	O

including	O

.	O
''	O

The	O

was	O
detected	O
for	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
in	O
humans	O
in	O
1970	O
in	O

.	O

3rd	O

has	O

in	O
the	O
Central	B-Country
African	I-Country
Republic	I-Country
.	O

The	O
1st	O
time	O
was	O
in	O
Mbomou	B-Province
in	O
2001	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
2nd	O

in	O
Haute	O
Kotto	O
in	O
2014.	O
from	O
the	O
2010	O
cases	O
.	O

to	O
which	O
clade	O
the	O
current	O

,	O

which	O
wild	O
animals	O
are	O

in	O
the	O
Central	B-Country
African	I-Country
Republic	I-Country
.	O

for	O

.	O

A	O

(	O

)	O

3337	O

,	O

Community	O

(	O

.	O

is	O

(	O

)	O

''	O
a	O

.	O

[	O

]	O

_E	O
.	O

coli_	O

.	O

We	O

a	O

.	O

a	O

.	O

patient	O

28	O

2018	O

.	O

Butte	B-City
County	I-City
Public	O
Health	O
Department	O
(	O
BCPHD	O
)	O
is	O
investigating	O
a	O
case	O
of	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
in	O
a	O
Butte	O
County	O
resident	O
who	O
injected	O
black	O
tar	O
heroin	O
.	O

Laboratory	O
testing	O
to	O
confirm	O
the	O
diagnosis	O
is	O
pending	O
.	O

The	O
patient	O
remains	O
hospitalized	O
and	O
on	O
a	O
ventilator	O
.	O

The	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
heroin	O
is	O
unknown	O
at	O
this	O
time	O
.	O

Black	O
tar	O
heroin	O
has	O
been	O
linked	O
to	O
other	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
outbreaks	O
in	O
injection	O
drug	O
users	O
,	O
so	O
there	O
is	O
concern	O
that	O
locally	O
available	O
black	O
tar	O
heroin	O
may	O
be	O
contaminated	O
.	O

An	O
average	O
of	O
10	O
cases	O
of	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
are	O
reported	O
each	O
year	O
in	O
California	B-Province
.	O

Wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
occurs	O
when	O
a	O
wound	O
becomes	O
infected	O
with	O
_Clostridium	O
botulinum_	O
(	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
foodborne	O
botulism	O
)	O
or	O
a	O
closely	O
related	O
_Clostridium_	O
bacterium	O
.	O

The	O
bacteria	O
multiply	O
in	O
the	O
wound	O
and	O
create	O
a	O
toxin	O
that	O
acts	O
on	O
the	O
nerves	O
.	O

Most	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
all	O
,	O
people	O
with	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
will	O
have	O
a	O
visibly	O
infected	O
wound	O
.	O

Persons	O
injecting	O
black	O
tar	O
heroin	O
into	O
their	O
muscles	O
(	O
``	O
muscling	O
''	O
)	O
or	O
under	O
their	O
skin	O
(	O
``	O
skin	O
popping	O
''	O
)	O
are	O
at	O
highest	O
risk	O
of	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
.	O

Persons	O
with	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
can	O
not	O
transmit	O
the	O
illness	O
to	O
others	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
occur	O
within	O
days	O
or	O
weeks	O
of	O
injecting	O
contaminated	O
drug	O
and	O
may	O
be	O
mistaken	O
for	O
drug	O
overdose	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
can	O
include	O
weak	O
or	O
drooping	O
eyelids	O
,	O
blurred	O
or	O
double	O
vision	O
,	O
dry	O
mouth	O
,	O
sore	O
throat	O
,	O
slurred	O
speech	O
,	O
trouble	O
swallowing	O
,	O
difficulty	O
breathing	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
progressive	O
symmetric	O
paralysis	O
that	O
begins	O
at	O
the	O
face	O
and	O
head	O
and	O
travels	O
down	O
the	O
body	O
.	O

If	O
left	O
untreated	O
,	O
symptoms	O
may	O
progress	O
to	O
paralysis	O
of	O
the	O
respiratory	O
muscles	O
,	O
arms	O
,	O
legs	O
,	O
and	O
trunk	O
with	O
subsequent	O
death	O
.	O

Prompt	O
diagnosis	O
and	O
treatment	O
is	O
critical	O
to	O
decreasing	O
the	O
severity	O
and	O
duration	O
of	O
illness	O
.	O

Any	O
injection	O
drug	O
users	O
with	O
symptoms	O
of	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
should	O
seek	O
medical	O
attention	O
immediately	O
at	O
the	O
nearest	O
emergency	O
room	O
.	O

Wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
is	O
treated	O
with	O
antitoxin	O
that	O
must	O
be	O
requested	O
on	O
a	O
case	O
by	O
case	O
basis	O
from	O
the	O
CDC	O
through	O
the	O
state	O
health	O
department	O
.	O

The	O
Camden	O
County	O
Health	O
Department	O
announced	O
that	O
a	O
horse	O
in	O
Waverly	B-City
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
Eastern	B-Virus
Equine	I-Virus
Encephalitis	I-Virus
(	O
EEE	O
)	O
.	O

EEE	O
is	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
virus	O
that	O
causes	O
swelling	O
of	O
the	O
brain	O
and	O
is	O
fatal	O
in	O
horses	O
70	O
-	O
90	O
percent	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
health	O
department	O
,	O
horse	O
and	O
large	O
animal	O
owners	O
are	O
encouraged	O
to	O
vaccinate	O
their	O
animals	O
against	O
the	O
virus	O
and	O
to	O
clean	O
out	O
watering	O
sources	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
buckets	O
and	O
troughs	O
,	O
every	O
3	O
to	O
4	O
days	O
to	O
prevent	O
mosquitoes	O
from	O
breeding	O
there	O
.	O

The	O
primary	O
mosquito	O
that	O
transmits	O
EEE	O
breeds	O
in	O
freshwater	O
swamps	O
.	O

No	O
human	O
cases	O
of	O
disease	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
in	O
Georgia	B-Province
this	O
year	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
;	O
however	O
,	O
humans	O
are	O
susceptible	O
to	O
EEE	O
.	O

All	O
residents	O
are	O
also	O
encouraged	O
to	O
use	O
EPA-registered	O
insect	O
repellents	O
containing	O
20	O
-	O
30	O
percent	O
DEET	O
,	O
Picaridin	O
,	O
IR3535	O
,	O
or	O
Oil	O
of	O
Lemon	O

to	O
protect	O
themselves	O
from	O
mosquitoes	O
and	O
to	O
get	O
rid	O
of	O
standing	O
water	O
around	O
the	O
home	O
and	O
in	O
the	O
yard	O
where	O
mosquitoes	O
can	O
breed	O
.	O

Remember	O
the	O
5Ds	O
of	O
mosquito	O
bite	O
prevention	O
can	O
also	O
help	O
prevent	O
mosquito	O
bites	O
and	O
breeding	O
:	O
-	O
Dusk/Dawn	O
-	O
Avoid	O

and	O
dawn	O
activities	O
during	O
the	O
summer	O
when	O
mosquitoes	O
are	O
most	O
active	O
.	O

-	O
Dress	O
-	O
Wear	O
loose-fitting	O
,	O
long	O

shirts	O
and	O
pants	O
to	O
reduce	O

amount	O
of	O

.	O

-	O
DEET	O
-	O
Cover	O
exposed	O
skin	O
with	O
an	O
insect	O
repellent	O
containing	O
the	O
DEET	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
effective	O

against	O

bites	O
.	O

-	O
Drain	O
-	O
Empty	O
any	O
containers	O
holding	O
standing	O
water	O
-	O
buckets	O
,	O
barrels	O
,	O
flower	O
pots	O
,	O
tarps	O
-	O
because	O
they	O
are	O
breeding	O
grounds	O
for	O
virus-carrying	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

-	O
Doors	O
-	O
Make	O

doors	O
and	O
windows	O
are	O
in	O
good	O

and	O
fit	O
tightly	O
,	O

torn	O
or	O

to	O

mosquitoes	O
out	O
of	O
the	O
house	O
.	O

Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
is	O
an	O
acute	O
viral	O
hemorrhagic	O
illness	O
,	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
food	O
or	O
household	O
items	O
contaminated	O
by	O
infected	O
rodents	O
.	O

Cundinamarca	B-Province
alert	O
for	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
avian	O
virus	O
that	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

The	O
Health	O
Ministry	O
warned	O
that	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
cases	O
of	O
Newcastle	B-Virus
disease	I-Virus
in	O
the	O
municipalities	O
of	O
FÃ³meque	B-City
and	O
CÃ¡queza	B-City
.	O

Red	O
eye	O
or	O
eye	O
discharge	O
,	O
itching	O
,	O
or	O
burning	O
are	O
the	O
main	O
symptoms	O
of	O
Newcastle	B-Virus
disease	I-Virus
in	O
humans	O
.	O

Authorities	O
make	O
recommendations	O
for	O
prevent	O
contagion	O
.	O

On	O
Tue	O
22	O
Jan	O
2018	O
,	O
the	O
country	O
woke	O
up	O
to	O
the	O
news	O
of	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
the	O
little	O
known	O
viral	O
disease	O
,	O
Newcastle	B-Virus
disease	I-Virus
,	O
which	O
is	O
highly	O
contagious	O
for	O
humans	O
and	O
is	O
transmitted	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
sick	O
birds	O
.	O

The	O
alarm	O
was	O
reported	O
by	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
of	O
Cundinamarca	B-Province
after	O
registering	O
cases	O
of	O
Newcastle	B-Virus
disease	I-Virus
in	O
the	O
municipalities	O
of	O
FÃ³meque	B-City
and	O
CÃ¡queza	B-City
.	O

Authorities	O
issued	O
a	O
statement	O
with	O
recommendations	O
to	O
learn	O
more	O
about	O
the	O
disease	O
and	O
to	O
prevent	O
further	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

In	O
avians	O
,	O
Newcastle	B-Virus
disease	I-Virus
may	O
cause	O
acute	O
respiratory	O
symptoms	O
,	O
neck	O
bowing	O
,	O
neurologic	O
signs	O
,	O
and	O
even	O
death	O
.	O

In	O
humans	O
,	O
although	O
the	O
symptoms	O
are	O
milder	O
and	O
more	O
limited	O
,	O
infection	O
results	O
in	O
conjunctivitis	O
,	O
discharge	O
from	O
the	O
eyes	O
,	O
and	O
itching	O
or	O
burning	O
of	O
the	O
eyes	O
.	O

Hence	O
,	O
the	O
MOH	O
advises	O
individuals	O
not	O
to	O
handle	O
birds	O
in	O
commercial	O
farms	O
or	O
in	O
backyards	O
or	O
to	O
consume	O
poultry	O
of	O
unknown	O
origin	O
.	O

Increased	O
hygiene	O
measures	O
in	O
high	O
risk	O
areas	O
is	O
suggested	O
.	O

These	O
include	O
washing	O
hands	O
,	O
changing	O
clothes	O
after	O
contact	O
with	O
poultry	O
,	O
and	O
making	O
sure	O
potable	O
water	O
is	O
consumed	O
.	O

Personal	O
protection	O
measures	O
such	O
as	O
goggles	O
and	O
masks	O
are	O
recommended	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
avoiding	O
handling	O
unprocessed	O
organic	O
fertilizers	O
.	O

Note	O
from	O
the	O
editors	O
:	O
MERS-CoV	B-Virus
--	O
the	O
quest	O
for	O
the	O
reservoir	O
continues	O
Two	O
papers	O
in	O
this	O
last	O
Eurosurveillance	O
issue	O
of	O
2013	O
,	O
one	O
by	O
Reusken	O
et	O
al	O
.	O

and	O
one	O
by	O
Hemida	O
et	O
al	O
.	O

,	O
look	O
into	O
the	O
potential	O
animal	O
reservoir	O
for	O
the	O
Middle	O
East	O
respiratory	O
syndrome	O
(	O
MERS	O
)	O
coronavirus	O
(	O
CoV	O
)	O
.	O

This	O
virus	O
,	O
which	O
emerged	O
in	O
2012	O
and	O
was	O
reported	O
for	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
in	O
September	O
2013	O
,	O
has	O
caused	O
163	O
cases	O
and	O
71	O
deaths	O
as	O
of	O
2	O
Dec	O
2013	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
many	O
questions	O
remain	O
on	O
its	O
origin	O
,	O
reservoir	O
and	O
transmission	O
patterns	O
.	O

The	O
2	O
papers	O
investigate	O
the	O
seroprevalence	O
of	O
antibodies	O
against	O
MERS-CoV	B-Virus
and	O
MERS-like	O
CoV	O
in	O
a	O
similar	O
set	O
of	O
domestic	O
livestock	O
,	O
namely	O
camels	O
,	O
cattle	O
,	O
goats	O
,	O
sheep	O
and	O
chicken	O
,	O
in	O
2	O
different	O
geographic	O
hotspots	O
in	O
Jordan	B-Country
and	O
Saudi	B-Country
Arabia	I-Country
,	O
respectively	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
largest	O
described	O
clusters	O
of	O
MERS	O
have	O
occurred	O
to	O
date	O
.	O

The	O
papers	O
complement	O
each	O
other	O
and	O
support	O
the	O
authors	O
'	O
earlier	O
findings	O
that	O
dromedary	O
camels	O
could	O
be	O
a	O
potential	O
reservoir	O
for	O
MERS-CoV	B-Virus
.	O

The	O
results	O
presented	O
now	O
are	O
compelling	O
evidence	O
that	O
in	O
the	O
studied	O
regions	O
high	O
proportions	O
of	O
dromedary	O
camels	O
are	O
exposed	O
to	O
a	O
MERS-CoV	B-Virus
or	O
MERS-like	O
CoV	O
already	O
in	O
their	O
1st	O
year	O
of	O
life	O
.	O

Hemida	O
at	O
al	O
.	O

conclude	O
that	O
camels	O
could	O
be	O
infected	O
early	O
in	O
life	O
,	O
and	O
Reusken	O
et	O
al	O
.	O

additionally	O
raise	O
the	O
possibility	O
that	O
the	O
serological	O
reactivity	O
early	O
in	O
life	O
could	O
be	O
due	O
to	O
maternal	O
antibodies	O
.	O

While	O

confirm	O

of	O
dromedary	O
camels	O
as	O
MERS-CoV	B-Virus
reservoir	O

do	O
not	O
support	O
a	O

of	O
other	O

in	O

affected	O

in	O

.	O

Neither	O

2	O

in	O

,	O

or	O

.	O

.	O

cause	O
neurological	O
disease	O
and	O
death	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
1st	O
appeared	O
in	O
Croatia	B-Country
in	O
2012	O
and	O
since	O
then	O
38	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
only	O
a	O
small	O
percentage	O
of	O
the	O
infected	O
has	O
been	O
recorded	O
,	O
as	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
usually	O
mild	O
and	O
goes	O
without	O
any	O
symptoms	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
estimated	O
that	O
80	O
percent	O
of	O
infected	O
people	O
have	O
no	O
symptoms	O
while	O
others	O
develop	O
a	O
disease	O
with	O
flu-like	O
symptoms	O
such	O
as	O
high	O
temperature	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
sickness	O
,	O
and	O
vomiting	O
.	O

Only	O
1	O
percent	O
of	O
infected	O
people	O
are	O
hit	O
by	O
a	O
heavy	O
fever	O
that	O
usually	O
leads	O
to	O
meningitis	O
or	O
encephalitis	O
.	O

Abstract	O
Highly	O
pathogenic	O
avian	O
influenza	O
(	O
HPAI	O
)	O
H5N8	O
outbreaks	O
in	O
poultry	O
farms	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
in	O
Asia	O
and	O
Europe	O
since	O
January	O
and	O
November	O
2014	O
,	O
respectively	O
.	O

The	O
entry	O
of	O
HPAI	O
H5N8	O
into	O
Europe	O
and	O
its	O
subsequent	O
spread	O
within	O
Europe	O
are	O
2	O
separate	O
events	O
with	O
possibly	O
different	O
transmission	O
vectors	O
.	O

Following	O
epidemiological	O
investigations	O
of	O
infected	O
poultry	O
holdings	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
not	O
yet	O
a	O
clear	O
indication	O
of	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
no	O
known	O
direct	O
bird	O
migration	O
routes	O
from	O
Asia	O
to	O
western	O
Europe	O
.	O

It	O
has	O
been	O
hypothesised	O
that	O
long-distance	O
transmission	O
of	O
HPAI	O
viruses	O
could	O
occur	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
cross-infection	O
between	O
different	O
birds	O
in	O
north	O
Eurasian	O
breeding	O
areas	O
,	O
but	O
this	O
hypothesis	O
needs	O
further	O
investigation	O
.	O

HPAI	O
H5N8	O
has	O
been	O
detected	O
in	O
wild	O
bird	O
populations	O
in	O
Germany	B-Country
and	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
.	O

Direct	O
contact	O
between	O
wild	O
birds	O
and	O
farmed	O
birds	O
in	O
the	O
affected	O
holdings	O
was	O
unlikely	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
more	O
plausible	O
that	O
indirect	O
introduction	O
of	O
HPAI	O
H5N8	O
to	O
poultry	O
holdings	O
via	O
humans	O
,	O
vehicles	O
,	O
equipment	O
,	O
fomites	O
,	O
live	O
animals	O
and/or	O
animal-derived	O
products	O
contaminated	O
with	O
virus	O
(	O
for	O
instance	O
in	O
faeces	O
)	O
of	O
infected	O
birds	O
took	O
place	O
.	O

Investigations	O
in	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
suggest	O
separate	O
introductions	O
into	O
4	O
holdings	O
and	O
one	O
between-farm	O
transmission	O
.	O

Assessing	O
biosecurity	O
procedures	O
is	O
recommended	O
with	O
a	O
focus	O
on	O
segregation	O
,	O
cleaning	O
and	O
disinfection	O
,	O
and	O
improving	O
where	O
necessary	O
.	O

Given	O
the	O
apparent	O
low	O
pathogenicity	O
of	O
HPAI	O
H5N8	O
for	O
several	O
wild	O
bird	O
species	O
,	O
focused	O
strategic	O
and	O
proportionate	O
enhancement	O
of	O
active	O
and	O
passive	O
surveillance	O
of	O
living	O
and	O
dead	O
wild	O
birds	O
in	O
the	O
high	O
risk	O
areas	O
would	O
improve	O
the	O
understanding	O
of	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
virus	O
transmission	O
to	O
poultry	O
.	O

It	O
might	O
also	O
facilitate	O
the	O
design	O
of	O
targeted	O
measures	O
to	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
virus	O
transmission	O
between	O
poultry	O
and	O
wild	O
birds	O
.	O

Timely	O
updated	O
analyses	O
on	O
the	O
evolving	O
situation	O
within	O
the	O
European	O
Union	O
are	O
required	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
assessment	O
of	O
all	O
transmission	O
routes	O
that	O
might	O
transport	O
HPAI	O
viruses	O
from	O
Asia	O
to	O
Europe	O
.	O

(	O

Ontario	B-Province
,	O
Canada	B-Country
.	O

.	O

horse	O
.	O

In	O
2011	O
,	O
there	O
was	O
1	O
laboratory-confirmed	O
case	O
and	O
1	O
suspect	O
case	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
Ontario	B-Province
.	O

EHV-1	O
infection	O
in	O
horses	O
can	O
cause	O
respiratory	O
disease	O
,	O
abortion	O
,	O
neonatal	O
foal	O
death	O
,	O
and/or	O
neurological	O
disease	O
.	O

Neurological	O
signs	O
include	O
loss	O
of	O
muscle	O
coordination	O
,	O
lethargy	O
,	O
inability	O
to	O
urinate	O
,	O
reduced	O
tail	O
tone	O
and/or	O
head	O
tilt	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
federally	O
reportable	O
disease	O
.	O

EHV-1	O
is	O
easily	O
spread	O
by	O
sharing	O
contaminated	O
equipment	O
,	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
animal	O
carrying	O
the	O
virus	O
,	O
or	O
by	O
the	O
clothing	O
,	O
hands	O
or	O
equipment	O
of	O
visitors	O
to	O
farms	O
who	O
recently	O
had	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
infected	O
horse	O
.	O

The	O
department	O
urged	O
all	O
horse	O
owners	O
to	O
practice	O
vaccination	O
and	O
appropriate	O
biosecurity	O
protocols	O
and	O
procedures	O
for	O
horses	O
and	O
equipment	O
coming	O
on	O
and	O
off	O
farms	O
,	O
particularly	O
if	O
traveling	O
to	O
shows	O
or	O
events	O
.	O

It	O
said	O
current	O
EHV	O
vaccines	O
may	O
reduce	O
viral	O
shedding	O
but	O
are	O
not	O
protective	O
against	O
the	O
neurological	O
form	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Implementing	O
routine	O
biosecurity	O
practices	O
is	O
the	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
minimize	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
this	O
disease	O
,	O
it	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Increased	O
vigilance	O
is	O
needed	O
in	O
the	O
equine	O
industry	O
at	O
this	O
time	O
,	O
''	O
a	O
spokesman	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
In	O
cases	O
of	O
neurological	O
disease	O
,	O
a	O
veterinarian	O
's	O
first	O
obligation	O
is	O
to	O
rule	O
out	O
rabies	O
if	O
the	O
animal	O
dies	O
or	O
is	O
euthanized	O
,	O
by	O
submitting	O
a	O
brain	O
sample	O
to	O
Canadian	O
Food	O
Inspection	O
Agency	O
.	O

Appropriate	O
personal	O
protection	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
gloves	O
and	O
a	O
face	O
shield	O
,	O
should	O
be	O
used	O
when	O
collecting	O
samples	O
.	O
''	O

NDSU	O
's	O
Veterinary	O
Diagnostic	O
Laboratory	O
has	O
confirmed	O
the	O
1st	O
case	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
in	O
the	O
state	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2012	O
]	O
.	O

A	O
beef	O
cow	O
in	O
Stark	B-City
County	I-City
was	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Livestock	O

are	O

to	O

from	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Myxomatosis	B-Disease
is	O

The	O
epidemic	O
situation	O
for	O
rabies	B-Virus
has	O
reached	O
the	O
highest	O
levels	O
of	O
concern	O
in	O
Moscow	B-City
.	O

There	O
were	O
257	O
animal	O
rabies	B-Virus
cases	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2009	O
]	O
,	O
more	O
than	O
10-fold	O
the	O
means	O
of	O
previous	O
years	O
.	O

Rosselkhoznadzor	O
considers	O
taking	O
unprecedented	O
measure	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
epidemic	O
,	O
like	O
banning	O
movements	O
of	O
pets	O
to	O
suburban	O
cottages	O
,	O
canceling	O
a	O
show	O
dog	O
exhibition	O
and	O
mass	O
immunization	O
of	O
wild	O
and	O
domestic	O
animals	O
.	O

The	O
veterinarians	O
say	O
that	O
the	O
situation	O
was	O
worse	O
only	O
during	O
the	O
post-WW2	O
years	O
,	O
when	O
the	O
annual	O
numbers	O
were	O
above	O
2000	O
cases	O
.	O

Only	O
the	O
mass	O
shooting	O
of	O
stray	O
dogs	O
,	O
foxes	O
and	O
raccoon	O
dogs	O
controlled	O
the	O
epidemic	O
,	O
they	O
think	O
.	O

These	O
measures	O
were	O
so	O
effective	O
that	O
almost	O
nobody	O
remembered	O
about	O
rabies	B-Virus
until	O
the	O
late	O
60s	O
.	O

Since	O

,	O
there	O
were	O
only	O

rabies	B-Virus
cases	O
reported	O
.	O

of	O

that	O

from	O
2	O
to	O

of	O
rabies	B-Virus
cases	O
from	O
the	O
1970s	O
until	O
recently	O
,	O
when	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
increased	O
to	O
hundreds	O
.	O

The	O
situation	O
is	O
worst	O
in	O
the	O
North-West	O
of	O
Moscow	B-City
oblast	I-Province
where	O
,	O
the	O
specialists	O
think	O
,	O
the	O

are	O

for	O

rabies	B-Virus

.	O

There	O
are	O
several	O

and	O
nature	O

in	O
this	O

,	O

for	O

animals	O
to	O

in	O
.	O

The	O
water	O

of	O
the	O
animals	O

especially	O
if	O
they	O
are	O
already	O

of	O

of	O

.	O

.	O

Dead	O
blackbirds	O
:	O
Experts	O
suspect	O
virus	O
Conservationists	O
and	O
bird	O
lovers	O
are	O
concerned	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
Rhine-Neckar	B-Province
region	O
,	O
an	O
increasing	O
number	O
of	O
dead	O
blackbirds	O
has	O
been	O
found	O
.	O

The	O
mosquito	O
experts	O
KABS	O
located	O
in	O
Waldsee	O
suspect	O
an	O
African	O
virus	O
as	O
the	O
cause	O
.	O

``	O
One	O
of	O
our	O
staff	O
was	O
able	O
to	O
prove	O
(	O
the	O
existence	O
of	O
)	O
African	O
Usutu	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
in	O
local	O

in	O
our	O
region	O
,	O
''	O
says	O
Norbert	O
Becker	O
,	O
Scientific	O
Director	O
of	O
KABS	O
.	O

Even	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
only	O
a	O
single	O
find	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
conceivable	O
that	O

have	O

the	O
virus	O
to	O
birds	O
.	O

Already	O
in	O
the	O
years	O
2001	O
and	O
2002	O
in	O
Austria	O
there	O
has	O
been	O
an	O

in	O
blackbirds	O

of	O
Usutu	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
.	O

In	O
Italy	O
and	O
Hungary	O
,	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
minor	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
bird	O
disease	O
(	O
Usutu	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
)	O
that	O
is	O
often	O
fatal	O
for	O
blackbirds	O
.	O

For	O
people	O
the	O
virus	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
would	O
be	O
relatively	O
harmless	O
,	O
says	O

.	O

Only	O
in	O
rare	O
cases	O
there	O
might	O
be	O
a	O

fever	O
.	O

The	O
sole	O
evidence	O
of	O
Usutu	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
in	O
the	O
_Culex	O
pipiens_	O
(	O
Common	O
Gnat	O
)	O
that	O
includes	O
sucking	O
blood	O
from	O
birds	O
,	O
is	O
not	O
enough	O
to	O
prove	O
a	O
link	O
between	O
the	O
virus	O
and	O
the	O
dead	O
black	O
birds	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
must	O
be	O
detected	O
in	O
dead	O
birds	O
.	O

Norbert	O
Becker	O
and	O
PhD	O
student	O
Hanna	O
Jost	O
are	O
asking	O
the	O
public	O
to	O

found	O
dead	O
in	O
a	O

and	O

the	O
experts	O
by	O
phone	O
.	O

The	O

birds	O
will	O
be	O
picked	O
up	O
for	O
examination	O
.	O

On	O
20	O
Apr	O

has	O

Alberta	O

a	O

.	O

Little	B-Virus
cherry	I-Virus
disease	I-Disease
is	O
threatening	O
the	O
Washington	B-Province
cherry	O
industry	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
,	O
which	O
results	O
in	O
small	O
,	O
bitter-tasting	O
cherries	O
that	O
are	O
unmarketable	O
,	O
took	O
a	O
big	O
jump	O
in	O
2013	O
,	O
Tim	O
Smith	O
,	O
WSU	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
everyone	O
recognizes	O
how	O
serious	O
it	O
is	O
.	O

We	O
need	O
to	O
jump	O
on	O
it	O
now	O
and	O
get	O
ahead	O
of	O
it	O
before	O
it	O
takes	O
out	O
the	O
industry	O
.	O
''	O

There	O
is	O
no	O

and	O
the	O
only	O
treatment	O
is	O

removal	O
.	O

[	O

]	O
fall	O
,	O

[	O
81	O
ha	O
]	O
of	O

were	O

out	O
.	O

``	O

would	O

another	O
200	O
to	O
400	O
[	O
81-162	O

.	O

The	O
recalled	O
eggs	O
were	O
distributed	O
between	O
August	O
to	O
October	O
2012	O
to	O
stores	O
and	O

located	O
in	O

City	O

,	O

.	O

This	O
product	O

vacuum	O
packed	O
in	O

with	O
6	O
eggs	O
per	O
12.69	O
ounce	O
package	O
,	O

6949682803568	O
.	O

lot	O

,	O
YS12-02C	O
,	O
is	O

on	O
the	O
product	O

.	O

was	O

after	O
it	O
was	O
discovered	O
through	O
NYSDAM	O
Sampling	O
,	O

not	O

to	O

of	O
_Clostridium	O
botulinum_	O
.	O

S	O
&	O

International	O
Inc.	O
reached	O

to	O
recall	O
this	O
product	O
after	O
a	O

.	O

has	O

a	O

Strangles	B-Disease
is	O
an	O
upper-respiratory	O
illness	O
that	O
can	O
cause	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
,	O
nasal	O
discharge	O
,	O
and	O
fevers	O
in	O
horses	O
,	O
donkeys	O
,	O
and	O
mules	O
.	O

While	O
the	O
illness	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
,	O
most	O
animals	O
do	O
survive	O
.	O

It	O
spreads	O
easily	O
through	O
nose-to-nose	O
contact	O
between	O
horses	O
,	O
or	O
even	O
contact	O
with	O
people	O
.	O

This	O
case	O
comes	O
after	O
the	O
racetrack	O
went	O
into	O
lockdown	O
earlier	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
following	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
the	O
contagious	O
disease	O
.	O

Red	O
Shores	O
placed	O
45	O
horses	O
in	O
isolation	O
at	O
that	O
time	O
and	O
tested	O
hundreds	O
of	O
the	O
animals	O
.	O

For	O
this	O
most	O
recent	O
case	O
of	O
strangles	B-Disease
,	O
Drake	O
said	O
Red	O
Shores	O
is	O
still	O
business	O
as	O
usual	O
,	O
but	O
they	O
'll	O
be	O
keeping	O
an	O
eye	O
on	O
other	O
horses	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
they	O
're	O
OK.	O
''	O
The	O
horses	O
that	O
are	O
in	O
that	O
shed	O
row	O
have	O

placed	O
in	O

.	O
''	O

)	O

Defra	O

in	O

had	O

)	O

``	O

,	O

is	O
also	O
rare	O
in	O
this	O

``	O

our	O

into	O
a	O

of	O

in	O

earlier	O
this	O
month	O
[	O
October	O
2012	O
]	O
.	O

We	O
have	O
no	O
reason	O
to	O
believe	O
this	O
disease	O
is	O
widespread	O
in	O
the	O
UK	O
.	O
''	O

EIA	O
is	O
a	O
virus	O
that	O
attacks	O
a	O
horse	O
's	O
immune	O
system	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
passed	O
by	O
biting	O
insects	O
such	O
as	O
horse	O
flies	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
cure	O
,	O
so	O
horses	O
confirmed	O
with	O
EIA	O
are	O
put	O
down	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

H7	B-Virus
avian	I-Virus
influenza	I-Virus
virus	O
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
in	O
a	O
flock	O
of	O
50	O
000	O
layer	O
hens	O
in	O
the	O
lower	O
Hunter	B-City
Valley	I-City
,	O

.	O

property	O
has	O

the	O
birds	O
are	O
being	O

.	O

DPI	O
and	O
the	O
Livestock	O
Health	O
and	O
Pest	O
Authority	O
are	O
continuing	O
surveillance	O
and	O
tracing	O
to	O
confirm	O
the	O
virus	O
has	O
not	O

.	O

is	O

to	O

.	O

Australia	B-Country
has	O
previously	O
had	O
a	O

of	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
AI	O
viruses	O
and	O
all	O
were	O

.	O

The	O
NSW	O
Food	O
Authority	O
has	O
further	O
details	O
and	O
advice	O
.	O

prevent	O

,	O
a	O

now	O

within	O
a	O
10	O

[	O

virus	O
]	O
positive	O
crow	O
is	O
a	O

that	O

is	O
present	O
in	O
our	O

virus	I-Disease
.	O
''	O

Manitoba	B-Province
Agriculture	O
reported	O
that	O
a	O
new	O
strain	O
of	O
clubroot	B-Disease
of	O
canola	O
was	O
positively	O
identified	O
in	O
southern	O
Manitoba	O
near	O
the	O
US	O
border	O
.	O

Outside	O
of	O
Alberta	O
,	O
very	O
few	O
fields	O
have	O
been	O
found	O
to	O
contain	O
novel	O
pathotypes	O
like	O
the	O
one	O
identified	O
,	O
and	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
finding	O
in	O
Manitoba	B-Province
.	O

The	O
new	O
strain	O
is	O
pathotype	O
3A	O
,	O
[	O
which	O
]	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
overcome	O
some	O
1st-generation	O
genetic	O
resistance	O
in	O
commercial	O
cultivars	O
.	O

Traditionally	O
rated	O
``	O
resistant	O
''	O
varieties	O
will	O
not	O
prevent	O
infection	O
[	O
with	O
]	O
this	O
pathotype	O
.	O

Genetic	O
resistance	O
to	O
3A	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
in	O
a	O
small	O
number	O
of	O
commercial	O
varieties	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
long-term	O
sustainability	O
of	O
canola	O
production	O
requires	O
crop	O
rotation	O
,	O
rotation	O
of	O
sources	O
of	O
genetic	O
resistance	O
,	O
[	O
and	O
]	O
good	O
farm	O
biosecurity	O
.	O

[	O
With	O
]	O
resistant	O
varieties	O
,	O
growers	O
need	O
to	O
ensure	O
the	O
resistance	O
is	O
effective	O
against	O
their	O
pathotypes	O
.	O

Under	O
high	O
resting	O
spore	O
loads	O
,	O
symptoms	O
can	O
occur	O
after	O
using	O
the	O
same	O
resistance	O
source	O
2	O
or	O
3	O
times	O
,	O
or	O
even	O
sooner	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
is	O
critically	O
important	O
to	O
limit	O
the	O
pressure	O
we	O
put	O
on	O
resistance	O
by	O
using	O
resistant	O
varieties	O
before	O
spore	O
concentrations	O
are	O
high	O
,	O
extending	O
the	O
break	O
between	O
canola	O
crops	O
and	O
changing	O
resistance	O
sources	O
if	O
necessary	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dan	O
Orchard	O
,	O
Canola	O
Council	O
of	O
Canada	B-Country
.	O

According	O
to	O

(	O

.	O

source	O
:	O
Mainichi	O
[	O
edited	O
]	O
Japan	B-Country
's	O
farm	O
ministry	O
said	O
on	O
that	O
the	O
highly	O
contagious	O
African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
[	O
ASF	O
]	O

from	O
China	O
at	O
a	O

,	O
Sausages	O
in	O
the	O

's	O

at	O
New	O
Chitose	O
Airport	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
the	O
disease	O

to	O

country	O
from	O

.	O

No	O
domestic	O
case	O
of	O
infections	O
with	O
ASF	O
virus	O
has	O
been	O
reported	O
thus	O
far	O
.	O

African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
is	O
regarded	O
as	O
more	O
lethal	O
than	O
[	O
classical	O
]	O
swine	O
fever	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
hog	O
cholera	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
effective	O
vaccine	O
to	O
protect	O
swine	O
from	O
the	O
deadly	O
pig	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
rapid	O
onset	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
was	O
reported	O
in	O
China	O
earlier	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
,	O
and	O
authorities	O
were	O
anxious	O
about	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
the	O
infectious	O
disease	O
spreading	O
to	O
other	O
Asian	O
countries	O
including	O
Japan	B-Country
.	O

The	O
U.N.	O
Food	O
and	O
Agriculture	O
Organization	O
[	O
FAO	O
]	O
has	O
called	O
for	O
regional	O
collaboration	O
including	O
stronger	O
monitoring	O
and	O
preparedness	O
measures	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Agriculture	O
,	O
Forestry	O
and	O
Fisheries	O
Ministry	O
,	O
the	O
passenger	O
arriving	O
on	O
from	O
Beijing	O
was	O
found	O
to	O
have	O
about	O
1.5	O
kilograms	O
of	O
sausages	O
which	O
are	O
prohibited	O
from	O
being	O
brought	O
into	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

The	O
passenger	O
was	O
asked	O
to	O
hand	O
the	O
sausages	O
and	O
they	O
tested	O
positive	O
by	O
the	O
state	O
's	O
genetic	O
test	O
conducted	O
later	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
unclear	O
whether	O
the	O
heat-processed	O
,	O
vacuum-packed	O
sausages	O
contained	O
any	O
pork	O
produced	O
in	O
China	O
,	O
the	O
ministry	O
said	O
[	O
see	O
comment	O
]	O
.	O

China	O
is	O
a	O
major	O
pig	O
producer	O
and	O
accounts	O
for	O
about	O
half	O
the	O
global	O
population	O
of	O
swine	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
FAO	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
unlikely	O
that	O
food	O
infected	O
with	O
African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
virus	O
will	O
cause	O
an	O
outbreak	O
in	O
Japan	B-Country
unless	O
pigs	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
are	O
fed	O
with	O
infected	O
food	O
.	O

Both	O
African	O
and	O
classical	O
swine	O
fevers	O
pose	O
no	O
direct	O
threat	O
to	O
human	O
health	O
as	O
they	O
are	O
diseases	O
of	O
domesticated	O
pigs	O
and	O
wild	O
boars	O
,	O
but	O
infections	O
can	O
be	O
devastating	O
to	O
the	O
farm	O
industry	O
.	O

Last	O
month	O
[	O
September	O
2018	O
]	O
,	O
hog	O
cholera	O
infection	O
was	O

The	O
1st	O
confirmed	O
case	O
of	O
a	O
new	O
deadly	O
rabbit	O
virus	O
has	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
a	O
4-month-old	O
rabbit	O
in	O
Bedford	B-City
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
rabbit	B-Disease
haemorrhagic	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
variant	I-Disease
2	I-Disease
(	O
RVHD-2	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
fatal	O
in	O
approximately	O
25	O
percent	O
of	O
rabbits	O
that	O
catch	O
it	O
.	O

Rabbits	O
may	O
die	O
suddenly	O
without	O
any	O
symptoms	O
.	O

Until	O
now	O
,	O
there	O
had	O
been	O
no	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
,	O
but	O
this	O
month	O
[	O
July	O
2017	O
]	O
,	O
a	O
young	O
rabbit	O
that	O
died	O
unexpectedly	O
at	O
home	O
was	O
tested	O
for	O
the	O
new	O
virus	O
and	O
has	O
become	O
the	O
1st	O
confirmed	O
case	O
of	O
RVHD-2	O
in	O
the	O
Bedford	B-City
area	O
.	O

The	O
standard	O
UK	O
rabbit	O
vaccination	O
does	O
not	O
protect	O
against	O
RVHD-2	O
;	O
it	O
covers	O
myxomatosis	O
and	O
RVHD-1	O
.	O

Katharine	O
Nelson	O
,	O
Senior	O
Vet	O
at	O

House	O

,	O

that	O
this	O
new	O
virus	O
is	O
present	O
in	O
the	O
Bedford	B-City
area	O
.	O

Both	O

rabbits	O

.	O

We	O

Bedford	B-City

''	O

a	O

.	O

,	O

This	O
year	O
's	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
outbreak	O
of	O
wheat	B-Virus
streak	I-Virus
mosaic	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
in	O
Kansas	B-Province
was	O
the	O
worst	O
since	O
2006	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
Kansas	O
State	O
University	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
also	O
struck	O
parts	O
of	O
Oklahoma	O
,	O
Nebraska	O
,	O
and	O
Colorado	O
[	O
in	O
the	O
]	O
US	O
Plains	O
[	O
region	O
]	O
.	O

Kansas	B-Province
could	O
face	O
hefty	O
yield	O
losses	O
from	O
a	O
virus	O
that	O
cost	O
it	O
nearly	O
6	O
per	O
cent	O
of	O
production	O
,	O
valued	O
at	O
USD	O
76.8	O
million	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
mites	O
that	O
thrive	O
on	O
``	O
volunteer	O
wheat	O
''	O
that	O
sprout	O
from	O
kernels	O
left	O
after	O
harvest	O
.	O

Farmers	O
need	O
to	O
kill	O
those	O
plants	O
with	O
herbicide	O
2	O
weeks	O
before	O
they	O
plant	O
the	O
crop	O
.	O

Not	O
enough	O
farmers	O
did	O
so	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2016	O
]	O
.	O

Low	O
[	O
grain	O
]	O
prices	O
may	O
have	O
discouraged	O
growers	O
from	O
spending	O
money	O
to	O
eradicate	O
volunteer	O
wheat	O
.	O

``	O
If	O
it	O
happens	O
again	O
,	O
there	O
has	O
got	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
monetary	O
penalty	O
attached	O
,	O
''	O
[	O
a	O
farmer	O
]	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
Kansas	B-Province
Wheat	O
Commission	O
,	O
Kansas	O
State	O
University	O
and	O
the	O
Kansas	O
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
launched	O
a	O
campaign	O
called	O
``	O
Stop	O
the	O
Streak	O
''	O
to	O
educate	O
farmers	O
.	O

A	O
total	O
of	O
2018	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
killed	O
by	O

case	O
is	O
still	O
underway	O
.	O

Plague	O
is	O
a	O

disease	O
that	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
fleas	O
living	O
on	O

.	O

in	O

than	O

hours	O
if	O

.	O

Adenovirus	B-Virus
usually	O
poses	O
little	O
risk	O
for	O
healthy	O
people	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
cause	O
mild	O
cold	O
or	O
flu	O
symptoms	O
,	O
and	O
some	O
strains	O
also	O
cause	O
diarrhea	O
and	O
pinkeye	O
.	O

The	O
strain	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
Wanaque	B-City
rehab	O
center	O
outbreak	O
is	O
called	O
type	O
7	O
and	O
is	O
among	O
the	O
more	O
potent	O
types	O
.	O

It	O
sometimes	O
causes	O
more	O
serious	O
respiratory	O
illness	O
,	O
especially	O
among	O
those	O
with	O
weak	O
immune	O
systems	O
.	O

.	O

:	O

At	O
:	O
Veterinary	O
Type	O
Culture	O
Centre	O
,	O
National	O
Research	O
Centre	O
on	O
Equines	O
,	O
Sirsa	O
Road	O
,	O
Hisar	O
,	O
Haryana	O
,	O
India	B-Country
.	O

Abstract	O
This	O
study	O
reports	O
the	O
1st	O
conclusive	O
evidence	O
of	O
zoonotic	O
camelpox	B-Virus
virus	O
(	O
CMLV	O
)	O
infection	O
in	O
humans	O
associated	O
with	O
outbreaks	O
in	O
dromedarian	O
camels	O
(	O
_Camelus	O
dromedaries_	O
)	O
in	O
the	O
northwest	O
region	O
of	O
India	B-Country
during	O
2009	O
.	O

CMLV	O
infection	O
is	O
usually	O
restricted	O
to	O
camels	O
and	O
causes	O
localised	O
skin	O
lesions	O
but	O
occasionally	O
leads	O
to	O
a	O
generalised	O
form	O
of	O
disease	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
present	O
outbreak	O
involved	O
camel	O
handlers	O
and	O
attendants	O
,	O
with	O
clinical	O
manifestations	O
such	O
as	O
papules	O
,	O
vesicles	O
,	O
ulceration	O
and	O
finally	O
scabs	O
over	O
fingers	O
and	O
hands	O
.	O

In	O
camels	O
,	O
the	O
pock-like	O
lesions	O
were	O
distributed	O
over	O
the	O
hairless	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
.	O

On	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
clinical	O
and	O
epidemiological	O
features	O
coupled	O
with	O
serological	O
tests	O
and	O
molecular	O
characterization	O
of	O
the	O
causative	O
agent	O
,	O
CMLV	O
zoonosis	O
was	O
confirmed	O
in	O
3	O
human	O
cases	O
.	O

Clinical	O
samples	O
such	O
as	O
skin	O
scabs/swabs	O
and	O
blood	O
collected	O
from	O
affected	O
animals	O
and	O
humans	O
were	O
analysed	O
initially	O
for	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
CMLV-specific	O
antigen	O
and	O
antibodies	O
by	O
counter	O
immunoelectrophoresis	O
(	O
CIE	O
)	O
;	O
serum	O
neutralization	O
test	O
(	O
SNT	O
)	O
;	O
plaque-reduction	O
neutralization	O
test	O
(	O
PRNT	O
)	O
and	O
indirect	O
immunoperoxidase	O
test	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
later	O
confirmed	O
by	O
amplification	O
of	O
CMLV-specific	O
ankyrin	O
repeat	O
protein	O
(	O
C18L	O
)	O
gene	O
.	O

Virus	O
isolation	O
was	O
successful	O
only	O
from	O
samples	O
collected	O
from	O
camels	O
.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O
sequence	O
analyses	O
based	O
on	O
3	O
full-length	O
envelope	O
protein	O
genes	O
(	O

,	O

and	O

)	O
revealed	O
95.2-99.8	O
percent	O
and	O
93.1-99.3	O
percent	O
homology	O
with	O
other	O

at	O
nucleotide	O
and	O
amino	O
acid	O
levels	O
,	O
respectively	O
.	O

Phylogram	O
of	O
the	O
3	O
genes	O
revealed	O
a	O
close	O
relationship	O
of	O
CMLV	O
with	O

virus	O
(	O

)	O
.	O

have	O
only	O
been	O
33	O
recorded	O
cases	O
of	O
foodborne	O
botulism	O
in	O
England	O
and	O
Wales	O
since	O
1989	O
,	O
with	O
27	O
of	O
these	O

to	O
a	O

.	O

Dr	O

,	O
a	O

at	O
the	O
HPA	O
,	O

:	O
``	O

of	O

are	O
thankfully	O
very	O
rare	O
in	O
the	O
UK	O
,	O

can	O

a	O

in	O

that	O
are	O
affected	O
.	O

We	O
urge	O
the	O
public	O
to	O
take	O
heed	O
of	O
this	O
message	O
and	O
ensure	O
that	O
they	O
immediately	O
dispose	O
of	O
this	O
product	O
and	O
to	O

aware	O
of	O

''	O

.	O

says	O
the	O
birds	O

7th	O

in	O
Kandiyohi	B-City

9000	O

the	O

.	O

28	O
Minnesota	B-Province
farms	O
have	O
now	O

by	O
the	O
outbreaks	O
.	O

The	O
USDA	O
also	O
confirmed	O
that	O
a	O
backyard	O
flock	O
of	O
33	O
mixed	O
birds	O
in	O
Juneau	O
County	O
of	O
Wisconsin	O
where	O
bird	B-Disease
flu	I-Disease
was	O
detected	O
last	O
week	O
was	O
affected	O
by	O
the	O
same	O
H5N2	B-Virus
virus	O
that	O
has	O
hit	O
other	O
poultry	O
farms	O
across	O
the	O
Midwest	O
.	O

With	O
the	O
deadly	O
canine	B-Virus
distemper	I-Virus
virus	O
(	O
CDV	O
)	O
killing	O
tigers	O
,	O
leopards	O
and	O
lions	O
in	O
many	O
forest	O
areas	O
and	O
zoos	O
across	O
the	O
country	O
,	O
the	O
scientists	O
at	O
Indian	O
Veterinary	O
Research	O
Institute	O
(	O
IVRI	O
)	O
will	O
recommend	O
officials	O
to	O
use	O
recombinant	O
CDV	O
vaccine	O
available	O
in	O
US	O
.	O

As	O
currently	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
vaccination	O
available	O
for	O
CDV	O
in	O
India	B-Country
,	O
big	O
cats	O
of	O
Dudhwa	O
Tiger	O
Reserve	O
,	O
Delhi	O
Zoo	O
,	O
Etawah	O
Lion	O
Safari	O
,	O
and	O
Sakkarbaug	O
Zoo	O
died	O
after	O
they	O
were	O
infected	O
with	O
the	O
virus	O
.	O

Red	O
Pandas	O
in	O
Gangtok	O
were	O
also	O
found	O
infected	O
with	O
this	O
virus	O
.	O

CDV	O
is	O
a	O
common	O
disease	O
in	O
dogs	O
.	O

The	O
source	O
of	O
CDV	O
in	O
big	O
cats	O
is	O
primarily	O
dogs	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
from	O
foxes	O
and	O
wild	O
cats	O
.	O

CDV	O
can	O
spread	O
from	O
one	O
animal	O
to	O
another	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
animal	O
infected	O
with	O
it	O
will	O
excrete	O
virus	O
in	O
all	O
body	O
fluid	O
,	O
including	O
urine	O
and	O
[	O
saliva	O
]	O
.	O

Principal	O
scientist	O
and	O
in-charge	O
of	O
the	O
Centre	O
for	O
Wildlife	O
AK	O
Sharma	O
said	O
:	O
``	O
After	O
6	O
lions	O
at	O
Etawah	O
Lion	O
Safari	O
were	O
infected	O
with	O
CDV	O
,	O
a	O
vaccine	O
from	O
the	O
US	O
was	O
given	O
to	O
lions	O
here	O
.	O

The	O
test	O
showed	O
that	O
after	O
vaccination	O
,	O
the	O
immunity	O
in	O
lions	O
became	O
stronger	O
.	O

Even	O
Delhi	O
Zoo	O
also	O
used	O
this	O
vaccination	O
after	O
a	O
tiger	O
was	O
found	O
infected	O
with	O
it	O
.	O
''	O

``	O
However	O
,	O
the	O
vaccination	O
available	O
for	O
dogs	O
is	O
not	O
recommended	O
for	O
big	O
cats	O
.	O

We	O
have	O
decided	O
to	O
recommend	O
this	O
US	O
vaccination	O
to	O
others	O
for	O
protection	O
of	O
big	O
cats	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Sharma	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
be	O
mostly	O
given	O
in	O
zoos	O
,	O
as	O
it	O
will	O
be	O
difficult	O
to	O
vaccinate	O
big	O
cats	O
in	O
the	O
wild	O
.	O
''	O

CDV	O
affects	O
different	O
systems	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
nervous	O
and	O
respiratory	O
systems	O
,	O
in	O
these	O
animals	O
.	O

It	O
breaks	O
down	O
the	O
immunity	O
system	O
and	O
causes	O
various	O
secondary	O
bacterial	O
infections	O
,	O
which	O
lead	O
to	O
their	O
deaths	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
virus	O
affects	O
the	O
immune	O
response	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
and	O
makes	O
the	O
animal	O
susceptible	O
to	O
other	O
diseases	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Sharma	O
.	O

``	O
As	O
this	O
disease	O
damages	O
the	O
brain	O
,	O
it	O
badly	O
affects	O
their	O
decision-making	O
powers	O
.	O

Due	O
to	O
this	O
,	O
the	O
animals	O
go	O
beyond	O
their	O
natural	O
habitat	O
and	O
enter	O
human	O
settlements	O
.	O

It	O
leaves	O
them	O
easy	O
prey	O
for	O
poachers	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
a	O
scientist	O
.	O

Taranaki	B-Province
's	O
6th	O
case	O
of	O
bovine	B-Disease
tuberculosis	I-Disease
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
.	O

The	O
Animal	O
Health	O
Board	O
(	O
AHB	O
)	O
said	O
last	O
week	O
that	O
a	O
herd	O
near	O
Inglewood	B-City
was	O
suspected	O
of	O
having	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
confirmation	O
this	O
week	O
of	O
the	O
infection	O
brings	O
to	O
4	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
herds	O
near	O
Inglewood	B-City
with	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Two	O

near	O
Opunake	B-City
also	O
have	O
it	O
.	O

between	O
the	O
2	O
Opunake	B-City
herds	O
,	O
AHB	O

Frank	O

,	O
of	O

,	O

.	O

``	O

know	O
why	O
these	O

have	O
been	O
infected	O
.	O
''	O

He	O
hoped	O
that	O
the	O
Taranaki	B-Province
outbreak	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
1st	O
case	O
was	O
detected	O
in	O
January	O
2013	O
,	O
would	O
be	O
confined	O
to	O
the	O
6	O
herds	O
already	O
identified	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
hope	O
we	O
're	O
coming	O
to	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
our	O
investigation	O
and	O
that	O
we	O
've	O
identified	O
all	O
the	O
infections	O
that	O
are	O
present	O
.	O

But	O
it	O
's	O
still	O
a	O
work	O
in	O
progress	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
a	O
dynamic	O

,	O
so	O
we	O
do	O
n't	O
know	O
when	O

``	O

''	O

``	O
that	O

virus	O
.	O

Chikungunya	B-Virus
fever	O
,	O
like	O
dengue	O
fever	O
,	O
is	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
virus	O
is	O
carried	O
mostly	O
by	O

_Aedes	O
aegypti_	O

.	O

where	O

.	O

seen	O
in	O
young	O
children	O
,	O
but	O
can	O
result	O
in	O
symptoms	O
in	O
adults	O
that	O
can	O
last	O
up	O
to	O
a	O
week	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
very	O
contagious	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Gibson	O
wrote	O
in	O
the	O
Tweet	O
.	O

In	O
an	O
email	O
to	O
The	O
Bellingham	B-City
Herald	O
,	O
Dr	O
Gibson	O
said	O
Western	O
sees	O
sporadic	O
hand-foot-mouth	B-Virus
disease	I-Virus
cases	O
most	O
years	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
usually	O
the	O
small	O
cluster	O
they	O
've	O
seen	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
.	O

Dr	O
Gibson	O
also	O
said	O
that	O
larger	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
more	O
than	O
100	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
seen	O
at	O
colleges	O
on	O
the	O
East	O
Coast	O
this	O
fall	O
.	O

``	O
This	O
is	O
a	O
mild	O
viral	O
illness	O
that	O
typically	O
afflicts	O
young	O
children	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Gibson	O
said	O
in	O
the	O
email	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
is	O
now	O
being	O
seen	O
more	O
in	O
college	O
populations	O
among	O
non-immune	O
individuals	O
and	O
is	O
easily	O
spread	O
through	O
coughing	O
,	O
sneezing	O
,	O
or	O
sharing	O
utensils	O
and	O
drinks	O
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
include	O
fever	O
,	O
body	O
aches	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O

nose	O
,	O

in	O
the	O

the	O
hands	O
and	O
feet	O
,	O
usually	O
resolve	O
in	O
5	O
to	O
7	O
days	O
.	O
''	O

When	O
students	O
are	O
diagnosed	O
,	O
Dr	O
Gibson	O
said	O
,	O
the	O
Student	O

Center	O

as	O

attending	O
class	O
,	O
to	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
spreading	O
.	O

Student	O

will	O
continue	O
to	O

for	O

on	O
campus	O

and	O

who	O
feel	O
they	O
have	O

to	O
contact	O
the	O
center	O
.	O

British	B-Province
Columbia	I-Province
has	O
recorded	O
its	O
1st	O
case	O
in	O
2016	O
of	O
someone	O
being	O
sickened	O
by	O
eating	O
raw	O
oysters	O
contaminated	O
with	O
vibrio	O
bacteria	O
.	O

The	O
BC	O
Centre	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
(	O
BCCDC	O
)	O
said	O
the	O
illness	O
was	O
reported	O
on	O
30	O
Jun	O
2016	O
in	O
the	O
Vancouver	B-City
area	O
.	O

_Vibrio	O
parahaemolyticus_	O
grows	O
in	O
seawater	O
and	O
can	O
end	O
up	O
in	O
shellfish	O
such	O
as	O
oysters	O
and	O
clams	O
.	O

When	O
water	O
temperatures	O
rise	O
in	O
the	O
summer	O
,	O
the	O
accumulations	O
of	O
the	O
naturally	O
occurring	O
bacteria	O
increase	O
to	O
the	O
point	O
that	O
eating	O
undercooked	O
shellfish	O
can	O
give	O
people	O
nausea	O
,	O
fever	O
and	O
diarrhea	O
.	O

2015	O
's	O
outbreak	O
of	O
the	O
vibrio-caused	O
illness	O
was	O
the	O
biggest	O
in	O
Canadian	O
history	O
and	O
sickened	O
at	O
least	O
73	O
British	O
Columbians	O
.	O

60	O
of	O
the	O
illnesses	O
were	O
due	O
to	O
eating	O
contaminated	O
raw	O
or	O
undercooked	O
BC	O
oysters	O
in	O
restaurants	O
.	O

The	O
other	O
13	O
illnesses	O
were	O
traced	O
to	O
exposure	O
to	O
seawater	O
with	O
high	O
levels	O
of	O
the	O
bacteria	O
.	O

At	O
the	O
height	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
last	O
summer	O
[	O
2015	O
]	O
,	O
Vancouver	B-City
Coastal	O
Health	O
ordered	O
restaurants	O
not	O
to	O
serve	O
raw	O
oysters	O
harvested	O
from	O
BC	O
waters	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
Canadian	O
Food	O
Inspection	O
Agency	O
issued	O
a	O
food	O
recall	O
for	O
BC	O
oysters	O
.	O

``	O
Eating	O
raw	O
shellfish	O
increases	O
your	O
risk	O
of	O
vibrio	O
and	O
other	O
infections	O
,	O
''	O
said	O

,	O

at	O

,	O
in	O
a	O

.	O

``	O

,	O

the	O
risks	O
and	O
take	O

to	O
reduce	O
your	O

of	O
illness	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
measles	B-Virus
outbreak	O
in	O
Katanga	B-Province
province	I-Province
in	O
southern	O

of	O

.	O

DRC	O

``	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

``	O

measles	B-Virus
is	O

,	O

is	O

,	O
and	O
a	O

.	O

a	O

.	O
''	O

In	O

a	O

,	O

.	O

It	O
appears	O
we	O
may	O
have	O
identified	O
a	O
new	O
disease	O
of	O
watermelons	O
and	O
other	O
cucurbits	O
in	O
Alabama	B-Province
.	O

On	O
we	O
collected	O
samples	O
from	O
plants	O
expressing	O
symptoms	O
of	O
``	O
cucurbit	B-Disease
yellow	I-Disease
vine	I-Disease
decline	I-Disease
''	O
(	O
CYVD	O
)	O
from	O
a	O
small	O
commercial	O
watermelon	O
field	O
in	O
east-central	O
Alabama	B-Province
.	O

This	O
would	O
be	O
the	O
1st	O
report	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
the	O
state	O
.	O

We	O
are	O
trying	O
to	O
confirm	O
our	O
diagnosis	O
with	O
the	O
help	O
of	O
USDA	O
scientists	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
has	O
been	O
observed	O
on	O
squash	O
and	O
pumpkins	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
melons	O
in	O
the	O
US	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
caused	O
by	O
CYVD	O
are	O
very	O
similar	O
to	O
those	O
of	O
bacterial	O
wilt	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
a	O
disease	O
transmitted	O
by	O
cucumber	O
beetles	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
progression	O
is	O
much	O
slower	O
than	O
CYVD	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
plants	O
rapidly	O
turn	O
yellow	O
and	O
wilt	O
almost	O
overnight	O
.	O

Control	O
of	O
CYVD	O
relies	O
on	O
managing	O
the	O
squash	O
bug	O
vectors	O
early	O
in	O
the	O
season	O
.	O

*	O
*	O
*	O
*	O
*	O
[	O
2	O
]	O
Fusarium	B-Disease
wilt	I-Disease
-	O
Georgia	B-Province
Source	O
:	O
Southeast	O
Farm	O
Press	O
[	O
edited	O
]	O
Fusarium	O
wilt	O
hits	O
Georgia	O
watermelons	O
Georgia	O
[	O
watermelon	O
]	O
farmers	O
now	O
grow	O
seedless	O
varieties	O
.	O

The	O
switch	O
has	O
them	O
fighting	O
a	O
deadly	O
plant	O
disease	O
that	O
likes	O
seedless	O
melons	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
consumers	O
do	O
,	O
says	O
David	O
Langston	O
,	O
University	O
of	O
Georgia	B-Province
.	O

Fusarium	B-Disease
wilt	I-Disease
[	O
FW	O
]	O
is	O
now	O
popping	O
up	O
frequently	O
in	O
Georgia	B-Province
watermelon	O
fields	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
will	O
infect	O
the	O
roots	O
and	O
basically	O
kills	O
the	O
plant	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
says	O
.	O

Damage	O
so	O
far	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2010	O
]	O
has	O
been	O
localized	O
,	O
but	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
half	O
of	O
some	O
fields	O
has	O
been	O
lost	O
to	O
it	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
've	O
seen	O
a	O
considerable	O
increase	O
in	O
FW	O
this	O
year	O
so	O
far	O
,	O
twice	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
previous	O
years	O
,	O
''	O
Langston	O
says	O
.	O

Every	O
watermelon-growing	O
county	O
in	O
Georgia	B-Province
has	O
had	O
reports	O
of	O
FW	O
in	O
seedless	O
melons	O
.	O

The	O
industry	O
has	O
developed	O
varieties	O
with	O
FW	O
resistance	O
,	O
but	O
all	O
of	O
them	O
have	O
seeds	O
.	O

Seedless	O
watermelons	O
have	O
become	O
the	O
most	O
widely	O
grown	O
type	O
in	O
Georgia	B-Province
and	O
other	O
states	O
like	O
Florida	O
and	O
Texas	O
,	O
where	O
farmers	O
are	O
also	O
seeing	O
increased	O
problems	O
with	O
FW	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
build	O
up	O
in	O
fields	O
that	O
are	O
planted	O
with	O
watermelons	O
each	O
year	O
,	O
killing	O
even	O
more	O
plants	O
the	O
following	O
year	O
.	O

Most	O
important	O
is	O
finding	O
resistant	O
varieties	O
.	O

``	O
Seedless	O
melons	O
have	O
no	O
resistance	O
at	O
all	O
and	O
[	O
private	O
breeders	O
]	O
have	O
a	O
very	O
difficult	O
time	O
breeding	O
FW	O
resistance	O
into	O
them	O
,	O
''	O
Langston	O
says	O
.	O

FW	O
is	O
just	O
another	O
disease	O
back	O
on	O
farmers	O
'	O
radars	O
.	O

But	O
it	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
be	O
defeated	O
soon	O
,	O
or	O
many	O
farmers	O
could	O
be	O
planting	O
themselves	O
into	O
an	O
unavoidable	O
corner	O
in	O
the	O
coming	O
years	O
.	O

A	O
mysterious	O
disease	O
is	O
wiping	O
out	O
pomegranate	O
orchards	O
in	O
all	O
states	O
except	O
the	O
Northern	O
Territory	O
and	O
Tasmania	O
.	O

[	O
A	O
grower	O
]	O
in	O
north-west	O
Victoria	B-City
has	O
lost	O
80	O
percent	O
of	O
his	O

this	O
year	O
[	O
2013	O
]	O
.	O

He	O

most	O

from	O
pomegranates	O
and	O

to	O

.	O

``	O

(	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

``	O

,	O

.	O

.	O
''	O

.	O

.	O

of	O

(	O

)	O

[	O

]	O

this	O

.	O

A	O

to	O
Alexania	O
.	O

His	O
family	O
members	O
have	O
been	O
immunized	O
To	O
try	O
to	O
prevent	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
city	O
from	O
increasing	O

the	O
department	O
is	O
calling	O

residents	O
and	O
city	O
visitors	O
to	O

at	O

,	O

17	O

.	O

communicated	O
by	O
:	O
ProMED-PORT	O

The	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
(	O
NMDOH	O
)	O
reports	O
a	O
cat	O
has	O
been	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
Los	B-City
Alamos	I-City
County	I-City
,	O
making	O
it	O
the	O
1st	O
plague	O
case	O
in	O
New	O
Mexico	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
.	O

``	O
NMDOH	O
staff	O
will	O
conduct	O
an	O
environmental	O
investigation	O
to	O
ensure	O
the	O
safety	O
of	O
the	O
immediate	O
family	O
and	O
neighbors	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Secretary-Designate	O
Dr.	O
Tracie	O
Collins	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
also	O
offer	O
a	O
friendly	O
reminder	O
:	O
even	O
in	O
the	O
midst	O
of	O
a	O
global	O
pandemic	O
,	O
other	O
diseases	O
still	O
occur	O
in	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
,	O
and	O
there	O
are	O
steps	O
people	O
can	O
take	O
to	O
keep	O
themselves	O
and	O
their	O
pets	O
safe	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
cat	O
,	O
which	O
became	O
ill	O
in	O
early	O
January	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
,	O
has	O
now	O
recovered	O
following	O
veterinary	O
treatment	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
in	O
wildlife	O
and	O
is	O
generally	O
transmitted	O
to	O
pets	O
through	O
the	O
bites	O
of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
or	O
after	O
eating	O
an	O
infected	O
animal	O
.	O

Humans	O
can	O
also	O
contract	O
plague	B-Disease
via	O
infected	O
fleas	O
or	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
humans	O
include	O
sudden	O
onset	O
of	O
fever	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
and	O
weakness	O
.	O

In	O
most	O
cases	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
painful	O
swelling	O
of	O
the	O
lymph	O
node	O
in	O
the	O
groin	O
,	O
armpit	O
,	O
or	O
neck	O
area	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
symptoms	O
in	O
cats	O
and	O
dogs	O
are	O
fever	O
,	O
lethargy	O
,	O
and	O
loss	O
of	O
appetite	O
;	O
there	O
may	O
be	O
swelling	O
in	O
the	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
under	O
the	O
jaw	O
.	O

With	O
prompt	O
diagnosis	O
and	O
appropriate	O
antibiotic	O
treatment	O
,	O
the	O
probability	O
of	O
death	O
in	O
people	O
and	O
pets	O
can	O
be	O
greatly	O
reduced	O
.	O

Physicians	O
or	O
veterinarians	O
who	O
suspect	O
plague	B-Disease
should	O
promptly	O
report	O
to	O
NMDOH	O
.	O

To	O
prevent	O
plague	B-Disease
,	O
-	O
avoid	O
sick	O
or	O
dead	O
rodents	O
and	O
rabbits	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
their	O
nests	O
and	O
burrows	O
;	O
-	O
prevent	O
your	O
pets	O
from	O
roaming	O
and	O
hunting	O
;	O
-	O
talk	O
to	O
your	O
veterinarian	O
about	O
using	O
an	O
appropriate	O
flea	O
control	O
product	O
on	O
your	O
pets	O
;	O
-	O
have	O
any	O
sick	O
pets	O
examined	O
promptly	O
by	O
a	O
veterinarian	O
;	O
-	O
contact	O
your	O
medical	O
provider	O
about	O
any	O
unexplained	O
illness	O
involving	O
a	O
sudden	O
and	O
severe	O
fever	O
;	O
-	O
clean	O
up	O
areas	O
near	O
the	O
home	O
where	O
rodents	O
could	O
live	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
woodpiles	O
,	O
brush	O
piles	O
,	O
junk	O
,	O
and	O
abandoned	O
vehicles	O
;	O
-	O
place	O
hay	O
,	O
wood	O
,	O
and	O
compost	O
piles	O
as	O
far	O
as	O
possible	O
from	O
your	O
home	O
;	O
-	O
avoid	O
leaving	O
pet	O
food	O
and	O
water	O
where	O
rodents	O
and	O
wildlife	O
can	O
access	O
it	O
.	O

For	O
more	O
information	O
,	O
including	O
fact	O
sheets	O
in	O
English	O
and	O
Spanish	O
,	O
go	O
to	O
the	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
's	O
website	O
at	O

Authorities	O
have	O
confirmed	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
a	O
mild	O
form	O
of	O
bird	B-Disease
flu	I-Disease
in	O
turkeys	O
in	O
Kandiyohi	B-Province
County	I-Province
.	O

The	O
State	O
Board	O
of	O
Animal	O
Health	O
says	O
testing	O
on	O
Monday	O
showed	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
a	O
low	O
pathogenic	O
H5N2	B-Virus
virus	O
in	O
a	O
flock	O
of	O
40	O
000	O
turkeys	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
originated	O
in	O
wild	O
birds	O
.	O

The	O
affected	O
turkeys	O
have	O
been	O
quarantined	O
but	O
have	O
shown	O
no	O
signs	O
of	O
illness	O
.	O

Officials	O
are	O
careful	O
to	O
note	O
that	O
the	O
virus	O
is	O
different	O
from	O
the	O
highly	O
pathogenic	O
virus	O
that	O
caused	O
a	O
massive	O
outbreak	O
in	O
U.S.	O
turkeys	O
and	O
chickens	O
in	O
2015	O
,	O
which	O
resulted	O
in	O
the	O
deaths	O
of	O
nearly	O
50	O
million	O
birds	O
.	O

Minnesota	B-Province
was	O
among	O
the	O
hardest	O
hit	O
states	O
in	O
that	O
outbreak	O
.	O

The	O
Peruvian	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
(	O
MoH	O
)	O
confirmed	O
that	O
3	O
children	O
died	O
because	O
of	O
wild	O
rabies	B-Virus
in	O
Napo	B-Province
District	I-Province
,	O
Maynas	B-Province
Province	I-Province
,	O
Loreto	B-Province
region	O
,	O
after	O
being	O
bitten	O
by	O
vampire	O
bats	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
case	O
occurred	O
in	O
a	O
9-year	O
old	O
girl	O
who	O
died	O
29	O
May	O
2015	O
;	O
the	O
2nd	O
case	O
was	O
a	O
3-year	O
old	O
girl	O
who	O
died	O
12	O
Jun	O
;	O
and	O
the	O
last	O
case	O
was	O
a	O
boy	O
who	O
recently	O
passed	O
away	O
.	O

All	O
infected	O
children	O
lived	O
in	O
Soledad	B-City
native	O
community	O
.	O

Dr.	O
Oswaldo	O
Cabanillas	O
,	O
Coordinator	O
of	O
the	O
Zoonoses	O
Sanitary	O
Strategy	O
in	O
the	O
Peruvian	O
MoH	O
,	O
declared	O
that	O
the	O
1st	O
2	O
fatal	O
cases	O
were	O
confirmed	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
clinical	O
and	O
epidemiological	O
diagnosis	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
3rd	O
case	O
was	O
confirmed	O
by	O
laboratory	O
tests	O
.	O

After	O
learning	O
of	O
this	O
situation	O
,	O
both	O
the	O
Regional	O
Government	O
and	O
the	O
MoH	O
appointed	O
health	O
care	O
teams	O
including	O
physicians	O
,	O
nurses	O
,	O
veterinarians	O
,	O
biologists	O
,	O
sanitation	O
inspectors	O
,	O
and	O
epidemiologists	O
,	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
perform	O
surveillance	O
activities	O
in	O
the	O
affected	O
area	O
.	O

The	O
Peruvian	O
MoH	O
is	O
currently	O

Nipah	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
was	O
first	O
identified	O
during	O
an	O

of	O
disease	O
that	O
took	O

in	O

.	O

.	O

Well	O

virus	I-Disease

.	O

have	O

with	O
high	O
case	O

.	O

50	O

at	O

the	O

(	O

)	O
.	O

30	O

.	O

are	O

.	O

Humans	O

with	O

animals	O
are	O
likely	O
to	O

infected	O
by	O
brucellosis	B-Disease
.	O

They	O

if	O
they	O

or	O
products	O

.	O

against	O

Scrub	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
is	O
an	O
infectious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
parasite	O
called	O
chigger	O
,	O
primarily	O
found	O
in	O
rats	O
and	O
mice	O
.	O

The	O
mites	O
contract	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
their	O
larval	O
stage	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
the	O
mites	O
are	O
both	O
vectors	O
and	O
reservoirs	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
most	O
common	O
symptoms	O
of	O
scrub	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
,	O
also	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
bush	O
typhus	O
,	O
are	O
fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
body	O
ache	O
and	O
rashes	O
,	O
similar	O
to	O
dengue	O
,	O
Dr.	O
Joshi	O
said	O
,	O
while	O
adding	O
that	O
Bajura	B-Province
is	O
also	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
high-risk	O
areas	O
for	O
scrub	O
typhus	O
.	O

The	O
patients	O
with	O
scrub	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
would	O
likely	O
suffer	O
from	O
continuous	O
fever	O

,	O

in	O

.	O

in	O

A	O

was	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

He	O
contracted	O
the	O
disease	O
from	O
one	O
of	O
his	O
cows	O
.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
serious	O
infectious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
gram-positive	O
,	O
rod-shaped	O
bacteria	O
known	O
as	O
_Bacillus	O
anthracis_	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
information	O
posted	O
on	O
the	O
website	O
of	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
.	O

Although	O
it	O
is	O
rare	O
,	O
people	O
can	O
get	O
sick	O
with	O
anthrax	B-Disease
if	O
they	O
come	O
in	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
or	O
contaminated	O
animal	O
products	O
.	O

Signs	O
and	O
symptoms	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
can	O
range	O
from	O
skin	O
sores	O
to	O
vomiting	O
and	O
shock	O
.	O

Rapid	O
treatment	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
can	O
cure	O
most	O
anthrax	B-Disease
infections	O
.	O

A	O
warning	O
has	O
been	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
Auckland	B-City
Regional	O
Public	O
Health	O
Service	O
after	O
7	O
[	O
of	O
measles	B-Virus
]	O
cases	O
were	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
young	O
Aucklanders	O
,	O
including	O
one	O
at	O
Waitakere	O
Hospital	O
's	O
emergency	O
care	O

.	O

The	O
patients	O
are	O
aged	O
from	O
3	O
to	O
16	O
,	O
4	O
of	O
whom	O
were	O
on	O
a	O

to	O
Auckland	B-City
on	O
11	O
Jan	O
2011	O
.	O

A	O
family	O
group	O
caught	O
the	O
viral	O
disease	O
overseas	O
.	O

One	O
Auckland	B-City
child	O
was	O
a	O

,	O
while	O

but	O
not	O

.	O

Dr	O
Richard	O
Hoskins	O
of	O
Auckland	B-City
Regional	O
Public	O
Health	O
Service	O
says	O
measles	B-Virus
is	O
easily	O
passed	O
on	O
through	O
coughing	O
and	O
sneezing	O
.	O

In	O
rare	O
cases	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
.	O

People	O
who	O
are	O
suspected	O
to	O
have	O
measles	B-Virus
are	O
isolated	O
to	O
prevent	O
it	O
spreading	O
.	O

``	O
Generally	O
in	O
New	B-Country
Zealand	I-Country
we	O
have	O
a	O
pretty	O
good	O
immunisation	O
rate	O
and	O
so	O
we	O
tend	O
to	O
get	O
control	O
of	O
these	O
things	O
during	O
the	O
2nd	O
wave	O
,	O
as	O
not	O
everyone	O
has	O
to	O
be	O
isolated	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
says	O
.	O

``	O
There	O
are	O
no	O
cast-iron	O
guarantees	O
there	O
wo	O
n't	O
be	O
a	O
3rd	O
wave	O
this	O
time	O
but	O
the	O
signs	O
are	O
good	O
and	O
we	O
've	O
been	O
working	O
very	O
hard	O
on	O
it	O
.	O
''	O

Dr	O
Hoskins	O
says	O
the	O
health	O
service	O
contacts	O
principals	O
if	O
a	O
child	O
is	O
infectious	O
and	O
needs	O
to	O
stay	O
away	O
from	O
school	O
.	O

In	O
New	B-Country
Zealand	I-Country
the	O
MMR	O
(	O
measles	B-Virus
,	O
mumps	O
and	O
rubella	O
)	O
vaccine	O
is	O
free	O
and	O
given	O
to	O
children	O
at	O
around	O
15	O
months	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
2nd	O
dose	O
at	O
4	O
years	O
.	O

The	O
vaccination	O
is	O
99	O
per	O
cent	O
effective	O
after	O
the	O
2nd	O
dose	O
.	O

Dr	O
Hoskins	O
says	O
parents	O
whose	O
children	O
have	O
been	O
immunised	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
too	O
concerned	O
.	O

``	O
Check	O
with	O
your	O
family	O
doctor	O
or	O
your	O
Whanau	O
Ora	O
provider	O
if	O
you	O
're	O
not	O
sure	O
of	O
your	O
child	O
's	O
immunisation	O
status	O
.	O

People	O
start	O
to	O
develop	O
symptoms	O
about	O
10	O
days	O
after	O
coming	O
into	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

They	O
become	O
infectious	O
themselves	O
the	O
day	O
before	O
symptoms	O
appear	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
tricky	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
to	O
look	O
out	O
for	O
are	O
a	O
runny	O
nose	O
,	O
a	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
red	O
eyes	O
and	O
in	O
some	O
cases	O
small	O
white	O
spots	O
in	O
the	O
mouth	O
.	O
''	O

If	O
parents	O
are	O
concerned	O
they	O
should	O
call	O
their	O
family	O
doctor	O
or	O
Healthline	O
for	O
advice	O
.	O

At	O
least	O
20	O
residents	O
of	O
Malakajaya	B-City
subdistrict	O
in	O
Duren	O
Sawit	O
district	O
,	O

Jakarta	B-Province
,	O

with	O
the	O

virus	O

weeks	O
.	O

Head	O
of	O
the	O
subdistrict	O
's	O

03	O
,	O
Andang	O
Subaryono	O
,	O
said	O
the	O
1st	O

infection	O

bacterial	O
disease	O
,	O
and	O
_Mycobacterium	O
marinum_	O
have	O
sickened	O
people	O
from	O

to	O
salty-brackish	O
waters	O
of	O
Southwest	O
Louisiana	B-Province
.	O

``	O

the	O

warm	O
up	O
,	O

water	O
warms	O
up	O
,	O

to	O
get	O
more	O
out	O
on	O

water	O
and	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

``	O

slow	O
.	O

as	O

.	O
''	O

The	O
more	O
serious	O
infection	O
,	O
_Vibrio	O
vulnificus_	O
,	O
comes	O
on	O
very	O
quickly	O
after	O
punctured	O
skin	O
comes	O
in	O

with	O
this	O
bacterium	O
.	O

``	O

or	O

or	O
they	O
may	O
get	O
a	O
puncture	O
wound	O
while	O
in	O

oyster	O
shell	O
or	O

like	O
that	O

and	O
it	O

the	O
involved	O

,	O
but	O
it	O

''	O

Haman	O
.	O

The	O

6	O
hours	O
and	O
includes	O

,	O

.	O

Antimicrobials	O
are	O
needed	O
and	O
dead	O
tissue	O
must	O

.	O

Skin	O

_Mycobacterium	O
marinum_	O
are	O
much	O

than	O

.	O

typically	O

skin	O
and	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

``	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

A	O

cases	O

disease	O
in	O
Oldham	B-City
and	O

[	O

]	O

A	O
horse	O
property	O
in	O
southwest	O
Kansas	B-Province
is	O
under	O

following	O
confirmation	O
of	O
6	O
cases	O
of	O
equine	B-Virus
infectious	I-Virus
anemia	I-Virus
in	O
horses	O
.	O

The	O
infected	O
horses	O
on	O
the	O
property	O
in	O
Finney	B-City
County	I-City
will	O
be	O
euthanized	O
because	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
cure	O
and	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
risk	O
the	O
animals	O
may	O
infect	O
other	O
horses	O
.	O

The	O
Kansas	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
's	O
Division	O
of	O
Animal	O
Health	O
was	O
told	O
this	O
month	O
[	O
August	O
2017	O
]	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
positive	O
test	O
for	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
Swamp	O
fever	O
.	O

The	O
horse	O
facility	O
was	O
quarantined	O
and	O
all	O
the	O
exposed	O
horses	O
were	O
tested	O
,	O
with	O
5	O
additional	O
positive	O
cases	O
detected	O
.	O

The	O
remaining	O
horses	O
at	O
the	O
facility	O
will	O
be	O
observed	O
and	O
retested	O
in	O
60	O
days	O
.	O

Equine	B-Virus
infectious	I-Virus
anemia	I-Virus
is	O
most	O
commonly	O
spread	O
by	O
biting	O
flies	O
and	O
ticks	O
,	O
or	O
sometimes	O
through	O
the	O
shared	O
used	O
of	O
blood-contaminated	O
instruments	O
or	O
needles	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
does	O
not	O
affect	O
people	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
spread	O
to	O
horses	O
,	O
mules	O
and	O
donkeys	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
attacks	O
the	O
immune	O
system	O
,	O
with	O
signs	O
including	O
bleeding	O
in	O
mucus	O
membranes	O
and	O
a	O
gradual	O
loss	O
of	O
condition	O
and	O
muscle	O
weakness	O
.	O

Other	O
signs	O
include	O
fever	O
,	O
depression	O
and	O
anemia	O
.	O

Infected	O
horses	O
can	O
run	O
a	O
low-grade	O
fever	O
or	O
become	O
lethargic	O
,	O
but	O
often	O
there	O
are	O
no	O
clinical	O
signs	O
.	O

Infected	O
horses	O
continue	O
to	O
carry	O
the	O
virus	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
further	O
infections	O
,	O
hence	O
the	O
protocol	O
to	O
euthanize	O
infected	O
animals	O
.	O

All	O
infected	O
horses	O
,	O
including	O
those	O
who	O
have	O
no	O
signs	O
,	O
are	O
carriers	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
vaccine	O
or	O
treatment	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
typically	O
a	O
small	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
every	O
year	O
,	O
although	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
common	O
in	O
other	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
world	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
controlled	O
in	O
the	O
US	O
by	O
regular	O
testing	O
before	O
horses	O
are	O
allowed	O
to	O
travel	O
across	O
state	O
lines	O
and/or	O
to	O
shows	O
.	O

The	O
pathogen	O
causing	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
categorized	O
as	O
a	O
lentivirus	O
:	O
it	O
contains	O
genetic	O
RNA	O
material	O
,	O
which	O
it	O
uses	O
to	O
produce	O
DNA	O
.	O

This	O
DNA	O
is	O
then	O
incorporated	O
into	O
the	O
genetic	O
makeup	O
of	O
infected	O
cells	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
was	O
first	O
identified	O
in	O
France	O
in	O
1843	O
and	O
first	O
tentatively	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
in	O
1888	O
.	O

Several	O
cases	O
of	O
whooping	O
cough	O
were	O
detected	O
in	O
Washington	B-City
County	I-City
,	O
Indiana	B-Province
earlier	O
this	O
week	O
.	O

The	O
health	O
department	O
says	O
3	O
people	O
,	O
2	O
juveniles	O
and	O
an	O
adult	O
,	O
are	O
being	O
treated	O
with	O
antimicrobials	O
for	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Whooping	O
cough	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
pertussis	O
,	O
can	O
cause	O
coughing	O
fits	O
which	O
can	O
lead	O
to	O
ongoing	O
breathing	O
issues	O
and	O
in	O
some	O
cases	O
can	O
also	O
lead	O
to	O
pneumonia	O
and	O
seizures	O
.	O

Generally	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
milder	O
in	O
children	O
and	O
adults	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
health	O
leaders	O
say	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
very	O
dangerous	O
for	O
infants	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
can	O
easily	O
spread	O
,	O
''	O
says	O
Peggy	O
Scott	O
with	O
the	O
Washington	B-City

,	O
``	O

to	O

those	O
who	O
ca	O

get	O
their	O
vaccine	O
or	O
are	O

to	O
complete	O

.	O
''	O

.	O

The	O

[	O
a	O
]	O

.	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

.	O

Hantavirus	B-Virus
is	O

through	O

to	O
the	O

and	O
urine	O
of	O
certain	O

.	O

are	O

[	O
_Peromyscus	O

.	O

]	O
is	O

]	O

.	O

``	O

,	O

.	O

``	O

;	O
no	O

Los	B-City
Angeles	I-City

(	O
Public	O

)	O
announces	O

of	O
syphilis	B-Disease

in	O
California	B-Province
.	O

County	O
