young	O
animals	O
.	O

Diarrhea	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
parasites	O
results	O
in	O
dehydration	O
,	O
emaciation	O
,	O
and	O
anemia	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
,	O
particularly	O
to	O
young	O
deer	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
parasitic	O
worms	O
specifically	O
attack	O
ruminants	O
--	O
or	O
animals	O
with	O
split	O
hooves	O
and	O
multiple-chambered	O
stomachs	O
,	O
Ramsey	O
said	O
.	O

Those	O
include	O
deer	O
,	O
elk	O
,	O
antelope	O
,	O
moose	O
,	O
goats	O
,	O
sheep	O
,	O
and	O
cattle	O
.	O

The	O
parasites	O
occur	O
naturally	O
in	O
such	O
animals	O
and	O
become	O
debilitating	O
or	O
fatal	O
only	O
when	O
they	O
reach	O
extremely	O
high	O
numbers	O
in	O
an	O
animal's	O
stomach	O
.	O

The	O
worms	O
spread	O
between	O
animals	O
through	O
fecal	O
matter	O
,	O
Ramsey	O
said	O
.	O

They	O
reach	O
fatal	O
concentrations	O
when	O
infected	O
animals	O
eat	O
grass	O
or	O
browse	O
that	O
is	O
covered	O
with	O
infected	O
fecal	O
matter	O
.	O

Artificial	O
concentration	O
of	O
deer	O
in	O
and	O
around	O
Roundup	B-City
is	O
contributing	O
to	O
the	O
problem	O
as	O
wildlife	O
congregates	O
around	O
scarce	O
food	O
sources	O
,	O
including	O
livestock	O
feed	O
grounds	O
and	O
places	O
where	O
people	O
have	O
left	O
food	O
for	O
them	O
,	O
FWP	O
wildlife	O
biologist	O
Jay	O
Newell	O
of	O
Roundup	O
said	O
.	O

Deer	O
are	O
more	O
susceptible	O
to	O
parasites	O
at	O
this	O
time	O
of	O
year	O
because	O
they	O
are	O
emerging	O
from	O
a	O
long	O
winter	O
,	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

While	O
the	O
parasite	O
could	O
spread	O
to	O
livestock	O
,	O
Ramsey	O
said	O
,	O
most	O

and	O

routinely	O
treat	O
their	O

a	O

that	O
stops	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Trichostrongylosis	O
infection	O
in	O
humans	O
,	O
dogs	O
,	O
and	O
cats	O
is	O
quite	O
rare	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
and	O
easily	O
treated	O
with	O
inexpensive	O
medicine	O
,	O
Ramsey	O
said	O
.	O

To	O
catch	O
the	O
parasitic	O
disease	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
,	O
a	O
person	O
or	O
pet	O
would	O
have	O
to	O
directly	O
consume	O
unwashed	O
vegetables	O
or	O
water	O
that	O
was	O
contaminated	O
with	O
deer	O
feces	O
.	O

Normal	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

the	O
county	O
has	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
county	O
found	O
a	O
rabies-positive	O
bat	O
here	O
in	O
October	O
[	O
2016	O
]	O
.	O

And	O
while	O
it	O
's	O
been	O
50	O
years	O
since	O
a	O
human	O
rabies	B-Virus
case	O
has	O

recorded	O
in	O
Kansas	O
,	O
a	O
Missouri	O

of	O
rabies	O
in	O
September	O
[	O
2014	O
]	O
.	O

the	O
positive	O

result	O

,	O

for	O

disease	O
,	O

in	O

``	O

with	O

,	O
''	O

``	O

you/your	O

with	O
a	O
#	O
bat	O
(	O
living	O
or	O

)	O
,	O

animal	O

company	O
to	O
have	O

removed	O
and	O
tested	O
for	O
rabies	B-Virus
.	O
''	O

JCDHE	O
says	O
it	O
has	O
not	O

.	O

:	O

,	O

,	O
et	O
al	O
.	O

SARS-CoV-2	O
antibody	O
prevalence	O
in	O
Sierra	B-Country
Leone	I-Country
,	O
March	O
2021	O
:	O
a	O
cross-sectional	O
,	O
nationally	O
representative	O
,	O
age-stratified	O
serosurvey	O
.	O

medRxiv	O
.	O

Epub	O
5	O
Jul	O
2021	O
.	O

Abstract	O
Background	O
:	O
As	O
of	O
26	O
Mar	O
2021	O
,	O
the	O
Africa	O
CDC	O
had	O
reported	O
4	O
159	O
055	O
cases	O
of	O
COVID-19	B-Disease
and	O
111	O
357	O
deaths	O
among	O
the	O
55	O
African	O
Union	O
Member	O
States	O
;	O
however	O
,	O
no	O
country	O
has	O
published	O
a	O
nationally	O
representative	O
serosurvey	O
as	O
of	O
May	O
2021	O
.	O

Such	O
data	O
are	O
vital	O
for	O
understanding	O
the	O
pandemic	O
's	O
progression	O
on	O
the	O
continent	O
,	O
evaluating	O
containment	O
measures	O
,	O
and	O
policy	O
planning	O
.	O

Methods	O
:	O
We	O
conducted	O
a	O
cross-sectional	O
,	O
nationally	O
representative	O
,	O
age-stratified	O
serosurvey	O
in	O
Sierra	B-Country
Leone	I-Country
in	O
March	O
2021	O
by	O
randomly	O
selecting	O
120	O
Enumeration	O
Areas	O
throughout	O
the	O
country	O
and	O
10	O
randomly	O
selected	O
households	O
in	O
each	O
of	O
these	O
.	O

One	O
to	O
2	O
persons	O
per	O
selected	O
household	O
were	O
interviewed	O
to	O
collect	O
information	O
on	O
socio-demographics	O
,	O
symptoms	O
suggestive	O
of	O
COVID-19	B-Disease
,	O
exposure	O
history	O
to	O
laboratory-confirmed	O
COVID-19	O
cases	O
,	O
and	O
history	O
of	O
COVID-19	O
illness	O
.	O

Capillary	O
blood	O
was	O
collected	O
by	O
fingerstick	O
,	O
and	O
blood	O
samples	O
were	O
tested	O
using	O
the	O
Hangzhou	O
Biotest	O
Biotech	O
RightSign	O
COVID-19	B-Disease
IgG/IgM	O
Rapid	O
Test	O
Cassette	O
.	O

Total	O
seroprevalence	O
was	O
estimated	O
after	O
applying	O
sampling	O
weights	O
.	O

Findings	O
:	O
The	O
overall	O
weighted	O
seroprevalence	O
was	O
2.6	O
%	O
(	O
95	O
%	O
CI	O
1.9-3.4	O
)	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
43	O
times	O
higher	O
than	O
the	O
reported	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
.	O

Rural	O
seropositivity	O
was	O
1.8	O
%	O
(	O
95	O
%	O
CI	O
1.0-2.5	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
urban	O
seropositivity	O
was	O
4.2	O
%	O
(	O
95	O
%	O
CI	O
2.6-5.7	O
)	O
.	O

Interpretation	O
:	O
Although	O
overall	O
seroprevalence	O
was	O
low	O
compared	O
to	O
countries	O
in	O
Europe	O
and	O
the	O
Americas	O
(	O
suggesting	O
relatively	O
successful	O
containment	O
in	O
Sierra	B-Country
Leone	I-Country
)	O
,	O
our	O
findings	O
indicate	O
enormous	O
underreporting	O
of	O
active	O
cases	O
.	O

This	O
has	O
ramifications	O
for	O
the	O
country	O
's	O
3rd	O
wave	O
(	O
which	O
started	O
in	O
June	O
2021	O
)	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
average	O
number	O
of	O
daily	O

cases	O
was	O
87	O
by	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
month	O
--	O
this	O
could	O
potentially	O
be	O
on	O
the	O
order	O
of	O
3700	O
actual	O
infections	O
,	O
calling	O
for	O
stronger	O
containment	O
measures	O
in	O
a	O
country	O
with	O
only	O
0.2	O
%	O
of	O
people	O
fully	O
vaccinated	O
.	O

It	O
may	O
also	O
reflect	O
significant	O
underreporting	O
of	O
incidence	O
and	O
mortality	O
across	O
the	O
continent	O
.	O

A	O
Scott	B-City
County	I-City
chicken	O
has	O

positive	O
for	O
avian	B-Disease
influenza	I-Disease

al	I-City

_Campylobacter_	O
after	O

reports	O

has	O
recalled	O

13	O

``	O

Washington	B-Province

``	O

.	O

of	O

infection	I-Disease

The	O
bacillus	O
takes	O
the	O
form	O
of	O
spores	O
that	O
allows	O
it	O
to	O
live	O
in	O
a	O
hostile	O
environment	O
such	O
as	O
earth	O
.	O

In	O
a	O
supportive	O
environment	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O

inside	O
the	O
body	O
,	O
the	O
bacterium	O
becomes	O
active	O
and	O
toxic	O
,	O
says	O
Durand	O
.	O

Heroin	O
users	O
may	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
by	O
turning	O
to	O
substitute	O
products	O
.	O

Any	O
route	O
of	O
administration	O
(	O
injection	O
or	O
ingestion	O
)	O
does	O
not	O
eliminate	O
the	O
risk	O
,	O
and	O
inhalants	O
who	O
sniff	O
the	O
product	O
do	O
not	O
protect	O
themselves	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
Contamination	O
of	O
heroin	O
by	O
the	O
spores	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
seen	O
with	O
the	O
naked	O
eye	O
.	O

Especially	O
in	O
case	O
of	O
fever	O
,	O
or	O
local	O
events	O
such	O
as	O
injection	O
-	O

,	O
pain	O
,	O
swelling	O
,	O
or	O
which	O
are	O
swelling	O
rapidly	O
,	O
a	O
physician	O
should	O
be	O
consulted	O
stating	O
that	O
you	O
are	O
a	O
drug	O
user	O
,	O

advises	O
.	O

The	O
Regional	O

Agency-Sydney	O

>	O

.	O

A	O

.	O

.	O

``	O

do	O
not	O

in	O

district	O

Around	O
10	O

,	O
5	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

in	O

its	O

.	O

According	O

.	O

Mohammad	O

,	O
a	O

that	O

this	O

and	O

.	O

district	O

.	O

The	O
anthrax	B-Disease
form	O
affecting	O
the	O
Bangladeshi	O
villagers	O
is	O
a	O
cutaneous	O
form	O
that	O
produces	O
black	O
lesions	O
on	O
the	O
skin	O
.	O

While	O
not	O
directly	O
transferable	O
between	O
people	O
,	O
anthrax	B-Disease
spores	O
are	O
able	O
to	O

people	O
through	O

air	O
.	O

As	O
the	O
threat	O
of	O
bioterror	O

has	O
grown	O
,	O
attention	O
is	O
also	O
focused	O
on	O
preventing	O
and	O
containing	O
naturally	O
occurring	O
anthrax	O
breakouts	O
.	O

Bangladesh	B-Country
is	O
the	O
7th	O
most	O
populous	O
country	O
in	O
the	O
world	O
.	O

The	O
south	O
Asian	O
nation	O
also	O
has	O
the	O
highest	O
population	O
density	O
in	O
the	O
world	O
among	O
countries	O
with	O
more	O
than	O
10	O
million	O
people	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O
2005	O
United	O
Nations	O
study	O
.	O

Zebra	B-Disease
chip	I-Disease
hits	O
Northwest	O
Zebra	O
chip	O
,	O
a	O
disease	O
that	O
annually	O
costs	O

US	O

dollars	O
in	O
crop	O
loss	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
Washington	B-Province
and	O
Oregon	B-Province
.	O

USDA	O
and	O
Oregon	B-Province
State	O
University	O
[	O
OSU	O
]	O
confirmed	O
zebra	B-Disease
chip	I-Disease
in	O
tuber	O
samples	O
submitted	O
by	O
growers	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
was	O

in	O

in	O
the	O
southern	O
Columbia	O
Basin	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
5	O
cultivars	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
Idaho	O
.	O

Researchers	O
do	O
not	O
know	O
if	O
the	O
disease	O
develops	O
or	O
spreads	O
in	O
storage	O
.	O

Growers	O
who	O
plan	O
to	O
store	O
potatoes	O
are	O
advised	O
to	O
scout	O
and	O
treat	O
for	O
the	O
psyllid	O
if	O
they	O
find	O
symptoms	O
and	O
green	O
tissue	O
is	O
present	O
.	O

Swine	B-Disease
flu	I-Disease
deaths	O
continued	O
their	O
upwards	O
surge	O
since	O
the	O
onset	O
of	O
monsoon	O
with	O
17	O
fatalities	O
reported	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
since	O
21	O
Jun	O
2010	O
,	O
the	O
largest	O
numbers	O
of	O
which	O
occurred	O
in	O
Kerala	B-Province
and	O
Maharashtra	B-Province
.	O

Both	O
the	O
states	O
reported	O
7	O
deaths	O
each	O
while	O
Andhra	B-Province
Pradesh	I-Province
reported	O
2	O
and	O
Uttar	B-Province
Pradesh	I-Province
one	O
,	O
health	O
ministry	O
officials	O
said	O
today	O
.	O

All	O
345	O
cases	O
reported	O
during	O
the	O
week	O
are	O
indigenous	O
cases	O
.	O

Up	O
to	O
the	O
present	O
,	O
samples	O
from	O
143	O
285	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
tested	O
for	O
influenza	B-Virus
H1N1	I-Virus
[	O
virus	O
infection	O
]	O
and	O
33	O
083	O
(	O
23	O
per	O
cent	O
)	O
of	O
them	O
have	O
been	O
found	O
positive	O
.	O

With	O
the	O
new	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
swine	B-Disease
flu	I-Disease
toll	O
in	O
Kerala	B-Province
since	O
the	O
monsoon	O
hit	O
the	O
state	O
has	O
risen	O
to	O
32	O
.	O

Kerala	B-Province

,	O

,	O

)	O
on	O
Tuesday	O
reported	O
an	O
uptick	O
in	O
recorded	O
cases	O
of	O
acute	B-Disease
bloody	I-Disease
diarrhea	I-Disease
in	O

provinces	O
of	O
the	O
region	O
.	O

of	O

in	O

.	O

that	O
19	O
were	O
recorded	O
in	O
Quezon	B-Province
and	O
13	O
in	O
Rizal	B-Province
.	O

''	O

said	O
.	O

The	O
Regional	O
Epidemiology	O
and	O
Surveillance	O
Unit	O
has	O
recorded	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
44	O
acute	B-Disease
bloody	I-Disease
diarrhea	I-Disease
cases	O
from	O
1	O
Jan	O
to	O
15	O
May	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
.	O

Age	O
of	O
cases	O

from	O
one	O
year	O
to	O
57	O
years	O
old	O
.	O

Majority	O
of	O
the	O

were	O
female	O
with	O
23	O
(	O
52	O
%	O
)	O

of	O

.	O

The	O

with	O
the	O
highest	O
cases	O
of	O
acute	B-Disease
bloody	I-Disease
diarrhea	I-Disease
was	O

Quezon	B-Province
with	O

by	O

with	O
13	O

Laguna	B-Province

8	O

4	O
.	O

Janairo	O
warned	O
that	O

should	O
not	O
be	O
ignored	O
,	O
saying	O
the	O

may	O
result	O
in	O
death	O
.	O

Diarrhea	O
has	O
been	O
noted	O
to	O
be	O
common	O
during	O
the	O
dry	O
season	O
.	O

A	O
person	O
suffering	O
with	O
an	O
acute	B-Disease
bloody	I-Disease
diarrhea	I-Disease
experiences	O
abdominal	O

,	O
and	O
watery	O

.	O

that	O

_Escherichia	O
coli_	O
that	O
can	O

found	O
on	O
food	O

in	O
the	O

.	O

``	O

.	O

to	O
Greece	B-Country

to	O

against	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

.	O

Public	O
Health	O
England	B-Province
announced	O
infections	O
have	O
shot	O
up	O
over	O
the	O
past	O
3	O
weeks	O
and	O
almost	O
doubled	O
since	O
the	O
start	O
of	O
2018	O
.	O

There	O
were	O
735	O
cases	O
of	O
scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
in	O
England	B-Province
and	O
Wales	B-Province
during	O
the	O
week	O
ending	O
on	O
.	O

The	O
infection	O
,	O
most	O
common	O
among	O
children	O
aged	O
between	O
2	O
and	O
8	O
[	O
years	O
old	O
]	O
,	O
causes	O
symptoms	O
such	O
as	O
rashes	O
,	O
fever	O
,	O
``	O
strawberry	O
tongue	O
''	O
,	O
and	O
sore	O
throats	O
.	O

Dr	O
Theresa	O
Lamagni	O
,	O
from	O
Public	O
Health	O
England	B-Province
,	O
said	O
:	O
``	O

current	O
rates	O
are	O
nowhere	O
near	O
those	O
seen	O
in	O
the	O
early	O
1900s	O
,	O
the	O
magnitude	O
of	O
the	O
recent	O
upsurge	O
is	O
greater	O
than	O
any	O
documented	O
in	O
the	O
last	O
century	O
.	O
''	O

She	O
added	O
:	O
``	O
We	O
are	O
strongly	O
urging	O
people	O
with	O
symptoms	O
of	O
scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
,	O
which	O
include	O
a	O
sore	O
throat	O
,	O
headache	O
and	O
fever	O
accompanied	O
by	O
a	O
characteristic	O
rash	O
,	O
to	O
consult	O
their	O
GP	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
fever	O
is	O
known	O
to	O
strike	O
in	O
the	O
winter	O
and	O
spring	O
months	O
.	O

Cases	O
have	O
been	O
on	O
the	O
rise	O
since	O
2015	O
,	O
with	O
17	O
350	O
infections	O
recorded	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
.	O

In	O
2016	O
,	O
there	O
were	O
over	O
19	O
000	O
reported	O
cases	O
Â­	O
the	O
most	O
since	O
1967	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
proved	O
lethal	O
in	O
the	O
Victorian	O
era	O
,	O
causing	O
hundreds	O
of	O
thousands	O
of	O
deaths	O
in	O
the	O
late	O
19th	O
century	O
and	O
early	O
20th	O
century	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
take	O
up	O
to	O
a	O
week	O
for	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
ABC	O
,	O
the	O
bakery	O
was	O
also	O
struck	O
by	O
a	O
salmonellosis	B-Disease
outbreak	O
in	O
October	O
2016	O
which	O
affected	O
8	O
people	O
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
of	O
salmonellosis	B-Disease
include	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
fever	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
headaches	O
,	O
stomach	O
cramps	O
and	O
loss	O
of	O
appetite	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
typically	O
appear	O
12	O
to	O
36	O
hours	O
after	O
exposure	O
but	O
can	O
appear	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
6	O
hours	O
and	O
up	O
to	O
72	O
hours	O
afterwards	O
.	O

Infection	O
is	O
usually	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
ingesting	O
bacteria	O
from	O
contaminated	O
food	O
,	O
water	O
,	O
or	O
hands	O
.	O

High-risk	O
foods	O
include	O
poultry	O
,	O
meat	O
,	O
eggs	O
,	O
and	O
milk	O
.	O

Verticillium	B-Disease
wilt	I-Disease
has	O
been	O
widespread	O
in	O
Europe	O
for	O
decades	O
and	O
was	O
first	O
identified	O
in	O
the	O
south	O
of	O
England	B-Province
in	O
2007	O
,	O
said	O
Dr	O
Peter	O
Gladders	O
,	O
ADAS	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
causes	O
premature	O
ripening	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
cause	O
seed	O
shedding	O
during	O
harvest	O
.	O

Harvesting	O
contractors	O
were	O
alerted	O
to	O
a	O
cluster	O
of	O
cases	O
in	O
south	O
Lincolnshire	B-City
last	O
year	O
[	O
2009	O
]	O
,	O
leading	O
to	O
fears	O
that	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
working	O
its	O
way	O
north	O
and	O
could	O
affect	O
growers	O
in	O
Leicestershire	O
.	O

It	O
affects	O
brassicas	O
and	O
closely	O
related	O
weed	O
species	O
such	O
as	O
charlock	O
and	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
spores	O
that	O
remain	O
viable	O
in	O
the	O
soil	O
for	O
years	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
hard	O
to	O
control	O
,	O
Dr	O
Gladders	O
said	O
.	O

Despite	O
being	O
present	O
on	O
the	O
Continent	O
for	O
50	O
years	O
,	O
no	O
resistant	O
varieties	O
have	O
yet	O
been	O
bred	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
chemical	O
treatment	O
.	O

Dr	O
Gladders	O
said	O
:	O
``	O
At	O
the	O
moment	O
,	O
the	O
only	O
control	O
mechanism	O
is	O
to	O
avoid	O
growing	O
oilseed	O
too	O
tightly	O
in	O
the	O
rotation	O
.	O

Research	O
completed	O
in	O
Germany	O
suggests	O
it	O
should	O
be	O
grown	O
no	O
more	O
frequently	O
than	O
once	O
in	O
every	O
4	O
years	O
.	O

Later	O
drilling	O
also	O
seems	O
to	O
help	O
control	O
it	O
.	O

By	O
contrast	O
,	O
early	O
drilling	O
in	O
warmer	O
conditions	O
may	O
encourage	O
it	O
.	O
''	O

Farmers	O
are	O
also	O
advised	O
to	O
be	O
on	O
the	O
lookout	O
for	O
other	O
diseases	O
such	O
as	O
clubroot	O
,	O
sclerotinia	O
and	O
light	O
leaf	O
spot	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
cause	O
significant	O
yield	O
loss	O
.	O

The	O
authorities	O
in	O
Arua	B-City
municipality	I-City
have	O
closed	O
Hope	O
Kebir	O
primary	O
school	O
following	O
a	O
cholera	B-Disease
outbreak	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
.	O

The	O
school	O
is	O
located	O
among	O
heavily	O
crammed	O
settlements	O
in	O
Kenya	O
ward	O
,	O
Oli	O
division	O
where	O
sporadic	O
cholera	B-Disease
cases	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
since	O
October	O
2012	O
.	O

Norah	O
Fathu	O
,	O
the	O
municipal	O
principal	O
health	O
inspector	O
said	O
they	O
found	O
out	O
last	O
week	O
that	O
2	O

patients	O

.	O

``	O

,	O
''	O

of	O
cholera	B-Disease

.	O

2	O
of	O
the	O

while	O

still	O

.	O

However	O

.	O

The	O

and	O

in	O

only	O
up	O

A	O

Germany	B-Country
.	O

The	O

was	O

.	O

French	O

.	O

.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
a	O

bacterial	O
disease	O
cycling	O
between	O
rodents	O
and	O
fleas	O
.	O

from	O
the	O

of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
,	O
but	O

can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
,	O
including	O
rodents	O
and	O
pets	O
.	O

[	O
Signs	O
]	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
cats	O
can	O
include	O

lymph	O
nodes	O
,	O

,	O

,	O

of	O

.	O

.	O

Del	O

notes	O
.	O

To	O
make	O

worse	O
,	O
Del	O
Moral	O
says	O
shortages	O
of	O

are	O
a	O
major	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
problem	O
as	O
no	O

have	O
been	O
available	O
for	O
2	O
days	O
.	O

In	O

,	O

infection	O
popping	O
up	O
at	O
the	O
hospital	O

A	O
dog	O
that	O
went	O

in	O
a	O
New	B-Province
Brunswick	I-Province
river	O
notorious	O
for	O
toxic	B-Disease
algae	I-Disease
has	O
died	O
,	O
and	O

.	O

in	O

blue-green	B-Virus

.	O

[	O

A	O
jar	O
of	O
home-canned	O
salmon	O
sent	O
an	O
Anchorage	B-City
man	O
to	O
the	O
hospital	O
with	O
a	O
life-threatening	O
illness	O
for	O
a	O
week	O
this	O
summer	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O

according	O
to	O
state	O
epidemiologists	O
.	O

The	O
man	O
ate	O
the	O
salmon	O
on	O
19	O
Aug	O
2019	O
and	O
the	O
next	O
day	O
reported	O
feeling	O
lightheaded	O
.	O

His	O
vision	O
and	O
speech	O
began	O
to	O
blur	O
as	O
his	O

weakened	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
an	O

.	O

He	O
went	O
to	O
the	O
hospital	O
and	O
was	O
immediately	O
treated	O
for	O
botulism	B-Disease
.	O

The	O
illness	O
is	O
rare	O
but	O
occurs	O
with	O
higher	O
per-capita	O
frequency	O
in	O
Alaska	B-Province
than	O
in	O
the	O
Lower	O
48	O
,	O
said	O
Eric	O
Mooring	O
,	O
a	O
disease	O
detective	O
with	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
.	O

The	O
toxin	O
that	O
causes	O
botulism	B-Disease
can	O
develop	O
in	O
improperly	O
preserved	O
foods	O
,	O
and	O
symptoms	O
appear	O
within	O
18	O
to	O
36	O
hours	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
causes	O
muscle	O
paralysis	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
deadly	O
if	O
left	O
untreated	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
Lower	O
48	O
,	O
the	O
antitoxin	O
cure	O
is	O
kept	O
at	O
CDC	O
quarantine	O
stations	O
in	O
large	O
airports	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
treatment	O
is	O
shipped	O
to	O
the	O
impacted	O
patient	O
.	O

In	O
Alaska	B-Province
,	O
the	O
antitoxin	O
is	O
stored	O
at	O
8	O
hospitals	O
across	O
the	O
state	O
.	O

Mooring	O
said	O
there	O
are	O
about	O
a	O
half-dozen	O
or	O
fewer	O
cases	O
of	O
botulism	B-Disease
in	O
Alaska	B-Province
annually	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
are	O
only	O
a	O
few	O
dozen	O
throughout	O
the	O
entire	O
country	O
.	O

Mooring	O
said	O
the	O
sooner	O
patients	O
receive	O
treatment	O
,	O
the	O
better	O
off	O
they	O
are	O
.	O

The	O
antitoxin	O
stops	O
symptoms	O
from	O
worsening	O
but	O
does	O
n't	O
reverse	O
any	O
damage	O
that	O
has	O
already	O
set	O
in	O
.	O

Although	O
the	O
disease	O
has	O
the	O
potential	O
to	O
be	O
fatal	O
,	O
Mooring	O
said	O
``	O

's	O

,	O
''	O
because	O
only	O
4	O
%	O
of	O
patients	O
with	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
of	O
botulism	B-Disease
die	O
.	O

Anchorage	B-City
man	O

the	O

bad	O
.	O

.	O

to	O

can	O
low-acid	O
foods	O
like	O

.	O

[	O

]	O

.	O

Indonesia	B-Country
,	O
the	O

's	O
3rd-largest	O

,	O
has	O

a	O
bad	O

this	O
year	O
[	O
2011	O
]	O
as	O
wet	O
weather	O
damaged	O
the	O

crop	O
and	O
triggered	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
a	O

disease	O
.	O

Wet	O
weather	O
wreaked	O
havoc	O
on	O
the	O
crop	O
early	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2011	O
]	O
and	O
brought	O
back	O
the	O
vascular	B-Disease
streak	I-Disease
dieback	I-Disease
(	O
VSD	O
)	O
across	O
plantations	O
in	O
Sulawesi	B-Province
[	O

]	O
.	O

About	O
90	O
percent	O
of	O
Indonesian	O
cocoa	O
growers	O
are	O
smallholders	O
.	O

Output	O
is	O
likely	O
to	O
plunge	O
about	O
a	O
third	O
to	O
around	O
400	O
000	O
tonnes	O
in	O
2011	O
.	O

A	O
baby	O
in	O
California	B-Province
has	O
died	O
after	O
contracting	O
whooping	B-Disease
cough	I-Disease
,	O

the	O
1st	O
such	O
death	O
in	O
Orange	B-City
county	I-City
in	O
more	O

a	O

.	O

A	O
news	O

posted	O
on	O
by	O
the	O
county	O
's	O

officials	O
did	O
not	O

or	O

's	O
age	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
are	O
deeply	O

by	O
this	O
loss	O
of	O
life	O
and	O
send	O
our	O

to	O
the	O
family	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Nichole	O
Quick	O
,	O
interim	O
county	O
health	O
officer	O
,	O
said	O
in	O
the	O
news	O
release	O
.	O

The	O
health	O
department	O
counted	O
171	O
cases	O
of	O
whooping	B-Disease
cough	I-Disease
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
pertussis	O
,	O
in	O
2018	O
,	O
including	O
8	O
cases	O
involving	O
infants	O
under	O
3	O
months	O
.	O

7	O
of	O
those	O
children	O
required	O
hospitalization	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
is	O
a	O
very	O
contagious	O
disease	O
that	O
spreads	O
through	O
coughing	O
or	O
sneezing	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
take	O
up	O
to	O
3	O
weeks	O
for	O
symptoms	O
to	O
appear	O
.	O

Late-stage	O
symptoms	O
may	O
include	O
rapid	O
coughing	O
followed	O
by	O
a	O
high-pitched	O
``	O
whoop	O
''	O
sound	O
,	O
vomiting	O
and	O
exhaustion	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
pertussis	O
is	O
to	O
be	O
up-to-date	O
on	O
vaccinations	O
,	O
''	O
Quick	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Children	O
should	O
receive	O
5	O
doses	O
of	O
DTaP	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
their	O
routine	O
vaccination	O
schedule	O
starting	O
at	O
2	O
months	O
of	O
age	O
.	O

Pregnant	O
women	O
during	O
each	O
pregnancy	O
,	O
regardless	O
of	O
when	O
their	O
previous	O
pregnancy	O
occurred	O
,	O
are	O
strongly	O
recommended	O
to	O
receive	O
Tdap	O
vaccine	O
during	O
their	O
3rd	O
trimester	O
.	O

Vaccination	O
during	O
this	O
time	O
stimulates	O
production	O
of	O
maternal	O
antibodies	O
that	O
are	O
passed	O
on	O
to	O
the	O
infant	O
,	O
offering	O
protection	O
to	O
the	O
baby	O
against	O
pertussis	O
during	O
the	O
first	O
few	O
months	O
of	O
life	O
.	O
''	O

Hundreds	O
of	O
waterfowl	O
died	O
from	O
avian	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
last	O
year	O
[	O
2015	O
]	O
and	O
concerns	O
have	O
been	O
voiced	O
that	O
it	O
might	O
return	O
again	O
if	O
Verulamium	O
Lake	O
(	O
Hertforshire	B-City
)	O
is	O
not	O
cleared	O
.	O

Avian	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
is	O
a	O
paralytic	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
bacteria	O
(	O
_Clostridium	O
botulinum_	O
)	O
produced	O
from	O
silt	O
in	O
warmer	O
temperatures	O
.	O

A	O
number	O
of	O
dead	O
ducks	O
have	O
been	O
spotted	O
in	O
recent	O
weeks	O
but	O
the	O
district	O
council	O
will	O
not	O
confirm	O
the	O
deaths	O
are	O
caused	O
by	O
botulism	O
.	O

Now	O
3	O
swans	O
,	O
which	O
were	O
retrieved	O
by	O
Swan	O
Rescue	O
Hertfordshire	O
working	O
with	O
the	O
Swan	O
Sanctuary	O
,	O
have	O
died	O
,	O
while	O
another	O
is	O
currently	O
in	O
their	O
care	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
2	O
further	O
swans	O
that	O
are	O
thought	O
to	O
be	O
at	O
risk	O
which	O
will	O
be	O
re-located	O
later	O
this	O
week	O
.	O

Steve	O
Knight	O
,	O
a	O
Swan	O
Sanctuary	O
trustee	O
,	O
said	O
that	O
he	O
was	O
very	O
sure	O
that	O
botulism	O
was	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
swan	O
deaths	O
,	O
despite	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
no	O
official	O
tests	O
yet	O
.	O

Steve	O
said	O
that	O
he	O
did	O
not	O
understand	O
how	O
the	O
council	O
could	O
deny	O
that	O
it	O
was	O
botulism	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
:	O
``	O
We	O
've	O
been	O
doing	O
this	O
for	O
over	O
30	O
years	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
a	O
bit	O
like	O

child	O
has	O
a	O

,	O

is	O
as	O

as	O

.	O

We	O
are	O
a	O
registered	O
vet	O
practice	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
day	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
being	O
a	O
charity	O
.	O
''	O

from	O
members	O
of	O
the	O
public	O

swans	O
were	O
retrieved	O
from	O

(	O

)	O

)	O
.	O

.	O

:	O

.	O
''	O

St	O

.	O

.	O

An	O

[	O

the	O

``	O

''	O
.	O

One	O

Ebola	B-Virus

]	O

Xanthomonas	B-Virus
oryzae	I-Virus
pv	I-Virus
Oryzae	I-Virus
,	O
which	O
results	O
in	O
wilting	O
of	O
seedlings	O
,	O
yellowing	O
and	O
drying	O
of	O
leaves	O
.	O

In	O
Kaduna	B-Province
State	I-Province
,	O
many	O
of	O
the	O
farms	O
have	O
been	O
attacked	O
by	O
the	O
blight	B-Disease
.	O

Unfortunately	O
the	O
blight	B-Disease
wiped	O
out	O
all	O
investment	O
and	O
expected	O
gains	O
[	O
of	O
farmers	O
]	O
.	O

[	O
They	O
]	O
called	O
on	O
the	O
relevant	O
authorities	O
to	O
revive	O
the	O
system	O
,	O
where	O
extension	O
workers	O
would	O
be	O
available	O
to	O

for	O

.	O

In	O
Nasarawa	B-Province
State	I-Province
,	O
some	O
farms	O
have	O
also	O
been	O
devastated	O
by	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Syngenta	O
Nigeria	B-Country
advised	O
farmers	O
to	O
always	O
use	O
not	O
only	O
certified	O
seeds	O
but	O
treated	O
certified	O
seeds	O
and	O
observe	O
good	O
agronomy	O
practices	O
to	O
avoid	O
things	O
like	O
this	O
.	O

IRRI	O
has	O
advised	O
farmers	O
to	O
practice	O
good	O
cleaning	O
of	O
equipment	O
and	O
fields	O
between	O
season	O
,	O
use	O
clean	O
seeds	O
and	O
resistant	O
varieties	O
,	O
plant	O
at	O
the	O
same	O
time	O
as	O
your	O
neighbours	O
.	O

The	O
Pennsylvania	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
received	O
notice	O
Wednesday	O
from	O
the	O
USDA	O
confirming	O
rabbit	B-Virus
hemorrhagic	I-Virus
disease	I-Virus
(	O
RHD	O
)	O
in	O
2	O
pet	O
rabbits	O
that	O
died	O
on	O
in	O
Clover	B-City
Township	I-City
,	O
Jefferson	O
County	O
.	O

The	O
site	O
is	O
under	O
quarantine	O
and	O
is	O
being	O
cleaned	O
and	O
disinfected	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
poses	O
no	O
risk	O
to	O
human	O
health	O
,	O
nor	O
to	O
animals	O
other	O
than	O
rabbits	O
.	O

RHD	O
causes	O
sudden	O
death	O
in	O
rabbits	O
having	O
previously	O
exhibited	O
no	O
signs	O
of	O
disease	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
spreads	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
rabbits	O
,	O
their	O
meat	O
or	O
fur	O
,	O
or	O
materials	O
they	O
have	O
touched	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
has	O
2	O
strains	O
.	O

This	O
strain	O
,	O
RHD1	B-Virus
,	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
Pennsylvania	B-Province
before	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
known	O
to	O
affect	O
wild	O
rabbits	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
vaccine	O
available	O
in	O
the	O
USA	O
.	O

A	O
strain	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
known	O
to	O
affect	O
wild	O
and	O
domestic	O
rabbits	O
was	O
confirmed	O
in	O
Ohio	O
in	O
September	O
2018	O
.	O

Rabbit	O
owners	O
who	O
have	O
questions	O
about	O
this	O
disease	O
should	O
contact	O
their	O
veterinarians	O
.	O

Veterinarians	O
who	O
suspect	O
RHD	O
cases	O
should	O
immediately	O
contact	O
the	O
department	O
's	O
Bureau	O
of	O
Animal	O
Health	O
at	O
717-787-4250	O
.	O

People	O
in	O
Western	B-Province
Australia	I-Province
's	O
Gascoyne	O
and	O
Pilbara	O
regions	O
have	O
been	O
warned	O
to	O
take	O
extra	O
care	O
to	O
avoid	O
contracting	O
mosquito-borne	O
viruses	O
after	O
heavy	O
rainfall	O
and	O
localised	O
flooding	O
.	O

WA	O
Health	O
's	O
managing	O
scientist	O
Mike	O
Lindsay	O
said	O
Ross	B-Virus
River	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
(	O
RRV	O
)	O
was	O
active	O
at	O
above-average	O
levels	O
in	O
the	O
north-west	O
during	O
February	O
and	O
March	O
[	O
2014	O
]	O
.	O

``	O

case	O
numbers	O
decreased	O
during	O
April	O
[	O
2014	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
latest	O

in	O
the	O

and	O

may	O
extend	O
the	O
mosquito	O
breeding	O
season	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
turn	O
lead	O
to	O
increased	O
activity	O
of	O
RRV	O
or	O
other	O
mosquito-borne	O
viruses	O
over	O
the	O
next	O
few	O
weeks	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Lindsay	O
said	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
RRV	O
disease	O
include	O
painful	O
or	O

joints	O

can	O

for	O
weeks	O
or	O
months	O
.	O

There	O

or	O

,	O
WA	O

said	O
.	O

``	O

and	O
Family	O
Welfare	O
,	O
45	O
out	O
of	O
188	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
cases	O
that	O
were	O

positive	O
across	O
the	O
state	O

from	O
Ramanagara	B-City
.	O

An	O

also	O

that	O
the	O
district	O
had	O
been	O

the	O

.	O

Officials	O
of	O

had	O

in	O
Ramanagara	B-City
.	O

However	O

fell	O

,	O
with	O

in	O
the	O
district	O
.	O

``	O

are	O
awareness	O

that	O
are	O

.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
issue	O
is	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
primary	O
areas	O
where	O

are	O

.	O

Water-logging	O
and	O
leaking	O
drainage	O
is	O
a	O
common	O
problem	O
in	O
the	O
district	O
,	O
''	O

the	O
official	O
.	O

Further	O
,	O
in	O

like	O
Doddipalya	O
,	O

is	O

.	O

:	O
``	O
From	O
what	O
we	O
have	O
noticed	O
,	O
the	O
conditions	O
are	O
so	O
bad	O
that	O
people	O
even	O

farm	O

from	O
this	O
region	O
,	O
as	O
water	O
from	O
the	O
drainage	O
gets	O
mixed	O
with	O
drinking	O
water	O
.	O

This	O
even	O
stagnates	O
in	O
the	O
fields	O
making	O

conducive	O
for	O
mosquitoes	O
to	O
breed	O
.	O
''	O

Despite	O

the	O
country	O
in	O
2013	O
,	O
little	O
has	O

to	O

the	O
situation	O
.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
flea-borne	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
has	O
hit	O
downtown	O
Los	B-City
Angeles	I-City
[	O
CA	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
county	O
Department	O
of	O
Public	O
Health	O
said	O
Thursday	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
say	O
they	O
are	O
investigating	O
several	O
cases	O
of	O
flea-borne	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
,	O
a	O
disease	O
that	O
infected	O
fleas	O
can	O
spread	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

Although	O
the	O
fleas	O
can	O
come	O
from	O
cats	O
,	O
rats	O
,	O
and	O
opossums	O
,	O
pets	O
and	O
animals	O
do	O
not	O
get	O
sick	O
from	O
typhus	O
.	O

In	O
people	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
typhus	O
can	O
cause	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
and	O
rash	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
not	O
transmitted	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
treated	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
.	O

``	O
Although	O
typhus	O
normally	O
occurs	O
throughout	O
LA	O
County	O
,	O
we	O
are	O
observing	O
several	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
downtown	O
Los	B-City
Angeles	I-City
area	O
,	O
''	O
Los	O
Angeles	O
County	O
Health	O
Officer	O
Muntu	O
Davis	O
said	O
in	O
a	O
statement	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
encourage	O
pet	O
owners	O
to	O
practice	O
safe	O
flea	O
control	O
and	O
encourage	O
all	O
cities	O
in	O
the	O
county	O
to	O
ensure	O
maintenance	O
of	O
their	O
trash	O
clean-up	O
and	O
rodent	O
control	O
activities	O
.	O
''	O

Typhus	O
can	O
spread	O
in	O
areas	O
where	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
accumulation	O
of	O
trash	O
that	O
attracts	O
wild	O
animals	O
like	O
feral	O
cats	O
,	O
rats	O
,	O
and	O
opossums	O
.	O

To	O
help	O
prevent	O
typhus	O
,	O
the	O
department	O
recommended	O
that	O
residents	O
:	O
-	O
Practice	O
safe	O
flea	O
control	O
.	O

-	O
Use	O
flea	O
control	O
products	O
on	O
pets	O
.	O

-	O
When	O
outside	O
,	O
wear	O
pants	O
tucked	O
into	O
socks	O
or	O
boots	O
when	O
outside	O
.	O

Spray	O
insect	O
repellent	O
with	O
DEET	O
on	O
socks	O
and	O
pant	O
cuffs	O
.	O

-	O
Avoid	O
being	O
near	O
wild	O
or	O
stray	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Never	O
feed	O
or	O
touch	O
wild	O
animals	O
,	O
especially	O
opossums	O
,	O
rats	O
,	O
and	O
stray	O
or	O
feral	O
cats	O
.	O

-	O
Store	O
trash	O
in	O
cans	O
with	O
secure	O
lids	O
to	O
avoid	O
attracting	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Clear	O
areas	O
where	O
rats	O
and	O
stray	O
animals	O
sleep	O
,	O
hide	O
or	O
find	O
food	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
crawl	O
spaces	O
,	O
attics	O
,	O
or	O
under	O
decks	O
,	O
and	O
wear	O
gloves	O
and	O
a	O
mask	O
when	O
clearing	O
these	O
areas	O
.	O

After	O
27	O
years	O
with	O
no	O
detected	O
cases	O
,	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
occurred	O
in	O
a	O
beef	O
cattle	O
herd	O
in	O
the	O
south	O
of	O
Sweden	B-Country
.	O

The	O
outbreak	O
was	O
unusual	O
as	O
it	O
occurred	O
in	O
winter	O
,	O
in	O
animals	O
not	O
exposed	O
to	O
meat-and-bone	O
meal	O
,	O
in	O
a	O
non-endemic	O
country	O
.	O

The	O
affected	O
herd	O
consisted	O
of	O
90	O
animals	O
,	O
including	O
calves	O
and	O
young	O
stock	O
.	O

The	O
animals	O
were	O
kept	O
in	O
a	O
barn	O
on	O
deep	O
straw	O
bedding	O
and	O
fed	O
only	O
roughage	O
.	O

7	O
animals	O
died	O
during	O
10	O
days	O
,	O
with	O
no	O
typical	O
previous	O
clinical	O
signs	O
except	O
fever	O
.	O

The	O
carcasses	O
were	O
reportedly	O
normal	O
in	O
appearance	O
,	O
particularly	O
as	O
regards	O
rigor	O
mortis	O
,	O
bleeding	O
,	O
and	O
coagulation	O
of	O
the	O
blood	O
.	O

Subsequently	O
,	O
3	O
more	O
animals	O
died	O
and	O
anthrax	B-Disease
was	O
suspected	O
at	O
necropsy	O
and	O
confirmed	O
by	O
culture	O
and	O
PCR	O
on	O
blood	O
samples	O
.	O

The	O
isolated	O
strain	O
was	O
susceptible	O
to	O
tetracycline	O
,	O
ciprofloxacin	O
,	O
and	O
ampicillin	O
.	O

Subtyping	O
by	O
MLVA	O
showed	O
the	O
strain	O
to	O
cluster	O
with	O
isolates	O
in	O
the	O
A	O
lineage	O
of	O
_Bacillus	O
anthracis_	O
.	O

Environmental	O
samples	O
from	O
the	O
holding	O
were	O
all	O
negative	O
except	O
for	O
2	O
soil	O
samples	O
taken	O
from	O
a	O
spot	O
where	O
infected	O
carcasses	O
had	O
been	O
kept	O
until	O
they	O
were	O
picked	O
up	O
for	O
transport	O
.	O

The	O
most	O
likely	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
infection	O
was	O
concluded	O
to	O
be	O
contaminated	O
roughage	O
,	O
although	O
this	O
could	O
not	O
be	O
substantiated	O
by	O
laboratory	O
analysis	O
.	O

The	O
suspected	O
feed	O
was	O
mixed	O
with	O
soil	O
and	O
dust	O
and	O
originated	O
from	O
fields	O
where	O
flooding	O
occurred	O
the	O
previous	O
year	O
,	O
followed	O
by	O
a	O
dry	O
summer	O
with	O
a	O
very	O
low	O
water	O
level	O
in	O
the	O
river	O
allowing	O
for	O
the	O
harvesting	O
on	O
soil	O
usually	O
not	O
exposed	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
early	O
1900s	O
,	O
animal	O
carcasses	O
are	O
said	O
to	O
have	O
been	O
dumped	O
in	O
this	O
river	O
during	O
anthrax	B-Disease
outbreaks	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
most	O
likely	O
that	O
some	O
anthrax	O
spores	O
could	O
remain	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
.	O

The	O
case	O
indicates	O
that	O
atypical	O
cases	O
in	O
non-endemic	O
areas	O
may	O
be	O
missed	O
to	O
a	O
larger	O
extent	O
than	O
previously	O
thought	O
.	O

Field	O
tests	O
allowing	O
a	O
preliminary	O
risk	O
assessment	O
of	O
animal	O
carcasses	O
would	O
be	O
helpful	O
for	O
increased	O
sensitivity	O
of	O
detection	O
and	O
prevention	O
of	O
further	O
exposure	O
to	O
the	O
causative	O
agent	O
.	O

Maitland	B-City
City	O
Council	O
has	O
been	O
made	O
aware	O
of	O
a	O
suspected	O
case	O
of	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
at	O
Maitland	O
Pool	O
,	O
New	B-Province
South	I-Province
Wales	I-Province
Australia	B-Country
(	O
Hunter	O
Valley	O
)	O
.	O

Council	O
is	O
urging	O
anyone	O
with	O
symptoms	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
to	O
see	O
a	O
doctor	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
possible	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
include	O
an	O
onset	O
of	O
slight	O
fever	O
,	O
runny	O
nose	O
,	O
and	O
feeling	O
generally	O
unwell	O
;	O
and	O
an	O
itchy	O
skin	O
rash	O
which	O
usually	O
appears	O
as	O
small	O
lumps	O
,	O
turns	O
into	O
blisters	O
and	O
then	O
scabs	O
over	O
a	O
3	O
--	O
4	O
day	O
period	O
.	O

An	O
individual	O
with	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
is	O
contagious	O
from	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
the	O
illness	O
-	O
up	O
to	O
2	O
days	O
before	O
the	O
spots	O
appear	O
-	O
until	O
about	O
5	O
days	O
after	O
the	O
1st	O
spots	O
appear	O
.	O

Early	O
in	O
the	O
illness	O
,	O
the	O
virus	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
coughing	O
and	O
sneezing	O
.	O

Later	O
in	O
the	O
illness	O
,	O
the	O
virus	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
fluid	O
in	O
the	O
blisters	O
.	O

People	O
with	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
should	O
avoid	O
others	O
until	O
at	O
least	O
5	O
days	O
after	O
onset	O
of	O
the	O
rash	O
and	O
up	O
until	O
all	O
the	O
blisters	O
have	O
dried	O
.	O

They	O
should	O
cover	O
their	O
nose	O
and	O
mouth	O
when	O
coughing	O
or	O
sneezing	O
,	O
dispose	O
of	O
soiled	O
tissues	O
,	O
wash	O
their	O
hands	O
well	O
and	O
not	O
share	O
eating	O
utensils	O
,	O
food	O
or	O
drinking	O
cups	O
.	O

People	O
who	O
have	O
a	O
past	O
history	O
of	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
and	O
are	O
vaccinated	O
against	O
the	O
virus	O
are	O
less	O
likely	O
to	O
contract	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Anyone	O
who	O
has	O
not	O
had	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
or	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
can	O
get	O
chickenpox	O
.	O

In	O
particular	O
,	O
pregnant	O
women	O
,	O
newborn	O
babies	O
and	O
people	O
with	O
a	O
weakened	O
immune	O
system	O
should	O
avoid	O
anyone	O
with	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
and	O
should	O
see	O
their	O
doctor	O
immediately	O
if	O
they	O
have	O
been	O
around	O
someone	O
with	O
this	O
virus	O
.	O

A	O
person	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
should	O
rest	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
possible	O
and	O
avoid	O
contact	O
with	O
other	O
until	O
no	O
longer	O
infected	O
.	O

For	O
more	O
information	O
,	O
contact	O
your	O
doctor	O
,	O
or	O
visit	O
the	O
NSW	O
Health	O
website	O
.	O

Gates	O
are	O
closed	O
at	O
Plast	O
Camp	O
in	O
Geauga	B-City
County	I-City
as	O
the	O
health	O
district	O
begins	O
their	O
investigation	O
to	O
try	O
to	O
figure	O
out	O
why	O
kids	O
at	O
the	O
summer	O
camp	O
suddenly	O
got	O
sick	O
.	O

Health	O
District	O

Robert	O

there	O
are	O
2	O
confirmed	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
cases	O

a	O
handful	O

they	O

well	O
and	O
more	O
tests	O
are	O
being	O
done	O
to	O
see	O
if	O
other	O
kids	O
have	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
.	O

University	O
Hospitals	O
Dr	O
Aaron	O
Lareau	O
said	O
there	O
are	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
signs	O
to	O
watch	O
out	O
for	O
.	O

``	O
Diarrhea	O
,	O
cramping	O
of	O
the	O
stomach	O
.	O

Occasionally	O
in	O
cases	O
where	O
people	O
are	O
more	O
ill	O

can	O
see	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
blood	O
in	O
the	O
stool	O
.	O

cases	O
it	O
can	O

a	O
pretty	O
severe	O
illness	O
,	O
''	O

.	O

Lareau	O
said	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
infection	O
that	O
can	O
travel	O
quickly	O
,	O
especially	O
in	O
cases	O
where	O
there	O
are	O
a	O
lot	O
of	O
kids	O
who	O
might	O
not	O
always	O
be	O
the	O

at	O
camp	O
.	O

The	O
kids	O
are	O
sleeping	O
in	O
tents	O
and	O

outside	O
.	O

Right	O
now	O
,	O
the	O
health	O
district	O
does	O

know	O
where	O
the	O

came	O
from	O
.	O

They	O

,	O

.	O

``	O

hygiene	O

well	O

and	O

any	O

source	O
,	O
''	O

Lareau	O
.	O

``	O

's	O
a	O

to	O
say	O
,	O
but	O

's	O
probably	O

from	O
contaminated	O
water	O
from	O
stool	O
,	O
either	O
from	O
animals	O
or	O
from	O
humans	O
,	O
possibly	O
related	O
to	O
poor	O
hygiene	O
.	O
''	O

More	O
than	O
200	O
kids	O
went	O
to	O
Plast	O
Camp	O
,	O
ranging	O
in	O
age	O
from	O
6	O
to	O
18	O
years	O
old	O
.	O

Cleveland	O
19	O
News	O
called	O
Plast	O
Camp	O
,	O
but	O
workers	O
directed	O
questions	O
to	O
the	O
Geauga	B-City
County	I-City
Health	O
District	O

said	O
.	O

Hatchery	O
staff	O
became	O
aware	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
after	O
noticing	O
higher	O
than	O
normal	O
mortalities	O
in	O
juvenile	O
steelhead	O
.	O

Staff	O
noticed	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
and	O
initiated	O
lab	O
tests	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
fisheries	O
department	O
,	O
IHN	O
is	O
a	O
naturally	O
occurring	O
pathogen	O
in	O
wild	O
fish	O
throughout	O
the	O
Pacific	O
West	O
Coast	O
from	O
Alaska	O
to	O
California	O
.	O

IHN	O
poses	O
no	O
risk	O
to	O
humans	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
spread	O
quickly	O
and	O
has	O
a	O
100	O
per	O
cent	O
mortality	O
rate	O
if	O
a	O
fish	O
population	O
becomes	O
infected	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
known	O
to	O
exist	O
in	O
Great	O
Central	O
Lake	O
where	O
the	O
hatchery	O
draws	O
its	O
water	O
supplies	O
.	O

Lab	O
tests	O
identified	O
the	O
virus	O
as	O
the	O
endemic	O
,	O
naturally	O
occurring	O
strain	O
that	O
is	O
commonly	O
found	O
in	O
Pacific	O
sockeye	O
.	O

The	O
Canadian	O
Food	O
Inspection	O
Agency	O
[	O
CFIA	O
]	O
was	O
called	O
because	O
IHN	O
is	O
a	O
reportable	O
disease	O
.	O

Staff	O
have	O
isolated	O
the	O
area	O
where	O
the	O
infected	O
fish	O
were	O
being	O
held	O
,	O
and	O
are	O
cleaning	O
and	O
disinfecting	O
the	O
area	O
.	O

Measures	O
have	O
also	O
been	O
put	O
in	O
place	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
movement	O
of	O
staff	O
and	O
fish	O
in	O

out	O
of	O

hatchery	O
.	O

when	O
the	O
CFIA	O
is	O
satisfied	O
that	O
the	O
process	O
has	O
met	O
their	O
requirements	O
.	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
and	O
Livestock	O

for	O
urgent	O

in	O
fighting	O
a	O
disease	O

as	O
``	O
tar	B-Disease
spot	I-Disease
''	O

is	O

.	O

.	O

[	O

]	O

nov.	O

]	O

.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
spores	O
have	O

in	O
Koshi	B-City

,	O

Dr.	O

.	O

``	O

is	O

to	O

.	O

.	O

[	O
O.C	O
.	O

]	O
,	O
including	O
one	O
under	O
18	O
,	O
have	O
been	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
confirmed	O
or	O
probable	O
infections	O
caused	O
by	O
flea-borne	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
during	O
the	O
past	O
3	O
months	O
,	O
the	O
county	O
's	O
Health	O
Care	O
Agency	O
[	O
HCA	O
]	O
reported	O
Wednesday	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
include	O
fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
muscle	O
aches	O
and	O
a	O
rash	O
on	O
the	O
chest	O
,	O
back	O
,	O
arms	O
or	O
legs	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
treatable	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
if	O
left	O
untreated	O
,	O
says	O
Michael	O
Hearst	O
,	O
district	O
manager	O
for	O
the	O
county	O
's	O
Vector	O
Control	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
endemic	O
typhus	O
,	O
is	O
n't	O
passed	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
.	O

Instead	O
,	O
it's	O
transmitted	O
by	O
the	O
bites	O
of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
.	O

In	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
O.C	O
.	O

cases	O
the	O
past	O
few	O
years	O
,	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
by	O
a	O
family	O
cat	O
,	O
although	O
other	O
animals	O
can	O
carry	O
the	O
fleas	O
,	O
including	O
rats	O
,	O
opossums	O
and	O
raccoons	O
.	O

``	O
Everybody	O
we	O
talked	O
to	O
had	O
adopted	O
a	O
feral	O
cat	O
,	O
or	O
had	O
a	O
cat	O
that	O
was	O
in	O
and	O
out	O
a	O
lot	O
,	O
''	O
Hearst	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Between	O
1994	O
and	O
2005	O
,	O
there	O
were	O
no	O
reported	O
cases	O
of	O
flea-borne	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
in	O
the	O
county	O
.	O

There	O
was	O
one	O
case	O
in	O
2006	O
,	O
6	O
in	O
2007	O
,	O
15	O
in	O
2008	O
,	O
and	O
6	O
cases	O
each	O
in	O
2009	O
and	O
2010	O
.	O

We	O
've	O
had	O
more	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
last	O
3	O
years	O
than	O
in	O
the	O
previous	O
50	O
,	O
''	O
Hearst	O
said	O
.	O

There	O
have	O
been	O
8	O
reported	O
cases	O
in	O
2011	O
.	O

Of	O
the	O
5	O
in	O
the	O
last	O
3	O
months	O
,	O
4	O
were	O
adults	O
and	O
one	O
was	O
under	O
18	O
,	O
HCA	O
said	O
.	O

All	O
live	O
in	O
North	O
County	O
,	O
although	O
infected	O
animals	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
in	O
any	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
county	O
.	O

What	O
can	O
people	O
do	O
to	O
protect	O
themselves	O
from	O
flea-borne	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
?	O

Here	O
are	O
some	O
tips	O
offered	O
by	O
HCA	O
:	O
-	O
Treat	O
pets	O
regularly	O
with	O
flea-prevention	O
medications	O
.	O

-	O
Avoid	O
contact	O
with	O
rodents	O
,	O
opossums	O
,	O
feral	O
cats	O
or	O
other	O
animals	O
that	O
may	O
have	O
fleas	O
.	O

-	O
Close	O
openings	O
to	O
attics	O
and	O
crawl	O
spaces	O
in	O
your	O
home	O
,	O
and	O
keep	O
vents	O
and	O
screens	O
in	O
good	O
repair	O
to	O
prevent	O
animals	O
from	O
getting	O
in	O
.	O

-	O
Report	O
dead	O
animals	O
to	O
your	O
local	O
Animal	O
Control	O
agency	O
.	O

OC	O
Animal	O
Care	O
covers	O
17	O
O.C	O
.	O

cities	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
unincorporated	O
areas	O
.	O

For	O
other	O
cities	O
,	O
consult	O
the	O
OCAC	O
website	O
,	O
-	O
Remove	O
or	O
trim	O
overgrown	O
vegetation	O
or	O
ground	O
cover	O
where	O
wild	O
animals	O
may	O
hide	O
or	O
nest	O
.	O

-	O
Keep	O
trashcans	O
covered	O
,	O
and	O
remove	O
outdoor	O
sources	O
of	O
food	O
and	O
water	O
,	O
like	O
pet	O
food	O
and	O
fallen	O

from	O

.	O

that	O
rabies	B-Virus

now	O

108	O

Bali	B-Province
.	O

.	O

A	O
popular	O
nonprofit	O
riding	O
program	O
,	O
Westernaires	O
,	O

about	O
230	O

,	O
has	O
been	O

a	O
strangles	B-Disease
outbreak	O
that	O
threatens	O
the	O
financial	O

of	O
the	O
organization	O
.	O

Over	O
80	O
of	O
the	O
equines	O
in	O
their	O
care	O
have	O
contracted	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Westernaires	O
is	O
a	O
``	O
mounted	O
precision	O
drill	O
organization	O
composed	O
of	O
Jefferson	B-City
County	O
,	O
Colorado	B-Province
,	O
youngsters	O
from	O
9	O
to	O
19	O
years	O
of	O
age	O
''	O
.	O

They	O
were	O
founded	O
in	O
1949	O
and	O
have	O
been	O
serving	O
the	O
greater	O
Denver	O
area	O
since	O
then	O
.	O

``	O
Strangles	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
highly	O
contagious	O
equine	O
disease	O
that	O
's	O
like	O
strep	O
throat	O
,	O
''	O
Westernaires	O
director	O
Glen	O
Keller	O
told	O
reporters	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
's	O
common	O
among	O
horses	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
's	O
not	O
contagious	O
to	O
people	O
or	O
other	O
animals	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
very	O
contagious	O
among	O
horses	O
and	O
they	O
get	O
it	O
by	O
contact	O
,	O
either	O
by	O
touching	O
each	O
other	O
or	O
drinking	O
out	O
of	O
the	O
same	O
water	O
.	O
''	O

Horses	O
that	O
have	O
recovered	O
from	O
strangles	B-Disease
are	O
contagious	O
for	O
up	O
to	O
6	O
weeks	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
organization	O
is	O
looking	O
at	O
a	O
long	O
and	O
costly	O
quarantine	O
and	O
rehabilitation	O
process	O
.	O

A	O
voluntary	O
quarantine	O
has	O
been	O
put	O
in	O
place	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
entire	O
herd	O
from	O
contracting	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
loss	O
of	O
rental	O
and	O

fees	O
have	O
led	O
to	O
an	O
estimated	O
loss	O
of	O
USD	O
15	O
000	O
per	O
week	O
for	O
the	O
organization	O
.	O

The	O
most	O
recent	O
available	O
990	O
,	O
2016	O
,	O
shows	O
a	O
total	O
cash	O

of	O
just	O
over	O
USD	O
330	O
000	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
director	O
is	O
worried	O
.	O

``	O
Even	O
when	O
you	O
run	O
a	O
nonprofit	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
prepare	O
for	O
a	O

day	O
,	O
''	O
Keller	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
've	O

to	O
prepare	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
will	O
certainly	O
impact	O
us	O
in	O
the	O
long	O
run	O
,	O
likely	O
eliminating	O

to	O

and	O
things	O
like	O
that	O
or	O
what	O
we	O

to	O
transport	O
the	O
kids	O
.	O
''	O

St.	O
Joseph	O
County	O
Health	O
Officer	O
Dr.	O
Thomas	O
A.	O
Felgerhas	O
announced	O
that	O
laboratory	O
tests	O
have	O
confirmed	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
as	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
gastrointestinal	O
outbreak	O
that	O
affected	O
106	O
students	O
attending	O
a	O
sport	O
camp	O
at	O
the	O
University	O
of	O
Notre	O
Dame	O
earlier	O
this	O
week	O
.	O

29	O
of	O
those	O
students	O
were	O
treated	O
and	O
released	O
from	O
local	O
emergency	O
departments	O
for	O
the	O
intestinal	O
illness	O
.	O

Norovirus	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
very	O
contagious	O
virus	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
common	O
``	O
stomach	O
bug	O
''	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
.	O

Norovirus	B-Virus
can	O
be	O
spread	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
,	O
contaminated	O
food	O
or	O
water	O
,	O
or	O
by	O
touching	O
contaminated	O
surfaces	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
usually	O
occur	O
12-48	O
hours	O
after	O
exposure	O
,	O
and	O
include	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
stomach	O
pain	O
,	O
nausea	O
,	O
and	O
vomiting	O
.	O

Most	O
people	O
recover	O
in	O
1-3	O
days	O
,	O
but	O
remain	O
contagious	O
for	O
up	O
to	O
2	O
weeks	O
after	O
recovery	O
.	O

Hand	O
washing	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
effective	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
.	O

Wash	O
hands	O
with	O
warm	O
water	O
and	O
soap	O
for	O
at	O
least	O
20	O
seconds	O
,	O
and	O
be	O
sure	O
to	O
wash	O
hands	O
after	O
using	O
the	O
bathroom	O
,	O
after	O
changing	O
a	O
diaper	O
,	O
after	O
taking	O
care	O
of	O
someone	O
else	O
who	O
is	O
sick	O
,	O
and	O
before	O
eating	O
or	O
preparing/handling	O
food	O
.	O

After	O
throwing	O
up	O
or	O
having	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
immediately	O
clean	O
and	O
disinfect	O
contaminated	O
surface	O
using	O
a	O
chlorine	O
bleach	O
solution	O
with	O
a	O
concentration	O
of	O
1000-5000	O
ppm	O
(	O
5-25	O
tablespoons	O
of	O
household	O
bleach	O
per	O
gallon	O
of	O
water	O
)	O
or	O
other	O
disinfectant	O
registered	O
as	O
effective	O
against	O
Norovirus	B-Virus
by	O
the	O
Environmental	O
Protection	O
Agency	O
(	O
EPA	O
)	O
.	O

Those	O
who	O
are	O
ill	O
should	O
stay	O
home	O
,	O
preferably	O
at	O
least	O
3	O
days	O
after	O
symptoms	O
resolve	O
.	O

The	O
St.	O
Joseph	O
County	O
Health	O
Department	O
will	O
continue	O
to	O
work	O
with	O
the	O
University	O
of	O
Notre	O
Dame	O
and	O
the	O
Indiana	B-Province
State	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
to	O
gather	O
and	O
disseminate	O
information	O
.	O

Additional	O
information	O
about	O
Norovirus	B-Virus
can	O
be	O
found	O
on	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
website	O
.	O

Health	O
authorities	O
are	O
also	O
investigating	O
a	O
suspected	O
norovirus	B-Virus
outbreak	O
among	O
girls	O
attending	O
a	O
cheerleading	O
camp	O
at	O
Davenport	O
University	O
in	O
Grand	O
Rapids	O
.	O

(	O
By	O
By	O
Adam	O
Ziegler	O
)	O

The	O
Virginia	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
does	O
not	O
know	O
and	O
may	O
never	O
know	O
from	O
which	O
body	O
of	O
water	O
a	O
Virginia	O
child	O
contracted	O
a	O
deadly	O
infection	O
from	O
an	O
amoeba	O
.	O

``	O
In	O
all	O
likelihood	O
,	O
we	O
're	O
never	O
going	O
to	O
pinpoint	O
exactly	O
where	O
this	O
amoeba	O
was	O
acquired	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dr.	O
Keri	O
Hall	O
,	O
the	O
state	O
epidemiologist	O
.	O

Her	O
department	O
received	O
results	O
from	O
an	O
autopsy	O
Friday	O
that	O
confirmed	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
death	O
as	O
primary	B-Disease

found	O
deer	O
frothing	O
at	O
the	O
mouth	O
,	O
approaching	O
homes	O
and	O
humans	O
,	O
and	O
dying	O
near	O
creeks	O
.	O

Those	O
are	O
all	O
signs	O
of	O
EHD	O
.	O

A	O
Crete	B-City
resident	O
calls	O
the	O
situation	O
``	O
scary	O
''	O
and	O
describes	O
the	O
smell	O
as	O
``	O
horrendous	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
last	O

outbreak	O
of	O
EHD	O
in	O
Illinois	B-Province
in	O
2007	O
killed	O
1900	O
deer	O
in	O
57	O
counties	O
.	O

A	O
total	O
of	O
2	O

from	O
the	O
Hydesville	B-City
area	O
were	O

by	O

.	O

.	O

,	O

for	O
rabies	B-Virus
.	O

Public	O

against	O

animals	O
in	O
the	O
head	O
.	O

``	O

intact	O

for	O
an	O

lab	O

in	O
the	O
head	O
can	O
delay	O
and	O
disrupt	O
results	O
,	O
''	O
said	O

.	O

When	O

is	O
incomplete	O
or	O

,	O
the	O
specimen	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
if	O
rabid	O
,	O
leading	O
to	O
potentially	O

courses	O
of	O

as	O
human	O

and	O
animal	O

.	O

Experts	O
say	O
rabies	B-Virus
is	O
always	O
present	O
in	O
the	O
wildlife	O
population	O
throughout	O
Humboldt	O
County	O
,	O
especially	O
among	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

with	O
wild	O
and	O

animals	O
,	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

against	O

.	O

phone	O
in	O

that	O

A	O

as	O

virus	O
is	O

in	O

of	O

.	O

Tomatoes	O
have	O

.	O

]	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

]	O

[	O

]	O

.	O

As	O
of	O

its	O

.	O

``	O

a	O

in	O

,	O
''	O

Research	O
said	O
.	O

Increasing	O

in	O

has	O
enhanced	O
the	O
risks	O
manifold	O
.	O

have	O

[	O
with	O
]	O
sap-sucking	O
insects	O
[	O
that	O
]	O
spread	O
many	O
crop	O
viruses	O
,	O
with	O
new	O
strains	O
emerging	O
.	O

Seeds	O
from	O
reputed	O
sources	O
must	O
be	O
procured	O
.	O

Multiple	O
virus	O
invasions	O
make	O
[	O
it	O
]	O
more	O
difficult	O
to	O
get	O
resistant/tolerant	O
stock	O
.	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
(	O
MOH	O
)	O
has	O
identified	O
the	O
disease	O
that	O
has	O
been	O
claiming	O
the	O
lives	O
of	O
people	O
in	O
Manafwa	B-Province
district	I-Province
as	O
blackwater	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
,	O
a	O
severe	O
complication	O
of	O
malaria	O
in	O
which	O
red	O
blood	O
cells	O
burst	O
in	O
the	O
bloodstream	O
,	O
releasing	O
haemoglobin	O
directly	O
into	O
the	O
blood	O
vessels	O
and	O
the	O
urine	O
and	O
leading	O
to	O
kidney	O
failure	O
.	O

In	O
May	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
,	O
14	O
people	O
died	O
under	O
unclear	O
circumstances	O
in	O
Manafwa	B-Province
district	I-Province
.	O

The	O
victims	O
were	O
passing	O
urine	O
laced	O
with	O
blood	O
.	O

Last	O
month	O
[	O
June	O
2018	O
]	O
,	O
parliament	O
directed	O
the	O
health	O
ministry	O
to	O
investigate	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
deaths	O
.	O

Dr	O
Charles	O
Olar	O
,	O
Director	O
Clinical	O
Services	O
,	O
said	O
investigations	O
revealed	O
that	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
not	O
new	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
's	O
healthcare	O
system	O
,	O
adding	O
that	O
the	O
recent	O
outbreak	O
has	O
shown	O
an	O
increase	O
in	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
deaths	O
.	O

``	O
When	O
you	O
look	O
at	O
the	O
fatality	O
rate	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
we	O
have	O
seen	O
an	O
increase	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
In	O
2017	O
we	O
recorded	O
9	O
deaths	O
,	O
but	O
we	O
have	O
almost	O
doubled	O
that	O
figure	O
this	O
month	O
.	O
''	O

Records	O
from	O
the	O
MOH	O
show	O
that	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
which	O
first	O
manifested	O
itself	O
in	O
2003	O
,	O
has	O
affected	O
500	O
people	O
and	O
claimed	O
32	O
lives	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
common	O
in	O
Bukomero	O
Subcounty	O
,	O
Kiboga	O
district	O
.	O

The	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
unknown	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
is	O
suspected	O
to	O
be	O
an	O
autoimmune	O
reaction	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
interaction	O
of	O
the	O
malaria	B-Virus
parasite	I-Virus
and	O
malaria	O
medication	O
such	O
as	O
quinine	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
Dr	O
Olar	O
,	O
investigations	O
are	O
ongoing	O
to	O
establish	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
blackwater	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
include	O
a	O
rapid	O
pulse	O
,	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
extreme	O
prostration	O
,	O
rapidly	O
developing	O
anaemia	O

and	O
passage	O
of	O
urine	O
that	O
is	O
black	O
or	O
dark	O
red	O
in	O
colour	O
.	O

of	O

virus	I-Disease
has	O

2	O

A	O

[	O

]	O
for	O

``	O

``	O

Karmikund	O
village	O
under	O

block	O
of	O

.	O

On	O
Tuesday	O
,	O
a	O
domestic	O
cat	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
the	O
plague	B-Disease
at	O
a	O
local	O
veterinarian	O
hospital	O
in	O
San	B-City
Miguel	I-City
County	O
[	O
Colorado	B-Province
]	O
.	O

The	O
cat	O
was	O
hospitalized	O
,	O
tested	O
,	O
and	O
treated	O
and	O
is	O
recovering	O
well	O
.	O

No	O
fleas	O
were	O
found	O
during	O
treatment	O
and	O
those	O
who	O
handled	O
the	O
cat	O
did	O
not	O
experience	O
high	O
risk	O
exposures	O
though	O
will	O
monitor	O
for	O
symptoms	O
for	O
the	O
next	O
week	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
one	O
of	O
a	O
few	O
instances	O
of	O
the	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
domestic	O
and	O
wild	O
animals	O
so	O
far	O
this	O
summer	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
across	O
the	O
state	O
of	O
Colorado	B-Province
though	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
no	O
human	O
cases	O
to	O
date	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
has	O
been	O
present	O
in	O
Colorado	B-Province
since	O
at	O
least	O
the	O
1940s	O
and	O
is	O
most	O
frequently	O
discovered	O
amongst	O
rodents	O
in	O
the	O
summer	O
months	O
.	O

Domestic	O
animals	O
can	O
be	O
infected	O
with	O
the	O
plague	B-Disease
when	O
the	O
infection	O
spills	O
over	O
from	O
rodent	O
populations	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
by	O
infected	O
animal	O
tissue	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
an	O
animal	O
carcass	O
,	O
fluid	O
,	O
or	O
respiratory	O
droplets	O
spread	O
through	O
coughing	O
or	O
sneezing	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
most	O
often	O
spread	O
to	O
people	O
through	O
a	O
bite	O
from	O
an	O
infected	O
flea	O
.	O

While	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
human	O
vaccine	O
for	O
plague	B-Disease
,	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
treated	O
successfully	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
when	O
caught	O
early	O
.	O

The	O
infection	O
occurred	O
in	O
San	O
Bernardo	O
at	O
9400	O
feet	O
[	O
2865	O
m	O
]	O
of	O
elevation	O
.	O

San	B-City
Miguel	I-City
County	O
Public	O
Health	O
is	O
currently	O
working	O
with	O
regional	O
campgrounds	O
to	O
watch	O
for	O
dead	O
rodents	O
,	O
fleas	O
,	O
and	O
other	O
possible	O
signs	O
of	O
disease	O
prevalence	O
.	O

``	O
Throughout	O
the	O
summer	O
,	O
as	O
you	O
and	O
your	O
pets	O
enjoy	O
being	O
active	O
outdoors	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
important	O
to	O
keep	O
an	O
eye	O
out	O

disease	O
and	O
infections	O
,	O
''	O
said	O

Director	O

Franklin	O
.	O

``	O
If	O
you	O
or	O
your	O
pets	O
have	O
contact	O
with	O
fleas	O
,	O
wild	O
animals	O
,	O
or	O
rodents	O
,	O
please	O
monitor	O
for	O
symptoms	O
throughout	O
the	O
season	O
.	O

When	O
caught	O
early	O
,	O
the	O
plague	B-Disease
is	O
highly	O
treatable	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
symptoms	O
of	O
the	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
human	O
beings	O
include	O
,	O
but	O
are	O
not	O
limited	O
to	O
:	O
-	O
swollen	O
or	O
tender	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
;	O
-	O
shortness	O
of	O
breath	O
;	O
-	O
pain	O
in	O
the	O
abdomen	O
or	O
muscles	O
;	O
-	O
fever	O
;	O
-	O
chills	O
;	O
-	O
fatigue	O
If	O
you	O
or	O
someone	O
you	O
know	O
has	O
been	O
in	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
infected	O
rodent	O
,	O
wild	O
,	O
or	O
domestic	O
animal	O
and	O
is	O
experiencing	O
symptoms	O
of	O
the	O
plague	O
,	O
please	O
contact	O
your	O
primary	O
care	O
physician	O
right	O
away	O
.	O

not	O

physician	O
,	O

reach	O
out	O

Miguel	I-City
County	O

Health	O

sanmiguelcountyco.gov	O
>	O
.	O

A	O
cat	O
in	O
Pueblo	B-City
West	I-City
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
tularemia	B-Disease
,	O
a	O
potentially	O
serious	O
illness	O
that	O
can	O
be	O
passed	O
on	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

The	O
Health	O
Department	O
said	O
the	O
cat	O
was	O
an	O
indoor/outdoor	O
cat	O
,	O
and	O
officials	O
are	O
working	O
with	O
the	O
cat	O
's	O
owners	O
regarding	O
medical	O
concerns	O
.	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
serious	O
illness	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
bacteria	O
found	O
in	O
animals	O
,	O
especially	O
rodents	O
,	O
rabbits	O
,	O
and	O
prairie	O
dogs	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
said	O
the	O
illness	O
can	O
be	O
passed	O
on	O
to	O
humans	O
in	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
ways	O
including	O
:	O
being	O
bitten	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
tick	O
,	O
deerfly	O
,	O
or	O
other	O
insect	O
;	O
handling	O
infected	O
animal	O
carcasses	O
;	O
eating	O
or	O
drinking	O
contaminated	O
food	O
or	O
water	O
;	O
breathing	O
in	O
the	O
bacteria	O
.	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
not	O
treated	O
with	O
the	O
right	O
antibiotics	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
said	O
the	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
keep	O
your	O
pets	O
safe	O
is	O
to	O
not	O
let	O
them	O
roam	O
or	O
eat	O
dead	O
animals	O
and	O
to	O
keep	O
an	O
eye	O
on	O
their	O
health	O
.	O

in	O
Nunavik	B-City
[	O
region	O
,	O
Quebec	B-Province
]	O

[	I-Disease

]	I-Disease

in	O

[	O

.	O

Details	O
of	O
the	O
case	O
A	O
78-year-old	O

from	O
Kuwait	B-City
city	I-City
developed	O

,	O

.	O

,	O
who	O

,	O

for	O
MERS-CoV	O
on	O
.	O

and	O

.	O

to	O

in	O

.	O

.	O

for	O
this	O
case	O
.	O

Globally	O
,	O
WHO	O
has	O
been	O
notified	O
of	O
1570	O

cases	O
of	O
infection	O
with	O
MERS-CoV	O
,	O

at	O
least	O
555	O
related	O

.	O

So	O
far	O
in	O
2011	O
,	O
13	O
cases	O
of	O
tularemia	B-Disease
have	O
been	O
reported	O
in	O
people	O
living	O
in	O
5	O
municipalities	O
in	O
More	O
og	O
Romsdal	O
and	O
Sor-Trondelag	O
.	O

In	O
2010.	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
21	O
cases	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
across	O
the	O
country	O
were	O
reported	O
.	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
,	O
sometimes	O
called	O
hare	O
plague	O
,	O
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
that	O
every	O
few	O
years	O
causes	O
local	O
outbreaks	O
among	O
rabbits	O
and	O
rodents	O
,	O
particularly	O
in	O
lemmings	O
.	O

Humans	O
can	O
become	O
infected	O
through	O
direct	O
or	O
indirect	O
contact	O
with	O
sick	O
,	O
dead	O
,	O
or	O
disease-carrying	O
animals	O
.	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
through	O
contaminated	O
drinking	O
water	O
when	O
animal	O
tissue	O
has	O

.	O

The	O
disease	O
can	O
also	O
spread	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
such	O
animals	O
and	O
by	O

of	O
dust	O
with	O
infected	O
feces	O
or	O
urine	O
.	O

,	O

in	O

mansoni_	O

vital	O
_S	O
.	O

haematobium_	O
eggs	O
were	O
found	O
in	O

(	O
5-10/ml	O
)	O
processed	O

(	O

in	O

.	O

This	O
report	O
shows	O
that	O
significant	O
infection	O
with	O
_S	O
.	O

haematobium_	O
may	O
be	O

with	O

exposure	O
and	O
that	O
exposure	O
risk	O
still	O
existed	O
in	O
the	O
summer	O
of	O
2013	O
.	O

In	O
northern	O
India	B-Country
in	O
recent	O
years	O
,	O
rice	B-Disease
root	I-Disease
knot	I-Disease
has	O
emerged	O
as	O
a	O
major	O
problem	O
in	O
flooded	O
and	O
irrigated	O
rice	O
.	O

Farmers	O
are	O
not	O
able	O
to	O
recognize	O
this	O
disease	O
because	O
specific	O
symptoms	O
on	O
roots	O
remain	O
hidden	O
in	O
the	O
soil	O
.	O

As	O
a	O
result	O
,	O
its	O
identity	O
is	O
misjudged	O
,	O
and	O
fertilizer	O
or	O
an	O
inappropriate	O
pesticide	O
are	O
applied	O
,	O
which	O
give	O
no	O
economic	O
return	O
[	O
and	O
cause	O
]	O
environmental	O
contamination	O
.	O

Root-knot	O
of	O
rice	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
nematode	O
(	O
_Meloidogyne	O
graminicola_	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
crop	O
has	O
reduced	O
tillering	O
,	O
and	O
yield	O
is	O
severely	O
affected	O
.	O

Consequently	O
,	O
farmers	O
plough	O
the	O
field	O
and	O
discard	O
the	O
crop	O
.	O

Rice	O
varieties	O
grown	O
in	O
India	B-Country
are	O
generally	O
susceptible	O
and	O
exhibit	O
significant	O
yield	O
loss	O
100	O
percent	O
in	O
heavily	O
infested	O
fields	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
can	O
be	O
controlled	O
by	O
nematicides	O
available	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

The	O
control	O
measures	O
should	O
be	O
taken	O
in	O
the	O
nursery	O
bed	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
the	O
main	O
field	O
.	O

Farmers	O
are	O
advised	O
to	O
thoroughly	O
plough	O
the	O
nursery	O
beds	O
and	O
remove	O
weeds	O
and	O
crop	O
debris	O
.	O

[	O
Seed	O
or	O
]	O
seedlings	O
should	O
be	O
disinfested	O
.	O

Biopesticides	O
as	O
seed	O
dressing	O
,	O
soil	O
treatment	O
in	O
nursery	O
beds	O
,	O
or	O
root-dips	O
may	O
help	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
best	O
option	O
is	O
crop	O
rotation	O
[	O
with	O
]	O
maize	O
,	O
pearl	O
millet	O
,	O
vegetables	O
and	O
cucurbits	O
as	O
per	O
climatic	O
suitability	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
positive	O
sample	O
of	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
reported	O

Louisiana	B-Province

.	O

that	O

.	O

wo	O

West	B-Virus

wo	O

,	O

is	O

to	O

are	O
most	O

and	O

.	O

He	O

any	O

around	O

.	O

year	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O

20	O
Louisiana	B-Province
residents	O

West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus

,	O

2	O

.	O

The	O
most	O

is	O
a	O

infection	O
,	O

can	O

to	O

The	O
increasing	O

of	O

spot	I-Disease
(	O

)	O

[	O
the	O
]	O

's	O

for	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

[	O

]	O

has	O

The	O

West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus

.	O

It	O

they	O
have	O
gone	O
from	O
one	O
in	O
2014	O
,	O
to	O
20	O
last	O

[	O
2017	O
]	O
.	O

Mosquito	O

that	O
tested	O
positive	O
rose	O
from	O
just	O
one	O
in	O
2014	O
to	O
29	O
in	O
2017	O
.	O

This	O
year	O
's	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
(	O
WNV	O
)	O
program	O
is	O
being	O
launched	O
on	O
.	O

The	O
program	O
includes	O
larviciding	O
catch	O
basins	O
,	O
standing	O
water	O
sites	O
,	O
and	O
lagoons	O
to	O
disrupt	O
mosquito	O
breeding	O
.	O

The	O
campaign	O
also	O
educates	O
residents	O
on	O
self-protection	O
,	O
conducts	O
adult	O
mosquito	O
surveillance	O
,	O
and	O
investigates	O
human	O
cases	O
.	O

The	O
health	O
unit	O
urges	O
people	O
to	O
use	O
insect	O
repellents	O
containing	O
DEET	O
,	O
Icaridin	O
,	O
or	O
other	O
approved	O
ingredients	O
on	O
clothing	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
exposed	O
skin	O
,	O
wear	O
long-sleeved	O
shirts	O
,	O
pants	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
hat	O
when	O
outdoors	O
.	O

Light-coloured	O
clothing	O
is	O
best	O
as	O
mosquitoes	O
tend	O
to	O
be	O
attracted	O
to	O
dark	O
colours	O
.	O

The	O
public	O
is	O
also	O
asked	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
that	O
door	O
and	O
window	O
screens	O
fit	O
securely	O
and	O
are	O
free	O
of	O
holes	O
,	O
and	O
remove	O
any	O
hazards	O
that	O
could	O
become	O
a	O
reservoir	O
for	O
standing	O
water	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
old	O
tires	O
,	O
upturned	O
wheelbarrows	O
,	O
animal	O
dishes	O
,	O
and	O
unused	O
flower	O
pots	O
.	O

``	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
serious	O
illness	O
that	O
is	O
transmitted	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O

.	O

Each	O
year	O
,	O
we	O
have	O
to	O
prepare	O
and	O
assume	O
that	O
mosquitoes	O
are	O
carrying	O
the	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
,	O
''	O
says	O
Dr.	O
Wajid	O
Ahmed	O
,	O
acting	O
medical	O
officer	O
of	O
health	O
.	O

``	O

simple	O

,	O
residents	O
can	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
being	O

by	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

was	O

at	O
Shoal	B-City

dump	O
in	O
Leanyer	B-City
[	O

]	O
last	O

.	O

Department	O

likely	O

[	O
_Trichomonas	O
gallinae_	O
]	O
,	O

Mr	O

said	O
in	O

of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
in	O

of	O

to	O

with	O
the	O

.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
an	O
acute	O
infectious	O
disease	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
without	O
timely	O
aid	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
meat	O
of	O
infected	O
animals	O
and	O
their	O
products	O
:	O
hides	O
,	O
skin	O
and	O
so	O
on	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
transmitted	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
.	O

Rabies	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
3rd-world	O
problem	O
:	O
it	O
's	O
treatable	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
you	O
have	O
money	O
and	O
access	O
to	O
the	O
proper	O
medical	O
care	O
.	O

(	O
95	O
percent	O
of	O
human	O
deaths	O
are	O
in	O
Asia	O
and	O
Africa	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
.	O
)	O

In	O
Jiangsu	B-Province
province	O
,	O
a	O
father	O
chose	O
--	O
out	O
of	O
monetary	O
reasons	O
--	O
to	O
not	O
seek	O

after	O
sucking	O
blood	O
out	O
of	O
a	O
dog	O
bite	O
on	O
his	O
son	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
dead	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
.	O

reported	O
that	O

victim	O
's	O
son	O
was	O

to	O

and	O
received	O
rabies	B-Virus
vaccine	O
shots	O
after	O
his	O

,	O
a	O

,	O
tried	O
to	O
remove	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

unlikely	O

virus	O
through	O
the	O
mouth	O
and	O
he	O
thought	O
taking	O
shots	O
too	O
troublesome	O
.	O

China	B-Country
has	O
the	O
2nd	O
highest	O
mortality	O
rate	O
from	O
rabies	B-Virus
in	O
the	O
world	O
,	O
behind	O
India	O
--	O
about	O
2000	O
deaths	O
per	O
year	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
why	O
authorities	O
,	O
especially	O
in	O
rural	O
villages	O
,	O
occasionally	O
``	O
crack	O
down	O
''	O
on	O
dogs	O
--	O
it	O
's	O
easier	O
than	O
vaccinating	O
everyone	O
,	O
unfortunately	O
.	O

Last	O
night	O
,	O
Keshet	O
12	O
TV	O
News	O
magazine	O
aired	O
an	O
article	O
by	O
Guy	O
Varon	O
,	O
which	O
covered	O
the	O
closure	O
of	O
[	O
a	O
family	O
's	O
]	O
dairy	O
operation	O
in	O
Kinneret	B-City
colony	O
,	O
following	O
the	O
infection	O
with	O
bovine	B-Disease
tuberculosis	I-Disease
of	O
their	O
herd	O
of	O
nearly	O
200	O
cattle	O
.	O

In	O
recent	O
months	O
we	O

,	O

,	O
''	O
she	O
added	O
.	O

American	B-Disease
Foulbrood	I-Disease
(	O
AFB	O
)	O
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
by	O
the	O
Scottish	O
government	O
at	O
one	O
hive	O
in	O
the	O
Stranraer	B-City
area	O
.	O

An	O
infected	O
area	O
has	O
been	O
declared	O
5km	O
(	O
3	O
miles	O
)	O
around	O
the	O
apiary	O
involved	O
,	O
prohibiting	O
the	O
movement	O
of	O
bees	O
or	O
equipment	O
in	O
or	O
out	O
of	O
the	O
area	O
.	O

Foulbrood	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
bacterium	O
getting	O
inside	O
bee	O
larvae	O
and	O
using	O
up	O
their	O
food	O
supplies	O
,	O
starving	O
them	O
to	O
death	O
.	O

Hives	O
with	O
AFB	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
treated	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
and	O
have	O
to	O
be	O
destroyed	O
.	O

There	O
were	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
and	O
European	O
Foulbrood	O
(	O
EFB	O
)	O
in	O
Perthshire	O
last	O
year	O
.	O

The	O
Scottish	O
government	O
is	O
currently	O
working	O
on	O
a	O
control	O
strategy	O
for	O
the	O
diseases	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
public	O
health	O
risk	O
from	O
the	O
outbreak	O
.	O

State	O
health	O
officials	O
now	O
say	O
there	O
are	O
13	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
of	O
blastomycosis	B-Disease
connected	O
to	O
the	O
Little	B-City
Wolf	I-City
River	I-City
in	O
Waupaca	B-City
County	O
.	O

The	O
Wisconsin	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
Services	O
[	O
DHS	O
]	O
issued	O
a	O
statement	O
on	O
Friday	O
,	O
saying	O
that	O
another	O
13	O
cases	O
are	O
probable	O
.	O

Officials	O
believe	O
exposure	O
happened	O
starting	O
with	O
Memorial	O
Day	O
weekend	O
and	O
continued	O
at	O
least	O
through	O
July	O
[	O
2015	O
]	O
.	O

DHS	O
says	O
they	O
anticipate	O
more	O
cases	O
to	O
be	O
confirmed	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
[	O
CDC	O
]	O
,	O
blastomycosis	B-Disease
lives	O
in	O
soil	O
and	O
decaying	O
organic	O
matter	O
,	O
like	O
leaves	O
and	O
wood	O
.	O

When	O
the	O
soil	O
is	O
disturbed	O
,	O
the	O
fungal	O
spores	O
become	O
airborne	O
.	O

Breathing	O
in	O
those	O
spores	O
can	O
cause	O
people	O
to	O
become	O
ill.	O
Health	O
officials	O
say	O
that	O
if	O
you	O
're	O
experiencing	O
symptoms	O
of	O
blastomycosis	B-Disease
and	O
you	O
visited	O
the	O
Little	B-City
Wolf	I-City
River	I-City
during	O
the	O
estimated	O
exposure	O
time	O
to	O
contact	O
your	O
health	O
provider	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
include	O
fever	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O
muscle	O
aches	O
,	O
and	O
fatigue	O
,	O
which	O
may	O
progress	O
to	O
weight	O
loss	O
,	O
chest	O
pain	O
and	O
a	O
persistent	O
cough	O
.	O

DHS	O
will	O
be	O
updating	O
case	O
numbers	O
weekly	O
on	O
its	O
website	O
.	O

On	O
,	O
the	O
Ministries	O
of	O
Health	O
of	O
Jordan	B-Country
notified	O
WHO	O
of	O
an	O
additional	O
laboratory-confirmed	O
case	O
of	O
infection	O
with	O
Middle	B-Virus
East	I-Virus
respiratory	I-Virus
syndrome	I-Virus
coronavirus	I-Virus
(	O
MERS-CoV	O
)	O
.	O

patient	O
is	O
a	O

.	O

.	O

San	B-City

to	O

into	O
contact	O
with	O
squirrels	O
or	O
their	O
fleas	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
spread	O
plague	B-Disease
,	O
a	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O

that	O
can	O
make	O
people	O
very	O

and	O

.	O

``	O

in	O
our	O

there	O

to	O

,	O
''	O

``	O

is	O
to	O

with	O
squirrels	O
and	O
the	O
fleas	O
they	O
carry	O
.	O

're	O

,	O
set	O
your	O
tents	O
up	O
away	O
from	O

.	O

,	O
and	O

''	O

Two	O
of	O

were	O
trapped	O
in	O

at	O
Cedar	B-City
Grove	I-City
Campground	I-City
near	O
Palomar	O
Mountain	O
;	O
the	O
3rd	O
was	O

at	O
nearby	O
Doane	O
campground	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
mainly	O
a	O
disease	O
of	O
wild	O
rodents	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
spread	O
to	O

fleas	O
that	O
feed	O
on	O
the	O
blood	O
of	O
a	O
sick	O

and	O
then	O
bite	O
humans	O
.	O

San	B-City
Diego	I-City
County	O
's	O
environmental	O
health	O
department	O
monitors	O
flea	O
populations	O
at	O
campgrounds	O
and	O
takes	O
measures	O
to	O
control	O
those	O
populations	O
whenever	O
necessary	O
.	O

People	O
who	O
visit	O
or	O
stay	O
in	O
rural	O

areas	O
should	O

for	O
Plague	B-Disease
Warning	O
signs	O
and	O
always	O
follow	O
these	O
easy	O

to	O
make	O
sure	O
they	O
do	O

come	O
into	O
contact	O
with	O
plague-carrying	O
fleas	O
:	O
-	O

with	O
ground	O

,	O

and	O
other	O
wild	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O

,	O

or	O

.	O

-	O

not	O

,	O

in	O

.	O

or	O

.	O

.	O

by	O
raw	O
eggs	O
served	O
in	O
a	O

.	O

Officials	O

that	O

,	O

a	O

,	O

that	O

had	O
used	O

in	O

of	O
the	O
food	O

.	O

)	O

.	O

Hepatitis	B-Virus
E	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
liver	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
hepatitis	O
E	O
virus	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
transmitted	O
from	O
one	O
person	O
to	O
another	O
,	O
mainly	O
through	O
contaminated	O
water	O
.	O

Scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
remains	O
a	O
concern	O
for	O
doctors	O
after	O
a	O
sharp	O
rise	O
across	O
the	O
country	O
during	O
2015	O
--	O
and	O
health	O
officials	O
have	O
warned	O
that	O
we	O

not	O

.	O

fever	I-Disease
was	O
often	O

occur	O
in	O
rural	O
Top	O
End	O
areas	O
at	O
this	O
time	O
of	O
year	O
within	O
5	O
kilometres	O
of	O
freshwater	O
creeks	O
,	O
flood	O
plains	O
and	O
swamps	O
.	O

Since	O
reporting	O
began	O
in	O
1974	O
,	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
37	O
MVE	O
case	O
have	O
been	O
notified	O
in	O
the	O
NT	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
last	O
case	O
reported	O
in	O
the	O
Katherine	O
region	O
in	O
May	O
2015	O
.	O

The	O
current	O
case	O
is	O
making	O
a	O
recovery	O
in	O
hospital	O
.	O

MVE	O
is	O
a	O
rare	O
disease	O
,	O
but	O
can	O
potentially	O
be	O
fatal	O
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
can	O
include	O
severe	O
headache	O
,	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
drowsiness	O
,	O
tremor	O
,	O
seizures	O
(	O
especially	O
in	O
young	O
children	O
)	O
and	O
in	O
some	O
cases	O
the	O
disease	O
can	O
progress	O
to	O
delirium	O
,	O
coma	O
,	O
permanent	O
brain	O
damage	O
or	O
death	O
.	O

People	O
most	O
at	O
risk	O
include	O
campers	O
,	O
infants	O
and	O
young	O
children	O
residing	O
near	O
mosquito-breeding	O
areas	O
.	O

People	O
in	O
remote	O
Top	O
End	O
communities	O
and	O
anyone	O
visiting	O
parks	O
and	O
recreation	O
areas	O
where	O
mosquitoes	O
may	O
be	O
active	O
are	O
also	O
at	O
greater	O
risk	O
of	O
contracting	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
disease	O
,	O
including	O
MVE	O
.	O

To	O
minimise	O
the	O
chance	O
of	O
being	O
bitten	O
by	O
mosquitoes	O
,	O
people	O
should	O
:	O
-	O
use	O
a	O
protective	O
repellent	O
containing	O
20	O
per	O
cent	O
DEET	O
or	O
Picaridin	O
as	O
a	O
supplement	O
to	O
protective	O
clothing	O
when	O
outdoors	O
in	O
mosquito	O
prone	O
areas	O
-	O
wear	O
light-coloured	O
clothing	O
with	O
long	O
sleeves	O
,	O
long	O
trousers	O
and	O
socks	O
,	O
between	O
dusk	O
and	O
dawn	O
in	O
areas	O
where	O
mosquito	O
bites	O
are	O
likely	O
-	O
avoid	O
outdoor	O
exposure	O
around	O
dusk	O
and	O
at	O
night	O
near	O
areas	O
of	O
dense	O
vegetation	O
and	O
other	O
areas	O
of	O
high	O
mosquito	O
activity	O
-	O
use	O
mosquito-proof	O
accommodation	O
and	O
camping	O
facilities	O
at	O
night	O
-	O
use	O
mosquito	O
coils	O
,	O
mosquito	O
lanterns	O
and	O
barrier	O
sprays	O
containing	O
bifenthrin	O
in	O
patio	O
and	O
outdoor	O
areas	O
near	O
houses	O
-	O
ensure	O
children	O
are	O
adequately	O
protected	O
against	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

Uganda	B-Country
's	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
said	O
on	O
Wed	O
21	O
Aug	O
2013	O
that	O
a	O
27-year-old	O
woman	O
in	O
Kampala	B-City
had	O
died	O
after	O
contracting	O
the	O
deadly	O
Crimean-Congo	B-Virus
haemorrhagic	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
(	O
CCHF	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
woman	O

to	O
a	O

Sudan-based	O
Ugandan	O

who	O
had	O

from	O

in	O

recently	O

to	O
Uganda	B-Country
,	O

Uganda	B-Country

``	O

.	O

There	O

for	O
either	O

or	O
animals	O
.	O

)	O

of	O

a	O

of	O
paralytic	B-Disease
shellfish	I-Disease
poisoning	I-Disease
(	O
PSP	O
)	O

a	O
33-year-old	O
woman	O
.	O

The	O
patient	O
presented	O

,	O

of	O

,	O

and	O

about	O
45	O

at	O

.	O

She	O

and	O

of	O

District	O
Hospital	O
on	O

was	O

.	O

She	O
was	O

on	O
.	O

She	O
has	O
been	O
in	O
a	O
stable	O
condition	O
all	O
along	O
.	O

Initial	O
enquiries	O
revealed	O
that	O
the	O
frozen	O
sea	O
urchin	O
was	O
purchased	O
from	O
a	O
food	O
store	O
in	O
Fanling	B-City
.	O

Investigations	O
by	O
the	O
CHP	O
and	O
the	O
Food	O
and	O
Environmental	O
Hygiene	O
Department	O
are	O
continuing	O
.	O

Members	O
of	O
the	O
public	O
should	O
seek	O
medical	O
advice	O
immediately	O
if	O
they	O
develop	O
shellfish	O
poisoning	O
symptoms	O
and	O
save	O
any	O
leftovers	O
for	O
investigation	O
and	O
laboratory	O
testing	O
.	O

A	O
spokesman	O
for	O
CHP	O
said	O
that	O
PSP	O
toxin	O
was	O
a	O
natural	O
toxin	O
sometimes	O
found	O
in	O
bi-valve	O
shellfish	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
heat-stable	O
and	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
destroyed	O
through	O
cooking	O
.	O

He	O
appealed	O
to	O
people	O
to	O
observe	O
the	O
following	O
measures	O
:	O
-	O

shellfish	O
from	O
reliable	O
and	O
licensed	O
seafood	O
shops	O
;	O
-	O
Remove	O
the	O
viscera	O
,	O

and	O
roe	O
before	O
cooking	O
and	O
discard	O
any	O
cooking	O
liquid	O
before	O
consumption	O
;	O
-	O

a	O
smaller	O
amount	O
of	O
shellfish	O
in	O
any	O
one	O
meal	O
;	O
-	O
When	O
symptoms	O
occur	O
after	O
consuming	O
shellfish	O
,	O
seek	O
medical	O
advice	O
immediately	O
.	O

can	O
cause	O

and	O

issues	O
.	O

and	O
no	O

are	O

.	O

this	O

,	O
14	O

11	O

.	O

Botulism	B-Disease
(	O
from	O
Latin	O
Botulinus	O
meaning	O
``	O
sausage	O
''	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
serious	O
paralytic	O
illness	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
bacterial	O
neurotoxin	O
,	O
botulinum	O
toxin	O
.	O

In	O
July	O
1998	O
,	O
in	O
Setif	O
and	O
its	O
surroundings	O
,	O
a	O
large	O
outbreak	O
of	O

that	O

44	O
people	O
and	O
hospitalized	O
dozens	O
more	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
traced	O
to	O
cachir	O
.	O

[	O

]	O

In	O
2014	O
,	O
potato	B-Virus
spindle	I-Virus
tuber	I-Virus
viroid	I-Virus
(	O
PSTVd	O
)	O
was	O
identified	O
in	O
a	O
potato	O
clone	O
originating	O
from	O
a	O
breeding	O
company	O
in	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
.	O

This	O
clone	O
was	O
submitted	O
for	O
micro	O
propagation	O
and	O
tested	O
for	O
PSTVd	O
.	O

This	O
initiated	O
actions	O
to	O
track	O
the	O
infections	O
.	O

PSTVd	O
was	O
also	O
found	O
at	O
a	O
research	O
institute	O
.	O

At	O
both	O
locations	O
the	O
viroid	O
was	O
eradicated	O
.	O

Additional	O
surveys	O
revealed	O
no	O
further	O
infections	O
in	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
.	O

They	O
included	O
testing	O
of	O
each	O
plant	O
in	O
all	O
crossing	O
glasshouses	O
,	O
random	O
samples	O
of	O
seed	O
potatoes	O
[	O
and	O
]	O
samples	O
from	O
all	O
varieties	O
introduced	O
since	O
2009	O
.	O

Spread	O
via	O
true	O
seed	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
obvious	O
route	O
for	O
the	O
infections	O
in	O
micro	O
propagated	O
plants	O
since	O
they	O
shared	O
a	O
common	O
PSTVd-infected	O
parent	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
[	O
this	O
]	O
does	O
not	O
provide	O
insight	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
internal	O
or	O
external	O
presence	O
of	O
viroid	O
.	O

Previous	O
experiments	O
were	O
unable	O
to	O
show	O
mechanical	O
transmission	O
of	O
PSTVd	O
under	O
field	O
conditions	O
in	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
.	O

It	O
was	O
concluded	O
that	O
germplasm	O
poses	O
the	O
highest	O
risk	O
of	O
introducing	O
this	O
viroid	O
in	O
potatoes	O
in	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
.	O

Phylogenetic	O
analysis	O
showed	O
that	O
all	O
potato	O
isolates	O
from	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
cluster	O
with	O
potato	O
isolates	O
from	O
other	O
countries	O
and	O
separate	O
from	O
PSTVd	O
genotypes	O
from	O
other	O
vegetatively	O
propagated	O
species	O
,	O
both	O
from	O
the	O
Netherlands	O
and	O
abroad	O
.	O

This	O
indicates	O
that	O
the	O
[	O
potato	O
]	O
isolates	O
originate	O
in	O
(	O
wild	O
)	O
potato	O
accessions	O
rather	O
than	O
being	O
introduced	O
from	O
recent	O
outbreaks	O
in	O

crops	O
.	O

for	O

The	O

State	O

but	O

in	O
a	O
statement	O
:	O
``	O
We	O
did	O
implement	O
procedures	O
and	O
protocols	O
per	O
our	O
policies	O
for	O
any	O

.	O

Our	O

chief	O

and	O

prevention	O
director	O
have	O
been	O
coordinating	O
management	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
since	O
then	O
.	O
''	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
US	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
,	O
scabies	B-Disease
is	O
an	O
infestation	O
of	O
the	O
skin	O
by	O
the	O
human	O
itch	O
mite	O
.	O

The	O
microscopic	O
scabies	B-Disease
mite	O
burrows	O
into	O
the	O
upper	O
layer	O
of	O
the	O
skin	O
where	O
it	O
lives	O
and	O
lays	O
its	O
eggs	O
.	O

The	O
most	O
common	O
symptoms	O
of	O
scabies	B-Disease
are	O
intense	O
itching	O
and	O
a	O
pimple-like	O
skin	O
rash	O
.	O

The	O
scabies	B-Disease
mite	O
usually	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
direct	O
,	O
prolonged	O
,	O
skin-to-skin	O
contact	O
with	O
a	O
person	O
who	O
has	O
scabies	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
never	O
had	O
scabies	B-Disease
,	O
symptoms	O
could	O
take	O
4	O
to	O
6	O
weeks	O
to	O
appear	O
.	O

``	O
Presumably	O
at	O
a	O
hospital	O
,	O
it	O
gets	O
brought	O
in	O
by	O
a	O
patient	O
.	O

It	O
gets	O
transmitted	O
to	O
a	O
healthcare	O
[	O
provider	O
,	O
and	O
because	O
it	O
's	O
highly	O
contagious	O
,	O
healthcare	O
]	O
providers	O
can	O
transmit	O
it	O
to	O
other	O
healthcare	O
providers	O
and	O
even	O
potentially	O
to	O
other	O
patients	O
.	O

So	O
even	O
if	O
you	O
're	O
taking	O
the	O
best	O
precautions	O
with	O
hand	O
washing	O
and	O
gloves	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
transmissible	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dr.	O
James	O
Ireland	O
with	O
the	O
John	O
A.	O
Burns	O
School	O
of	O
Medicine	O
{	O
university	O
of	O
Hawaii	B-Province
]	O
.	O

Two	O
mule	O
deer	O
taken	O
in	O
September	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
have	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
chronic	B-Disease
wasting	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease

was	O

.	O

reaching	O

24-year	O
high	O
,	O
data	O
reveal	O
.	O

Public	O
Health	O
England	B-Province
(	O
PHE	O
)	O
says	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
868	O
notified	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
1st	O
8	O
weeks	O
of	O
2014	O
,	O
compared	O
to	O
591	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
period	O
in	O
2013	O
.	O

This	O
figure	O
is	O
at	O
its	O
highest	O
for	O
this	O
time	O
of	O
year	O
since	O
1990	O
.	O

The	O
bacterial	O
illness	O
causes	O
a	O
distinctive	O
rash	O
,	O
high	O
temperature	O
,	O
and	O
sore	O
throat	O
as	O

on	O
the	O

.	O

The	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
normally	O
increases	O
during	O
the	O
winter	O
because	O
scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
bacteria	O
is	O
found	O
in	O
mucus	O
and	O
saliva	O
--	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
spread	O
through	O

and	O

.	O

Cases	O
are	O
more	O

in	O
children	O
although	O
adults	O
can	O
also	O
develop	O
scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
.	O

in	O

to	O

of	O

[	O

,	O

,	O

)	O

a	O
disease	O
[	O

]	O
of	O

[	O

]	O
,	O
''	O

.	O
''	O

A	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
[	O
infection	O
]	O
causes	O
a	O
lethal	O
disease	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
estimated	O
that	O
50	O
per	O
cent	O
of	O
the	O
patients	O
who	O
contract	O
it	O
die	O
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
are	O
myalgia	O
and	O
fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O
