,	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
abdominal	O
pain	O
,	O
and	O
mainly	O
respiratory	O
difficulties	O
.	O

The	O
US	O
Embassy	O
wishes	O
to	O
inform	O
US	O
citizens	O
about	O
one	O
confirmed	O
and	O
one	O
suspected	O
case	O
of	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
in	O
northern	O
Togo	B-Country
.	O

This	O
message	O
is	O
for	O
informational	O
purposes	O
only	O
.	O

Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
is	O
a	O
rare	O
but	O
potentially	O
life-threatening	O
viral	O
hemorrhagic	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
risk	O
of	O
contamination	O
is	O
low	O
,	O
but	O
can	O
occur	O
if	O
someone	O
comes	O
into	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
's	O
blood	O
or	O
bodily	O
fluids	O
.	O

Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
can	O
not	O
be	O
spread	O
through	O
casual	O
contact	O
,	O
including	O
skin	O
to	O
skin	O
contact	O
,	O
without	O
exchange	O
of	O
bodily	O
fluids	O
.	O

Those	O
at	O
highest-risk	O
would	O
be	O
health	O
care	O
workers	O
treating	O
patients	O
in	O
facilities	O
known	O
to	O
have	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
and	O
family	O
members	O
caring	O
for	O
infected	O
patients	O
.	O

Early	O
diagnosis	O
and	O
supportive	O
care	O
are	O
essential	O
.	O

You	O
should	O
consult	O
a	O
medical	O
professional	O
if	O
you	O
have	O
been	O
in	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
within	O
the	O
past	O
3	O
weeks	O
and	O
have	O
symptoms	O
of	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
,	O
which	O
include	O
:	O
fever	O
,	O
chest	O
,	O
stomach	O
or	O
back	O
pain	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
or	O
mucosal	O
bleeding	O
.	O

.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
by	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O
flea	O
,	O
or	O
by	O
handling	O
an	O
infected	O
animal	O
.	O

Taking	O
steps	O
to	O
avoid	O
flea	O
exposure	O
will	O
help	O
prevent	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

In	O
humans	O
,	O
the	O
symptoms	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
infection	O
are	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
extreme	O
fatigue	O
and	O
tender	O
or	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
glands	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
experience	O
these	O
symptoms	O
,	O
contact	O
your	O
physician	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
endemic	O
in	O
El	B-City
Paso	I-City
County	O
,	O
and	O
precautions	O
to	O
prevent	O
plague	O
should	O
always	O
be	O
taken	O
.	O

The	O

virus	O
is	O
found	O
in	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

May	O
2017	O
.	O

This	O
increased	O
the	O
alarm	O
of	O
public	O
health	O
in	O
France	B-Country
.	O

In	O
the	O
past	O
year	O
[	O
2016	O
]	O
,	O
only	O
79	O
cases	O
had	O
been	O
identified	O
.	O

It	O
must	O
be	O
said	O
that	O
measles	B-Virus
is	O
active	O
and	O
virulent	O
.	O

In	O
total	O
,	O
168	O
patients	O
were	O
hospitalized	O
because	O
of	O
the	O
infection	O
,	O
most	O
often	O
for	O
severe	O
pneumonia	O
.	O

Evidence	O
that	O
the	O
virus	O
does	O
not	O
distinguish	O
between	O
its	O
victims	O
,	O
a	O
16	O
year-old	O
girl	O
died	O
of	O
severe	O
complications	O
in	O
July	O
2017	O
.	O

She	O
was	O
non-vaccinated	O
;	O
however	O
,	O
she	O
had	O
no	O
previous	O
medical	O
history	O
.	O

Most	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
,	O
these	O
are	O
young	O
children	O
who	O
bear	O
the	O
brunt	O
of	O
the	O
infection	O
.	O

Infants	O
under	O
1	O
year	O
and	O
children	O
1-4	O
years	O
of	O
age	O
are	O
among	O
the	O
main	O
reported	O
cases	O
;	O
next	O
,	O
adolescents	O
15-19	O
years	O
.	O

Kindergartens	O
,	O
schools	O
and	O
universities	O
are	O
among	O
the	O
privileged	O
places	O
of	O
measles	B-Virus
transmission	O
.	O

Public	O
Health	O
France	B-Country
considers	O
it	O
necessary	O
to	O
prepare	O
for	O
an	O
outbreak	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
current	O
epidemiology	O
of	O
measles	B-Virus
shows	O
that	O
France	B-Country
is	O
still	O
endemic	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
immune	O
to	O
a	O
new	O
outbreak	O
of	O
significant	O
[	O
size	O
]	O
.	O
''	O

In	O
fact	O
,	O
the	O
[	O
cases	O
]	O
are	O
distributed	O
rather	O
evenly	O
in	O
the	O
territory	O
.	O

The	O
scenario	O
of	O
an	O
epidemic	O
is	O
all	O
the	O
more	O
credible	O
because	O
the	O
immunization	O
coverage	O
is	O
so	O
low	O
.	O

Only	O
79	O
percent	O
of	O
babies	O
2	O
years	O
old	O
are	O
vaccinated	O
.	O

It	O
would	O
be	O
necessary	O
to	O
reach	O
95	O
percent	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
prevent	O
any	O
movement	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
light	O
of	O
these	O
indicators	O
,	O
public	O
Health	O
France	B-Country
recommends	O
that	O
healthcare	O
professionals	O
be	O
vigilant	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
[	O
vaccine	O
series	O
]	O
is	O
incomplete	O
,	O
a	O
vaccination	O
catch-up	O
or	O
post-exposure	O
prophylaxis	O
will	O
prevent	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
.	O

The	O
goal	O
:	O
prevent	O
an	O

like	O
that	O
of	O
2011	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
space	O
of	O
a	O
year	O
,	O

than	O
15	O
000	O
people	O
had	O
been	O
infected	O
;	O
10	O
deaths	O
were	O
recorded	O
.	O

France	B-Country
is	O
[	O
not	O
alone	O
]	O
in	O
the	O
face	O
of	O
this	O
resurgence	O
of	O
measles	B-Virus
.	O

,	O

.	O

.	O

that	O
is	O

.	O

The	O
Dagestan	B-Province

has	O

that	O

cases	O

11	O

.	O

the	O

)	O
.	O

[	O

]	O
has	O

.	O

This	O
has	O

can	O

.	O

The	O

.	O

Martin	O

that	O

1st	O
2	O

2011	O

from	O

of	O
Marial	O

.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
that	O
primarily	O
affects	O
animals	O
but	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
consumption	O
of	O
infected	O
meat	O
or	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
infected	O
carcass	O
.	O

Mayen	O
urged	O
people	O
not	O
to	O
eat	O
meat	O
from	O
any	O
animal	O
unless	O
they	O

how	O

,	O

.	O

,	O

,	O

(	O

)	O
.	O

Primary	O
school	O
students	O
are	O
the	O
most	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
affected	O
by	O
whooping	B-Disease
cough	I-Disease
(	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
pertussis	O
)	O
,	O
but	O
anyone	O
can	O
contract	O
it	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
life-threatening	O
for	O
infants	O
(	O
aged	O
6	O
months	O
and	O
under	O
)	O
.	O

Whooping	B-Disease
cough	I-Disease
usually	O
begins	O
like	O
a	O
cold	O
with	O
a	O
blocked	O
or	O
runny	O
nose	O
,	O
tiredness	O
,	O
mild	O
fever	O
and	O
a	O
cough	O
.	O

The	O
cough	O
gets	O
worse	O
,	O
and	O
severe	O
bouts	O
of	O
uncontrollable	O
coughing	O
can	O
develop	O
.	O

Coughing	O
bouts	O
can	O
be	O
followed	O
by	O
vomiting	O
,	O
choking	O
or	O
taking	O
a	O
big	O
gasping	O
breath	O
which	O
causes	O
a	O
whooping	O
sound	O
.	O

Gray	O
mould	O
,	O
caused	O
by	O
_Botrytis	O
cinerea_	O
,	O
is	O
among	O
the	O
most	O
serious	O
fungal	O
disease	O
of	O
table	O
grape	O
(	O
_Vitis	O
vinifera_	O
)	O
worldwide	O
.	O

This	O
pathogen	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
heavy	O
losses	O
in	O
Mazzarrone	B-City
,	O
among	O
the	O
most	O
important	O
Italian	O
areas	O
for	O
table	O
grape	O
production	O
.	O

From	O
2009	O
to	O
2013	O
,	O
scientists	O
collected	O
302	O
single-spore	O
isolates	O
of	O
_B	O
.	O

cinerea_	O
from	O
vineyards	O
in	O
[	O
the	O
]	O
district	O
[	O
and	O
]	O
evaluated	O
in	O
vitro	O
sensitivity	O
to	O
,	O
identified	O
point	O
mutations	O
in	O
field	O
isolates	O
resistant	O
to	O
different	O
fungicides	O
,	O
and	O
investigated	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
isolates	O
with	O
multiple	O
fungicide	O
resistance	O
.	O

45.7	O
per	O
cent	O
were	O
found	O
to	O
be	O
resistant	O
to	O
at	O
least	O
1	O
fungicide	O
.	O

About	O
10	O
per	O
cent	O
had	O
multiple	O
resistance	O
to	O
at	O
least	O
2	O
or	O
more	O
individual	O
fungicides	O
.	O

[	O
Some	O
]	O
isolates	O
[	O
showed	O
]	O
simultaneous	O
resistance	O
to	O
4	O
different	O
classes	O
of	O
fungicides	O
.	O

Accordingly	O
,	O
these	O
fungicides	O
failed	O
to	O
control	O
infections	O
by	O
isolates	O
with	O
resistance	O
or	O
reduced	O
sensitivity	O
.	O

This	O
study	O
represents	O
the	O
1st	O
report	O
of	O
_B	O
.	O

cinerea_	O
field	O
isolates	O
with	O
single	O
or	O
multiple	O
resistance	O
to	O
botryticides	O
.	O

By	O
continuous	O
selection	O
of	O
multi-resistant	O
isolates	O
,	O
chemical	O
control	O
of	O
gray	O
mould	O
in	O
vineyards	O
will	O
become	O
increasingly	O
difficult	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
careful	O
monitoring	O
of	O
sensitivity	O
and	O
multiple	O
resistance	O
to	O
botryticides	O
over	O
time	O
will	O
be	O
crucial	O
in	O
managing	O
fungicide	O
resistance	O
.	O

[	O
Fungicides	O
]	O
should	O
be	O
[	O
used	O
]	O
in	O
alternation	O
or	O
in	O
mixtures	O
with	O
different	O
[	O
modes	O
of	O
]	O
action	O
and	O
low	O
risk	O
of	O
resistance	O
development	O
.	O

CWD-positive	O
white-tailed	O
deer	O
found	O
on	O
Iowa	B-City
County	O
farm	O

:	O

(	O

)	O

State	O

today	O
(	O

)	O
.	O

The	O
National	O

Services	O
Laboratory	O
in	O
Ames	O
,	O
Iowa	B-City
,	O
confirmed	O
the	O
test	O
results	O
.	O

The	O
2-year-old	O
buck	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
born	O
on	O
the	O
farm	O
and	O

was	O

.	O

9	O

(	O

)	O

of	O

when	O

,	O

``	O

filly	O
displaying	O
severe	O

signs	O
was	O
euthanized	O
.	O

In	O
a	O
blog	O
post	O
published	O
today	O
(	O
31	O
Jul	O
2012	O
)	O
,	O
California	B-Province
State	O
Veterinarian	O
Annette	O
Whiteford	O
,	O
DVM	O
,	O
said	O
:	O
``	O
Each	O
year	O
,	O
we	O
find	O
ourselves	O
using	O
this	O
sad	O
occasion	O
to	O
remind	O
horse	O
owners	O
to	O
have	O
their	O
animals	O
vaccinated	O
.	O

It	O
offers	O
them	O
maximum	O
protection	O
against	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

And	O
once	O
vaccinations	O
occur	O
,	O
horse	O
owners	O
should	O
be	O
checking	O
regularly	O
with	O
their	O
veterinarians	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
they	O
stay	O
current	O
.	O
''	O

Clinical	O
signs	O
for	O
WNV	O
include	O
flu-like	O
signs	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
horse	O
seems	O
mildly	O
anorexic	O
and	O
depressed	O
;	O
fine	O

(	O

)	O
;	O

(	O

to	O

and	O

)	O
;	O
changes	O
in	O

(	O

``	O

;	O
''	O

(	O

)	O
;	O

(	O

or	O

)	O
;	O
and	O
``	O

''	O
signs	O
,	O
including	O

.	O

.	O

fecally	O
contaminated	O
food	O
or	O
water	O
is	O
the	O
main	O

.	O

,	O

(	O

.	O

steamed	O
)	O
shellfish	O
are	O
common	O
sources	O
of	O
infection	O
.	O

We	O
urge	O
you	O
to	O
follow	O
public	O
health	O

and	O
guidelines	O
,	O

.	O

to	O

with	O

,	O

.	O

Unusual	O

were	O

in	O

in	O
North	B-Province

.	O

In	O
total	O
,	O
more	O
than	O
25	O
ha	O
of	O
greenhouse	O
tomatoes	O
were	O
affected	O
.	O

_Tomato	O
brown	O
rugose	O
fruit	O
virus_	O
(	O
ToBRFV	O
)	O
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
in	O
7	O
greenhouses	O
;	O
one	O
further	O
greenhouse	O
is	O
suspected	O
to	O
be	O
infested	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
the	O
1st	O
report	O
of	O
ToBRFV	O
in	O
Germany	B-Country
.	O

The	O
infested	O
tomato	O
plants	O
were	O
used	O
for	O
tomato	O
fruit	O
production	O
.	O

Eradication	O
measures	O
are	O
in	O
progress	O
.	O

ToBRFV	O
infects	O
tomato	O
plants	O
and	O
leads	O
to	O
foliar	O
symptoms	O
,	O
including	O
chlorosis	O
mosaic	O
with	O
dark	O
green	O
bulges	O
and	O
narrowing	O
.	O

Fruit	O
symptoms	O
consisted	O
of	O
yellow	O
spots	O
,	O
often	O
concentrated	O
around	O
the	O
calyx	O
with	O
occasional	O
rugose	O
symptoms	O
rendering	O
the	O
fruits	O
non-marketable	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
can	O
affect	O
up	O
to	O
100	O
%	O
of	O
a	O
crop	O
.	O

The	O
available	O
resistance	O
genes	O
in	O
conventional	O
tomato	O
varieties	O
against	O
other	O
tobamoviruses	O
are	O
ineffective	O
against	O
ToBRFV	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
,	O
too	O
little	O
is	O
known	O
about	O
the	O
virus	O
to	O
exclude	O
possible	O
damage	O
on	O
other	O
host	O
plants	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
can	O
establish	O
in	O
greenhouses	O
[	O
and	O
]	O
outdoors	O
;	O
potential	O
host	O
plants	O
can	O
serve	O
as	O
reservoir	O
for	O
new	O
infections	O
.	O

Because	O
of	O
its	O
high	O
damaging	O
potential	O
for	O
tomato	O
production	O
,	O
ToBRFV	O
poses	O
a	O
significant	O
phytosanitary	O
risk	O
for	O
Germany	B-Country
and	O
other	O
EU	O
member	O
states	O
.	O

Institute	O
of	O
Public	O

]	O

North	B-Province

.	O

Eastern	B-Virus
equine	I-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
is	O
better	O
known	O
as	O
``	O
EEE	O
.	O
''	O

It	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
case	O
reported	O
in	O
the	O
Carolinas	O
in	O
2019	O
.	O

``	O
EEE	O
virus	O
is	O
a	O
rare	O
cause	O
of	O
brain	O
infections	O
.	O

Only	O
a	O
few	O
cases	O
are	O
reported	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
each	O
year	O
,	O
''	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
Centers	O
of	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
.	O

``	O
Most	O
occur	O
in	O
eastern	O
or	O
Gulf	O
Coast	O
states	O
.	O

Approximately	O
30	O
%	O
of	O
people	O
with	O
EEE	O
die	O
and	O
many	O
survivors	O
have	O
ongoing	O
neurologic	O
problems	O
.	O
''	O

A	O
map	O
on	O
the	O
CDC	O
's	O
website	O
confirms	O
the	O
case.	O
.	O
11	O
people	O
have	O
died	O
nationwide	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
after	O
contracting	O
EEE	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
CDC	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
have	O
not	O
confirmed	O
the	O
condition	O
of	O
the	O
patient	O
in	O
Catawba	B-City
County	O
.	O

The	O
CDC	O
said	O
the	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
contracting	O
EEE	O
is	O
to	O
use	O
insect-repellent	O
as	O
directed	O
and	O
use	O
other	O
standard	O
mosquito-control	O
steps	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
EEE	O
include	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
mumps	B-Virus
involving	O
University	O
of	O
Idaho	B-Province
Moscow	B-City
students	O
is	O
leading	O
public	O
health	O
officials	O
to	O
urge	O
students	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
upcoming	O
holiday	O
break	O
to	O
check	O
their	O
vaccination	O
records	O
to	O
make	O
certain	O
they	O
are	O
current	O
for	O
the	O
measles	O
,	O
mumps	O
,	O
and	O
rubella	O
(	O
MMR	O
)	O
vaccination	O
before	O
they	O
return	O
for	O
classes	O
.	O

As	O
of	O
Wednesday	O
,	O
10	O
laboratory-confirmed	O
cases	O
of	O
mumps	B-Virus
have	O
been	O
reported	O
,	O
with	O
over	O
20	O
additional	O
reports	O
being	O
investigated	O
,	O
including	O
2	O
in	O
the	O
Moscow	B-City
community	O
.	O

The	O
MMR	O
vaccine	O
is	O
the	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
mumps	B-Virus
.	O

Students	O
who	O
have	O
not	O
previously	O
had	O
mumps	B-Virus
or	O
who	O
have	O
no	O
record	O
of	O
any	O
doses	O
of	O
MMR	O
vaccine	O
should	O
receive	O
2	O
doses	O
at	O
least	O
28	O
days	O
apart	O
;	O
students	O
who	O
received	O
only	O
1	O
dose	O
of	O
MMR	O
vaccine	O
should	O
receive	O
a	O
2nd	O
dose	O
.	O

Students	O
can	O
check	O
with	O
the	O
University	O
of	O
Idaho	B-Province
Student	O
Health	O
Services	O
,	O
their	O
primary	O
care	O
provider	O
,	O
local	O
public	O
health	O
office	O
or	O
a	O
local	O
pharmacy	O
about	O
receiving	O
an	O
MMR	O
vaccine	O
.	O

Mumps	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
contagious	O
virus	O
that	O
spreads	O
from	O
person-to-person	O
via	O
droplets	O
of	O
saliva	O
or	O
mucus	O
from	O
the	O
mouth	O
,	O
nose	O
,	O
or	O
throat	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
,	O
usually	O
when	O
the	O
person	O
coughs	O
,	O
sneezes	O
,	O
or	O
talks	O
.	O

An	O
infected	O
person	O
can	O
spread	O
the	O
virus	O
before	O
being	O
sick	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
also	O
spread	O
when	O
someone	O
with	O
mumps	B-Virus
touches	O
items	O
or	O
surfaces	O
without	O
washing	O
their	O
hands	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
someone	O
else	O
touches	O
the	O
same	O
item	O
or	O
surface	O
and	O
rubs	O
their	O
mouth	O
or	O
nose	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
appear	O
up	O
to	O
25	O
days	O
after	O
being	O
exposed	O
,	O
may	O
include	O
fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
muscle	O
aches	O
,	O
tiredness	O
,	O
loss	O
of	O
appetite	O
,	O
and	O
swollen	O
or	O
tender	O
salivary	O
glands	O
under	O
the	O
ears	O
on	O
one	O
or	O
both	O
sides	O
of	O
the	O
head	O
.	O

The	O
most	O
common	O
complication	O
of	O
mumps	B-Virus
infection	O
in	O
adults	O
is	O
testicular	O
inflammation	O
.	O

Rare	O
complications	O
include	O
meningitis	O
,	O
encephalitis	O
,	O
inflammation	O
of	O
the	O
ovaries	O
,	O
and	O
deafness	O
.	O

Anyone	O
experiencing	O
symptoms	O
compatible	O
with	O
mumps	B-Virus
should	O
contact	O
their	O
health	O
care	O
professional	O
.	O

Up	O
to	O
half	O
of	O
people	O
with	O
mumps	B-Virus
have	O
very	O
mild	O
or	O
no	O
symptoms	O
and	O
might	O
not	O
know	O
they	O
are	O
infected	O
.	O

Anyone	O
infected	O
with	O
the	O
mumps	B-Virus
virus	O
should	O
stay	O
home	O
for	O
5	O
days	O
after	O
symptoms	O
begin	O
,	O
while	O
minimizing	O
close	O
contact	O
with	O
other	O
people	O
.	O

Infected	O
people	O
should	O
avoid	O
sharing	O
drinks	O
or	O
eating	O
utensils	O
,	O
cover	O
all	O
coughs	O
and	O
sneezes	O
,	O
wash	O
their	O
hands	O
frequently	O
with	O
soap	O
and	O
water	O
,	O
and	O
regularly	O
clean	O
frequently	O
touched	O
surfaces	O
.	O

A	O
typical	O
case	O
of	O
pertussis	B-Disease
starts	O
with	O
a	O
cough	O
and	O
runny	O
nose	O
for	O
one	O
to	O
2	O
weeks	O
,	O
followed	O
by	O
weeks	O
to	O
months	O
of	O
rapid	O
coughing	O
fits	O
that	O
sometimes	O
end	O
with	O
a	O
whooping	O
sound	O
Fever	O
,	O
if	O
present	O
,	O
is	O
usually	O
mild	O
.	O

Antibiotics	O
can	O
lessen	O
the	O
severity	O
of	O
symptoms	O
and	O
prevent	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
disease	O
to	O
others	O
.	O

The	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
recommends	O
the	O
following	O
vaccination	O
schedule	O
:	O
-	O
young	O
children	O
need	O
5	O
doses	O
of	O
DTaP	O
by	O
kindergarten	O
:	O
at	O
2	O
months	O
,	O
4	O
months	O
,	O
6	O
months	O
,	O
15	O
to	O
18	O
months	O
,	O
and	O
4	O
to	O
6	O
years	O
.	O

-	O
all	O
students	O
entering	O
7th	O
grade	O
need	O
proof	O
of	O
a	O
whooping	O
cough	O
booster	O
immunization	O
(	O
Tdap	O
)	O
.	O

-	O
a	O
Tdap	O
booster	O
is	O
recommended	O
for	O
pregnant	O
women	O
during	O
their	O
third	O
trimester	O
of	O
each	O
pregnancy	O
,	O
even	O
if	O
they	O
got	O
a	O
booster	O
before	O
becoming	O
pregnant	O
.	O

-	O
one	O
dose	O
of	O
Tdap	O
is	O
recommended	O
for	O
adults	O
19	O
years	O
of	O
age	O
and	O
older	O
who	O
did	O
not	O
get	O
Tdap	O
as	O
an	O
adolescent	O
.	O

parents	O
can	O
obtain	O
the	O
DTaP	O
vaccine	O
series	O
and	O
the	O
Tdap	O
booster	O
shot	O
for	O
themselves	O
and	O
their	O
children	O
through	O
their	O
primary	O
care	O
physicians	O
.	O

Local	O
retail	O
pharmacies	O
offer	O
vaccinations	O
for	O
a	O
fee	O
,	O
and	O
anyone	O
who	O
is	O
not	O
covered	O
by	O
a	O
medical	O
insurance	O
plan	O
can	O
get	O
the	O
shot	O
from	O
a	O
County	O
Public	O
Health	O
Center	O
at	O
minimal	O
or	O
no	O
cost	O

Rat	O
fever	O
[	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
]	O
cases	O
are	O
rising	O
.	O

Between	O
January	O
and	O
September	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
,	O
173	O
rat	O
fever	O
cases	O
were	O
reported	O
.	O

A	O
total	O
of	O
85	O
of	O
them	O
were	O
from	O
Udupi	B-City
taluk	O
,	O
54	O
from	O
Kundapur	B-City
taluk	O
and	O
34	O
from	O
Karkala	B-City
taluk	O
.	O

Until	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
October	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
,	O
203	O
such	O
cases	O
had	O
been	O
detected	O
.	O

In	O
January	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
559	O
people	O
were	O
tested	O
,	O
and	O
24	O
showed	O
symptoms	O
of	O
this	O
fever	O
.	O

As	O
many	O
as	O
26	O
people	O
were	O
infected	O
in	O
February	O
,	O
23	O
more	O
in	O
March	O
,	O
5	O
in	O
May	O
,	O
11	O
in	O
June	O
,	O
32	O
in	O
July	O
and	O
25	O
in	O
August	O
.	O

The	O
highest	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
was	O
reported	O
in	O
September	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
34	O
cases	O
.	O

Among	O
them	O
,	O
17	O
were	O
from	O
Udupi	B-City
taluk	O
with	O
11	O
cases	O
from	O
Kundapur	B-City
and	O
6	O
from	O
Karkala	B-City
.	O

Fewer	O
cases	O
than	O
in	O
2019	O
,	O
when	O
344	O
cases	O
were	O
diagnosed	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
2018	O
[	O
330	O
]	O
.	O

This	O
fever	O
normally	O
spreads	O
through	O
the	O
urine	O
and	O
stools	O
of	O
the	O
rats	O
.	O

Usually	O
,	O
farmers	O
who	O
visit	O
the	O
fields	O
for	O
harvesting	O
paddy	O
crops	O
get	O
infected	O
.	O

During	O
the	O
4	O
months	O
of	O
lockdown	O
,	O
cases	O
were	O
minimal	O
.	O

The	O
district	O
reported	O
111	O
rat	O
fever	O
cases	O
from	O
January	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
until	O
now	O
.	O

A	O
death	O
also	O
occurred	O
due	O
to	O
rat	O
fever	O
in	O
August	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
.	O

As	O
people	O
avoided	O
going	O
out	O
because	O
of	O
the	O
coronavirus	O
pandemic	O
,	O
cases	O
seem	O
to	O
have	O
fallen	O
sharply	O
.	O

Moreover	O
,	O
when	O
the	O
ASHA	O
workers	O
visited	O
houses	O
to	O
create	O

about	O
coronavirus	O
,	O

about	O

and	O

.	O

District	O

,	O
Dr	O
Jagadish	O
K	O
,	O
feels	O
that	O
this	O
would	O
have	O
resulted	O
in	O
a	O
steep	O
fall	O
in	O
the	O
cases	O
.	O

Precautions	O
Water	O
should	O
be	O
boiled	O
before	O
consumption	O
.	O

People	O
should	O
not	O
take	O
baths	O
in	O
standing	O
water	O
as	O
excreta	O
and	O
urine	O
of	O
animals	O
might	O
have	O
contaminated	O
that	O
water	O
.	O

Care	O
should	O
be	O
taken	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
food	O
items	O
,	O
fruits	O
,	O
vegetables	O
,	O
etc	O
are	O
not	O
accessible	O
to	O
rats	O
.	O

All	O
holes	O
,	O
cracks	O
,	O
etc	O
in	O
houses	O
,	O
godowns	O
,	O
drains	O
,	O
fields	O
,	O
etc	O
should	O
be	O
sealed	O
to	O
destroy	O
the	O
rats	O
,	O
and	O
carcasses	O
of	O
rats	O
should	O
be	O
properly	O
disposed	O
of	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
better	O
if	O
rubber	O
boots	O
are	O
worn	O
when	O
visiting	O
farms	O
,	O
cattle	O
sheds	O
,	O
agricultural	O
fields	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

If	O
someone	O
works	O
in	O
slush	O
or	O
standing	O
water	O
,	O
they	O
should	O
take	O
a	O
bath	O
in	O
hot	O
water	O
afterwards	O
.	O

Dr	O
Sudhir	O
Chandra	O
Sooda	O
,	O
Udupi	B-City
district	O
health	O
officer	O
,	O
says	O
that	O
fever	O
occurs	O
when	O
viruses	O
from	O
the	O
discharges	O
of	O
rats	O
enter	O
the	O
human	O
body	O
.	O

Rat	O
fever	O
should	O
be	O
treated	O
at	O
its	O
initial	O
stage	O
.	O

Enough	O
stock	O
of	O
medicines	O
for	O
rat	O
fever	O
is	O
available	O
in	O
all	O
the	O
primary	O

,	O

.	O

Udupi	B-City
district	O
has	O
not	O

any	O

to	O
this	O

,	O

.	O

Wyoming	B-Province
state	O

,	O

Logan	O

in	O
a	O

(	O

)	O
.	O

has	O

5	O

.	O

to	O

.	O

Logan	O

,	O

Thach	O

,	O
are	O

the	O

and	O

.	O

The	O
herd	O
with	O
known	O
_Brucella_	O
spp.-positive	O
animals	O
is	O

at	O
this	O

.	O

No	O
sexually	O
intact	O

can	O

from	O

until	O

of	O

,	O

are	O
any	O
additional	O

This	O
case	O
is	O
not	O
related	O
to	O
the	O
case	O
found	O
in	O
early	O
October	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
in	O
Park	O
County	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
is	O
no	O

link	O
between	O
the	O
2	O
cases	O
.	O

Brucellosis	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
that	O
can	O
cause	O
cattle	O
,	O
elk	O
,	O
and	O
bison	O
to	O
abort	O
their	O
pregnancies	O
,	O
typically	O
late	O
term	O
.	O

All	O
of	O
Wyoming	B-Province
's	O
brucellosis	B-Disease
cases	O
since	O
1988	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
to	O
have	O
been	O
caused	O
by	O
transmission	O
from	O
infected	O
wildlife	O
to	O
cattle	O
or	O
domestic	O
bison	O
.	O

For	O
more	O
information	O
,	O
contact	O
the	O
Wyoming	B-Province
Livestock	O
Board	O
field	O
office	O
.	O

A	O
fresh	O
outbreak	O
of	O
foot	B-Virus
and	I-Virus
mouth	I-Virus
disease	I-Virus
[	O
FMD	O
]	O
has	O
been	O
detected	O
in	O
the	O
north	O
eastern	O
province	O
of	O
Khentii	B-Province
,	O
as	O

tries	O
to	O
fight	O
against	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
Sukhbaatar	O
and	O
Dornod	O
provinces	O
for	O
the	O
last	O
few	O
months	O
.	O

According	O
to	O

and	O

of	O

(	O

)	O

]	O
from	O

in	O

,	O
Khentii	B-Province
.	O

Out	O
of	O
64	O

540	O

,	O
17	O

.	O

6	O

on	O

from	O
and	O

the	O

.	O

was	O

in	O
a	O
7000	O
hectare	O
area	O
surrounding	O
the	O
epicenter	O
and	O
of	O
122	O

6	O

.	O

of	O

cattle	O
continues	O
in	O

[	O

]	O
of	O

and	O
Dornogobi	O
provinces	O
,	O
said	O
Orgil	O
,	O
a	O
VBAM	O
head	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
,	O
25	O
125	O
heads	O
of	O

and	O
125	O
pigs	O
in	O
Darkhan	O
Soum	O
[	O
have	O

]	O

,	O
which	O
is	O
only	O
14.5	O

cent	O
of	O

.	O

As	O
of	O

,	O
FMD	O
in	O
Dornod	O
and	O
Sukhbaatar	O

MNT	O
3.2	O
billion	O
for	O
its	O

to	O
fight	O
against	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Hospitals	O
in	O
Democratic	O
Republic	O
of	O
Congo	O
's	O
capital	O
Kinshasa	B-City
are	O
``	O
overwhelmed	O
''	O
by	O
a	O
rise	O
in	O
COVID-19	B-Disease
infections	I-Disease
,	O
President	O
Felix	O
Tshisekedi	O
said	O
on	O
Sat	O
12	O
Jun	O
2021	O
,	O
as	O
the	O
country	O
was	O
hit	O
by	O
a	O
3rd	O
wave	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Like	O
many	O

is	O
animal	O
husbandry	O
and	O
agriculture	O
.	O

said	O
that	O

Effective	O
anthrax	B-Disease
vaccines	O
are	O
readily	O
available	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
takes	O
about	O
a	O
week	O
for	O
immunity	O
to	O
be	O
established	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
must	O
be	O
administered	O
annually	O
for	O
continued	O
protection	O
.	O

Producers	O
should	O
monitor	O
their	O
herds	O
for	O
unexplained	O
deaths	O
and	O
work	O
with	O
their	O
veterinarian	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
appropriate	O
samples	O
are	O
collected	O
and	O
submitted	O
to	O
a	O
diagnostic	O
lab	O
to	O
give	O
the	O
best	O

of	O
obtaining	O
a	O
diagnosis	O
.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
has	O
been	O
most	O
frequently	O
reported	O
in	O
northeast	O
,	O
southeast	O
,	O
and	O
south-central	O
North	B-Province
Dakota	I-Province
,	O
but	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
almost	O
every	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
state	O
.	O

A	O
few	O
anthrax	B-Disease
cases	O
are	O
reported	O
in	O
North	B-Province
Dakota	I-Province
almost	O
every	O
year	O
.	O

In	O
2005	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
more	O
than	O
500	O
confirmed	O
deaths	O
from	O
anthrax	B-Disease
were	O
reported	O
with	O
total	O
losses	O
estimated	O
at	O
more	O
than	O
1000	O
head	O
.	O

The	O
animals	O
impacted	O
included	O

,	O

,	O
horses	O
,	O
sheep	O
,	O

,	O
and	O

and	O

.	O

One	O
case	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
was	O
reported	O
in	O
North	B-Province
Dakota	I-Province
in	O
2019	O
.	O

An	O
anthrax	B-Disease
factsheet	O
is	O
available	O
on	O
the	O
North	B-Province
Dakota	I-Province
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
website	O
at	O
Anthrax	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
bacterium	O
_Bacillus	O
anthracis_	O
.	O

The	O
bacterial	O
spores	O
can	O
lie	O
dormant	O
in	O
the	O
ground	O
for	O
decades	O
and	O
become	O
active	O
under	O
ideal	O
conditions	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
heavy	O
rainfall	O
,	O
flooding	O
and	O
drought	O
.	O

Animals	O
are	O
exposed	O
to	O
the	O
disease	O
when	O
they	O
graze	O
or	O
consume	O
forage	O
or	O
water	O
contaminated	O
with	O
the	O
spores	O
.	O

A	O
beloved	O
fire	O
fighter	O
from	O
Melipal	O
died	O
this	O
morning	O
of	O
[	O
a	O
]	O
suspected	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
[	O
infection	O
]	O
and	O
[	O
samples	O
]	O
for	O
study	O
were	O
sent	O
to	O
Buenos	B-Province
Aires	I-Province
for	O
confirmation	O
.	O

The	O
Director	O
of	O
the	O
Area	O
Hospital	O
,	O
VÃ­ctor	O
Parodi	O
confirmed	O
the	O
need	O
to	O
await	O
the	O
results	O
which	O
are	O
expected	O
on	O
Monday	O
.	O

.	O

Ebola	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
viral	O
haemorrhagic	O
fever	O
and	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
most	O
dangerous	O
viral	O
diseases	O
known	O
to	O
humankind	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
known	O
treatment	O
or	O
vaccine	O
for	O
Ebola	B-Virus
,	O
which	O
is	O
transmitted	O
through	O
close	O
personal	O
contact	O
.	O

It	O
kills	O
up	O
to	O
90	O
percent	O
of	O
victims	O
.	O

Its	O
initial	O
symptoms	O
include	O
persistent	O
fever	O
,	O
intense	O
weakness	O
,	O
muscle	O
pain	O
,	O
headache	O
and	O
sore	O
throat	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
usually	O
followed	O
by	O
vomiting	O
,	O
diarrhoea	O
,	O
rashes	O
on	O
the	O
body	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
external	O
bleeding	O
.	O

Highly	O
pathogenic	O
influenza	O
A	O
viruses	O
(	O

.	O

)	O

,	O

told	O
APA	O
.	O

Somalia	B-Country
has	O
not	O
had	O
a	O
functioning	O
central	O
government	O
since	O
the	O
1991	O
downfall	O
of	O
former	O
military	O
ruler	O
General	O
Mohamed	O
Siyad	O
Barre	O
.	O

A	O
mystery	O
disease	O
that	O
usually	O
strikes	O
horses	O
in	O
Nordic	O
countries	O
during	O
the	O
winter	O
months	O
has	O
emerged	O
in	O
Iceland	B-Country
for	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
,	O
leading	O
to	O
the	O
death	O
of	O
13	O
horses	O
.	O

Equine	B-Disease
polyneuropathy	I-Disease
(	O
AEP	O
)	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
Scandinavian	B-Disease
knuckling	I-Disease
syndrome	I-Disease
,	O
1st	O
appeared	O
in	O
Scandinavia	O
in	O
1995	O
,	O
and	O
,	O
despite	O
extensive	O
research	O
,	O
its	O
cause	O
has	O
never	O
been	O
identified	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
presents	O
as	O
muscle	O
weakness	O
in	O
the	O
back	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
cause	O
the	O
fetlock	O
joints	O
to	O
knuckle	O
forward	O
,	O
giving	O
it	O
its	O
common	O
name	O
.	O

Horses	O
with	O
the	O
disease	O
exhibit	O
full	O
consciousness	O
,	O
good	O
appetite	O
,	O
and	O
mostly	O
normal	O
behaviour	O
.	O

AEP	O
is	O
neither	O
contagious	O
nor	O
genetic	O
and	O
usually	O
occurs	O
in	O
populations	O
fed	O
forage	O
,	O
between	O
late	O
winter	O
and	O
early	O
May	O
.	O

While	O
horses	O
are	O
able	O
to	O
make	O
a	O
full	O
recovery	O
,	O
statistics	O
from	O
Norway	O
and	O
Sweden	O
show	O
that	O
up	O
to	O
30	O
%	O
of	O
animals	O
who	O
contract	O
the	O
disease	O
have	O
to	O
be	O
put	O
down	O
.	O

The	O
Icelandic	O
Food	O
and	O
Veterinary	O
Authority	O
(	O
MAST	O
)	O
confirmed	O
the	O
country	O
's	O
1st	O
outbreak	O
in	O
a	O
herd	O
of	O
horses	O
at	O
a	O
large	O
horse	O
farm	O
in	O
northwest	B-Province
Iceland	B-Country
at	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
June	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
.	O

Further	O
tests	O
have	O
brought	O
the	O
total	O
of	O
affected	O
horses	O
to	O
44	O
,	O
12	O
of	O
which	O
had	O
to	O
be	O
euthanised	O
,	O
while	O
one	O
was	O
found	O
dead	O
.	O

In	O
a	O

,	O
Sigridur	O
Bjornsdottir	O
,	O

for	O
health	O
and	O

,	O
said	O
the	O
disease	O
was	O
linked	O
to	O
hay	O
the	O

had	O
been	O
fed	O
.	O

All	O
affected	O
animals	O
had	O
been	O

with	O

from	O
the	O
same	O
field	O
,	O
although	O
not	O
all	O
horses	O
who	O

symptoms	O
.	O

``	O
AEP	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
found	O
on	O
any	O
other	O
farms	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
,	O
and	O

can	O
be	O
assumed	O
that	O

of	O

more	O
cases	O
this	O

[	O
2019	O
]	O
is	O
low	O
,	O
as	O
most	O
young	O
horses	O
are	O
now	O
grazing	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
risk	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
that	O

disease	O
will	O
arise	O
elsewhere	O

as	O

conditions	O
that	O
cause	O
it	O
have	O
now	O
clearly	O
appeared	O
in	O
Iceland	B-Country
,	O
''	O
the	O
statement	O
added	O
.	O

``	O
As	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
new	O
to	O
the	O
country	O
,	O
MAST	O
requests	O
notification	O
of	O
all	O
cases	O
where	O
AEP	O
is	O
suspected	O
or	O
confirmed	O
.	O
''	O

AEP	O
is	O
found	O
most	O
commonly	O
in	O
Norway	O
but	O
also	O
in	O
Sweden	O
and	O
Finland	O
,	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
typical	O
for	O
there	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
cluster	O
of	O
cases	O
at	O
one	O
site	O
.	O

World	O
Horse	O
Welfare	O
has	O
been	O
made	O
aware	O
of	O
several	O
cases	O
of	O
equine	B-Disease
atypical	I-Disease
myopathy	I-Disease
(	O
EAM	O
)	O
in	O
the	O
UK	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
urging	O
horse	O
owners	O
to	O
monitor	O
their	O
own	O
horses	O
.	O

Liphook	O
Equine	O
Hospital	O
in	O
Hampshire	B-City
[	O
England	B-Province
]	O
have	O
issued	O
an	O
alert	O
that	O
they	O
have	O
diagnosed	O
5	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
few	O
days	O
.	O

2	O
of	O
the	O
5	O
diagnosed	O
horses	O
have	O
died	O
.	O

Liphook	O
are	O
also	O
aware	O
of	O
a	O
further	O
4	O
cases	O
attended	O
by	O
veterinarians	O
which	O
have	O
died	O
in	O
the	O
Hampshire/Sussex/Surrey	O
area	O
.	O

EAM	O
is	O
a	O
disease	O
of	O
unknown	O
cause	O
which	O
results	O
in	O
significant	O
muscle	O
damage	O
.	O

The	O
condition	O
,	O
which	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
becoming	O
more	O
common	O
,	O
affects	O
horses	O
at	O
pasture	O
,	O
often	O
in	O
the	O
spring	O
and/or	O
autumn	O
,	O
and	O
has	O
a	O
high	O
death	O
rate	O
.	O

Similarities	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
have	O
been	O
made	O
with	O
equine	O
grass	O
sickness	O
as	O
it	O
is	O
a	O
pasture	O
related	O
disease	O
that	O
appears	O
to	O
be	O
associated	O
with	O
an	O
adverse	O
change	O
in	O
weather	O
conditions	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
,	O
sudden	O
frost	O
,	O
heavy	O
rain	O
)	O
.	O

Signs	O
to	O
look	O
out	O
for	O
include	O
:	O
-	O
Weakness	O
and	O
stiffness	O
in	O
horses	O
at	O
pasture	O
-	O
not	O
related	O
to	O
excessive/unusual	O
exercise	O
-	O
Dark	O
coloured	O
urine	O
-	O
Collapse	O
-	O
Muscle	O
tremors	O
.	O

Notably	O
,	O
for	O
a	O
day	O
or	O
2	O
prior	O
to	O
referral	O
to	O
Liphook	O
,	O
the	O
5	O
horses	O
also	O
displayed	O
clinical	O
signs	O
less	O
well-recognised	O
in	O
atypical	O
myopathy	O
cases	O
.	O

These	O
signs	O
included	O
:	O
-	O
Vigorous	O
head	O
shaking	O
and	O
nodding	O
-	O
Frenzied	O
vocalisation	O
-	O
Recurrent	O
choke-like	O
retching	O
neck	O
spasms	O
without	O
a	O
persistent	O
oesophageal	O
obstruction	O
-	O
Stiffness	O
and	O
lethargy	O
when	O
ridden	O
Intensive	O
treatment	O
of	O
any	O
case	O
is	O
required	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
possible	O
to	O
maximise	O
its	O
chances	O
of	O
survival	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
suspect	O
your	O
horse	O
has	O
atypical	O
myopathy	O
contact	O
your	O
vet	O
immediately	O
and	O
remove	O
the	O
horse	O
from	O
the	O
pasture	O
.	O

Any	O
other	O
animals	O
that	O
are	O
grazing	O
with	O
the	O
horse	O
you	O
are	O
concerned	O
about	O
should	O
also	O
be	O
removed	O
from	O
the	O
affected	O
pastures	O
immediately	O
,	O
as	O
it	O
is	O
possible	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
toxin	O
in	O
the	O
grass	O
,	O
released	O
only	O
during	O
changing	O
weather	O
conditions	O
,	O
which	O
causes	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Further	O
information	O
on	O
the	O
disease	O
can	O
be	O
obtained	O
from	O

It	O
took	O
less	O
than	O
3	O
weeks	O
for	O
the	O
FMD	B-Virus
to	O
resurface	O
in	O
South	B-Country
Korea	I-Country
,	O
which	O
in	O
January	O
[	O
2010	O
]	O
had	O
affected	O
the	O
country	O
for	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
in	O
8	O
years	O
.	O

The	O
country	O
is	O
scrambling	O
again	O
to	O
contain	O
further	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
highly	O
contagious	O
disease	O
that	O
mainly	O
affects	O
cloven-hoofed	O
animals	O
including	O
pigs	O
,	O
cattle	O
,	O
and	O
goats	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
ministry	O
,	O
animals	O
on	O
the	O
farm	O
on	O
Ganghwa	O
Island	O
,	O
58	O
km	O
[	O
36	O
mi	O
]	O
west	O
of	O
Seoul	O
,	O
started	O
showing	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
FMD	B-Virus
symptoms	O
on	O
Thursday	O
.	O

Quarantine	O

took	O

by	O

off	O
the	O
farm	O
and	O

of	O

.	O

The	O

that	O

are	O

the	O

cause	O
of	O
the	O

.	O

of	O
the	O

had	O

a	O

to	O
a	O

[	O

]	O

country	O
that	O

an	O

outbreak	O
last	O
week	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
,	O
5	O
cases	O
[	O
animal	O
holdings	O
?	O
]	O

of	O

Texas	B-Province
Animal	O
Health	O
Commission	O
(	O
TAHC	O
)	O
officials	O
confirmed	O
equine	B-Virus
infectious	I-Virus
anemia	I-Virus
(	O
EIA	O
)	O
in	O
one	O
quarter	O
horse	O
on	O
a	O
Dallas	B-City
County	I-City
premises	O
on	O
26	O
Jan	O
2021	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
confirmed	O
case	O
of	O
EIA	O
in	O
Texas	B-Province
this	O
year	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
.	O

The	O
horse	O
was	O
confirmed	O
positive	O
after	O
testing	O
was	O
performed	O
to	O
meet	O
regulatory	O
requirements	O
.	O

The	O
premises	O
has	O
been	O
quarantined	O
and	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
released	O
until	O
TAHC	O
's	O
requirements	O
are	O
met	O
.	O

TAHC	O
staff	O
are	O
working	O
closely	O
with	O
the	O
owner	O
and	O
local	O
veterinarian	O
to	O
monitor	O
potentially	O
exposed	O
horses	O
and	O
implement	O
biosecurity	O
measures	O
.	O

``	O
Last	O
year	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
,	O
17	O
horses	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
equine	B-Virus
infectious	I-Virus
anemia	I-Virus
in	O
Texas	B-Province
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dr	O
Andy	O
Schwartz	O
,	O
state	O
veterinarian	O
.	O

``	O
These	O
cases	O
serve	O
a	O
reminder	O
that	O
EIA	O
is	O
present	O
in	O
our	O
state	O
,	O
biosecurity	O
and	O
sanitary	O
practices	O
are	O
invaluable	O
,	O
and	O
required	O
EIA	O
testing	O
for	O
equine	O
event	O
participation	O
and	O
congregation	O
continues	O
to	O
be	O
of	O
the	O
utmost	O
importance	O
.	O
''	O

EIA	O
is	O
an	O
incurable	O
,	O
infectious	O
viral	O
disease	O
spread	O
through	O
blood-to-blood	O
contact	O
,	O
not	O
through	O
close	O
proximity	O
or	O
direct	O
contact	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
from	O
an	O
infected	O
equine	O
to	O
an	O
uninfected	O
equine	O
by	O
biting	O
flies	O
,	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
unsterilized	O
or	O
contaminated	O
medical	O
instruments	O
,	O
or	O
through	O
a	O
blood	O
transfusion	O
.	O

The	O
commonest	O
clinical	O
sign	O
of	O
acute	O
EIA	O
is	O
fever	O
,	O
which	O
often	O
precedes	O
the	O
development	O
of	O
other	O
signs	O
.	O

In	O
chronic	O
cases	O
,	O
signs	O
such	O
as	O
weight	O
loss	O
,	O
weakness	O
,	O
anemia	O
,	O
and	O
swelling	O
of	O
the	O
lower	O
legs	O
,	O
chest	O
and	O
abdomen	O
may	O
occur	O
.	O

The	O
TAHC	O
would	O
like	O
to	O
remind	O
horse	O
owners	O
all	O
Texas	B-Province
equine	O
participating	O
in	O
Texas	O
events	O
must	O
have	O
a	O
negative	O
EIA	O
test	O
,	O
performed	O
by	O
a	O
private	O
practitioner	O
,	O
within	O
the	O
past	O
12	O
months	O
.	O

Horse	O
owners	O
should	O
keep	O
the	O
EIA	O
test	O
document	O
or	O
``	O
Coggins	O
papers	O
''	O
available	O
when	O
traveling	O
with	O
horses	O
.	O

Contact	O
your	O
private	O
veterinarian	O
for	O
testing	O
.	O

Any	O
additional	O
Texas	B-Province
EIA	O
cases	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
will	O

The	O
Minnesota	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
[	O
MDH	O
]	O
reported	O
3	O

of	O
salmonellosis	B-Disease
have	O
been	O

to	O

Inver	B-City
Grove	I-City
Heights	I-City
.	O

The	O
cases	O
are	O

of	O
a	O
multi-state	O
outbreak	O
of	O
salmonellosis	B-Disease
being	O
investigated	O
by	O
the	O
CDC	O
.	O

The	O
ill	O
Minnesotans	O
were	O
age	O
18	O
to	O
60	O
.	O

All	O
3	O
cases	O
were	O
caused	O
by	O
_Salmonella	O
[	O
enterica_	O
serotype	O
]	O
Infantis	O
,	O
which	O
has	O
been	O
previously	O
associated	O
with	O
poultry	O
.	O

The	O
cases	O
occurred	O
from	O
late	O
March	O
2013	O
through	O
early	O
April	O
2013	O
.	O

MDH	O
State	O
Public	O
Health	O
Veterinarian	O
Dr	O
Joni	O
Scheftel	O
said	O
the	O
outbreak	O
underscores	O
the	O
importance	O
of	O
washing	O
hands	O
thoroughly	O
after	O
handling	O
chicks	O
,	O
ducklings	O
,	O
or	O
other	O
birds	O
.	O

People	O
typically	O
get	O
salmonella	O
from	O
poultry	O
by	O
hand-to-mouth	O
contact	O
.	O

Usually	O
this	O
happens	O
when	O
people	O
handle	O
birds	O
or	O
objects	O
in	O
their	O
environment	O
and	O
then	O
accidentally	O
touch	O
their	O
mouths	O
or	O
forget	O
to	O
wash	O
their	O
hands	O
before	O
eating	O
or	O
drinking	O
.	O

Salmonellosis	B-Disease
can	O
also	O
be	O
contracted	O
by	O
eating	O
contaminated	O
foods	O
that	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
properly	O
prepared	O
and	O
handled	O
.	O

man	O
has	O

3rd	O

Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
indicated	O
yellow	B-Virus
fever	I-Virus
had	O
not	O

.	O

to	O

the	O

.	O

Ishaq	O
Ahmed	O
Yaqoub	O
,	O

of	O
West	O

is	O
not	O

of	O
the	O

of	O

cases	O
of	O
yellow	B-Virus
fever	I-Virus
in	O

.	O

that	O

phase	O
of	O
the	O

campaign	O
will	O

.	O

as	O

2013	O

.	O

35	O

.	O

City	O

[	O

Dr	O

4	O

the	O

.	O

While	O

can	O

swiftly	O
where	O

is	O
poor	O
and	O
clean	O

the	O
disease	O
in	O
New	B-City
York	I-City
is	O
considered	O
low	O
.	O

The	O

is	O
also	O
low	O
,	O
as	O
one	O

_Vibrio	O

.	O

``	O

by	O

.	O

The	O
Israeli	O

on	O
Sunday	O

that	O
3	O

cases	O
of	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
[	O
infection	O
]	O
,	O
a	O

disease	O
,	O
were	O
recorded	O
in	O
Israel	B-Country
over	O
the	O

[	O
July	O
2014	O
]	O
.	O

Up	O
until	O
the	O
July	O
[	O
2014	O
]	O
cases	O
,	O

total	O
number	O
of	O

13	O

as	O

[	O

]	O

virus	O
.	O

The	O
cases	O
stretched	O
through	O
a	O
region	O
from	O
the	O
Haifa	B-City
and	O
Afula	B-City
area	O
in	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
country	O
to	O
the	O
Ashkelon	O
region	O
in	O
the	O

and	O
were	O
reported	O
in	O
12	O
different	O
communities	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
central	O
Gush	O
Dan	O
coastal	O
region	O
,	O
6	O
patients	O
suffering	O
from	O
the	O
virus	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
up	O
till	O
now	O
.	O

While	O
most	O
people	O
infected	O
with	O
the	O
virus	O
either	O
experience	O
no	O
symptoms	O
or	O
only	O
minor	O
ones	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
a	O
fever	O
or	O
mild	O
headache	O
,	O
the	O
virus	O
is	O
life-threatening	O
to	O
some	O
and	O
can	O
develop	O
into	O
an	O
inflammation	O
of	O
the	O
brain	O
.	O

Severe	O
symptoms	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
a	O
severe	O
headache	O
,	O
fever	O
or	O
disorientation	O
,	O
require	O
immediate	O
attention	O
.	O

In	O
2013	O
,	O
71	O
cases	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
were	O
reported	O
in	O
Israel	B-Country
;	O
4	O
of	O
those	O
infected	O
passed	O
away	O
from	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Likewise	O
in	O
2012	O
,	O
out	O
of	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
89	O
cases	O
,	O
2	O
patients	O
passed	O
away	O
.	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
recommends	O
that	O
the	O
public	O
protect	O
itself	O
by	O
avoiding	O
mosquito	O
bites	O
through	O
various	O
means	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
usage	O
of	O
mosquito	O
repellent	O
creams	O
,	O
placing	O
screens	O
on	O
windows	O
,	O
and	O
reporting	O
standing	O
stagnant	O
water	O
to	O
local	O
authorities	O
,	O
given	O
that	O
stagnant	O
water	O
is	O
often	O
a	O
breeding	O
ground	O
for	O
the	O
insects	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
reportedly	O
resides	O
in	O
birds	O
;	O
mosquitoes	O
who	O
bite	O
birds	O
carrying	O
the	O
virus	O
can	O
transmit	O
it	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

In	O
around	O
one	O
per	O
cent	O
of	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
virus	O
poses	O
a	O
serious	O
danger	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
specific	O
treatment	O
for	O
the	O
virus	O
,	O
and	O
,	O
therefore	O
,	O
the	O
main	O
method	O
to	O
combat	O
it	O
is	O
by	O
avoiding	O
contracting	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
primarily	O
by	O
preventing	O
mosquito	O
bites	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
an	O
April	O
[	O
2015	O
]	O
surveillance	O
report	O
from	O
China	B-Country
,	O
6	O

avian	I-Virus

,	O

[	O

]	O

.	O

,	O

's	O

where	O
it	O
was	O
confirmed	O
to	O
have	O
rabies	B-Virus
on	O
.	O

``	O
Rabies	B-Virus
is	O
transmitted	O
when	O
saliva	O
or	O
neural	O
tissue	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O
animal	O
is	O
introduced	O
into	O
the	O
body	O
of	O
a	O
person	O
or	O
animal	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
David	O
Vaughan	O
,	O
director	O
of	O
the	O
DHEC	O
Onsite	O
Wastewater	O
,	O
Rabies	O
Prevention	O
,	O
and	O
Enforcement	O
Division	O
.	O

One	O
of	O
the	O
easiest	O
ways	O
of	O
avoiding	O
rabies	B-Virus
is	O
keeping	O
your	O
pet	O
's	O
rabies	O
vaccination	O
up-to-date	O
,	O
reports	O
DHEC	O
.	O

``	O
To	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
getting	O
rabies	B-Virus
,	O
always	O
give	O
wild	O
and	O
stray	O
animals	O
their	O
space	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
see	O
an	O
animal	O
in	O
need	O
,	O
avoid	O
touching	O
it	O
and	O
contact	O
someone	O
trained	O
in	O
handling	O
animals	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
your	O
local	O
animal	O
control	O
officer	O
or	O
wildlife	O
rehabilitator	O
,	O
''	O
Vaughan	O
said	O
.	O

DHEC	O
also	O
suggests	O
washing	O
the	O
affected	O
area	O
immediately	O
with	O
soap	O
and	O
water	O
if	O
you	O
think	O
you	O
have	O
been	O
affected	O
by	O
rabies	B-Virus
,	O
and	O
calling	O
your	O
local	O
DHEC	O
office	O
.	O

Belarus	B-Country
has	O
confirmed	O
African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
.	O

The	O
State	O
Veterinary	O
Service	O
of	O
Belarus	B-Country
has	O
recorded	O
African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
(	O
ASF	O
)	O
in	O
the	O
Grodno	B-Province
region	O
,	O

to	O
the	O

.	O

.	O

[	O
Sin	O
Nombre	O
]	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
,	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
deadly	O
,	O
is	O
carried	O
primarily	O
by	O
deer	O
mice	O
[	O
_Peromyscus	O
maniculatus_	O
]	O
.	O

The	O
infected	O
rodents	O
excrete	O
the	O
virus	O
in	O
their	O
urine	O
,	O
droppings	O
and	O
saliva	O
.	O

People	O
are	O
infected	O
by	O

particles	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
or	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
rodents	O
,	O
their	O
droppings	O
or	O

.	O

say	O
the	O
case	O
is	O
a	O
good	O

to	O

to	O

to	O

hantavirus	B-Virus
[	O

are	O
present	O
.	O

A	O
South	O
American	O
species	O
of	O
hairy-legged	O
vampire	O
bat	O
that	O
was	O
thought	O
to	O
feed	O
only	O
on	O
birds	O
has	O
been	O
caught	O
feeding	O
on	O
human	O
blood	O
for	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
,	O
prompting	O
concerns	O
about	O
disease	O
transmission	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
if	O
the	O
bats	O
become	O
rabid	O
.	O

Scientists	O
studying	O
bat	O
poo	O
found	O
in	O
3	O
out	O
of	O
15	O
samples	O
from	O
the	O
bats	O
,	O
living	O
in	O
the	O
Caatinga	O

forests	O
of	O
north	O
east	O
Brazil	B-Country
,	O
there	O
were	O
traces	O
of	O
DNA	O
from	O
human	O
blood	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O

in	O

Acta	O
Chiropterologica	O
.	O

The	O
bat	O
species	O
studied	O
is	O
usually	O
a	O
fastidious	O
eater	O
and	O
only	O
feeds	O
on	O
bird	O
blood	O
,	O
whose	O
composition	O
is	O
very	O
different	O
from	O
that	O
of	O
mammal	O
blood	O
.	O

But	O
the	O

are	O
adapting	O
fast	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
scientists	O
noted	O
significant	O
and	O
regular	O
consumption	O
of	O
human	O
blood	O
.	O

The	O
scientists	O
say	O
that	O
human	O
activity	O
is	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
the	O
cause	O
in	O
the	O
bats	O
'	O
changing	O
tastes	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
record	O
of	O
humans	O
as	O
prey	O
and	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
blood	O
from	O

of	O
wild	O

in	O

,	O
''	O

in	O
the	O
paper	O
.	O

Humans	O
are	O
increasingly	O

,	O

.	O

The	O
birds	O

<	O

>	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

)	O

.	O

.	O

I	O
will	O

.	O

Front	B-City
Range	I-City
counties	O
and	O
all	O
involved	O
adults	O
.	O

Hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
virus	O
contracted	O
by	O
eating	O
food	O
or	O
drinks	O
contaminated	O
with	O
fecal	O
matter	O
from	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
or	O
through	O
sexual	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
,	O
including	O
oral-anal	O
contact	O
.	O

Those	O
at	O
higher	O
risk	O
include	O
men	O
who	O
have	O
sex	O
with	O
men	O
,	O
people	O
who	O
use	O
drugs	O
through	O
injection	O
,	O
and	O
people	O
who	O
are	O
homeless	O
.	O

Among	O
the	O
26	O
cases	O
reported	O
so	O
far	O
in	O
2017	O
,	O
the	O
majority	O
involved	O
men	O
and	O
more	O
than	O
half	O
involved	O
men	O
who	O
had	O
sex	O
with	O
men	O
.	O

Vaccines	O
are	O
routinely	O
recommended	O
for	O
children	O
but	O
most	O
adults	O
are	O
not	O
vaccinated	O
against	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
.	O

People	O
at	O
higher	O
risk	O
are	O
urged	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
vaccine	O
,	O
``	O
which	O
is	O
extremely	O
safe	O
and	O
highly	O
effective	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
state	O
epidemiologist	O
Rachel	O
Herlihy	O
.	O

Several	O
cases	O
of	O
illness	O
from	O
eating	O
raw	O
oysters	O
and	O
lab	O
detection	O
of	O
bacteria	O
that	O
can	O

people	O
sick	O
has	O
led	O
state	O

officials	O
to	O
close	O
2	O
Hood	B-City
Canal	I-City
growing	O
areas	O
.	O

Lab	O
tests	O
in	O
Hood	B-City
Canal	I-City
Six	O
,	O
which	O
runs	O
from	O
Hoodsport	B-City
south	O
and	O
east	O
to	O
the	O
boat	O
launch	O
area	O
at	O
Twanoh	B-City
State	I-City
Park	I-City
,	O
showed	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
_Vibrio	O
parahaemolyticus_	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
cause	O
an	O
illness	O
known	O
as	O
vibriosis	B-Disease
.	O

While	O
no	O

have	O

to	O

from	O
this	O

this	O

[	O

]	O

in	O

who	O

Hood	B-City
Canal	I-City
Five	O
,	O

from	O

(	O

a	O

)	O

.	O

Both	O

have	O

by	O
the	O

to	O

There	O

cases	O

[	O
2010	O
]	O

state	O
's	O

.	O

Typically	O
,	O
Washington	B-Province
sees	O
about	O
50	O
cases	O
of	O
vibriosis	B-Disease
a	O
year	O
.	O

_Vibrio	O
parahaemolyticus_	O
is	O
found	O
naturally	O
in	O
the	O
environment	O
.	O

The	O
warm	O
temperatures	O
and	O
daytime	O
low	O
tides	O
are	O
likely	O
contributing	O
to	O
these	O
recent	O
cases	O
.	O

These	O
2	O
areas	O
are	O
closed	O
for	O
all	O
recreational	O
harvesting	O
of	O
oysters	O
.	O

Some	O
commercial	O
growers	O
may	O
still	O
harvest	O
oysters	O
from	O
these	O
areas	O
,	O
but	O
those	O

can	O
only	O
be	O
sold	O
when	O
they	O
are	O
shucked	O
and	O
intended	O
to	O
be	O
cooked	O
before	O
consumption	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
is	O
usually	O
moderate	O
and	O
lasts	O
for	O
2	O
to	O
7	O
days	O
;	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
more	O
serious	O
,	O
and	O
may	O
be	O
life	O
threatening	O
to	O
people	O
with	O
weak	O
immune	O
systems	O
or	O
chronic	O
liver	O
disease	O
.	O

Thorough	O
cooking	O
will	O
kill	O
the	O
bacteria	O
and	O
leave	O
the	O
shellfish	O
safe	O
to	O
eat	O
.	O

Food	O
safety	O
specialists	O
recommend	O
oysters	O
be	O
cooked	O
to	O
an	O
internal	O
temperature	O
of	O
145	O
deg	O
F	O
to	O
kill	O
the	O
bacteria	O
.	O

upazila	O

This	O
is	O

3rd	O
wave	O
of	O

cases	O
in	O
the	O
upazila	O
since	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

The	O
outbreak	O
is	O
linked	O
to	O
anthrax	O
tainted	O
meat	O
.	O

All	O
the	O
cases	O
are	O
considered	O
cutaneous	B-Disease
anthrax	I-Disease
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
report	O
.	O

Anthrax	O
is	O
a	O
serious	O
infectious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
gram-positive	O
,	O
rod-shaped	O
bacteria	O
known	O
as	O
_Bacillus	O
anthracis_	O
.	O

Anthrax	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
naturally	O
in	O
soil	O
and	O
commonly	O
affects	O
domestic	O
and	O
wild	O
animals	O
around	O
the	O
world	O
.	O

Although	O
it	O
is	O
rare	O
,	O
people	O
can	O
get	O
sick	O
with	O
anthrax	O
if	O
they	O
come	O
in	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
or	O
contaminated	O
animal	O
products	O
Cutaneous	B-Disease
anthrax	I-Disease
occurs	O
when	O
the	O
spore	O
(	O
or	O
possibly	O
the	O
bacterium	O
)	O
enters	O
a	O
cut	O
or	O
abrasion	O
on	O
the	O
skin	O
.	O

It	O
starts	O
out	O
as	O
a	O
raised	O
bump	O
that	O
looks	O
like	O
an	O
insect	O
bite	O
.	O

It	O
then	O
develops	O
into	O
a	O
blackened	O
lesion	O
called	O
an	O
eschar	O
that	O
may	O
form	O
a	O
scab	O
.	O

Lymph	O
glands	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
may	O
swell	O
plus	O
edema	O
may	O
be	O
present	O
.	O

This	O
form	O
of	O
anthrax	O
responds	O
well	O
to	O
antibiotics	O
.	O

If	O
untreated	O
,	O
deaths	O
can	O
occur	O
if	O
the	O
infection	O
goes	O
systemic	O
.	O

Up	O
to	O
95	O
percent	O
of	O
cases	O
of	O
anthrax	O
are	O
cutaneous	O
.	O

Summary	O
Report	O
type	O
:	O
immediate	O
notification	O
Started	O
:	O
22	O
Mar	O
2021	O

:	O
26	O
Mar	O
2021	O

1	O

2021	O

recurrence	O

Legionnaires	B-Disease
'	I-Disease
[	O
disease	O
]	O
is	O

'	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
,	O

Avian	B-Disease

is	O

_Clostridium	O
botulinum_	O

.	O

levels	O
,	O

.	O

.	O

According	O
to	O

for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
,	O
bacteria	O
that	O

can	O
be	O
found	O
in	O

and	O
dirt	O
,	O
even	O
after	O
cleaning	O
.	O

Infants	O
are	O
more	O

to	O
complications	O
because	O
their	O
digestive	O
tracts	O
are	O
not	O
developed	O
enough	O
to	O
fight	O
off	O
the	O
bacteria	O
which	O
then	O
begins	O
producing	O
toxins	O
.	O

Warning	O
signs	O
of	O
infant	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
include	O

,	O

,	O

feeding	O
,	O
and	O

cry	O
.	O

Botulism	O
is	O
not	O
contagious	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
CDC	O
.	O

A	O
yellow	B-Virus

outbreak	O
in	O

and	O

``	O

)	O

out	O
soon	O
.	O

``	O

far	O
in	O
Angola	B-Country
more	O
than	O
15	O
million	O
people	O
(	O
have	O
been	O

)	O
,	O
this	O

of	O
the	O

.	O

So	O

still	O

to	O

and	O

but	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
a	O
major	O

I	O

is	O
now	O
over	O
,	O
''	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

But	O
there	O
were	O
still	O
32	O
endemic	O
countries	O
in	O

,	O
so	O

of	O

,	O

.	O

At	O

[	O

]	O

''	O

was	O

to	O

,	O
with	O
1000	O

cases	O
and	O
up	O
to	O
6000	O
suspected	O
cases	O
of	O
the	O
mosquito-borne	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
outbreak	O
is	O
the	O
worst	O
in	O
decades	O
among	O
unprotected	O
African	O
populations	O
and	O
has	O

more	O

.	O

The	O

have	O

of	O
6	O
million	O

from	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

On	O

.	O

Ross	B-Virus
River	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
[	O

]	O

since	O

.	O

.	O

also	O

more	O

.	O

_Pepino	O

(	O

LFV	B-Virus
can	O
be	O

from	O

with	O

blood	O
in	O

of	O

.	O

Several	O

of	O

have	O

in	O

.	O

Fortunately	O
,	O
there	O

no	O
cases	O
among	O
the	O
Kano	O
AKTH	O
staff	O
in	O
the	O
previous	O
ProMED-mail	O
report	O
.	O

As	O
Mod.CP	O
pointed	O
out	O
in	O
his	O
comment	O
in	O
archived	O
posting	O
20130131.1524034	O
:	O
``	O
In	O
the	O
countries	O
of	O
Africa	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
Nigeria	B-Country
,	O
where	O
Lassa	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
is	O
endemic	O
,	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
a	O
significant	O
cause	O
of	O
morbidity	O
and	O
mortality	O
.	O

While	O
Lassa	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
infection	O
is	O
normally	O
mild	O
or	O
has	O
no	O
observable	O
symptoms	O
in	O
about	O
80	O
per	O
cent	O
of	O
people	O
infected	O
with	O
the	O
virus	O
,	O
the	O
remaining	O
20	O
per	O
cent	O
have	O
a	O
severe	O
,	O
multisystem	O
disease	O
.	O

Rarely	O
,	O
Lassa	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
is	O
associated	O
with	O
epidemics	O
,	O
during	O
which	O
the	O
case-fatality	O
rate	O
can	O
reach	O
50	O
per	O
cent	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
preventative	O
vaccine	O
or	O
treatment	O
.	O

The	O
antiviral	O
drug	O
ribavirin	O
has	O
been	O
used	O
with	O
success	O
in	O
Lassa	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
patients	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
a	O
member	O
of	O
the	O
family	O
_Arenaviridae_	O
and	O
causes	O
acute	O
hemorrhagic	O
fever	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
from	O
contact	O
with	O
food	O
or	O
household	O
items	O
contaminated	O
with	O
excreta	O
of	O
the	O
reservoir	O
rodent	O
host	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
adequate	O
infection	O
control	O
measures	O
,	O
person-to-person	O
virus	O

can	O

stable	O
condition	O
.	O

as	O
a	O

case	O
in	O
a	O

of	O
a	O
previously	O
confirmed	O
case	O

on	O
newly	O

recoveries	O

)	O
:	O
1-	O

State	O
health	O
officials	O
are	O
investigating	O
a	O
cluster	O
of	O
possible	O
botulism	B-Disease
cases	O
in	O
the	O
Yukon-Kuskokwim	O
Delta	O

a	O

of	O
fermented	O
fish	O
heads	O
,	O

said	O
Mon	O

2014	O
.	O

Of	O
4	O

last	O

Alaska	B-Province

.	O

Alaska	B-Province
State	O
Troopers	O
on	O
Sun	O
17	O
Aug	O
2014	O
evening	O
said	O
the	O
man	O
who	O
died	O
was	O
59	O
,	O
of	O
Lower	B-City
Kalskag	I-City
,	O
a	O
village	O
of	O
about	O
300	O
people	O
on	O
the	O
Kuskokwim	O
River	O
350	O
miles	O
west	O

.	O

He	O
ate	O
the	O
fish	O
Wed	O
13	O
Aug	O
2014	O
and	O

,	O

.	O

He	O
was	O

in	O
his	O

Fri	O
15	O

2014	O
.	O

to	O
Anchorage	O
for	O
an	O

by	O
the	O
state	O

.	O

Health	O
officials	O
are	O
testing	O
samples	O
of	O
the	O
food	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
clinical	O
samples	O
from	O
the	O
people	O
who	O
may	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
to	O
look	O
for	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
botulinum	O
toxin	O
.	O

Testing	O
takes	O
about	O
a	O
week	O
,	O
Castrodale	O
said	O
.	O

Botulism	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
life-threatening	O
disease	O
and	O
a	O
public	O
health	O
emergency	O
.	O

The	O
bacteria	O
can	O
incubate	O
in	O
some	O
traditional	O
Alaska	B-Province
native	O
foods	O
including	O
fermented	O
``	O
stink	O
heads	O
,	O
''	O
which	O
some	O
in	O
the	O
Yukon-Kuskokwim	O
region	O
consider	O
a	O
delicacy	O
,	O
but	O
others	O
stay	O
away	O
from	O
.	O

The	O
traditional	O
way	O
of	O
aging	O
the	O
fish	O
in	O
grass	O
or	O
straw	O
has	O
given	O
way	O
to	O
glass	O
or	O
plastic	O
containers	O
that	O
can	O
increase	O
the	O
risk	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O
2011	O
state	O
report	O
,	O
``	O
Botulism	B-Disease
in	O
Alaska	B-Province
.	O
''	O

If	O
officials	O
confirm	O
that	O
the	O
man	O
died	O
from	O
botulism	B-Disease
,	O
it	O
will	O
be	O
the	O
1st	O
Alaska	B-Province
death	O
from	O
the	O
bacteria	O
since	O
2007	O
,	O
Castrodale	O
said	O
.	O

Health	O
care	O
providers	O
are	O
urged	O
to	O
immediately	O
report	O
suspected	O
cases	O
to	O
ensure	O
quick	O
treatment	O
and	O
to	O
stop	O
others	O
from	O
eating	O
suspect	O
food	O
.	O

People	O
may	O
suffer	O
from	O
nausea	O
,	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
blurred	O
vision	O
,	O
skeletal	O
muscular	O
weakness	O
and	O
partial	O
paralysis	O
.	O

Two	O
horses	O
and	O
a	O
donkey	O
were	O
euthanised	O
in	O
Gorakhpur	B-City
[	O
Uttar	B-Province
Pradesh	I-Province
]	O
on	O
after	O
they	O
were	O
detected	O
with	O
the	O
deadly	O
glanders	B-Disease
disease	I-Disease
.	O

A	O
high	O
alert	O
has	O
been	O
sounded	O
in	O
the	O
district	O
and	O
movement	O
of	O
equines	O
--	O
horses	O
,	O
ponies	O
,	O
mules	O
,	O
and	O
donkeys	O
--	O
has	O
been	O
restricted	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
can	O
spread	O
quickly	O
in	O
animals	O
and	O
also	O
infect	O
humans	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
detected	O
in	O
Gorakhpur	B-City
.	O

Chief	O

Officer	O

KP	O
Singh	O

samples	O

20	O

A	O

23	O

_Salmonella	O

9	O

.	O

pet	O

's	O

.	O

Farmers	O
in	O
Sarpang	B-City
[	O
Geylegphug	B-City
]	O
are	O
losing	O
chilli	O
plants	O
to	O
a	O
new	O
disease	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
turning	O
the	O
plants	O
yellow	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
an	O
addition	O
to	O
pests	O
like	O

,	O
aphids	O
,	O
and	O
whitefly	O
they	O
have	O
observed	O
for	O
the	O
past	O
2	O
years	O
.	O

GS	O
Rai	O
,	O
Agriculture	O
Research	O
and	O
Development	O
Centre	O
(	O
ARDC	O
)	O
,	O
said	O
the	O
yellowing	B-Disease
disease	I-Disease
is	O
new	O
in	O
the	O
region	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
isolated	O
the	O
pathogen	O
from	O
the	O
infected	O
plant	O
for	O
laboratory	O
observation	O
.	O

We	O
would	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
confirm	O
the	O
disease	O
within	O
14	O
days	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
centre	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
confirmatory	O
facility	O
for	O
molecular	O
analysis	O
.	O

The	O
officials	O
had	O
visited	O
14	O
different	O
fields	O
.	O

A	O
farmer	O
said	O
the	O
pest	O
started	O
to	O
appear	O
suddenly	O
when	O
the	O
plants	O
were	O
ready	O
for	O
harvest	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
a	O
similar	O
disease	O
hampered	O
chilli	O
production	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
.	O

Three	O
hybrid	O
varieties	O
were	O
introduced	O
through	O
fast-track	O
evaluation	O
.	O

GS	O
Rai	O
said	O
the	O
same	O
disease	O
and	O
pests	O
were	O
also	O
observed	O
in	O
the	O
local	O
variety	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
disease	O
is	O
not	O
because	O
of	O
the	O
imported	O
hybrid	O
.	O

Phytophthora	O
infection	O
on	O
peppers	O
was	O
seen	O
in	O
Bhutan	B-Country
since	O
1995	O
.	O

Only	O
yellowing	B-Disease
of	O
plant	O
is	O
the	O
new	O
disease	O
observed	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
.	O
''	O

[	O
byline	O
:	O
Nima	O
]	O

The	O
Illinois	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Public	O
Health	O
(	O
IDPH	O
)	O
,	O
working	O
with	O
the	O
CDC	O
,	O
the	O
FDA	O
and	O
other	O
state	O
health	O
departments	O
,	O
is	O
investigating	O
several	O
foodborne	O
outbreaks	O
in	O
which	O
people	O
report	O
becoming	O
ill	O
after	O
consuming	O
desserts	O
from	O
Rolf	O
's	O
Patisserie	O
in	O
Lincolnwood	B-City
,	O
Illinois	O
.	O

There	O
have	O
been	O
4	O
recent	O
outbreaks	O
where	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
dessert	O
items	O
has	O
come	O
from	O
Rolf	O
's	O
Patisserie	O
.	O

Approximately	O
100	O
people	O
have	O
reported	O
becoming	O
ill	O
after	O
consuming	O
Rolf	O
's	O
desserts	O
at	O
a	O
company	O
event	O
,	O
a	O
catered	O
party	O
,	O
a	O
restaurant	O
and	O
holiday	O
party	O
.	O

Rolf	O
's	O
is	O
a	O
wholesale	O
and	O
retail	O
sales	O
bakery	O
.	O

Rolf	O
's	O
Patisserie	O
is	O
working	O
closely	O
with	O
IDPH	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
bakery	O
is	O
temporarily	O
closed	O
while	O
these	O
outbreaks	O
are	O
investigated	O
.	O

Rolf	O
's	O
is	O
voluntarily	O
recalling	O
all	O
products	O
made	O
after	O
1	O
Nov	O
2010	O
.	O

The	O
bakery	O
is	O
contacting	O
retailers	O
and	O
restaurants	O
to	O
remove	O
and	O
discard	O
these	O
products	O
from	O
their	O
shelves	O
.	O

Both	O
Rolf	O
's	O
and	O
public	O
health	O
officials	O
are	O
advising	O
people	O
not	O
to	O
eat	O
these	O
food	O
items	O
and	O
throw	O
them	O
out	O
.	O

IDPH	O
is	O
working	O
to	O
obtain	O
a	O
distribution	O
list	O
,	O
but	O
individuals	O
or	O
businesses	O
may	O
have	O
already	O
purchased	O
goods	O
for	O
the	O
holidays	O
,	O
so	O
it	O
is	O
important	O
to	O
ask	O
where	O
the	O
dessert	O
is	O
from	O
and	O
avoid	O
consuming	O
desserts	O
from	O
Rolf	O
's	O
made	O
after	O
1	O
Nov	O
2010	O
.	O

Initial	O
laboratory	O
testing	O
shows	O
one	O
food	O
item	O
to	O
be	O
contaminated	O
with	O
high	O
levels	O
of	O
_Staphylococcus	O
aureus_	O
.	O

Food	O
can	O
become	O
contaminated	O
if	O
a	O
person	O
with	O
a	O
staph	O
infection	O
has	O
an	O
uncovered	O
lesion	O
or	O
sore	O
that	O
comes	O
in	O
contact	O
with	O
food	O
or	O
food	O
processing	O
equipment	O
.	O

_Staphylococcus	O
aureus_	O
bacteria	O
and	O
toxin	O
can	O
contaminate	O
foods	O
or	O
equipment	O
.	O

Staphylococcal	O
enterotoxins	O
are	O
fast	O
acting	O
,	O
sometimes	O
causing	O
illness	O
in	O
as	O
little	O
as	O
30	O
minutes	O
but	O
usually	O
in	O
4-6	O
hours	O
,	O
with	O
nausea	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
stomach	O
cramps	O
,	O
and	O
little	O
if	O
any	O
fever	O
.	O

The	O
patients	O
usually	O
recover	O
within	O
a	O
day	O
.	O

Guernsey	B-Country
horse	O
owners	O
have	O
been	O
told	O
to	O
take	O
necessary	O
precautions	O
after	O
suspected	O
cases	O

The	O
Andalusia	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
confirmed	O
an	O

of	O
Q	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
in	O
Villaverde	B-City
del	I-City
Rio	I-City
that	O
affected	O
17	O
people	O
.	O

Q	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
is	O
a	O
[	O
zoonosis	O
]	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
the	O
air	O
,	O
never	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
,	O
by	O
inhalation	O
of	O
these	O
organisms	O
from	O
air	O
contaminated	O
mostly	O
by	O
excreta	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
,	O
with	O
an	O
incubation	O
period	O
of	O
10	O
to	O
40	O
days	O
,	O
produces	O
high	O
fevers	O
and	O
headaches	O
,	O
can	O
affect	O
organs	O
such	O
as	O
the	O
liver	O
and	O
,	O
in	O
severe	O
cases	O
,	O
lead	O
to	O
pneumonia	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
has	O
a	O
low	O
mortality	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
treated	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
.	O

In	O
Villaverde	O
,	O
the	O
rumors	O
that	O
resulted	O
from	O
lack	O
of	O
information	O
have	O
it	O
that	O
more	O
than	O
100	O
people	O
are	O
affected	O
;	O
however	O
,	O
the	O
health	O
department	O
gives	O

that	O
only	O
17	O
have	O
been	O
affected	O
by	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
clinical	O
evolution	O
of	O
all	O
of	O
them	O
has	O
been	O
favorable	O
.	O

Moreover	O
,	O

Junta	O
[	O
government	O
]	O
says	O
that	O

incubation	O
phase	O
has	O

and	O

there	O

no	O

cases	O
.	O

was	O

of	O

,	O

.	O

Q	B-Disease

.	O

.	O

The	O
last	O
plague	B-Disease
epidemic	O
in	O
Europe	O
was	O
in	O
1910	O
.	O

Corps	O
officials	O
have	O
closed	O
off	O
a	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
jungle	O
warfare	O
training	O
center	O
in	O
Okinawa	B-City
,	O
Japan	B-Country
,	O
thought	O
to	O
be	O
contaminated	O
with	O
a	O
bacterium	O
that	O
has	O
left	O
dozens	O
of	O
marines	O
sick	O
.	O

Over	O
the	O
past	O
2	O
months	O
,	O
about	O
90	O
marines	O
are	O
suspected	O
to	O
have	O
contracted	O
a	O
rare	O
illness	O
called	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
,	O
which	O
can	O
turn	O
serious	O
if	O
left	O
untreated	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
,	O
more	O
than	O
half	O
of	O
those	O
cases	O
were	O
confirmed	O
to	O
be	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
bacterial	O
infection	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
cause	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

Normally	O
,	O

on	O
Okinawa	B-City
see	O
a	O

cases	O
of	O

disease	O
each	O
year	O
,	O

,	O
the	O

and	O

for	O

.	O

when	O
a	O
slew	O
[	O
a	O
large	O
number	O
.	O

-	O
Mod.SH	O
]	O
of	O

were	O

all	O

to	O
have	O

the	O

at	O

.	O

[	O

In	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

[	O
11	O

2017	O

.	O

As	O

,	O

.	O

More	O
young	O

are	O
ending	O
up	O

on	O

,	O

sometimes	O

from	O

during	O

in	O
cases	O
.	O

Doctors	O

are	O

this	O

,	O
not	O
seen	O
in	O

in	O

.	O

14	O
Aug	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
,	O
76.2	O
%	O
of	O

were	O

.	O

Pregnant	O
women	O
with	O
COVID-19	B-Disease
are	O
15	O
times	O
more	O
likely	O
to	O
die	O
,	O

times	O
more	O
likely	O
to	O
need	O
to	O

,	O

than	O

who	O

,	O

in	O
JAMA	O
Network	O
Open	O
[	O

citation	O

]	O
.	O

``	O
I	O
have	O
not	O
seen	O
risks	O
like	O
this	O
,	O
''	O

Linda	O

,	O

at	O

.	O

to	O
get	O
the	O
shots	O
has	O

among	O
the	O
pregnant	O
population	O

from	O

for	O

Inc.-BioNTech	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

on	O

began	O
in	O

[	O

]	O
,	O
and	O
evidence	O
has	O

no	O

.	O

[	O

]	O

to	O

.	O

``	O

about	O
the	O

of	O

in	O

and	O
we	O
have	O

is	O
to	O
get	O
COVID	O
when	O

're	O

,	O
''	O

said	O
.	O

of	O

people	O
who	O
are	O
vaccinated	O
and	O
the	O
delta	O
variant	O
have	O
``	O

,	O

Alison	O
Cahill	O

An	O

[	O

at	O

ward	O
,	O

this	O

in	O
the	O

.	O

A	O

14	O

were	O
unwell	O
with	O

.	O

The	O
ward	O
stopped	O

on	O
Tuesday	O
[	O
13	O
Jul	O
2021	O
]	O
.	O

Only	O
patients	O
who	O
could	O
go	O
to	O
their	O

were	O

.	O

not	O

to	O

.	O

had	O
to	O
use	O

on	O
the	O
way	O
in	O
and	O
out	O
of	O
the	O
ward	O

patient	O
contact	O
.	O

Staff	O
were	O

and	O

when	O

patients	O
.	O

The	O

not	O

,	O
while	O
the	O

to	O

.	O

Billinghurst	O
said	O
norovirus	B-Virus
was	O
highly	O
infectious	O
and	O
could	O
spread	O
in	O
many	O
ways	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
consuming	O
contaminated	O
food	O
or	O

,	O
or	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O

person	O
.	O

It	O
could	O
survive	O
on	O
contaminated	O
surfaces	O
even	O
after	O
cleaning	O
with	O
some	O

.	O

included	O

,	O

,	O
and	O

.	O

Most	O

,	O

could	O

for	O

.	O

were	O
more	O

to	O
be	O
seriously	O
ill	O
.	O

of	O

at	O

On	O

Jun	O
2016	O
,	O

Hong	B-Country
Kong	I-Country
Centre	O
for	O
Health	O
Proyection	O
(	O

)	O
recorded	O

suis_	O

He	O
presented	O
with	O
headache	O
,	O
cough	O
with	O
sputum	O
,	O
vertigo	O
,	O
tinnitus	O
and	O
hearing	O
loss	O
on	O
22	O
Jun	O
[	O
2016	O
]	O
and	O
was	O
admitted	O
to	O
a	O
public	O
hospital	O
on	O
24	O
Jun	O
[	O
2016	O
]	O
.	O

His	O
blood	O
and	O
cerebrospinal	O
fluid	O
sample	O
collected	O
grew	O
_Streptococcus	O
suis_	O
.	O

He	O
was	O
treated	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
and	O
his	O
condition	O
was	O
stable	O
.	O

He	O
worked	O
as	O
a	O
butcher	O
in	O
a	O
wet	O
market	O
who	O
had	O
handled	O
raw	O
pork	O
during	O
the	O
incubation	O
period	O
.	O

He	O
recalled	O
an	O
abrasion	O
injury	O
over	O
his	O
right	O
middle	O
finger	O
a	O
few	O
days	O
before	O
illness	O
onset	O
.	O

His	O
home	O
contacts	O
and	O
colleagues	O
were	O
asymptomatic	O
.	O

Human	O
_Streptococcus	O
suis_	O
infection	O
is	O
a	O
zoonotic	O
infection	O
associated	O
with	O
pigs	O
.	O

The	O
infection	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
,	O
particularly	O
if	O
the	O
specific	O
strain	O
produces	O
certain	O
toxins	O
.	O

_S	O
.	O

suis_	O
infection	O
can	O
manifest	O
itself	O
in	O
meningitis	O
,	O
toxic	O
shock	O
,	O
septicemia	O
and	O
endocarditis	O
.	O

Eating	O
undercooked	O
infected	O
pork	O
and	O
blood	O
paste	O
are	O
common	O
ways	O
people	O
contract	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Proper	O
cooking	O
of	O
pork	O
meat	O
or	O
porcine	O
organs	O
eliminates	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
infection	O
with	O
_Streptococcus	O
suis_	O
.	O

The	O
infection	O
in	O
humans	O
is	O
not	O
only	O
seen	O
in	O
those	O
who	O
consume	O
raw	O
pork	O
,	O
but	O
also	O
in	O
those	O
who	O
slaughter	O
and	O
prepare	O
the	O
meals	O
.	O

_Streptococcus	O
suis_	O
infection	O
can	O
be	O
treated	O
with	O
appropriate	O
antibiotics	O
.	O

To	O
prevent	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
members	O
of	O
the	O
public	O
are	O
advised	O
to	O
always	O
practice	O
personal	O
and	O
environmental	O
hygiene	O
.	O

They	O
should	O
avoid	O
contact	O
with	O
pigs	O
that	O
are	O
sick	O
or	O
dead	O
from	O
diseases	O
and	O
their	O
excreta	O
or	O
body	O
fluid	O
.	O

If	O
contact	O
with	O
pigs	O
or	O
raw	O
pork	O
is	O
necessary	O
,	O
one	O
should	O
:	O
use	O
protective	O
gloves	O
;	O
wash	O
hands	O
after	O
handling	O
pigs	O
or	O
raw	O
pork	O
;	O
and	O
clean	O
and	O
cover	O
all	O
wounds	O
properly	O
.	O

London	B-City
,	O
UK	O
--	O
November	O
1	O
,	O
2007	O
--	O
A	O
mysterious	O
skin	B-Disease
disorder	I-Disease
affecting	O
farmers	O
at	O
lambing	O
time	O
has	O
been	O
discovered	O
by	O
a	O
Hampshire	O
farmer	O
and	O
a	O
team	O
of	O
doctors	O
from	O
Southampton	O
,	O
the	O
British	O
Journal	O
of	O
Dermatology	O
will	O
reveal	O
.	O

Following	O
several	O
turbulent	O
months	O
for	O
UK	O
farmers	O
,	O
with	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
foot	O
and	O
mouth	O
and	O
blue	O
tongue	O
,	O
dermatologists	O
have	O
now	O
discovered	O
a	O
disorder	O
which	O
affects	O
the	O
farmers	O
themselves	O
.	O

The	O
strange	O
disorder	O
specifically	O
targets	O
the	O
ears	O
,	O
which	O
initially	O
become	O
hot	O
,	O
itchy	O
and	O
sore	O
and	O
soon	O
suffer	O
blistering	O
and	O
crusting	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
painful	O
and	O
unsightly	O
.	O

No	O
other	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
are	O
affected	O
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
are	O
also	O
confined	O
to	O
lambing	O
season	O
(	O
which	O
usually	O
lasts	O
from	O
one	O
to	O
3	O
months	O
)	O
and	O
disappear	O
promptly	O
when	O
lambing	O
is	O
over	O
.	O

In	O
some	O
farmers	O
,	O
the	O
blistering	O
appears	O
every	O
year	O
during	O
lambing	O
,	O
in	O
one	O
case	O
for	O
the	O
previous	O
30	O
years	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
all	O
patients	O
both	O
ears	O
are	O
affected	O
.	O

It	O
also	O
occurs	O
in	O
farmers	O
who	O
are	O
calving	O
,	O
but	O
less	O
frequently	O
.	O

The	O
condition	O
was	O
discovered	O
by	O
George	O
Heathcote	O
,	O
a	O
farmer	O
from	O
Hampshire	O
and	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
study	O

authors	O
,	O
who	O
experienced	O
blistering	O
on	O
his	O

and	O

in	O
Southampton	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
:	O
``	O

was	O

that	O

,	O

.	O

symptoms	O
improve	O
or	O
even	O
disappear	O
.	O

Scabies	B-Disease
is	O
spread	O
by	O
indirect	O
contact	O
through	O
sheets	O
or	O
clothing	O
,	O
or	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
,	O
although	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
health	O
professionals	O
the	O
latter	O
possibility	O
is	O
less	O
likely	O
because	O
they	O
work	O
with	O
gloves	O
.	O

The	O
same	O
sources	O
have	O
indicated	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
sometimes	O
difficult	O
to	O
detect	O
because	O
this	O
skin	O
condition	O
is	O
often	O
misdiagnosed	O
as	O
eczema	O
or	O
dermatitis	O
,	O
hence	O
there	O
may	O
be	O
more	O
cases	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
the	O
coming	O
days	O
.	O

SATSE	O
considers	O
it	O
should	O
be	O
investigated	O
whether	O
the	O
hospital	O
``	O
has	O
acted	O
right	O
or	O
wrong	O
''	O
,	O

which	O

should	O
determine	O
the	O

that	O
has	O
passed	O
since	O
the	O
first	O

to	O
the	O
time	O

and	O
treatment	O
were	O

.	O

Legionnaires	B-Disease
'	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
is	O
a	O
respiratory	O
infection	O
caused	O
by	O
_Legionella_	O
bacteria	O
.	O

These	O
bacteria	O
can	O
also	O
cause	O
a	O
milder	O
illness	O
called	O
Pontiac	O
fever	O
.	O

The	O
signs	O
and	O
symptoms	O
of	O
Legionnaires	B-Disease
'	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
include	O
fever	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O
shortness	O
of	O
breath	O
,	O
muscle	O
aches	O
,	O
pneumonia	O
,	O
and	O
sometimes	O
diarrhea	O
and	O
abdominal	O
pain	O
.	O

Pontiac	O
fever	O
has	O
similar	O
symptoms	O
but	O
does	O
not	O
progress	O
to	O
pneumonia	O
.	O

Antibiotics	O
are	O
highly	O
effective	O
against	O
_Legionella_	O
bacteria	O
.	O

_Salmonella_	O
in	O
chicken	O
has	O
been	O
linked	O
to	O
over	O
70	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
Czech	B-Country
Republic	I-Country
.	O

authorities	O
in	O
the	O
city	O
of	O
Zlin	B-City
reported	O
the	O
outbreak	O
in	O

at	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

_Salmonella_	O
infection	O

*	O
*	O
Anthrax	B-Disease
happens	O
to	O
be	O
the	O

.	O

.	O

for	O

and	O
Prevention	O
(	O

)	O

in	O
Pakistan	B-Country
of	O

(	I-Disease

)	I-Disease
typhoid	I-Disease
fever	I-Disease
.	O

This	O
``	O
practice	O
usual	O
precautions	O
''	O
travel	O
alert	O
published	O
on	O
[	O
30	O
Sep	O
2019	O
]	O
is	O
very	O
important	O
since	O
XDR	O
infections	O
do	O
not	O
respond	O
to	O
most	O
antibiotics	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
ampicillin	O
,	O
chloramphenicol	O
,	O
trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole	O
,	O
ciprofloxacin	O
,	O
and	O
ceftriaxone	O
.	O

And	O
in	O
rare	O
cases	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
.	O

The	O
CDC	O
says	O
people	O
from	O
the	O
USA	O
,	O
Canada	O
,	O
United	O
Kingdom	O
,	O
Denmark	O
,	O
and	O
Australia	O
with	O
a	O
travel	O
history	O
to	O
Pakistan	B-Country
have	O
reported	O
XDR	O
typhoid	O
infections	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Pakistan	B-Country
Tourism	O
Development	O
Corporation	O
,	O
about	O
1.75	O
million	O
tourists	O
visited	O
Pakistan	O
in	O
2017	O
alone	O
.	O

Pakistan	B-Country
is	O
the	O
world	O
's	O
6th-most	O
populous	O
country	O
with	O
a	O
population	O
exceeding	O
210	O
million	O
people	O
,	O
located	O
in	O
South	O
Asia	O
.	O

Pakistan	B-Country
's	O
current	O
XDR	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
outbreak	O
began	O
in	O
Hyderabad	B-City
,	O
which	O
is	O
a	O
city	O
of	O
Sindh	B-Province
province	I-Province
,	O
during	O
November	O
2016	O
.	O

The	O
CDC	O
says	O
,	O
``	O
If	O
you	O
are	O
going	O
to	O
South	O
Asia	O
,	O
including	O
Pakistan	B-Country
,	O
protect	O
yourself	O
against	O
typhoid	O
infection	O
by	O
getting	O
a	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
vaccination	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
CDC	O
's	O
Advisory	O
Committee	O
on	O
Immunization	O
Practices	O
(	O
ACIP	O
)	O
recommends	O
2	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
vaccines	O
:	O
an	O
oral	O
vaccine	O
,	O
Typhim	O
,	O
and	O
an	O
injectable	O
vaccine	O
,	O
Typbar	O
.	O

The	O
oral	O
vaccine	O
Typhim	O
is	O
approved	O
for	O
people	O
6	O
years	O
old	O
or	O
older	O
,	O
should	O
be	O
taken	O
as	O
directed	O
,	O
at	O
least	O
1	O
week	O
before	O
departure	O
.	O

The	O
injectable	O
vaccine	O
is	O
approved	O
for	O
people	O
2	O
years	O
old	O
or	O
older	O
.	O

Travelers	O
should	O
receive	O
the	O
injectable	O
vaccine	O
Typbar	O
at	O
least	O
2	O
weeks	O
before	O
departure	O
.	O

Neither	O
vaccine	O
is	O
100	O
%	O
effective	O
,	O
so	O
travelers	O
should	O
also	O
practice	O
safe	O
eating	O
and	O
drinking	O
while	O
traveling	O
abroad	O
,	O
says	O
the	O
ACIP	O
.	O

Typhoid	O
fever	O
is	O
a	O
serious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
bacterium	O
_Salmonella	O
Typhi_	O
and	O
spread	O
by	O
contaminated	O
food	O
and	O
water	O
.	O

Humans	O
are	O
the	O
only	O
source	O
of	O
these	O
bacteria	O
.	O

The	O
incubation	O
period	O
of	O
typhoid	O
and	O
paratyphoid	O
infections	O
is	O
6	O
to	O
30	O
days	O
,	O
says	O
the	O
CDC	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
often	O
include	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
weakness	O
,	O
stomach	O
pain	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O
and	O
loss	O
of	O
appetite	O
.	O

People	O
may	O
have	O
diarrhea	O
or	O
constipation	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
a	O
Deseret	O
News	O
report	O
yesterday	O
[	O
25	O
Jun	O
2019	O
]	O
,	O
a	O
migrant	O
boy	O
who	O
had	O
been	O
detained	O
at	O
a	O
U.S.	O
Customs	O
and	O
Border	O
Protection	O
camp	O
came	O
to	O
Utah	B-Province
with	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
last	O
month	O
[	O
May	O
2019	O
]	O
.	O

The	O
child	O
was	O
hospitalized	O
with	O
a	O
severe	O
case	O
in	O
Salt	B-City
Lake	I-City
County	O
soon	O
after	O
arriving	O
in	O
Utah	B-Province
.	O

He	O
was	O
treated	O
and	O
fully	O
recovered	O
and	O
released	O
after	O
a	O
week	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
say	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
additional	O
threat	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
Utah	B-Province
from	O
this	O
case	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
life-threatening	O
illness	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
bacterium	O
_Salmonella_	O
Typhi	O
.	O

_Salmonella_	O
Typhi	O
lives	O
only	O
in	O
humans	O
.	O

Persons	O
with	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
carry	O
the	O
bacteria	O
in	O
their	O
bloodstream	O
and	O
intestinal	O
tract	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
a	O
small	O
number	O
of	O
persons	O
,	O
called	O
carriers	O
,	O
recover	O
from	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
but	O
continue	O
to	O
carry	O
the	O
bacteria	O
.	O

Both	O
ill	O
persons	O
and	O
carriers	O
shed	O
_S._	O
Typhi	O
in	O
their	O
feces	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
get	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
if	O
you	O
eat	O
food	O
or	O
drink	O
beverages	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
handled	O
by	O
a	O
person	O
who	O
is	O
shedding	O
_S._	O
Typhi	O
or	O
if	O
sewage	O
contaminated	O
with	O
_S._	O
Typhi	O
bacteria	O
gets	O
into	O
the	O
water	O
you	O
use	O
for	O
drinking	O
or	O
washing	O
food	O
.	O

Therefore	O
,	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
is	O
more	O
common	O
in	O
areas	O
of	O
the	O
world	O
where	O
handwashing	O
is	O
less	O
frequent	O
and	O
water	O
is	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
contaminated	O
with	O
sewage	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
can	O
be	O
successfully	O
treated	O
with	O
appropriate	O
antimicrobials	O
,	O
and	O
persons	O
given	O
antimicrobials	O
usually	O
begin	O
to	O
feel	O
better	O
within	O
2	O
to	O
3	O
days	O
.	O

After	O
8	O
days	O
fighting	O
for	O
his	O
life	O
,	O
a	O
Venezuelan	O
who	O
entered	O
the	O
country	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
a	O
migrant	O
caravan	O
died	O
of	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
and	O
cardiorespiratory	O
complications	O
in	O
the	O
internal	O
medicine	O
ward	O
of	O
the	O
Gabriela	O
Alvarado	O
Hospital	O
.	O

On	O
Wednesday	O
afternoon	O
[	O
27	O
Jul	O
2022	O
]	O
,	O
[	O
a	O
]	O
citizen	O
(	O
43	O
)	O
[	O
years	O
old	O
]	O
,	O
originally	O
from	O
[	O
Caracas	O
]	O
Venezuela	O
,	O
died	O
.	O

He	O
had	O
arrived	O
on	O
Honduran	O
soil	O
in	O
the	O
Trojes	B-Province
area	O
,	O
immediately	O
asking	O
for	O
medical	O
assistance	O
.	O

He	O
was	O
admitted	O
to	O
the	O
hospital	O
on	O
21	O
Jul	O
2022	O
,	O
presenting	O
multiple	O
complications	O
.	O

The	O
deputy	O
director	O
of	O
the	O
care	O
center	O
,	O
Marlon	O
Estrada	O
,	O
reported	O
that	O
``	O
this	O
patient	O
was	O
already	O
admitted	O
with	O
liver	O
and	O
kidney	O
failure	O
,	O
until	O
yesterday	O
[	O
27	O
Jul	O
2022	O
]	O
he	O
presented	O
cardiorespiratory	O
complications	O
and	O
died	O
.	O
''	O

``	O
The	O
steps	O
are	O
being	O
taken	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
repatriate	O
this	O
body	O
or	O
if	O
the	O
Venezuelan	O
embassy	O
does	O
the	O
paperwork	O
with	O
the	O
Honduran	O
government	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
buried	O
here	O
,	O
''	O
explained	O
the	O
doctor	O
.	O

Estrada	O
pointed	O
out	O
that	O
``	O
we	O
think	O
that	O
the	O
body	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
more	O
than	O
24	O
hours	O
because	O
the	O
maintainers	O
are	O
not	O
of	O
the	O
best	O
quality	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
Public	O
Ministry	O
(	O
MP	O
)	O
provided	O
a	O
space	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
have	O
the	O
body	O
in	O
better	O
conditions	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
does	O
not	O
...	O
break	O
down	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
current	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
outbreak	O
in	O
Northern	B-Province
Israel	I-Province
with	O
36	O
confirmed/probably	O
and	O
583	O
suspected	O
cases	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
a	O
concerning	O
health	O
risk	O
among	O
all	O
travelers	O
visiting	O
this	O
region	O
,	O
but	O
special	O
surveillance	O
seemed	O
warranted	O
for	O
adolescents	O
.	O

(	O
1	O
)	O
Israel	B-Country
is	O
a	O
popular	O
summer	O
destination	O
among	O
youths	O
for	O
camps	O
,	O
tours	O
,	O
and	O
fresh-water	O
recreational	O
activities	O
;	O
making	O
up	O
to	O
40	O
%	O
of	O
all	O
visitors	O
.	O

(	O
2	O
)	O
Therefore	O
,	O
physicians	O
should	O
have	O
raised	O
clinical	O
awareness	O
for	O
young	O
travelers	O
returning	O
from	O
Israel	B-Country
with	O
an	O
acute	O
febrile	O
illness	O
.	O

We	O
report	O
three	O
cases	O
of	O
suspected	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
,	O
one	O
confirmed	O
,	O
of	O
teenaged	O
travelers	O
to	O
Israel	B-Country
.	O

All	O
3	O
patients	O
had	O
spent	O
about	O
4	O
weeks	O
in	O
Israel	B-Country
in	O
July/August	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
and	O
had	O
visited	O
affected	O
bodies	O
of	O
water	O
in	O
the	O
Golan	O
Heights	O
with	O
various	O
fresh	O
water	O
exposure	O
(	O
kayaking	O
,	O
swimming	O
,	O
or	O
white-water-rafting	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
patient	O
was	O
a	O
16-year-old	O
male	O
who	O
returned	O
to	O
the	O
US	O
in	O
the	O
1st	O
week	O
of	O
August	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
and	O
one	O
week	O
later	O
developed	O
general	O
lethargy	O
,	O
fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
and	O
myalgia	O
.	O

He	O
subsequently	O
presented	O
with	O
signs	O
of	O
meningitis	O
.	O

The	O
diagnosis	O
of	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
was	O
made	O
with	O
a	O
commercially	O
available	O
IgM	O
ELISA-assay	O
with	O
a	O
positive	O
convalescent	O
sample	O
one	O
month	O
later	O
.	O

The	O
2nd	O
patient	O
was	O
a	O
16	O
year-old	O
female	O
who	O
had	O
started	O
to	O
experience	O
intermittent	O
fevers	O
,	O
headaches	O
,	O
neck	O
pain	O
and	O
myalgia	O
while	O
still	O
in	O
Israel	B-Country
.	O

Upon	O
her	O
return	O
her	O
headaches	O
worsened	O
and	O
were	O
associated	O
with	O
blurry	O
vision	O
.	O

A	O
diagnosis	O
of	O
aseptic	O
meningitis	O
secondary	O
due	O
to	O
probable	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
was	O
made	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
diagnostic	O
screening	O
tests	O
with	O
the	O
IgM	O
ELISA-assay	O
during	O
the	O
acute	O
illness	O
,	O
and	O
at	O
subsequent	O
follow-up	O
one	O
week	O
later	O
were	O
negative	O
.	O

Lastly	O
,	O
a	O
16-year-old	O
male	O
presented	O
with	O
fever	O
and	O
headache	O
10	O
days	O
after	O
return	O
.	O

A	O
teen	O
co-traveler	O
had	O
been	O
diagnosed	O
and	O
treated	O
for	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
.	O

His	O
diagnostic	O
screening	O
test	O
(	O
IgM	O
ELISA-assay	O
)	O
for	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
obtained	O
during	O
the	O
acute	O
presentation	O
was	O
negative	O
.	O

Leptospirosis-specific	O
PCR	O
from	O
blood	O
had	O
been	O
sent	O
only	O
for	O
the	O
first	O
patient	O
and	O
was	O
negative	O
,	O
and	O
none	O

three	O

were	O

for	O
additional	O

with	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

received	O

with	O

,	O

or	O
azithromycin	O
for	O
5-7	O
days	O
and	O
had	O
made	O
full	O
recovery	O
.	O

South	O
Korea	O
said	O
on	O
Wed	O
[	O
26	O
Nov	O
2014	O
]	O
that	O
Britain	O
had	O

South	O

Ebola	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease

a	O

in	O
Sierra	B-Country

.	O

,	O
Freetown	O

.	O

an	O

will	O

to	O

of	O

for	O

EU	O

,	O

said	O
.	O

Four	O
members	O
of	O
a	O

for	O

after	O

States	O
,	O

the	O
first	O

,	O
Kenya	B-Country
's	O

Minister	O
Sam	O
Ongeri	O
said	O
Thursday	O
.	O

The	O
family	O
received	O
a	O

in	O
the	O

a	O

.	O

Two	O

United	O
Nations	O

.	O

The	O

was	O

the	O

30	O
African	O
countries	O
met	O
in	O
Dakar	O
,	O
Senegal	O
,	O
and	O
failed	O
to	O
