but	O
carried	O
on	O
evacuating	O
people	O
and	O
wading	O
in	O
floodwaters	O
to	O
distribute	O
essential	O
items	O
to	O
people	O
in	O
inundated	O
areas	O
.	O

He	O
was	O
first	O
taken	O
to	O
a	O
local	O
medical	O
center	O
for	O
treatment	O
,	O
but	O
his	O
condition	O
did	O
not	O
improve	O
and	O
was	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
Viet	O
am-Cuba	O
Dong	O
Hoi	O
Friendship	O
Hospital	O
with	O
a	O
high	O
fever	O
and	O
a	O
swollen	O
knee	O
.	O

He	O
was	O
then	O
taken	O
to	O
the	O
Hue	O
Central	O
Hospital	O
,	O
where	O
he	O
was	O
put	O
on	O
a	O
ventilator	O
and	O
underwent	O
artificial	O
blood	O
filtration	O
.	O

But	O
doctor	O
's	O
efforts	O
proved	O
in	O
vain	O
and	O
he	O
succumbed	O
to	O
the	O
infection	O
.	O

Doctors	O
said	O
he	O
died	O
on	O
Wednesday	O
[	O
11	O
Nov	O
2020	O
]	O
,	O
of	O
melioidosis	B-Disease
,	O
a	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
Gram	O
negative	O
bacterium	O
_Burkholderia	O
pseudomallei_	O
.	O

They	O
suspected	O
he	O
might	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
after	O
being	O
in	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
contaminated	O
soil	O
and	O
water	O
.	O

Melioidosis	B-Disease
,	O
also	O
called	O
Whitmore	O
's	O
disease	O
,	O
has	O
symptoms	O
like	O
fever	O
,	O
pneumonia	O
,	O
and	O
abscesses	O
,	O
and	O
inflammation	O
of	O
the	O
brain	O
and	O
joints	O
.	O

Its	O
mortality	O
rate	O
can	O
be	O
as	O
high	O
as	O
40	O
per	O
cent	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
was	O
first	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
Viet	O
Nam	O
in	O
1925	O
,	O
but	O
there	O
is	O
not	O
sufficient	O
knowledge	O
about	O
it	O
yet	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
around	O
10	O
000	O
cases	O
worldwide	O
every	O
year	O
,	O
mostly	O
during	O
the	O
rainy	O
season	O
,	O
many	O
being	O
fatal	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
vaccine	O
.	O

Quang	O
Binh	O
and	O
other	O
central	O
provinces	O
were	O
hit	O
by	O
a	O
series	O
of	O
storms	O
and	O
tropical	O
depressions	O
in	O
October	O
2020	O
,	O
which	O
caused	O
heavy	O
rains	O
,	O
floods	O
,	O
and	O
landslides	O
.	O

The	O
Greene	B-City
County	O
(	O
Missouri	B-Province
)	O
Health	O
Department	O
has	O
issued	O
a	O
memo	O
to	O
health	O
care	O
workers	O
who	O
are	O
treating	O
injured	O
victims	O
of	O
May	O
's	O
[	O
22	O

2011	O
]	O
deadly	O
Joplin	O
[	O
Missouri	O
]	O
tornado	O
,	O
warning	O
them	O
that	O
a	O
powerful	O
fungus	O
has	O
infected	O
patients	O
'	O
wounds	O
.	O

The	O
Springfield	O

reports	O
as	O
many	O
as	O
9	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
in	O
tornado	O
victims	O
across	O
the	O
area	O
in	O
various	O

.	O

Once	O
the	O
aggressive	O
fungus	O
--	O
[	O
of	O
the	O
class	O
]	O
_Zygomycetes_	O
--	O
enter	O
the	O
body	O
,	O
they	O
cause	O
the	O
death	O
of	O
infected	O
cells	O
.	O

3	O
or	O
4	O
patients	O
,	O
who	O
otherwise	O
would	O
have	O
survived	O
their	O
wounds	O
,	O
have	O
died	O
from	O
[	O
the	O
fungal	O
infection	O
]	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
fungus	O
stays	O
in	O

,	O
like	O

or	O

.	O

Others	O

the	O
head	O
were	O

so	O

--	O
as	O
soon	O

brain	O

started	O
dying	O
,	O
it	O
was	O
too	O
late	O
to	O
save	O
the	O
patient	O
.	O

The	O
National	O
Institutes	O
of	O
Health	O
says	O

form	O
of	O
infection	O
most	O
often	O

in	O
patients	O
with	O
suppressed	O
immune	O
systems	O
.	O

One	O
study	O
in	O
2009	O
noted	O
a	O
diabetes	O
patient	O
who	O
died	O
of	O
the	O
fungal	O

at	O

.	O

.	O

Infections	O
spread	O
through	O
the	O
blood	O
and	O
affects	O

circulation	O
.	O

It	O
is	O

.	O

)	O

The	O

_Leptospira_	O
[	O
bacteria	O
]	O
enter	O
the	O
human	O
body	O
through	O
cuts	O
in	O
the	O

or	O

of	O

,	O

,	O
and	O
mouth	O
.	O

this	O

[	O

]	O

far	O

of	O
Health	O
(	O

)	O

]	O
.	O

[	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

The	O
DOH	O
OIC	O
said	O
that	O
the	O
regions	O
that	O
have	O
recorded	O
the	O
most	O

cases	O
in	O
this	O
most	O
recent	O
period	O
were	O
the	O
National	B-Province
Capital	I-Province
Region	I-Province
(	O
NCR	O
)	O
,	O
Cagayan	B-Province
Valley	I-Province
,	O
and	O
Central	B-Province
Luzon	I-Province
.	O

Leptospirosis	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
fatal	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
that	O
affects	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
alike	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
spiral-shaped	O
_Leptospira_	O
bacteria	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
exposure	O
to	O
the	O
urine	O
of	O
infected	O
animals	O
or	O
water	O
or	O
soil	O
that	O
has	O
been	O
contaminated	O
by	O
infected	O
animal	O
urine	O
.	O

Floods	O
can	O
potentially	O
increase	O
the	O
transmission	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
know	O
that	O
every	O
time	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
rainy	O
season	O
,	O
it	O
floods	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
public	O
becomes	O
more	O
vulnerable	O
to	O
the	O
illness	O
,	O
''	O
Vergeire	O
said	O
.	O

Vergeire	O
earlier	O
urged	O
the	O
public	O
to	O
take	O
precautions	O
when	O
wading	O
through	O
floodwaters	O
:	O
to	O
wear	O
boots	O
,	O
wash	O
their	O
feet	O
after	O
contact	O
with	O
floodwater	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
get	O
checked	O
by	O
a	O
healthcare	O
professional	O
in	O
case	O
of	O
symptoms	O
.	O

Cholera	B-Disease
is	O

in	O

after	O

[	O

.	O

``	O

''	O

.	O

``	O

just	O
seems	O
like	O

to	O
water	O
is	O
already	O
so	O
,	O
so	O
limited	O
.	O
''	O

Those	O
seeking	O

for	O

a	O
depleted	O
healthcare	O
system	O
--	O

Haiti	B-Country
's	O

treatment	O

,	O
have	O
been	O
destroyed	O
.	O

A	O
man	O

[	O

-	O

.	O

A	O

in	O

,	O

are	O

.	O

.	O

An	O

leaf	B-Disease

and	O

of	O

is	O

.	O

To	O

carried	O
out	O
.	O

(	O

of	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

to	O
almond	O
(	O

.	O

.	O

_X	O
.	O

fastidiosa_	O
.	O

of	O
the	O

.	O

South	B-Country

A	O

has	O

outbreak	O

.	O

FMD	O
is	O
often	O
fatal	O
[	O
see	O
comment	O
]	O
for	O
cloven-hoofed	O
animals	O
including	O

and	O
goats	O
,	O

on	O
the	O
mouth	O
and	O
feet	O
.	O

It	O
does	O
not	O
affect	O
humans	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
last	O
hit	O
South	B-Country

in	O
2002	O
when	O
some	O

either	O

the	O

were	O

its	O

.	O

A	O

.	O

Yemen	B-Country
has	O
been	O
racked	O
by	O
violence	O
since	O
2014	O

when	O

.	O

)	O

``	O

is	O
a	O

(	O
_Cyprinus	O
carpio_	O
)	O
and	O

as	O

,	O

.	O

``	O

disease	O
occurs	O
at	O
higher	O

temperatures	O
(	O
over	O
16	O
C	O
[	O
60	O
F	O
]	O
)	O

is	O
highly	O
contagious	O
,	O
and	O
may	O
cause	O
up	O
to	O
100	O
%	O
mortality	O
.	O

Infected	O
fish	O
shed	O

in	O

.	O

in	O

.	O

.	O

virus	O
for	O

Senecavirus	B-Virus

(	O

''	O

The	O
1st	O
ASF	O
outbreak	O
in	O
wild	O
boar	O
was	O

recorded	O
in	O
the	O
Free	O
State	O
of	O
Saxony	B-Province
on	O
31	O
Oct	O
2020	O
.	O

With	O
the	O
new	O
cases	O
,	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
19	O
wild	O
boars	O
were	O
found	O
positive	O
for	O
ASF	O
.	O

African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
general	O
contagious	O
disease	O
affecting	O
pigs	O
(	O
domestic	O
and	O
wild	O
boars	O
)	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
almost	O
always	O
fatal	O
and	O
incurable	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
way	O
to	O
protect	O
the	O
pigs	O
with	O
preventive	O
vaccination	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
directly	O
from	O
animal	O
to	O
animal	O
or	O
indirectly	O
via	O
contaminated	O
objects	O
(	O
clothing	O
,	O
shoes	O
,	O
vehicles	O
)	O
and	O
food	O
moved	O
to	O
other	O
areas	O
by	O
humans	O
.	O

ASF	O
is	O
not	O
contagious	O
or	O
dangerous	O
for	O
humans	O
or	O
other	O
animal	O
species	O
.	O

A	O
panda	O
in	O
northwest	O
China	B-Country
's	O
Shaanxi	B-Province
Province	O
has	O
died	O
,	O
and	O
3	O
others	O
are	O
ill	O
after	O
contracting	O
a	O
measles-like	O
virus	O
,	O
local	O
authorities	O
confirmed	O
on	O
Monday	O
.	O

The	O
4	O
male	O
pandas	O
contracted	O
canine	B-Virus
distemper	I-Virus
virus	O
(	O
CDV	O
)	O
,	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
affects	O
a	O
wide	O
variety	O
of	O
animals	O
including	O
dogs	O
and	O
large	O
cats	O
,	O
early	O
last	O
month	O
[	O
December	O
2014	O
]	O
.	O

Among	O
them	O
was	O
8-year-old	O
Cheng	O
Cheng	O
,	O
who	O
died	O
on	O
9	O
Dec	O
2014	O
.	O

Another	O
2	O
pandas	O
,	O
one	O
8	O
years	O
old	O
and	O
one	O
5	O
years	O
old	O
,	O
are	O
critically	O
ill	O
,	O
while	O
the	O
14-year-old	O
Zhu	O
Zhu	O
is	O
in	O
stable	O
condition	O
.	O

More	O
than	O
30	O
experts	O
from	O
across	O
China	B-Country
are	O
taking	O
care	O
of	O
the	O
pandas	O
.	O

They	O
also	O
found	O
that	O
3	O
other	O
pandas	O
showed	O
symptoms	O
of	O
fever	O
and	O
had	O
them	O
quarantined	O
for	O
further	O
diagnosis	O
.	O

Canine	B-Virus
distemper	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
affects	O
the	O
gastrointestinal	O
and	O
respiratory	O
tract	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
the	O
spinal	O
cord	O
and	O
the	O
brain	O
.	O

The	O
infected	O
animals	O
usually	O
have	O
signs	O
including	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
eye	O
inflammation	O
,	O
coughing	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
lethargy	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
highly	O
contagious	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
high	O
fatality	O
rate	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
commonly	O
spread	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
body	O
fluids	O
or	O
contaminated	O
food	O
and	O
water	O
.	O

The	O
wildlife	O
rescue	O
,	O
breeding	O
and	O
research	O
center	O
of	O
Shaanxi	B-Province
was	O
home	O
to	O
25	O
giant	O
pandas	O
.	O

the	O
outbreak	O
of	O
the	O

center	O
sent	O
the	O
18	O
healthy	O
pandas	O
to	O
natural	O
reserves	O
elsewhere	O
in	O
the	O
province	O
.	O

of	O

]	O

[	O

]	O

confirm	O
this	O
.	O

Horses	O

in	O
New	B-Province
South	I-Province
Wales	I-Province
have	O
been	O

with	O
strangles	B-Disease
infections	I-Disease
,	O
a	O

disease	O
which	O

,	O

.	O

Grange	I-City
,	O

A	O

and	O
a	O

0950292102	O
,	O
0950512101	O
,	O
or	O
0951132202	O
.	O

The	O
USDA	O

that	O

,	O

.	O

to	O
a	O
temperature	O
of	O
165	O
F	O
[	O
74	O
C	O
]	O
should	O
kill	O
_Salmonella_	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
United	B-Country
Kingdom	I-Country
,	O
the	O
largest	O
outbreak	O
in	O
20	O
years	O
of	O
whooping	B-Disease
cough	I-Disease
is	O
taking	O
place	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
experts	O
announced	O
that	O
cases	O
have	O
fallen	O
off	O
slightly	O
.	O

In	O
November	O
2012	O
,	O
new	O
recorded	O
cases	O
dropped	O
for	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
18	O
months	O
,	O
but	O
medical	O
experts	O
have	O
warned	O
that	O
whooping	B-Disease
cough	I-Disease
does	O
generally	O
die	O
down	O
during	O
the	O
winter	O
months	O
,	O
and	O
that	O
could	O
mean	O
there	O
still	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
a	O
peak	O
in	O
the	O
outbreak	O
.	O

from	O
the	O
Health	O
Protection	O
Agency	O
show	O
1080	O
new	O
whooping	B-Disease
cough	I-Disease
cases	O
in	O
November	O
2012	O
,	O
compared	O
to	O
more	O
than	O
1600	O
during	O
October	O
2012	O
.	O

Thus	O
far	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
[	O
2012	O
]	O
,	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
over	O
8800	O
cases	O
of	O
whopping	O
cough	O
,	O
the	O
highest	O
in	O
one	O
year	O
since	O
the	O
early	O
1990s	O
.	O

Overall	O
,	O
14	O
babies	O
have	O
died	O
from	O
the	O
disease	O
because	O
they	O
were	O
too	O
young	O
to	O
be	O
completely	O
vaccinated	O
,	O
but	O
no	O
deaths	O
were	O
reported	O
in	O
November	O
2012	O
.	O

Other	O
data	O
show	O
that	O
hospital	O
admissions	O
for	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
young	O
children	O
have	O
increased	O
steeply	O
over	O
the	O
past	O
month	O
.	O

In	O
August	O
of	O
2011	O
,	O
22	O

younger	O
than	O
5	O
years	O
of	O
age	O
had	O
to	O

admitted	O
to	O
a	O

in	O
England	O
for	O
whopping	O
cough	O
.	O

During	O

2012	O
,	O

increased	O

127	O

being	O

the	O
disease	O

in	O

.	O

A	O

has	O

of	O
a	O

that	O

.	O

The	O
Canadian	O
Food	O
Inspection	O
Agency	O
(	O
CFIA	O
)	O
says	O
Orange	O
Blossom	O
Farm	O
is	O

relish	O
because	O

may	O

the	O

of	O
_Clostridium	O

.	O

The	O
product	O
was	O

in	O

at	O
the	O
St.	O
Jacob	O
's	O
Farmer	O
's	O

,	O
near	O
Waterloo	O
,	O
ON	O
.	O

The	O
agency	O
says	O
food	O
contaminated	O
with	O
the	O
toxin	O
may	O
not	O
look	O
or	O
smell	O
spoiled	O
but	O
can	O
still	O
make	O
you	O
sick	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
can	O
include	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

CFIA	O
says	O

no	O

due	O
to	O
the	O
relish	O
.	O

Biotechnology	O
company	O
,	O
Ridgeback	O
Biotherapeutics	O
,	O
announced	O
recently	O
that	O
the	O
U.S.	O
Food	O
and	O

Administration	O
(	O
FDA	O
)	O
approved	O
EbangaTM	O
for	O
the	O
treatment	O
of	O
Ebola	O
.	O

Ebanga	O
is	O
now	O
approved	O
for	O
treatment	O
of	O
infection	O
caused	O
by	O
_Zaire	O
ebolavirus_	O
in	O
adult	O
and	O

patients	O
(	O

to	O
a	O
mother	O
who	O
is	O
RT-PCR	O
positive	O
for	O
_Zaire	O
ebolavirus_	O
infection	O
)	O
.	O

Ebanga	O
is	O
the	O
only	O
FDA	O
approved	O
,	O
single	O
injection	O
Ebola	O
treatment	O
which	O
is	O
available	O
in	O
a	O
lyophilized	O
form	O
.	O

Ebanga	O
(	O
ansuvimab-zykl	O
,	O
formerly	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
mAb114	O
)	O
is	O

from	O
a	O

of	O

1995	O

in	O

,	O
a	O

in	O
the	O
DRC	O
.	O

,	O

Arkansas	B-Province
A	O
family	O
's	O
pet	O
dog	O
,	O
living	O
in	O
the	O
community	O
of	O
Imboden	O
in	O
Lawrence	B-City
County	I-City
,	O
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
rabid	O
by	O
the	O
Arkansas	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
this	O
week	O
.	O

The	O
dog	O
became	O
ill	O
around	O
25	O
Jan	O
2010	O
,	O
and	O
progressively	O
declined	O
until	O
it	O
was	O
euthanized	O
and	O
submitted	O
for	O
rabies	B-Virus
testing	O
.	O

Several	O
people	O
who	O
were	O
exposed	O
to	O
the	O
dog	O
will	O
be	O
undergoing	O
a	O
series	O
of	O
rabies	B-Virus
vaccinations	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
development	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
dog	O
was	O
an	O
inside/outside	O
dog	O
and	O
stayed	O
in	O
a	O
fenced	O
yard	O
when	O
outside	O
,	O
but	O
had	O
not	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
against	O
rabies	B-Virus
.	O

The	O
dog	O
had	O
been	O
sprayed	O
by	O
a	O
skunk	O
a	O
month	O
or	O
2	O
ago	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
disease	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
transmitted	O
in	O
skunk	O
spray	O
.	O

Undoubtedly	O
he	O
had	O
been	O
bitten	O
as	O
well	O
,	O
although	O
no	O
skunk	O
was	O
seen	O
or	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
yard	O
.	O

New	B-Province
Jersey	I-Province
A	O
raccoon	O
recently	O
captured	O
here	O
has	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
rabies	B-Virus
after	O
getting	O
into	O
a	O
fight	O
with	O
a	O
dog	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
Ocean	O
County	O
Health	O
Department	O
.	O

owner	O
of	O
the	O

,	O
a	O
local	O
resident	O
,	O
was	O

to	O

virus	O
through	O

of	O
the	O
raccoon	O
while	O

Hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
vaccine-preventable	O
,	O
communicable	O
disease	O
of	O
the	O
liver	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
virus	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
usually	O
transmitted	O
person-to-person	O
through	O
the	O
fecal-oral	O
route	O
or	O
consumption	O
of	O
contaminated	O
food	O
or	O
water	O
.	O

The	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
infection	I-Disease
is	O
to	O
get	O
vaccinated	O
.	O

As	O
of	O
at	O
least	O
almost	O
67	O
000	O
people	O
living	O
in	O
our	O
region	O
have	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
by	O
us	O
and	O
our	O
community	O
partners	O
.	O

those	O
,	O
more	O
than	O
5700	O
food	O
service	O
workers	O
have	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
.	O

with	O
629	O
cases	O
and	O
6	O
deaths	O
with	O
about	O
45	O
new	O
cases	O
per	O
week	O
.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
_Potato	O
spindle	B-Disease
tuber	I-Disease
viroid_	O
(	O
PSTVd	O
)	O
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
at	O
a	O
tomato	O
production	O
nursery	O
in	O
the	O
north	O
of	O
England	B-Province
.	O

This	O
is	O
the	O
2nd	O
outbreak	O
of	O
this	O
viroid	O
in	O
the	O
UK	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
was	O
in	O
Kent	O
in	O
2003	O
,	O
also	O
on	O
a	O
tomato	O
crop	O
.	O

The	O
viroid	O
is	O
listed	O
as	O
a	O
quarantine	O
organism	O
in	O
EU	O
.	O

UK	O
plant	O
health	O
legislation	O
and	O
statutory	O
controls	O
have	O
been	O
put	O
in	O
place	O
on	O
the	O
affected	O
nursery	O
,	O
requiring	O
hygiene	O
measures	O
to	O
prevent	O
further	O
spread	O
and	O
restrictions	O
on	O
the	O
marketing	O
of	O
the	O
fruit	O
.	O

Fera	O
are	O
investigating	O
the	O
extent	O
and	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
and	O
whether	O
other	O
premises	O
could	O
be	O
affected	O
.	O

PSTVd	O
is	O
closely	O
related	O
to	O
_Columnea	O
latent	O
viroid_	O
(	O
CLVd	O
)	O
and	O
_Tomato	O
chlorotic	O
dwarf	O
viroid_	O
(	O
TCDVd	O
)	O
.	O

CLVd	O
was	O
confirmed	O
in	O
2007	O
and	O
2009	O
in	O
4	O
tomato	O
production	O
nurseries	O
in	O
the	O
UK	O
,	O
and	O
both	O
PSTVd	O
and	O
TCDVd	O
are	O
occasionally	O
found	O
in	O
solanaceous	O
ornamentals	O
where	O
symptoms	O
are	O
rarely	O
seen	O
.	O

There	O
have	O
been	O
no	O
findings	O
of	O
any	O
of	O
these	O
viroids	O
on	O
potato	O
crops	O
in	O
the	O
UK	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
previous	O
PSTVd	O
case	O
in	O
2003	O
,	O
spread	O
within	O
plants	O
and	O
rows	O
was	O
found	O
,	O
by	O
observation	O
and	O
research	O
,	O
to	O
be	O
relatively	O
slow	O
and	O
this	O
[	O
PSTVd	O
outbreak	O
]	O
and	O
the	O
CLVd	O
outbreaks	O
were	O
successfully	O
eradicated	O
with	O
no	O
re-occurrence	O
the	O
following	O
year	O
.	O

Tomato	O
growers	O
are	O
strongly	O
advised	O
to	O
inspect	O
their	O
crops	O
and	O
report	O
any	O
suspicious	O
symptoms	O
to	O
their	O
local	O
Plant	O
Health	O
and	O
Seeds	O
Inspectorate	O
.	O

PSTVd	O
is	O
considered	O
to	O
pose	O
a	O
significant	O
risk	O
to	O
tomato	O
crops	O
and	O
potentially	O
to	O
potato	O
;	O
this	O
means	O
that	O
any	O
material	O
found	O
to	O
be	O
infected	O
would	O
be	O
subject	O
to	O
statutory	O
controls	O
.	O

a	O

also	O

it	O

a	O

life	O
.	O

A	O
fungal	O
disease	O
,	O
a	O
systemic	O
form	O
of	O
downy	B-Disease
mildew	I-Disease
,	O

entire	O

in	O
poppy	O
growing	O

across	O
Tasmania	B-Province
.	O

mildew	I-Disease
stunts	O
plant	O

,	O
yellows	O
the	O

and	O

.	O

Leprosy	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
chronic	O
infectious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
_Mycobacterium	O
leprae._	O
The	O
disease	O
mainly	O
affects	O
the	O
skin	O
,	O
the	O
peripheral	O
nerves	O
,	O
the	O
mucosa	O
of	O
the	O
upper	O
respiratory	O
tract	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
eyes	O
.	O

Leprosy	B-Disease
is	O
curable	O
and	O
treatment	O
provided	O
in	O
the	O
early	O
stages	O
averts	O
disability	O
.	O

Multidrug	O
therapy	O
,	O
made	O
available	O
by	O
WHO	O
free	O
of	O
charge	O
to	O
all	O
patients	O
worldwide	O
since	O
1995	O
,	O
provides	O
a	O
simple	O
yet	O
highly	O
effective	O
cure	O
for	O
all	O
types	O
of	O
leprosy	B-Disease
.	O

that	O

cases	O
were	O
recorded	O
in	O
the	O
city	O
in	O
2017	O
.	O

Mayor	O
Miftah	O
Hammadi	O
urged	O
the	O
government	O
health	O
officials	O
in	O
to	O
contract	O
a	O
specialized	O
company	O
to	O
combat	O
the	O
disease	O
ahead	O
of	O
summer	O
.	O

Leishmaniasis	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
parasitic	O
disease	O
spread	O
to	O
humans	O
by	O
bites	O
of	O
sandflies	O
that	O
are	O
usually	O
active	O
from	O
May	O
to	O
September	O
each	O
year	O
.	O

Deputy	O
director	O
Olga	O
Dulovic	O
of	O
Belgrade	O
's	O
Clinic	O
for	O
Infectious	O
and	O
Tropical	O
Diseases	O
reported	O
on	O
Thursday	O
that	O
the	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
[	O
WNV	O
]	O
has	O
claimed	O
the	O
lives	O
of	O
3	O
elderly	O
people	O
in	O
Serbia	B-Country
.	O

The	O
deaths	O
occurred	O
last	O
month	O
[	O
August	O
2012	O
]	O
,	O
and	O
Dulovic	O
said	O
doctors	O
confirmed	O
that	O
the	O
cause	O
was	O
viral	O
encephalitis	O
,	O
although	O
the	O
patients	O
had	O
other	O

.	O

On	O
Wednesday	O
,	O

said	O
that	O
16	O
more	O
people	O
were	O
infected	O
with	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
,	O
which	O
is	O
transmitted	O
by	O
the	O
tiger	O

.	O

As	O
of	O
Wednesday	O
,	O
the	O

of	O

in	O
Serbia	B-Country
rose	O

.	O

that	O
the	O
number	O

the	O
total	O
by	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
August	O
2012	O
,	O

an	O

West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
patients	O

on	O

of	O

in	O

.	O

.	O

However	O
,	O

that	O

public	O
has	O
no	O

for	O

since	O
several	O
types	O
of	O
viral	O

can	O
be	O

and	O
even	O
pass	O
unnoticed	O
.	O

Meanwhile	O
,	O

of	O
a	O

epidemic	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

The	O
international	O
medical	O
aid	O
agency	O
,	O
Doctors	O
Without	O
Borders	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
MSF	O
,	O
says	O
a	O
medical	O

crisis	O
is	O
gripping	O
citizens	O
in	O
Central	B-Country
African	I-Country
Republic	I-Country
(	O
CAR	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
country	O
has	O
been	O
plagued	O
by	O
political	O
instability	O
and	O
insecurity	O
,	O
and	O

is	O

.	O

to	O

.	O

``	O

[	O

]	O

cases	O

[	O

[	O

[	O

[	O

in	O

.	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

.	O

must	O

their	O

on	O

.	O

.	O

Angkor	O
Bakery	O

at	O

,	O

rolls	O
,	O

.	O

SA	O
[	O

]	O
Health	O

SA	O

said	O
raw	O

,	O

.	O

said	O

egg	O
products	O
could	O
be	O

if	O
not	O
appropriately	O

.	O

``	O
Many	O

have	O
been	O

with	O

containing	O
raw	O

,	O

as	O

or	O

and	O

,	O
''	O
Dr.	O
Jenkins	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
external	O
shell	O
of	O
eggs	O
may	O
contain	O
harmful	O
bacteria	O
such	O
as	O
salmonella	B-Virus
,	O
and	O
while	O

may	O
not	O
necessarily	O

'off	O
'	O
,	O

may	O

.	O

's	O

to	O
check	O
that	O

are	O

not	O

or	O

--	O
and	O

are	O

out	O
.	O

Preparation	O

and	O

should	O
be	O
thoroughly	O
washed	O
,	O

and	O
dried	O
after	O

,	O
and	O

to	O

of	O
raw	O

like	O

meat	O
,	O
and	O
wash	O
your	O

.	O
''	O

,	O

Nicola	O

.	O

)	O

Oblast	I-Province
[	O

]	O

.	O

She	O
said	O
rabies	B-Virus
was	O
a	O

in	O
South	B-Country
Africa	I-Country
,	O
particularly	O
in	O

``	O

,	O
''	O

charge	O
in	O
communities	O
across	O
the	O
province	O
.	O

``	O
Dogs	O
and	O
cats	O
should	O
be	O
vaccinated	O
at	O
3	O
months	O
of	O
age	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
booster	O
at	O
9	O
months	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
every	O
3	O
years	O
afterwards	O
.	O

In	O
high	O
risk	O
areas	O
,	O
annual	O
revaccination	O
is	O
recommended	O
,	O
''	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

She	O
said	O
stray	O
animals	O
,	O
animals	O
that	O
are	O
behaving	O
strangely	O
or	O
that	O
appear	O
sick	O
must	O
be	O
avoided	O
.	O

Once	O
the	O
rabies	B-Virus
virus	O
has	O
entered	O
the	O
body	O
,	O
it	O
goes	O
to	O
the	O
brain	O
where	O
the	O
virus	O
multiplies	O
,	O
causing	O
brain	O
dysfunction	O
and	O
ultimately	O
death	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
spread	O
from	O
animal	O
to	O
animal	O
,	O
and	O
occasionally	O
from	O
animals	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

Two	O
people	O
lost	O
their	O
lives	O
on	O
Wednesday	O
in	O
a	O
recent	O
outbreak	O
of	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
in	O
Nigeria	B-Country
's	O
middle-belt	O
Plateau	B-Province
state	I-Province
,	O
according	O
to	O
an	O
official	O
.	O

Plateau	B-Province
State	I-Province
Commissioner	O
for	O
Health	O
Fom	O
Dawak	O
told	O
reporters	O
in	O
Jos	O
,	O
the	O
state	O
capital	O
,	O
that	O
a	O
woman	O
and	O
a	O
man	O
died	O
while	O
receiving	O
treatments	O
at	O
the	O
state-run	O
Jos	O
University	O
Teaching	O
Hospital	O
(	O
JUTH	O
)	O
and	O
Vom	O
Christian	O
Hospital	O
,	O
respectively	O
.	O

``	O
Also	O
,	O
2	O
other	O
persons	O
are	O
currently	O
on	O
admission	O
at	O
the	O
Vom	O
Christian	O
Hospital	O
and	O
are	O
responding	O
to	O
treatment	O
for	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
,	O
''	O
the	O
state	O
official	O
said	O
,	O
adding	O
that	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
had	O
dispatched	O
epidemiologists	O
to	O
communicate	O
knowledge	O
on	O
how	O
to	O
contain	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
high	O
possibility	O
of	O
treatment	O
and	O
survival	O
after	O
early	O
diagnosis	O
,	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

Lassa	B-Virus
virus	O
is	O
usually	O
transmitted	O
when	O
the	O
saliva	O
,	O
urine	O
,	O
and	O
excreta	O
of	O
multi-mammalian	O
rats	O
come	O
in	O
contact	O
with	O
humans	O
through	O
their	O
food	O
or	O
water	O
.	O

Dawak	O
said	O
another	O
symptom	O
of	O
the	O
deadly	O
fever	O
is	O
bleeding	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
why	O
it	O
is	O
usually	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
haemorrhagic	O
fever	O
,	O
associated	O
with	O
bleeding	O
through	O
the	O
nose	O
,	O
gums	O
and	O
urine	O
.	O

``	O
Aside	O
from	O
bleeding	O
,	O
people	O
should	O
watch	O
out	O
for	O
the	O
general	O
symptoms	O
of	O
ill-health	O
such	O
as	O
headaches	O
and	O
fever	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
added	O
.	O

In	O
some	O
cases	O
,	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
has	O
similar	O
symptoms	O
to	O
malaria	O
,	O
the	O
commissioner	O
for	O
health	O
cum	O
medical	O
doctor	O
noted	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
symptoms	O
could	O
also	O
vary	O
,	O
but	O
we	O
always	O
use	O
proper	O
testing	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
the	O
patient	O
is	O
adequately	O
treated	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
,	O
advising	O
local	O
residents	O
to	O
always	O
cover	O
their	O
food	O
and	O
water	O
properly	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
pay	O
attention	O
to	O
clean	O
surroundings	O
.	O

When	O
people	O
have	O
clean	O
and	O
less	O
clustered	O
surroundings	O
so	O
as	O
to	O
keep	O
rats	O
away	O
,	O
the	O
possibility	O
of	O
contacting	O
the	O
fever	O
would	O
be	O
lower	O
,	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

In	O
2012	O
,	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
claimed	O
more	O
than	O
40	O
lives	O
in	O
12	O
states	O
across	O
the	O
West	O
African	O
country	O
.	O

For	O
this	O
reason	O
,	O
the	O
Nigerian	O
government	O
set	O
up	O
a	O
Lassa	B-Virus
Fever	I-Disease
Rapid	O
Response	O
Committee	O
to	O
investigate	O
,	O
prevent	O
,	O
and	O
control	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Five	O
people	O
were	O
infected	O
with	O
listeriosis	B-Disease
within	O
a	O
one-week	O
span	O
earlier	O
in	O

Serum	O

(	O

)	O

on	O
Tue	O
28	O
Apr	O
2015	O
.	O

Two	O
of	O
them	O
died	O
within	O
30	O
days	O
of	O
the	O

's	O
discovery	O
.	O

The	O
institute	O
said	O
that	O
2	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
cases	O
resemble	O
the	O
same	O
type	O
that	O
was	O
present	O
in	O

of	O
the	O

.	O

Two	O

resemble	O

,	O

5th	O

a	O

_Listeria_	O
that	O
has	O
not	O
yet	O
been	O

.	O

``	O

's	O
unusual	O
to	O

5	O

in	O
one	O
week	O
.	O

Normally	O

.	O

But	O

were	O

to	O
so	O

.	O

That	O

that	O
our	O
monitoring	O
for	O
the	O
organism	O
has	O
gotten	O
better	O
,	O
''	O
SSI	O

Kare	O
Molbak	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
Jorn	O
A.	O
Rullepolser	O
listeriosis	B-Disease
outbreak	O
led	O
to	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
30	O
products	O
--	O

of	O

,	O
salami	O
and	O
hot	O
dogs	O
--	O
being	O

from	O

.	O

The	O
company	O
was	O
shut	O
down	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
.	O

The	O

of	O
the	O

cases	O
was	O
not	O

,	O
Molbak	O
said	O
.	O

``	O

's	O
the	O
same	O
bacteria	O
as	O
in	O
the	O
rullepolse	O
outbreak	O
.	O

So	O
it	O
's	O
possible	O
that	O
the	O
old	O
outbreak	O
has	O
been	O
rekindled	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
told	O
public	O
broadcaster	O
DR.	O
SSI	O
said	O
that	O
the	O
majority	O
of	O
those	O
who	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
with	O
_Listeria_	O
had	O
weakened	O
immune	O
systems	O
.	O

Fatality	O
rates	O
among	O
infected	O
individuals	O
is	O
25	O
percent	O
,	O
the	O
institute	O
said	O
.	O

Denmark	B-Country
normally	O
sees	O
around	O
50	O
listeriosis	B-Disease
cases	O
per	O
year	O
,	O
but	O
in	O
the	O
years	O
2009-2014	O
,	O
that	O
number	O
was	O
closer	O
to	O
100	O
.	O

The	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
of	O
hemorrhagic	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
with	I-Disease
renal	I-Disease
syndrome	I-Disease
(	O
HFRS	O
)	O
in	O
the	O
Yaroslavl	B-Province
oblast	I-Province
increased	O
by	O
a	O
third	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2009	O
]	O
in	O
comparison	O
with	O
2008	O
.	O

There	O
were	O
118	O
cases	O
last	O
year	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
high	O
rate	O
of	O
infection	O
has	O
continued	O
into	O
this	O
year	O
.	O

During	O
the	O
1st	O
week	O
of	O
2010	O
,	O
7	O
new	O
cases	O
of	O
HFRS	O
have	O
been	O
detected	O
.	O

The	O
reason	O
for	O
the	O
high	O
morbidity	O
is	O
thought	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
consequence	O
of	O
the	O
mild	O
winter	O
weather	O
and	O
the	O
abundance	O
of	O
rodents	O
.	O

The	O
rodents	O
have	O
congregated	O
near	O
human	O
dwellings	O
,	O
especially	O
in	O
holiday	O
areas	O
.	O

Often	O
people	O
contract	O
infection	O
when	O
picnicking	O
in	O
the	O
countryside	O
.	O

The	O
rodent	O
vectors	O
of	O
HFRS	O
contaminate	O
the	O
environment	O
with	O
their	O
droppings	O
.	O

Humans	O
can	O
become	O
infected	O
by	O
inhaling	O
contaminated	O
dust	O
or	O
by	O
consuming	O
contaminated	O
food	O
.	O

The	O
public	O
health	O
authorities	O
have	O
stated	O
that	O
the	O
incidence	O
of	O
infection	O
is	O
expected	O
to	O
decline	O
throughout	O
December	O
2009	O
and	O
January	O
2010	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
epidemic	O
situation	O
is	O
serious	O
,	O
and	O
rodent	O
control	O
measures	O
have	O
been	O
inadequate	O
in	O
recent	O
times	O
.	O

Several	O
years	O
ago	O
,	O
a	O
state-funded	O
rodent	O
control	O
programme	O
was	O
in	O
force	O
,	O
but	O
that	O
programme	O
has	O
lapsed	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
expected	O
that	O
local	O
administrations	O
will	O
take	O
over	O
this	O
responsibility	O
and	O
initiate	O
their	O
own	O
programmes	O
.	O

The	O
aim	O
will	O
be	O
to	O
exterminate	O
the	O
rodent	O
vector	O
by	O
all	O
possible	O
means	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
meantime	O
,	O
to	O
avoid	O
infection	O
,	O
residents	O
and	O
visitors	O
to	O
the	O
countryside	O
should	O
wear	O
gloves	O
and	O
respirators	O
when	O
cleaning	O
surfaces	O
,	O
and	O
wash	O
their	O
hands	O
frequently	O
.	O

Massive	O
pest	O
(	O
stem	O
borer	O
)	O
attack	O
and	O
stem	B-Disease
rot	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
are	O
wreaking	O
havoc	O
on	O
the	O
transplanted	O
aman	O
in	O
Taraganj	O
,	O
Rangpur	B-Province
division	O
.	O

Frustration	O
has	O
gripped	O
the	O
farmers	O
.	O

At	O
least	O
20	O
to	O
25	O
percent	O
of	O
the	O
plants	O
have	O
been	O
badly	O
affected	O
.	O

The	O
farmers	O
said	O
that	O
plants	O
at	O
different	O
villages	O
are	O
drying	O
up	O
.	O

``	O
If	O
the	O
situation	O
continues	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
suffer	O
huge	O
losses	O
.	O
''	O

They	O
failed	O
to	O
prevent	O
spread	O
of	O
stem	O
disease	O
and	O
pest	O
attack	O
despite	O
spraying	O
insecticides	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
district	O
agriculture	O
officials	O
,	O
aman	O
has	O
been	O
cultivated	O
on	O
9800	O
hectares	O
in	O
Taraganj	O
.	O

A	O
serious	O
outbreak	O
of	O
malaria	B-Disease
in	O
Burundi	B-Country
has	O
reached	O
epidemic	O
proportions	O
,	O
killing	O
almost	O
as	O
many	O
people	O
as	O
the	O
Ebola	O
crisis	O
in	O
the	O
nearby	O
Democratic	O
Republic	O
of	O
the	O
Congo	O
.	O

The	O
outbreak	O
in	O
the	O
tiny	O
Great	O
Lakes	O
country	O
has	O
infected	O
almost	O
half	O
the	O
total	O
population	O
,	O
killing	O
about	O
1800	O
people	O
since	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
the	O
year	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
figures	O
gathered	O
by	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organisation	O
,	O
almost	O
6	O
million	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
recorded	O
since	O
the	O
1st	O
week	O
of	O
January	O
to	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
July	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
,	O
with	O
infections	O
reaching	O
crisis	O
levels	O
in	O
May	O
.	O

The	O
figures	O
look	O
on	O
course	O
to	O
outstrip	O
the	O
epidemic	O
of	O
2017	O
,	O
when	O
more	O
6	O
million	O
cases	O
were	O
recorded	O
for	O
the	O
whole	O
year	O
.	O

The	O
situation	O
has	O
continued	O
to	O
worsen	O
as	O
the	O
government	O
of	O
Burundi	B-Country
has	O
refused	O
to	O
declare	O
an	O
emergency	O
.	O

The	O
scale	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
was	O
described	O
in	O
the	O
latest	O
report	O
for	O
the	O
UN	O
's	O
office	O
for	O
the	O
Coordination	O
of	O
Humanitarian	O
Affairs	O
,	O
which	O
warned	O
that	O
the	O
outbreak	O
had	O
reached	O
``	O
epidemic	O
''	O
proportions	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
national	O
malaria	B-Disease
outbreak	O
response	O
plan	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
currently	O
being	O
validated	O
,	O
has	O
highlighted	O
a	O
lack	O
of	O
human	O
,	O
logistical	O
,	O
and	O
financial	O
resources	O
for	O
effective	O
response	O
,	O
''	O
reported	O
the	O
organisation	O
.	O

The	O
organisation	O
and	O
other	O
experts	O
have	O
blamed	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
issues	O
for	O
the	O
crisis	O
,	O
including	O
low	O
use	O
of	O
preventative	O
measures	O
and	O
a	O
vulnerable	O
population	O
with	O
low	O
levels	O
of	O
resistance	O
.	O

Experts	O
have	O
also	O
noted	O
an	O
increase	O
in	O
drug	O
resistant	O
strains	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
common	O
with	O
other	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
world	O
.	O

The	O
climate	O
crisis	O
has	O
been	O
cited	O
as	O
a	O
contributing	O
factor	O
.	O

Mosquitoes	O
,	O
which	O
spread	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
are	O
reaching	O
higher	O
altitudes	O
in	O
the	O
mountainous	O
country	O
,	O
and	O
have	O
displayed	O
behavioural	O
changes	O
including	O
more	O
aggressive	O
feeding	O
habits	O
.	O

The	O
country	O
's	O
agricultural	O
policies	O
have	O
also	O
encouraged	O
an	O
increase	O
in	O
rice	O
production	O
that	O
has	O
seen	O
farmers	O
encroach	O
on	O
mosquito-infested	O
areas	O
.	O

While	O
Burundi	B-Country
has	O
long	O
struggled	O
with	O
malaria	B-Disease
,	O
the	O
figures	O
for	O
the	O
current	O
outbreak	O
suggest	O
a	O
50	O
%	O
increase	O
compared	O
to	O
the	O
equivalent	O
period	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
.	O

The	O
UN	O
organisation	O
noted	O
bleakly	O
that	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
health	O
districts	O
that	O
have	O
passed	O
the	O
epidemic	O
threshold	O
had	O
continued	O
to	O
increase	O
.	O

Although	O
Burundi	B-Country
declared	O
a	O
national	O
health	O
emergency	O
in	O
2017	O
after	O
1.8	O
million	O
cases	O
and	O
700	O
deaths	O
were	O
recorded	O
,	O
it	O
has	O
declined	O
to	O
declare	O
one	O
for	O
the	O
current	O
outbreak	O
,	O
apparently	O
concerned	O
of	O
the	O
potential	O
impact	O
ahead	O
of	O
elections	O
slated	O
for	O
next	O
year	O
[	O
2010	O
]	O
...	O

After	O
confirming	O
that	O
someone	O
has	O
contracted	O
the	O
potentially	O
deadly	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
,	O
Alberta	B-Province
Health	O
Services	O
is	O
urging	O
residents	O
to	O
take	O
simple	O
precautions	O
.	O

The	O
infected	O
person	O
is	O
from	O
a	O
rural	O
community	O
in	O
central	O
Alberta	B-Province
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O
news	O
release	O
issued	O
Wednesday	O
by	O
AHS	O
.	O

Hantavirus	B-Virus
[	O
es	O
]	O
[	O
are	O
]	O
transferred	O
to	O
humans	O
from	O
exposure	O
to	O
mice	O
,	O
so	O
AHS	O
recommends	O
that	O
people	O
take	O
extra	O
precautions	O
when	O
dealing	O
with	O
mouse	O
droppings	O
and	O
dead	O
mice	O
.	O

``	O
Because	O
humans	O
can	O
be	O
exposed	O
to	O
[	O
a	O
]	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
when	O
the	O
urine	O
or	O
feces	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O
rodent	O
--	O
such	O
as	O
a	O
mouse	O
--	O
become	O
airborne	O
,	O
anyone	O
who	O
disturbs	O
areas	O
of	O
mice	O
or	O
mice	O
droppings	O
can	O
be	O
at	O
risk	O
,	O
''	O
Dr.	O
Ifeoma	O
Achebe	O
,	O
Medical	O
Officer	O
of	O
Health	O
,	O
Central	O
Zone	O
,	O
said	O
in	O
the	O
release	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
is	O
essential	O
that	O
Albertans	O
take	O
precautions	O
to	O
protect	O
themselves	O
and	O
greatly	O
reduce	O
their	O
risk	O
of	O
illness	O
.	O
''	O

Some	O
tips	O
that	O
AHS	O
offered	O
include	O
:	O
wearing	O
rubber	O
gloves	O
when	O
cleaning	O
mouse	O
droppings	O
,	O
soaking	O
dead	O
mice	O
and	O
droppings	O
in	O
a	O
bleach	O
solution	O
and	O
never	O
using	O
a	O
broom	O
to	O
sweep	O
up	O
droppings	O
or	O
dead	O
mice	O
,	O
as	O
the	O
dust	O
can	O
carry	O
the	O
virus	O
and	O
make	O
it	O
airborne	O
.	O

Although	O
the	O
virus	O
is	O
rare	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
will	O
usually	O
show	O
up	O
one	O
to	O
2	O
weeks	O
after	O
exposure	O
,	O
but	O
AHS	O
says	O
they	O
can	O
appear	O
up	O
to	O
5	O
weeks	O
later	O
.	O

Watch	O
for	O
severe	O
flu	O
,	O
including	O
fever	O
,	O
body	O
aches	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
abdominal	O
problems	O
and	O
severe	O
breathing	O

.	O

``	O

is	O
very	O

that	O
anyone	O
who	O
has	O
recently	O
been	O
in	O
an	O
area	O

by	O
mice	O

who	O
has	O

severe	O

symptoms	O
or	O
difficulty	O
breathing	O
see	O
a	O
doctor	O
immediately	O
,	O
''	O
Achebe	O
said	O
.	O

(	O

)	O
have	O
[	O

``	O

.	O

``	O

1000th	O

of	O
a	O

like	O
measles	B-Virus
is	O

of	O

that	O
work	O
is	O
to	O
the	O
public	O

of	O
the	O
nation	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
added	O
.	O

Measles	B-Virus
became	O
rare	O
after	O
vaccination	O
campaigns	O
started	O
in	O
the	O
1960s	O
.	O

A	O
decade	O
ago	O
,	O
there	O
were	O
fewer	O
than	O
100	O
cases	O
a	O
year	O
.	O

While	O
overall	O

rates	O
have	O
remained	O
fairly	O
high	O
,	O
outbreaks	O
have	O
been	O

in	O
communities	O
where	O
parents	O
have	O
refused	O

shots	O
for	O
their	O

.	O

were	O
updated	O
after	O

agency	O

20	O
fewer	O

on	O

.	O

``	O

not	O

:	O

are	O
a	O

and	O

tool	O
that	O
can	O
prevent	O
this	O

current	O
outbreak	O
,	O
''	O
the	O
health	O

continued	O
in	O

.	O

``	O
The	O
measles	B-Virus
vaccine	O
is	O
among	O

products	O
we	O
have	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

``	O

.	O
''	O

A	O
man	O
from	O
Karachi	B-City
Gardens	O
is	O
the	O
8th	O
victim	O
of	O
the	O
lethal	O
amoeba	O
,	O
_Naegleria	O
fowleri_	O
in	O
Pakistan	B-Country
this	O
year	O
[	O
2014	O
]	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O
Dawn.com	O

today	O
.	O

The	O
34-year-old	O
man	O

in	O
a	O

where	O

.	O

``	O

[	O

Karachi	B-City
was	O
the	O

of	O
a	O
_Naegleria	O
fowleri_	O
outbreak	O
that	O

10	O

in	O
the	O
summer	O
of	O
2012	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
US	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
(	O
CDC	O
)	O
,	O
_Naegleria	O
fowleri_	O
is	O
a	O
free-living	O
amoeba	O
that	O
can	O
cause	O
a	O
rare	O
and	O
devastating	O
infection	O
of	O
the	O
brain	O
called	O
primary	B-Disease
amebic	I-Disease
meningoencephalitis	I-Disease
(	O
PAM	O
)	O
.	O

People	O
get	O
infected	O
when	O
water	O
containing	O
the	O
amoeba	O
enters	O
the	O
body	O
through	O
the	O
nose	O
.	O

This	O
typically	O
occurs	O
when	O
people	O
go	O
swimming	O
or	O
diving	O
in	O
warm	O
freshwater	O
places	O
,	O
like	O
lakes	O
and	O
rivers	O
.	O

The	O
_Naegleria	O
fowleri_	O
ameba	O
then	O
travels	O
up	O
the	O
nose	O
to	O
the	O
brain	O
where	O
it	O
destroys	O
the	O
brain	O
tissue	O
.	O

In	O
Pakistan	B-Country
,	O
the	O
amoeba	O
has	O
been	O
reported	O
contracted	O
by	O
performing	O
ablution	O
.	O

The	O
practice	O
of	O
ablution	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
Yogic	O
,	O
Ayurvedic	O
,	O
and	O
Islamic	O
traditions	O
.	O

Within	O
the	O
Islamic	O
faith	O
,	O
ritual	O
nasal	O
rinsing	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
a	O
cleansing	O
process	O
called	O
wudu	O
,	O
or	O
ablution	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
usually	O
performed	O
several	O
times	O
a	O
day	O
in	O
preparation	O
for	O
prayer	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
CDC	O
.	O

The	O
deadly	O
parasite	O
has	O
also	O
been	O
contracted	O
via	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
neti	O
pots	O
.	O

can	O
not	O

_Naegleria	O
fowleri_	O

drinking	O
contaminated	O
water	O
,	O

notes	O
.	O

past	O
Gaidakot	O

Since	O
the	O

of	O
2017	O
,	O
the	O
Texas	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
State	O

says	O
it	O
has	O
seen	O

of	O
flea-borne	O
typhus	O
,	O
the	O
highest	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
16	O
years	O
.	O

Due	O
to	O
the	O
increase	O
in	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
across	O
the	O
state	O
,	O
the	O
state	O
agency	O
is	O
reminding	O
people	O
to	O
take	O
precautions	O
to	O
prevent	O
contracting	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Flea-borne	O
typhus	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
murine	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
,	O
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
infection	O
that	O
most	O
commonly	O
occurs	O
when	O
infected	O
flea	O
feces	O
are	O
scratched	O
into	O
the	O
site	O
of	O
the	O
flea	O
bite	O
or	O
another	O
break	O
in	O
the	O
skin	O
.	O

Fleas	O
are	O
infected	O
when	O
they	O
bite	O
animals	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
rodents	O
,	O
opossums	O
and	O
cats	O
,	O
that	O
can	O
maintain	O
and	O
transmit	O
the	O
bacteria	O
.	O

Rat	O
and	O
cat	O
fleas	O
are	O
the	O
primary	O
vectors	O
.	O

In	O
2017	O
,	O
the	O
increased	O
typhus	O
activity	O
has	O
been	O
reported	O
in	O
the	O
Dallas-Fort	O
Worth	O
and	O
Houston	O
areas	O
.	O

In	O
2016	O
,	O
the	O
state	O
recorded	O
364	O
cases	O
.	O

Travis	O
County	O
Flea-Borne	O
Typhus	O
Cases	O
(	O
Travis	O
County	O
contains	O
Austin	O

state	O
capital	O
-	O
Mod.LL	O
)	O
2017	O
:	O
25	O
(	O
as	O
of	O
11/30/17	O
)	O
2016	O
:	O
30	O
2014	O
:	O
4	O
2013	O
:	O
15	O
2012	O
:	O
42	O
The	O
state	O
is	O
also	O
requesting	O
health	O
care	O
professionals	O
keep	O
an	O
eye	O
out	O
for	O
patients	O
who	O
have	O
a	O
fever	O
have	O
one	O
or	O
more	O
of	O
the	O
following	O
:	O
headache	O
,	O
myalgia	O
,	O
anorexia	O
,	O
rash	O
,	O
nausea/vomiting	O
,	O
thrombocytopenia	O
,	O
or	O
any	O
hepatic	O
transaminase	O
elevation	O
.	O

Early	O
symptoms	O
of	O
flea-borne	O
typhus	O
develop	O
within	O
14	O
days	O
of	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
fleas	O
and	O
include	O
headache	O
,	O
fever	O
,	O
nausea	O
and	O
body	O
aches	O
.	O

Five	O
or	O
6	O
days	O
after	O
the	O
initial	O
symptoms	O
,	O
a	O
rash	O
that	O
starts	O
on	O
the	O
trunk	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
and	O
spreads	O
to	O
the	O
arms	O
and	O
legs	O
may	O
occur	O
.	O

Flea-borne	O
typhus	O
is	O
easily	O
treated	O
with	O
certain	O
antimicrobials	O
,	O
and	O
people	O
will	O
not	O
get	O
it	O
again	O
after	O
they	O
recover	O
.	O

Precautions	O
to	O
prevent	O
flea-borne	O
typhus	O
:	O
-	O
Keep	O
yards	O
clean	O
so	O
that	O
rodents	O
,	O
opossums	O
and	O
stray	O
cats	O
can	O
not	O
live	O
there	O
by	O
removing	O
any	O
brush	O
or	O
trash	O
,	O
keeping	O
the	O
grass	O
mowed	O
and	O
keeping	O
firewood	O
off	O
the	O
ground	O
.	O

-	O
Do	O
not	O
leave	O
pet	O
food	O
out	O
at	O
night	O
as	O
this	O
attracts	O
other	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Prevent	O
rodents	O
from	O
living	O
in	O
houses	O
.	O

-	O
Treat	O
for	O
fleas	O
with	O
a	O
commercial	O
flea	O
control	O
product	O
before	O
beginning	O
rodent	O
control	O
in	O
houses	O
or	O
yards	O
.	O

Fleas	O
will	O
search	O
for	O
new	O
hosts	O
when	O
rodents	O
die	O
.	O

-	O
Control	O
the	O
fleas	O
on	O
pets	O
regularly	O
.	O

Ask	O
a	O
veterinarian	O
about	O
flea	O
control	O
products	O
that	O
are	O
safe	O
to	O
use	O
on	O
pets	O
.	O

-	O
Wear	O
gloves	O
and	O
insect	O
repellent	O
when	O
handling	O
sick	O
or	O
dead	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Use	O
insect	O
repellent	O
when	O
hunting	O
,	O
camping	O
or	O
engaging	O
in	O
any	O
other	O
outdoor	O
activities	O
.	O

unfavourable	O
epidemiological	O
situation	O
with	O
regard	O
to	O
measles	B-Virus
incidence	O
has	O
developed	O
in	O

Novgorod	I-City
region	O
.	O

to	O
the	O

.	O

affected	O
2	O

,	O

in	O
a	O

.	O

8	O
cases	O

measles	B-Virus
were	O

in	O
these	O
2	O
families	O
.	O

5	O
children	O
were	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
class	O
of	O
a	O

institution	O
run	O

a	O

organisation	O
,	O
the	O
``	O
Saint	O
Nicholas	O
Orthodox	O
Gymnasium	O
''	O

where	O
68	O
pupils	O
and	O
40	O
employees	O
have	O
refused	O
to	O
accept	O
immunization	O
on	O
grounds	O
of	O
religious	O
conviction	O
.	O

The	O
only	O
measure	O
of	O
prevention	O
of	O
measles	B-Virus
infection	O
is	O
vaccination	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
available	O
in	O
all	O
countries	O
of	O
the	O
world	O
,	O
using	O
an	O
attenuated	O
live	O
virus	O
vaccine	O
.	O

As	O
prescribed	O
in	O
the	O
national	O
calendar	O
of	O
preventive	O
inoculations	O
of	O
the	O
Russian	O
Federation	O
,	O
vaccination	O
against	O
measles	B-Virus
is	O
carried	O
out	O
twice	O
:	O
children	O
under	O
the	O
age	O
of	O
12	O
months	O
(	O
primary	O
vaccination	O
)	O
and	O
at	O
6	O
years	O
(	O
booster	O
)	O
.	O

[	O
Unvaccinated	O
]	O
adults	O
under	O
35	O
years	O
of	O
age	O
should	O
be	O
vaccinated	O
twice	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
person	O
was	O
not	O
vaccinated	O
in	O
childhood	O
and	O
never	O
suffered	O
measles	B-Virus
,	O
or	O
when	O
data	O
on	O
vaccination	O
has	O
been	O
lost	O
,	O
vaccination	O
should	O
be	O
carried	O
out	O
with	O
an	O
interval	O
of	O
at	O
least	O
3	O
months	O
between	O
vaccinations	O
.	O

Refusal	O
on	O
the	O
religious	O
beliefs	O
to	O
accept	O
prophylactic	O
vaccination	O
can	O
result	O
in	O
greater	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
infection	O
,	O
and	O
result	O
in	O
the	O
emergence	O
of	O
a	O
group	O
of	O
susceptibles	O
and	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

At	O
least	O
66	O
people	O
people	O
have	O
died	O
of	O
Japanese	B-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
this	O
year	O
across	O
Assam	B-Province
,	O
chief	O
minister	O
Tarun	O
Gogoi	O
on	O
Monday	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
So	O
far	O
,	O
66	O
deaths	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
from	O
various	O
districts	O
in	O
Assam	B-Province
.	O

Though	O
the	O
severity	O
is	O
lesser	O
this	O
year	O
than	O
the	O
previous	O
years	O
,	O

are	O
taking	O
it	O
very	O
seriously	O
,	O
''	O
Gogoi	O
told	O
reporters	O
here	O
.	O

The	O

has	O

all	O

like	O

,	O

of	O

,	O

among	O
others	O

of	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

Health	O
authorities	O
alerted	O
the	O
population	O
about	O
the	O
consumption	O
of	O
raw	O
fish	O
after	O
detecting	O
6	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
and	O
another	O
14	O
suspects	O
of	O
contagion	O
with	O
difilobotriasis	B-Disease
[	O
_Diphyllobothrium	O
latum_	O
]	O
at	O
Puerto	O
Octay	O
Hospital	O
.	O

Also	O
known	O
as	O
the	O
tapeworm	O
of	O
fish	O
,	O
[	O
_Diphyllobothrium	O
latum_	O
]	O
is	O
the	O
largest	O
parasite	O
that	O
infects	O
humans	O
.	O

This	O
animal	O
has	O
the	O
appearance	O
of	O
a	O
worm	O
,	O
can	O
reach	O
up	O
to	O
10	O
m	O
and	O
is	O
lodged	O
in	O
the	O
intestines	O
,	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
reproduce	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
Las	O
Ãšltimas	O

,	O

Seremi	O
of	O
Los	B-Province
Lagos	I-Province
,	O

,	O

``	O

.	O

.	O

Three	O
men	O
from	O
La	B-City
Plata	I-City
,	O
Buenos	B-Province
Aires	I-Province
Province	O
have	O
contracted	O
the	O
viral	O
disease	O
,	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O
Clarin	O
report	O
(	O
computer	O
translated	O
)	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
currently	O
hospitalized	O
for	O
their	O
illness	O
.	O

The	O
3	O
cases	O
were	O
confirmed	O
by	O
a	O
source	O
from	O
Sanitary	O
Region	O
XI	O
,	O
who	O
detailed	O
that	O
those	O
affected	O
had	O
been	O
working	O
or	O
walking	O
in	O
the	O
rural	O
area	O
of	O
La	B-City
Plata	I-City
.	O

Hantaviruses	O
are	O
carried	O
by	O
certain	O
species	O
of	O
rats	O
and	O
mice	O
that	O
shed	O
the	O
virus	O
in	O
their	O
urine	O
,	O
droppings	O
and	O
saliva	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
to	O
people	O
when	O
nesting	O
materials	O
or	O
dust	O
contaminated	O
by	O
infected	O
rat	O
or	O
mouse	O
urine	O
,	O
droppings	O
and	O
saliva	O
are	O
stirred	O
up	O
,	O
allowing	O
the	O
virus	O
to	O
be	O
breathed	O
in	O
by	O
humans	O
.	O

Early	O
symptoms	O
of	O
[	O
a	O
]	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
include	O
fatigue	O
,	O
fever	O
and	O
muscle	O
aches	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
accompanied	O
by	O
headaches	O
,	O
dizziness	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
nausea	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
diarrhea	O
and	O
abdominal	O
pain	O
.	O

Later	O
symptoms	O
include	O
coughing	O
and	O
shortness	O
of	O
breath	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
is	O
suspected	O
,	O
people	O
should	O
contact	O
their	O
health	O
care	O
provider	O
immediately	O
and	O
mention	O
any	O
potential	O
exposure	O
to	O
rodents	O
,	O
their	O
nests	O
or	O
their	O
waste	O
.	O

A	O
``	O
viral	O
''	O
disease	O
has	O
attacked	O
date	O
palms	O
in	O
Khairpur	B-City
[	O
district	O
]	O
for	O
the	O
3rd	O
consecutive	O
year	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
affected	O
the	O
orchards	O
of	O
date	O
palms	O
in	O
several	O
municipalities	O
.	O

Growers	O
said	O
the	O
attack	O
dried	O
the	O
fruit	O
which	O
started	O
dropping	O
and	O
later	O
the	O
stem	O
also	O
dried	O
up	O
.	O

A	O
date	O
palm	O
grower	O
said	O
that	O
some	O
200	O
acres	O
[	O
81	O
ha	O
]	O
of	O

had	O
been	O

due	O
to	O
the	O
attack	O
of	O
an	O
unidentified	B-Disease
``	I-Disease
viral	I-Disease
''	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
.	O

In	O

current	O
month	O
[	O

]	O
,	O
the	O
disease	O
had	O
damaged	O
50	O

of	O
[	O
his	O
]	O
date	O
palms	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
that	O
there	O
was	O
no	O

to	O

.	O

There	O
are	O

44	O

of	O

the	O
district	O
.	O

)	O

that	O

had	O

.	O

.	O

a	O

.	O

Another	O

said	O
that	O

and	O

The	O

'	O

Legionnaires	B-Disease
'	O
disease	O
is	O
a	O
type	O
of	O
pneumonia	O
caused	O
by	O
_Legionella_	O
bacteria	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
be	O

by	O

mist	O
from	O
infected	O
water	O
sources	O
such	O
as	O

,	O

fountains	O
or	O
plumbing	O
systems	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
not	O
spread	O
by	O
person-to-person	O
contact	O
or	O
by	O
drinking	O
water	O
.	O

The	O
infected	O

who	O
died	O
was	O
reportedly	O

.	O

The	O
individual	O
's	O

.	O

20s	O
to	O
90s	O
.	O

Some	O
are	O
in	O

and	O

from	O

.	O

``	O

a	O

,	O
we	O
are	O
not	O

Minnesota	B-Province

Department	O

'	O

.	O

Dozens	O

have	O

to	O
a	O

in	O
Uttar	B-Province
Pradesh	I-Province
's	O
Gorakhpur	B-City
district	O
with	O
symptoms	O
of	O
encephalitis	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
first	O
came	O
to	O
India	B-Country
in	O
1978	O
.	O

Thousands	O
of	O
children	O
have	O
since	O

to	O

and	O

210	O
patients	O
have	O

so	O
far	O
.	O

Cases	O
of	O
encephalitis	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
increase	O
with	O
the	O
arrival	O
of	O
monsoon	O
and	O
may	O
continue	O
till	O
December	O
[	O
2010	O
]	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
most	O
important	O
thing	O
is	O
awareness	O
among	O
the	O
people	O
.	O

Hygiene	O
is	O
necessary	O
because	O
Japanese	B-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
is	O
transmitted	O
by	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
need	O
to	O
control	O
mosquito	O
growth	O
and	O
ensure	O
personal	O
hygiene	O
.	O

Japanese	B-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
can	O
thus	O
be	O
reduced	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dr	O
AK	O
Pandey	O
,	O
Research	O
Officer	O
at	O
the	O
National	O
Institute	O
of	O
Virology	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
specialists	O
,	O
the	O
vaccine	O
for	O
encephalitis	O
should	O
be	O
administered	O
around	O
3	O
months	O
before	O
the	O
monsoons	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
administration	O
has	O
not	O
taken	O
up	O
such	O
a	O
step	O
so	O
far	O
.	O

In	O
2006	O
,	O
the	O
government	O
had	O
launched	O
an	O

vaccination	O
campaign	O
but	O
only	O
a	O

children	O
were	O
benefited	O
by	O
the	O
campaign	O
.	O

Encephalitis	O
generally	O
affects	O
children	O
between	O
the	O
ages	O
of	O
1-15	O
years	O
.	O

Colorado	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Public	O
Health	O
and	O
Environment	O
has	O
investigated	O
several	O
cases	O
of	O
confirmed	O
or	O
suspected	O
foodborne	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
in	O
the	O
state	O
since	O
September	O
2020	O
.	O

Testing	O
from	O
CDC	O
confirmed	O
4	O
of	O
the	O
cases	O
.	O

One	O
is	O
still	O
under	O
investigation	O
and	O
test	O
results	O
are	O
pending	O
.	O

All	O
5	O
cases	O
occurred	O
along	O
the	O
Front	O
Range	O
.	O

The	O
individuals	O
are	O
either	O
hospitalized	O
or	O
recovering	O
.	O

3	O
of	O
the	O
cases	O
appear	O
to	O
be	O
unrelated	O
as	O
no	O
common	O
food	O
item	O
was	O

.	O

2	O

cases	O
were	O
likely	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
an	O
improperly	O
canned	O
shared	O
food	O
made	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
household	O
.	O

``	O
5	O
cases	O
of	O
foodborne	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
in	O
the	O
span	O
of	O
a	O
few	O
months	O
is	O
unusual	O
in	O
Colorado	B-Province
and	O
is	O
cause	O
for	O
concern	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Nicole	O
Comstock	O
,	O
deputy	O
branch	O
chief	O
,	O
communicable	O
disease	O
branch	O
.	O

``	O
Botulism	O
does	O
not	O
spread	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
,	O
so	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
risk	O
to	O
the	O
public	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
these	O
cases	O
are	O
a	O
good	O
reminder	O
of	O
how	O
important	O
it	O
is	O
to	O
properly	O
preserve	O
and	O
handle	O
food	O
in	O
the	O
home	O
.	O
''	O

A	O
variety	O
of	O
foods	O
can	O
be	O
associated	O
with	O
foodborne	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
,	O
including	O
homemade	O
foods	O
that	O
were	O
improperly	O
canned	O
or	O
preserved	O
.	O

The	O
most	O
common	O
source	O
of	O
home	O
canning	O
related	O
botulism	O
cases	O
come	O
from	O
foods	O
with	O
a	O
low	O
acid	O
content	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
chiles	O
,	O
green	O
beans	O
,	O
potatoes	O
,	O
beets	O
,	O
corn	O
,	O
and	O
asparagus	O
.	O

Prior	O

to	O
have	O
_Dickeya	O
solani_	O
.	O

*	O
*	O
*	O
*	O
*	O
*	O
[	O
2	O
]	O
_Dickeya_	O
stem	O
and	O
root	O
rot	O
,	O
sweetpotato	O
-	O
China	O
:	O
1st	O
report	O
,	O
(	O
Guangdong	O
Province	O
)	O
Source	O
:	O
Plant	O
Disease	O
[	O
edited	O
]	O
Since	O
2006	O
,	O
stem	O
and	O
root	O
rot	O
of	O
sweetpotato	O
has	O
been	O
observed	O
in	O
fields	O
at	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
sweetpotato-production	O
areas	O
in	O
Guangdong	O
Province	O
.	O

Initially	O
,	O
the	O
leaves	O
turn	O
yellow	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
black	O
,	O
water-soaked	O
rot	O
occurs	O
on	O
the	O
bottom	O
of	O
the	O
stems	O
that	O
gradually	O
extends	O
to	O
the	O
top	O
of	O
the	O
stems	O
.	O

Finally	O
,	O
the	O
entire	O
plant	O
collapses	O
and	O
dies	O
.	O

Bacteria	O
were	O
consistently	O
isolated	O
from	O
stems	O
of	O
diseased	O
seedlings	O
.	O

Twelve	O
representative	O
isolates	O
chosen	O
for	O
further	O
characterization	O
were	O
similar	O
to	O
_Erwinia	O
chrysanthemi_	O
.	O

The	O
[	O
nucleotide	O
]	O
sequence	O
of	O
isolated	O
strain	O
H12	O
was	O
99	O
per	O
cent	O
identical	O
to	O
_E	O
.	O

chrysanthemi_	O
,	O
99	O
per	O
cent	O
identical	O
to	O
_Dickeya	O
dadantii_	O
,	O
and	O
98	O
per	O
cent	O
identical	O
to	O
_D	O
.	O

dianthicola_	O
.	O

Recently	O
,	O
_E	O
.	O

chrysanthemi_	O
was	O
transferred	O
to	O
_Dickeya_	O
gen.	O
nov.	O
Seedlings	O
were	O
injected	O
with	O
a	O
bacteria	O
suspension	O
.	O

One	O
to	O
2	O
days	O
after	O
inoculation	O
,	O
symptoms	O
were	O
observed	O
in	O
all	O
inoculated	O
plants	O
and	O
appeared	O
to	O
be	O
identical	O
to	O
those	O
observed	O
in	O
the	O
field	O
.	O

No	O
symptoms	O
were	O
noted	O
on	O
control	O
plants	O
.	O

The	O
bacterium	O
was	O
re-isolated	O
from	O
symptomatic	O
stems	O
of	O
sweetpotato	O
plants	O
.	O

This	O
pathogen	O
was	O
previously	O
reported	O
on	O
sweetpotato	O
in	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
in	O
1974	O
.	O

To	O
our	O
knowledge	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
report	O
of	O
a	O
_Dickeya_	O
sp	O
.	O

causing	O
bacterial	O
stem	O
and	O
root	O
rot	O
of	O
sweetpotato	O
in	O
China	O
.	O

From	O
various	O
reliable	O
diplomatic	O
sources	O
in	O
Manila	B-City
and	O
elsewhere	O
,	O
I	O
am	O
informed	O
that	O
it	O
all	O
started	O
when	O
a	O
carabao	O
(	O
water	O
buffalo	O
)	O
suddenly	O
became	O
lethargic	O
,	O
which	O
persisted	O
for	O
a	O
week	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
died	O
.	O

The	O
animal	O
was	O
eventually	O
slaughtered	O
and	O
eaten	O
by	O
some	O
local	O
citizens	O
.	O

Those	O
who	O
ate	O
the	O
meat	O
developed	O
somewhat	O
cutaneous-like	O
symptoms	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
such	O
as	O
skin	O
rashes	O
and	O
sore	O
muscles	O
,	O
and	O
other	O
signs	O
such	O
as	O
stomach	O
pains	O
,	O
headaches	O
,	O
difficulty	O
in	O
breathing	O
,	O
sore	O
throat	O
,	O
and	O
dry	O
cough	O
.	O

Although	O
these	O
symptoms	O
might	O
suggest	O
anthrax	B-Disease
,	O
it	O
was	O
not	O
confirmed	O
in	O
either	O
the	O
humans	O
or	O
the	O
carabao	O
.	O

In	O
relation	O
to	O
the	O
latter	O
,	O
they	O
collected	O
soil	O
samples	O
which	O
were	O
immediately	O
sent	O
to	O
the	O
diagnostic	O
laboratory	O
.	O

The	O
result	O
was	O
negative	O
.	O

Should	O
there	O
be	O
other	O
available	O
tests	O
to	O
confirm	O
the	O
result	O
,	O
they	O
are	O
more	O
than	O
willing	O
to	O
provide	O
samples	O
again	O
...	O
For	O
the	O
mean	O
time	O
,	O
continuous	O
livestock	O
vaccination	O
efforts	O
were	O
being	O
made	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
possible	O
occurrence	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
veterinary	O
service	O
also	O
employs	O
protocols	O
such	O
as	O
animal	O
movement	O
control	O
and	O
updating	O
of	O
database	O
of	O
animal	O
population	O
.	O

The	O
region	O
conducts	O
regular	O
updating	O
meetings	O
regarding	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Any	O
errors	O
in	O
this	O
are	O
my	O
fault	O
,	O
not	O
of	O
my	O
informants	O
.	O

Cases	O
of	O
hemorrhagic	O
fever	O
were	O
reported	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
Congo	O
that	O
is	O
facing	O
an	O
Ebola	B-Virus
epidemic	O
as	O
far	O
back	O
as	O
December	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
and	O
the	O
1st	O
deaths	O
were	O
reported	O
in	O
January	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
,	O
a	O
spokesman	O
for	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
said	O
,	O
as	O
4	O
new	O
suspected	O
cases	O
surfaced	O
.	O

...	O
An	O
interval	O
of	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
5	O
months	O
since	O
the	O
1st	O
infection	O
would	O
give	O
the	O
virus	O
time	O
potentially	O
to	O
have	O
infected	O
many	O
people	O
before	O
action	O
was	O
taken	O
to	O
contain	O
it	O
.	O

``	O
According	O
to	O
our	O
early	O
information	O
,	O
the	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
since	O
December	O
and	O
the	O
1st	O
deaths	O
were	O
reported	O
in	O
January	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
link	O
between	O
the	O
deaths	O
and	O
the	O
epidemic	O
has	O
not	O
yet	O
been	O
established	O
,	O
''	O
WHO	O
Congo	O
spokesman	O
Eugene	O
Kabambi	O
told	O
Reuters	O
.	O

The	O
health	O
ministry	O
said	O
on	O
it	O
had	O

Gideon	O

,	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
and	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Livestock	O
and	O
Fisheries	O
have	O
declared	O
a	O
Rift	B-Virus
Valley	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
(	O
RVF	O
)	O
outbreak	O
today	O
in	O
Yirol	B-City
East	O
,	O
Yirol	O
West	O
,	O
and	O
Awerial	O
Counties	O
of	O
Eastern	O
Lakes	B-Province
state	O
.	O

The	O
declaration	O
was	O
preceded	O
by	O
a	O
joint	O
high-level	O
advocacy	O
mission	O
led	O
by	O
the	O
Minister	O
of	O
Health	O
,	O
Dr	O
Riak	O
Gai	O
Kok	O
.	O

The	O
mission	O
,	O
comprised	O
of	O
representatives	O
from	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
,	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Livestock	O
and	O
Fisheries	O
,	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
(	O
WHO	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
Food	O
and	O
Agriculture	O
Organization	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
Nations	O
(	O
FAO	O
)	O
,	O
visited	O
Yirol	B-City
East	O
on	O
6	O
Mar	O
2018	O
to	O
consolidate	O
response	O
efforts	O
and	O
solicit	O
more	O
commitments	O
by	O
all	O
stakeholders	O
to	O
contain	O
the	O
outbreak	O
.	O

The	O
RVF	O
outbreak	O
was	O
1st	O
suspected	O
in	O
December	O
2017	O
.	O

Following	O
the	O
reported	O
cases	O
and	O
deaths	O
,	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
and	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Livestock	O
and	O
Fisheries	O
,	O
with	O
support	O
from	O
WHO	O
,	O
FAO	O
and	O
other	O
human	O
and	O
animal	O
experts	O
,	O
launched	O
a	O
multi-sectoral	O
response	O
in	O
the	O
context	O
of	O
One	O
Health	O
for	O
in-depth	O
investigations	O
to	O
establish	O
the	O
exact	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
reported	O
deaths	O
and	O
illnesses	O
in	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
.	O

One	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
7	O
animal	O
samples	O
tested	O
at	O
UVRI	O
(	O
Uganda	O
Virus	O
Research	O
Institute	O
)	O
was	O
positive	O
for	O
RVF	O
.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O
8	O
out	O
of	O
21	O
samples	O
collected	O
from	O
animals	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
RVF	O
at	O
the	O
World	O
Organisation	O
for	O
Animal	O
Health	O
(	O
OIE	O
)	O
reference	O
laboratory	O
in	O
South	O
Africa	O
.	O

A	O
joint	O
multi-sectoral	O
contingency	O
plan	O
has	O
been	O
developed	O
,	O
which	O
will	O
be	O
fully	O
rolled	O
out	O
in	O
Eastern	O
Lakes	B-Province
to	O
ensure	O
RVF	O
is	O
contained	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
involve	O
intensified	O
surveillance	O
in	O
both	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
,	O
risk	O
communication	O
,	O
and	O
case	O
management	O
.	O

RVF	O
is	O
a	O
viral	O
zoonotic	O
disease	O
that	O
primarily	O
affects	O
animals	O
,	O
but	O
also	O
has	O
the	O
capacity	O
to	O
infect	O
humans	O
.	O

People	O
are	O
infected	O
with	O
RVF	O
virus	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
blood	O
,	O
body	O
fluids	O
,	O
or	O
tissues	O
of	O
RVF	O
virus-infected	O
animals	O
,	O
mainly	O
livestock	O
.	O

This	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
can	O
occur	O
during	O
slaughter	O
or	O
veterinary	O
procedures	O
,	O
like	O
assisting	O
an	O
animal	O
giving	O
birth	O
.	O

Less	O
commonly	O
,	O
people	O
can	O
be	O
infected	O
with	O
RVF	O
virus	O
from	O
bites	O
of	O
infected	O
mosquitoes	O
and	O
,	O
rarely	O
,	O
from	O
other	O
biting	O
insects	O
that	O
have	O
the	O
virus	O
on	O
their	O
mouthparts	O
.	O

Spread	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
documented	O
.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
in	O
the	O
Colima	B-City
Prison	O
Colima	O
kills	O
5	O
prisoners	O
who	O
allegedly	O
exchanged	O
syringes	O
injecting	O
heroin	O
.	O

In	O
a	O
statement	O
,	O
the	O
authorities	O
of	O
health	O
and	O
safety	O
in	O
the	O
state	O
reported	O
that	O
there	O
are	O
20	O
more	O
who	O
have	O
this	O
same	O
disease	O
.	O

It	O
was	O
reported	O
that	O
the	O
heroin	O
was	O
smuggled	O
into	O
prison	O
by	O
people	O
who	O
hid	O
the	O
drug	O
in	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
.	O

The	O
drug	O
was	O
mixed	O
into	O
the	O
prison	O
with	O
potentially	O
toxic	O
products	O
to	O
dilute	O
it	O
and	O
sell	O
it	O
at	O
a	O
lower	O

.	O

``	O

acquire	O
the	O
narcotic	O
inside	O
prices	O
of	O
5	O
and	O
10	O
pesos	O
,	O
they	O

told	O

,	O
``	O

Arias	O
,	O
president	O
of	O
the	O
State	O

Human	O
Rights	O
in	O
Colima	B-City
.	O

is	O
not	O

that	O

of	O

has	O
also	O
to	O
do	O
with	O
the	O
state	O
and	O

of	O
food	O
into	O
the	O
prison	O
.	O

``	O

son	O
showed	O
me	O
some	O
lentils	O
that	O
were	O
in	O
bad	O

and	O

a	O

anthrax	B-Disease
,	O

2019	O
.	O

The	O

outbreak	O
in	O
Kisumu	B-Province
County	O

,	O

.	O

The	O

and	O

.	O

[	O
OO	O
]	O

.	O

The	O

after	O

of	O
a	O

.	O

.	O

and	O

.	O

Kisumu	B-Province
has	O

on	O

of	O

.	O

County	O

,	O

.	O

``	O

must	O

in	O
ideal	O
[	O
locations	O
]	O
and	O
the	O

before	O

is	O
taken	O
to	O
butcheries	O
for	O
sale	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dr	O
Odhiambo	O
.	O

A	O
mosquito-borne	O
virus	O
with	O
symptoms	O
similar	O
to	O
dengue	O
fever	O
is	O
spreading	O
rapidly	O
in	O
Burma	O
[	O
Myanmar	B-Country
]	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
doctors	O
who	O
asserted	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
that	O
it	O
has	O
a	O
low	O
fatality	O
rate	O
.	O

The	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
virus	O
only	O
became	O
commonplace	O
in	O
Burma	O
[	O
Myanmar	B-Country
]	O
in	O
mid-2009	O
,	O
although	O
cases	O
were	O
reported	O
as	O
far	O
back	O
as	O
1975	O
.	O

It	O
comes	O
as	O
doctors	O
warn	O
of	O
a	O
new	O
wave	O
of	O
the	O
A	O
(	O
H1N1	O
)	O
and	O
A	O
(	O
H5N1	O
)	O
viruses	O
in	O
Burma	O
[	O
Myanmar	B-Country
]	O
that	O
have	O
struck	O
more	O
than	O
60	O
people	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
fortnight	O
.	O

anthrax	B-Disease
.	O

Cutaneous	O
anthrax	B-Disease
occurs	O
when	O
the	O
spore	O
(	O
or	O
possibly	O
the	O
bacterium	O
)	O
enters	O
a	O

on	O

that	O

like	O

that	O
may	O

.	O

glands	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
may	O
swell	O
,	O
plus	O

may	O
be	O
present	O
.	O

This	O

of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
responds	O
well	O
to	O

.	O

if	O

goes	O
systemic	O
;	O

of	O

are	O
cutaneous	O
.	O

(	O
HFH	O
)	O
.	O

Two	O
patients	O
who	O
were	O
suffering	O
from	O
dengue	O
fever	O
were	O
mistakenly	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
Congo	O
fever	O
[	O
CCHF	O
]	O
.	O

Talking	O
to	O

,	O

Hayyat	O
said	O

hospital	O
mistakenly	O

got	O

test	O

and	O
Congo	O
[	O
CCHF	O
]	O
patients	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
National	O
Institute	O
of	O
Health	O
(	O
NIH	O
)	O
.	O

``	O

hospital	O
administration	O
received	O
information	O
of	O
test	O
reports	O
from	O
NIH	O
on	O

phone	O

2	O

for	O
dengue	O
[	O
fever	O
]	O

for	O
[	O
CCHF	O

.	O

for	O
37	O
inpatients	O

having	O
dengue	O
fever	O
.	O

promed	O
@	O
promedmail.org	O
.	O

During	O
November	O
2012	O
,	O
Estonia	O
,	O
Latvia	O
,	O
and	O
Lithuania	B-Country
have	O
informed	O
the	O
European	O
Commission	O
on	O
the	O
detection	O
of	O
a	O
significant	O
number	O
of	O
animals	O
,	O
mostly	O
cattle	O
,	O
serologically	O
positive	O
to	O
bluetongue	B-Disease
virus	I-Disease
.	O

In	O
the	O
3	O
countries	O
,	O
the	O
samples	O
were	O
taken	O
in	O
the	O
framework	O
of	O
the	O
bluetongue	O
surveillance	O
.	O

Serologically	O
positive	O
samples	O
were	O
analyzed	O
by	O
RT-PCR	O
and	O
found	O
negative	O
in	O
all	O
cases	O
except	O
in	O
Lithuania	B-Country
where	O
15	O
animals	O
showed	O
an	O
equivocal	O
result	O
.	O

Poland	O
has	O
reported	O
that	O
,	O
similarly	O
within	O
the	O
framework	O
of	O
the	O
bluetongue	O
surveillance	O
,	O
3	O
cattle	O
farms	O
have	O
been	O
found	O
to	O
include	O
positive	O
animals	O
both	O
serologically	O
as	O
well	O
by	O
RT-PCR	O
.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O
sequencing	O
was	O
performed	O
leading	O
to	O
the	O
identification	O
of	O
a	O
virus	O
highly	O
compatible	O
with	O
BTV	O
serotype	O
14	O
.	O

Positive	O
farms	O
are	O
located	O
on	O
the	O
border	O
with	O
Belarus	O
and	O
Lithuania	B-Country
.	O

All	O
4	O
countries	O
have	O
implemented	O
the	O
following	O
measures	O
:	O
animal	O
movement	O
restrictions	O
in	O
the	O
positive	O
farms	O
and	O
epidemiological	O
investigations	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
around	O
them	O
.	O

All	O
positive	O
samples	O
have	O
been	O
sent	O
to	O
the	O
Community	O
Reference	O
Laboratory	O
(	O
Pirbright	O
)	O
for	O
confirmation	O
and	O
virus	O
sequencing	O
.	O

It	O
has	O
been	O
recommended	O
to	O
the	O
Veterinary	O
Services	O
of	O
the	O
Autonomous	O
Communities	O
to	O
exercise	O

to	O

susceptible	O
to	O

which	O
have	O

from	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

by	O

.	O

against	O

plague	I-Disease
:	O
-	O

from	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

1st	O

``	O

bees	O
,	O
even	O
in	O
tiny	O
amounts	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
now	O
widely	O
used	O
to	O
protect	O
corn	O
,	O
soy	O
,	O
and	O
wheat	O
seed	O
.	O

The	O
pesticide	O
is	O
water-soluble	O
and	O
persists	O
in	O
the	O
environment	O
for	O
several	O
years	O
.	O

Neonicotinoids	O
were	O
recently	O
banned	O
in	O
Europe	O
while	O
more	O
research	O
is	O
being	O
done	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Ontario	B-Province
Bee	O
Keepers	O
Association	O
,	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
acute	O
poisonings	O
like	O
this	O
is	O
mounting	O
this	O
summer	O
and	O
the	O
total	O
number	O
of	O
incidents	O
is	O
expected	O
to	O
surpass	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2012	O
]	O
when	O
240	O
were	O
reported	O
.	O

Laboratory	O
testing	O
confirmed	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
neonicotinoids	O
in	O
80	O
per	O
cent	O
of	O
those	O
cases	O
.	O

Today	O
inspectors	O
from	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
collected	O
samples	O
for	O
testing	O
to	O
see	O
if	O
the	O
pesticide	O
or	O
something	O
else	O
is	O
killing	O
these	O
bees	O
.	O

Results	O
are	O
not	O
expected	O
for	O
several	O
months	O
.	O

Health	O
Canada	B-Country
is	O
currently	O
re-evaluating	O
at	O
least	O
7	O
crop	O
protection	O
products	O
that	O
contain	O
the	O
chemical	O
.	O

In	O
July	O
[	O
2013	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
province	O
created	O

.	O

[	O

the	O

.	O

,	O

.	O

of	O

Septicemic	O
plague	B-Disease
accounts	O
for	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
25	O
percent	O
of	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
cases	O
.	O

Septicemic	O
plague	B-Disease
has	O
no	O
specific	O
features	O
or	O
detectable	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
node	O
,	O
by	O
which	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
distinguished	O
from	O
other	O
infectious	O
diseases	O
,	O
although	O
abdominal	O
pain	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
and	O
diarrhea	O
are	O
common	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
fatal	O
illness	O
in	O
people	O
that	O
occurs	O
in	O
many	O
parts	O
of	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
.	O

It	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
bacteria	O
found	O
in	O
rodents	O
,	O
especially	O
ground	O
squirrels	O
,	O
rabbits	O
,	O
and	O
hares	O
.	O

Most	O
human	O
cases	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
are	O
acquired	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
.	O

Dogs	O
and	O
cats	O
are	O
also	O
susceptible	O
to	O
plague	B-Disease
and	O
are	O
infected	O
either	O
through	O
bites	O
of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
or	O
by	O
eating	O
an	O
animal	O
that	O
has	O
died	O
from	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
people	O
usually	O
develop	O
2	O
to	O
8	O
days	O
after	O
exposure	O
.	O

Typical	O
symptoms	O
include	O
sudden	O
fever	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
headaches	O
,	O
and	O
swelling	O
of	O
the	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
in	O
the	O
neck	O
,	O
armpit	O
,	O
or	O
groin	O
areas	O
.	O

As	O
stated	O
earlier	O
,	O
no	O
detectable	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
node	O
is	O
found	O
in	O
cases	O
of	O
primary	O
septicemic	O
plague	B-Disease
.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
serious	O
infectious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
gram-positive	O
,	O
rod-shaped	O
bacteria	O
known	O
as	O
_Bacillus	O
anthracis_	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
information	O
posted	O
on	O
the	O
website	O
of	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
.	O

Although	O
it	O
is	O
rare	O
,	O
people	O
can	O
get	O
sick	O
with	O
anthrax	B-Disease
if	O
they	O
come	O
into	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
or	O
contaminated	O
animal	O
products	O
.	O

Signs	O
and	O
symptoms	O
can	O
range	O
from	O
skin	O
sores	O
to	O
vomiting	O
and	O
shock	O
.	O

Rapid	O
treatment	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
can	O
cure	O
most	O
anthrax	B-Disease
infections	O
.	O

``	O
The	O

of	O
infection	O
is	O
hand	O
to	O
mouth	O
.	O

_Shigella	O
flexneri_	O
is	O
an	O
endemic	O
bacterium	O
,	O
which	O
circulates	O
in	O
the	O
population	O
throughout	O
the	O
year	O
.	O

As	O
the	O
temperature	O
increases	O
,	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
circulation	O
increases	O
.	O

It	O
occurs	O
in	O
places	O
where	O
cleaning	O
is	O
not	O
taken	O
care	O
of	O
and	O
where	O
there	O
is	O
not	O
good	O
handling	O
of	O
the	O
food	O
or	O
the	O
cold	O
chain	O
.	O

When	O
it	O
occurs	O
in	O
enclosed	O
establishments	O
,	O
as	O
happened	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
in	O
a	O
school	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
affect	O
many	O
people	O
.	O

The	O
solution	O
is	O
to	O
take	O
the	O
appropriate	O
measures	O
so	O
that	O
the	O
bacterium	O
disappears	O
,	O
''	O
said	O

.	O

in	O
August	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
and	O
is	O
still	O
the	O
case	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
not	O
clear	O
what	O
they	O
die	O
from	O
.	O

We	O
have	O
been	O
raising	O
livestock	O
for	O
50	O
years	O
,	O
but	O
we	O
have	O
never	O
seen	O
anything	O
like	O
this	O
,	O
``	O
said	O
[	O
KK	O
]	O
,	O
a	O
resident	O
of	O
the	O
Baikenzhe	O
village	O
.	O

On	O
average	O
,	O
an	O
animal	O
is	O
sick	O
for	O
about	O
10	O
days	O
,	O
does	O
not	O
really	O
eat	O
,	O
loses	O
weight	O
,	O
then	O
dies	O
.	O

Treatment	O
is	O
ineffective	O
.	O

The	O
stallion	O
does	O
not	O
allow	O
sick	O
horses	O
to	O
approach	O
the	O
herd	O
,	O
the	O
TV	O
channel	O
reports	O
.	O

The	O
veterinary	O
inspection	O
said	O
that	O
the	O
people	O
themselves	O
are	O
to	O
blame	O
for	O
the	O
incident	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
from	O
which	O
horses	O
die	O
is	O
gastrofiliasis	B-Disease
caused	O
by	O
the	O
larvae	O
of	O
the	O
horse	O
botfly	O
.	O

They	O
get	O
on	O
the	O
animal	O
when	O
they	O
graze	O
in	O
the	O
steppe	O
.	O

``	O
This	O
year	O
it	O
was	O
very	O
hot	O
,	O
there	O
was	O
no	O
rain	O
.	O

The	O
animals	O
need	O
special	O
care	O
;	O
it	O
was	O
necessary	O
to	O
graze	O
in	O
the	O

,	O
not	O
during	O
the	O
day	O
.	O

They	O

,	O

so	O

,	O

Panicle	O
blight	O
is	O
affecting	O
Louisiana	O
rice	O
as	O
farmers	O
in	O
the	O
southern	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
state	O
are	O
gearing	O
up	O
for	O
harvest	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
Johnny	O
Saichuk	O
,	O
Louisiana	O
State	O
University	O
(	O
LSU	O
)	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
that	O
conditions	O
have	O
been	O
ideal	O
for	O
the	O
disease	O
with	O
hot	O
nighttime	O
temperatures	O
when	O
the	O
rice	O
plants	O
were	O
flowering	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
the	O
problem	O
is	O
not	O
isolated	O
to	O
Louisiana	B-Province
.	O

``	O
Rice	O
in	O
Texas	B-Province
is	O
getting	O
nailed	O
.	O
''	O

Saichuk	O
said	O
the	O
best	O
prevention	O
for	O
panicle	O
blight	O
is	O
to	O
plant	O
early	O
so	O
the	O
plants	O
are	O
in	O
the	O
flowering	O
stage	O
before	O
the	O
hottest	O
days	O
of	O
summer	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
effects	O
differ	O
among	O
varieties	O
.	O

'Jupiter	O
'	O
appears	O
to	O
have	O
resistance	O
,	O
while	O
CL111	O
is	O
susceptible	O
.	O

Saichuk	O
estimated	O
Louisiana	B-Province
has	O
550	O
000	O
acres	O
of	O
rice	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2010	O
]	O
,	O
roughly	O
80	O
000	O
acres	O
more	O
than	O
2009	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
the	O
crop	O
was	O
planted	O
late	O
,	O
and	O
farmers	O
were	O
late	O
to	O
flood	O
their	O
fields	O
.	O

of	O
12	O

today	O

a	O
total	O

:	O

cases	O
of	O

infection	I-Disease

.	O

(	O

.	O

.	O

,	O

Maha	B-Province

.	O

,	O

fever	I-Disease
has	O

of	O

.	O

number	O
of	O

has	O

the	O
doctor	O
afraid	O
that	O
dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
will	O

more	O

the	O

local	O

of	O
the	O

of	O
Public	O

to	O
spray	O

to	O

rid	O
of	O
common	O
house	O
mosquitoes	O
in	O
areas	O
near	O

and	O

.	O

From	O
until	O
the	O

,	O
there	O
have	O

with	O
dengue	B-Virus

,	O
a	O

for	O
every	O
100	O
000	O
in	O
the	O

population	O
,	O
the	O

said	O
.	O

infected	O
patient	O
who	O

in	O
Amphur	O
Muang	O
was	O
an	O
18-year-old	O
female	O

of	O

dropped	O

,	O

until	O
she	O
died	O
on	O
.	O

district	O
with	O
the	O
highest	O
rate	O
of	O
infection	O
was	O
Muang	O
Maha	B-Province
Sarakham	I-Province
,	O
followed	O
in	O

by	O

and	O

.	O

The	O
3	O

of	O

by	O

,	O
and	O
ages	O
15-24	O
.	O

Since	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
cure	O
or	O
treatment	O
for	O
dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
,	O
the	O
best	O
method	O
is	O
prevention	O
.	O

The	O
doctor	O
advised	O

with	O
children	O
to	O
take	O
precautions	O
to	O
prevent	O
youngsters	O
from	O
being	O
bitten	O
by	O
infected	O

.	O

The	O

recommended	O
that	O
parents	O
get	O
rid	O
of	O
water	O
sources	O
where	O
the	O
mosquitoes	O

as	O
containers	O
left	O
outdoors	O
,	O
or	O

and	O

areas	O
.	O

They	O
should	O
either	O

the	O
water	O
or	O
put	O

sand	O
in	O
the	O
water	O
.	O

of	O

fever	I-Disease
can	O

.	O

develop	O

and	O
organ	O
failure	O
,	O
which	O
may	O
turn	O
fatal	O
,	O
if	O
left	O
untreated	O
.	O

Doxycycline	O
antibiotic	O
is	O
usually	O
administered	O
to	O
scrub	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
patients	O
.	O

Members	O
of	O
the	O
Kozhikode	B-City
district	O
vector	O
control	O
unit	O
inspected	O
the	O
colony	O
,	O
though	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
reported	O
that	O
the	O
disease-carrying	O
larval	O
mites	O
were	O
yet	O
to	O
be	O
spotted	O
there	O
.	O

Awareness	O

were	O

in	O
the	O
area	O
and	O
the	O
grama	O
panchayat	O
(	O

)	O

to	O
conduct	O

on	O
.	O

Health	O

sources	O
pointed	O
out	O
that	O
a	O
dozen	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
of	O
scrub	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
and	O
2	O
deaths	O
had	O

the	O
district	O
so	O
far	O
this	O
month	O
.	O

An	O

for	O
bunchy	O
top	O
(	O

)	O
and	O
moko	B-Disease

of	I-Disease

.	O

All	O

are	O
on	O

race	O
4	O
(	O

)	O
and	O
none	O
on	O

banana	B-Virus
bunchy	I-Virus
top	I-Virus
virus	O
.	O

Its	O

on	O
production	O

.	O

.	O

A	O

a	O

as	O

a	O

disease	O
for	O
both	O

and	O
horses	O
.	O

The	O
North	O
Bay/Parry	O
Sound	O
District	O
Health	O
Unit	O
has	O
been	O
informed	O
by	O
Ontario	B-Province
Ministry	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
,	O
Food	O
and	O
Rural	O
Affairs	O
,	O
and	O
Public	O
Health	O
Ontario	O
of	O
a	O
dead	O
horse	O
in	O
the	O
Sundridge	B-City
area	O
testing	O
positive	O
for	O
eastern	B-Virus
equine	I-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
virus	O
(	O
EEEv	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
risk	O
of	O
a	O
person	O
being	O
infected	O
with	O
EEEv	O
remains	O
extremely	O
low	O
.	O

There	O
has	O
never	O
been	O
a	O
human	O
case	O
of	O
EEEv	O
reported	O
in	O
Ontario	B-Province
or	O
Canada	B-Country
,	O
although	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
in	O
horses	O
and	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

Eastern	B-Virus
equine	I-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
virus	O
that	O
causes	O
inflammation	O
of	O
the	O
brain	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
acquired	O
when	O
bitten	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
mosquito	O
.	O

Horses	O
or	O
people	O
infected	O
with	O
EEEv	O
can	O
not	O
spread	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

In	O
2015	O
,	O
the	O
Health	O
Unit	O
's	O
mosquito	O
surveillance	O
program	O
had	O
no	O
mosquito	O
pools	O
test	O
positive	O
for	O
EEEv	O
.	O

The	O
last	O
time	O
our	O
district	O
had	O
a	O
positive	O
EEEv	O
mosquito	O
pool	O
was	O
5	O
years	O
ago	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
Parry	O
Sound	O
District	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
being	O
infected	O
by	O
EEEv	O
during	O
active	O
mosquito	O
season	O
by	O
doing	O
the	O
following	O
:	O
-	O
Cover	O
your	O
skin	O
when	O
outside	O
by	O
wearing	O
long	O
pants	O
and	O
loose	O
fitting	O
shirts	O
with	O
long	O
sleeves	O
.	O

-	O
Use	O
insect	O
repellent	O
containing	O
DEET	O
.	O

The	O
concentration	O
of	O
DEET	O
should	O
be	O
no	O
greater	O
than	O
30	O
percent	O
for	O
adults	O
,	O
no	O
greater	O
than	O
10	O
percent	O
for	O
children	O
and	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
used	O
on	O
children	O
under	O
6	O
months	O
old	O
.	O

-	O
Eliminate	O
standing	O
water	O
on	O
your	O
property	O
as	O
this	O
is	O
where	O
mosquitoes	O
lay	O
their	O
eggs	O
.	O

Health	O
protection	O
officers	O
are	O
investigating	O
an	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
outbreak	O
in	O
Plymouth	B-City
believed	O
to	O
be	O
linked	O
to	O
crab	O
meat	O
.	O

Environmental	O
health	O
officers	O
and	O
the	O
Health	O
Protection	O
Agency	O
(	O
HPA	O
)	O
launched	O
an	O
inquiry	O
after	O
9	O
cases	O
were	O
confirmed	O
in	O
the	O
city	O
.	O

It	O

to	O

1st	O

of	O
the	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
O157	O
strain	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
consumption	O
of	O
crab	O
.	O

The	O
investigation	O
is	O
continuing	O
but	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
suspected	O
link	O
with	O
an	O
unapproved	O
crab	O
supplier	O
.	O

Investigators	O
revealed	O
they	O

action	O
after	O
9	O
cases	O

in	O
August	O
2011	O
.	O

There	O
have	O

no	O

.	O

(	O

.	O
''	O

''	O

cases	O

of	O

away	O
from	O
home	O
.	O

At	O

the	O
Chikungunya	B-Virus

fever	I-Disease

within	O

6	O

District	B-City

a	O

on	O
.	O

According	O
to	O

,	O
66	O

of	O

Chikungunya	B-Virus

[	O
2017	O
]	O
in	O

,	O

patients	O
toll	O
to	O
3190	O
in	O
the	O
metropolitan	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
.	O

It	O
said	O
22	O
cases	O
were	O
reported	O
from	O
Malir	O
,	O
2	O
from	O
District	B-City
East	I-City
and	O
42	O
from	O
District	B-City
West	I-City
.	O

Out	O
of	O
the	O
298	O
samples	O
tested	O
for	O
disease	O
diagnosis	O
at	O
the	O
National	O
Institute	O
of	O
Health	O
Islamabad	O
,	O
246	O
were	O
found	O
positive	O
for	O
Chikungunya	B-Virus
,	O
the	O
report	O
added	O
.	O

Chikungunya	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
,	O
non-lethal	O
viral	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
species	O
of	O
mosquitoes	O
called	O
_Aedes	O
aegypti_	O
,	O
which	O
also	O
carry	O
the	O
dengue	O
and	O
zika	O
viruses	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
experts	O
,	O
the	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
virus	O
causes	O
fever	O
and	O
severe	O
joint	O
pain	O
,	O
while	O
other	O
symptoms	O
include	O
muscle	O
pain	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
nausea	O
,	O
fatigue	O
and	O
rashes	O
.	O

A	O
9-member	O
delegation	O
of	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
also	O
visited	O
Karachi	B-City
in	O
May	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
to	O
help	O
health	O
authorities	O
prevent	O
the	O
Chikungunya	B-Virus
disease	O
from	O

in	O
the	O
metropolis	O
.	O

On	O
at	O
about	O
4:00	O
pm	O
,	O
Xicheng	O
[	O
Beijing	B-Province
]	O
District	O
Disease	O
Control	O

.	O

.	O
''	O

on	O

outbreak	O
was	O

``	O
was	O

this	O

At	O

the	O
problem	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
,	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
bacterium	O
_Salmonella	O
[	O
enterica_	O
serotype	O
]	O
Typhi	O
,	O
is	O
a	O
life-threatening	O
bacterial	O
infection	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
is	O
still	O
common	O
in	O
the	O
developing	O
world	O
,	O
where	O
it	O
affects	O
about	O
21	O
million	O
people	O
annually	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
can	O
be	O
successfully	O
treated	O
with	O
appropriate	O
antibacterials	O
,	O
and	O
treated	O
persons	O
usually	O
begin	O
to	O
feel	O
better	O
within	O
2	O
to	O
3	O
days	O
.	O

Farmers	O
should	O
not	O
underestimate	O
the	O
black	B-Disease
streaked	I-Disease
dwarf	I-Disease
rice	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
,	O
which	O
has	O
been	O
causing	O
widespread	O
panic	O
because	O
of	O
its	O
complicated	O
development	O
and	O
unexpected	O
consequences	O
,	O
according	O
to	O

.	O

was	O

at	O
some	O

that	O

.	O

,	O

.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
World	O

Organisation	O
,	O
measles	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
highly	O
contagious	O
,	O
serious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
virus	O
.	O

In	O

,	O
before	O

measles	B-Virus
caused	O
an	O
estimated	O
2.6	O

each	O
year	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
remains	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
leading	O
causes	O
of	O
death	O
among	O
young	O
children	O
globally	O
,	O
despite	O
the	O
availability	O
of	O
a	O
safe	O
and	O

vaccine	O
.	O

Approximately	O
145	O
700	O

died	O
from	O
measles	B-Virus
in	O
2013	O
--	O
mostly	O
children	O
under	O
the	O
age	O
of	O
5	O
.	O

A	O
Boulder	B-City
resident	O
is	O

of	O

to	O
contract	O

.	O

.	O

Officials	O

the	O

,	O
saying	O

should	O
be	O

while	O
working	O
outside	O
of	O
dead	O

.	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
is	O
transmitted	O
by	O
contact	O
with	O
dead	O
animals	O
,	O
particularly	O
through	O
tick	O
and	O
deer	O
fly	O
bites	O
,	O
or	O
skin	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
.	O

Rabbits	O
and	O
rodents	O
are	O
most	O
commonly	O
carriers	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Officials	O
listed	O
some	O
top	O
tips	O
for	O
avoiding	O
contracting	O
the	O
disease	O
:	O
-	O
Use	O
a	O
long-handled	O

to	O
pick	O
up	O
dead	O
animals	O
,	O
double	O
bagging	O
them	O
to	O
dispose	O
of	O
their	O

.	O

-	O
While	O
working	O
outside	O
,	O
use	O
DEET-infused	O
insect	O
repellants	O
.	O

-	O
Wash	O
any	O
cuts	O
or	O
scratches	O
incurred	O
from	O
outdoors	O
work	O
as	O
quickly	O
as	O
possible	O
.	O

-	O
Do	O
n't	O
let	O
pets	O
drink	O
from	O
groundwater	O
.	O

-	O
Never	O
mow	O
over	O
animal	O
carcasses	O
.	O

See	O
a	O
doctor	O
immediately	O
if	O
you	O
quickly	O
contract	O
a	O
fever	O
or	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
after	O
outside	O
work	O
.	O

A	O
man	O

to	O
the	O
diphtheria	B-Disease
.	O

The	O
27-year-old	O
was	O

to	O

last	O
night	O
,	O
with	O

confirming	O
he	O
was	O
infected	O
within	O
Australia	B-Country
.	O

The	O

and	O

Hospital	O
and	O

are	O
contacting	O
all	O
people	O
the	O
man	O
was	O
in	O
contact	O
with	O
in	O

.	O

as	O
to	O
how	O
the	O
man	O
contracted	O
the	O

.	O

A	O

of	O

man	O
had	O
n't	O

.	O

against	O

,	O
and	O

have	O

.	O

The	O

of	O

rushed	O
to	O

that	O
may	O
have	O
come	O
into	O

with	O
the	O
man	O

he	O
contracted	O
the	O

.	O

A	O
spokeswoman	O
said	O
several	O
people	O
were	O
treated	O
with	O
vaccinations	O
this	O
morning	O
a	O
precautionary	O
measure	O
.	O

Cases	O
of	O
diphtheria	B-Disease
are	O
rare	O
in	O
Australia	B-Country
due	O
to	O
the	O
introduction	O
of	O
an	O
effective	O
vaccine	O
,	O
but	O
a	O
century	O
ago	O
diphtheria	O
was	O
the	O
most	O
common	O
infectious	O
cause	O
of	O
death	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
Queensland	B-Province
Health	O
.	O

Outbreaks	O
still	O
occur	O
in	O
countries	O
with	O
low	O
vaccination	O
rates	O
.	O

In	O
2015	O
,	O
there	O
were	O
about	O
4500	O
cases	O
worldwide	O
,	O
down	O
from	O
about	O
100	O
000	O
cases	O
in	O
1980	O
.	O

The	O
number	O
of	O
people	O
affected	O
by	O
the	O
Fiji	B-Country

outbreak	O
continues	O
to	O

a	O

cases	O

this	O

,	O

to	O

.	O

A	O

of	O

,	O

of	O

in	O
the	O
Northern	O
[	O

]	O
.	O

The	O

``	O
