''	O

The	O
Nebraska	B-Province
Game	O
and	O
Parks	O
Commission	O
says	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
is	O
killing	O
deer	O
along	O
the	O
Platte	B-City
River	I-City
and	O
possibly	O
over	O
a	O
much	O
wider	O
area	O
.	O

Epizootic	B-Virus
hemorrhagic	I-Virus
disease	I-Virus
spreads	O
from	O
deer	O
to	O
deer	O
by	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
a	O
small	O
flying	O
insect	O
known	O
as	O
a	O
midge	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
causes	O
hemorrhaging	O
within	O
the	O
body	O
.	O

A	O
high	O
fever	O
may	O
result	O
,	O
causing	O
the	O
deer	O
to	O
seek	O
water	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
why	O
deer	O
killed	O
by	O
the	O
disease	O
usually	O
are	O
found	O
in	O
or	O
near	O
water	O
.	O

The	O
deer	O
may	O
show	O
bleeding	O
from	O
body	O
openings	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
threat	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

The	O
commission	O
wants	O
people	O
to	O
report	O
any	O
deer	O
deaths	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
attributed	O
to	O
this	O
disease	O
to	O
their	O
nearest	O
Game	O
and	O
Parks	O
office	O
.	O

The	O
Virginia	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
and	O
Consumer	O
Services	O
(	O
VDACS	O
)	O
announced	O
on	O
27	O
Aug	O
2018	O
that	O
another	O
horse	O
from	O
the	O
Hampton	B-City
Roads	I-City
area	O
had	O
contracted	O
eastern	B-Virus
equine	I-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
[	O
EEE	O
]	O
via	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O
mosquito	O
and	O
has	O
been	O
euthanized	O
.	O

The	O
animal	O
,	O
an	O
American	O
Quarter	O
Horse	O
stabled	O
in	O
Chesapeake	O
,	O
is	O
the	O
2nd	O
to	O
be	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
EEE	O
and	O
the	O
2nd	O
fatality	O
from	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
August	O
2018	O
.	O

Earlier	O
in	O
August	O
2018	O
,	O
a	O
Quarter	O
Horse	O
mare	O
stabled	O
in	O
the	O
Suffolk	O
area	O
also	O
succumbed	O
to	O
the	O
illness	O
,	O
which	O
has	O
a	O
fatality	O
rate	O
of	O
80-90	O
percent	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
VDACS	O
,	O
both	O
of	O
the	O
horses	O
had	O
an	O
``	O
incomplete	O
vaccination	O
history	O
.	O
''	O

For	O
full	O
effectiveness	O
,	O
horses	O
must	O
receive	O
the	O
initial	O
vaccination	O
and	O
a	O
booster	O
,	O
then	O
be	O
re-vaccinated	O
every	O
6-12	O
months	O
,	O
said	O
Elaine	O
Lidholm	O
,	O
communications	O
director	O
for	O
VDACS	O
.	O

Sometimes	O
called	O
sleeping	O
sickness	O
,	O
Lidholm	O
said	O
EEE	O
is	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
illness	O
causing	O
inflammation	O
or	O
swelling	O
of	O
the	O
brain	O
and	O
spinal	O
cord	O
.	O

Signs	O
include	O
impaired	O
vision	O
,	O
aimless	O
wandering	O
,	O
head	O
pressing	O
,	O
circling	O
,	O
inability	O
to	O
swallow	O
,	O
irregular	O
staggering	O
gait	O
,	O
paralysis	O
,	O
convulsions	O
and	O
death	O
.	O

Once	O
a	O
horse	O
has	O
been	O
bitten	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
mosquito	O
,	O
it	O
may	O
take	O
3	O
to	O
10	O
days	O
for	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
to	O
appear	O
.	O

Besides	O
vaccination	O
,	O
recommended	O
prevention	O
methods	O
include	O
eliminating	O
standing	O
water	O
that	O
can	O
provide	O
breeding	O
sites	O
for	O
mosquitoes	O
,	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
insect	O
repellents	O
,	O
and	O
removing	O
animals	O
from	O
mosquito-infested	O
areas	O
during	O
peak	O
biting	O
times	O
,	O
usually	O
dusk	O
to	O
dawn	O
.	O

Garvin	O
said	O
horse	O
owners	O
should	O
consult	O
their	O
veterinarians	O
if	O
an	O
animal	O
exhibits	O
any	O
neurological	O
signs	O
such	O
as	O
a	O

,	O

down	O
,	O
facial	O
paralysis	O
,	O

,	O
or	O

in	O

.	O

Why	O
you	O
should	O
take	O
note	O
?	O

The	O
Public	O
Health	O
Agency	O
of	O
Canada	B-Country
is	O
collaborating	O
with	O
federal	O
and	O
provincial	O

health	O

to	O
investigate	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
_Escherichia	O
coli_	O
,	O
called	O
_E.coli_	O
O121	O
.	O

The	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
identified	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
investigation	O
is	O
ongoing	O
.	O

The	O
risk	O
to	O
Canadians	O
is	O
low	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
Canadians	O
are	O
reminded	O
to	O
follow	O
safe	O
food	O
handling	O
practices	O
to	O
avoid	O
illness	O
.	O

Investigation	O
Summary	O
There	O
have	O
been	O
24	O
cases	O
of	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
O121	O
with	O
a	O
matching	O

4	O

:	O
British	B-Province
Columbia	I-Province
(	O

(	O
4	O
)	O
,	O

(	O
3	O
)	O

(	O
5	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

These	O

.	O

into	O

.	O

What	O
the	O
Government	O
of	O
Canada	B-Country
is	O
doing	O
The	O
Government	O
of	O
Canada	O
is	O
committed	O
to	O
food	O
safety	O
.	O

The	O
Public	O
Health	O
Agency	O
of	O
Canada	B-Country
leads	O
multi-jurisdictional	O
human	O
health	O
investigations	O
of	O
outbreaks	O
and	O
is	O
in	O
regular	O
contact	O
with	O
its	O
federal	O
and	O
provincial	O
partners	O
to	O
monitor	O
and	O
take	O

steps	O
to	O
address	O
outbreaks	O
.	O

Health	O
Canada	B-Country
provides	O
food-related	O
health	O
risk	O
assessments	O
to	O
determine	O
if	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
a	O
certain	O
substance	O
or	O
microorganism	O
poses	O
a	O
health	O
risk	O
to	O
consumers	O
.	O

The	O
Canadian	O
Food	O
Inspection	O
Agency	O
(	O
CFIA	O
)	O
conducts	O
food	O
safety	O
investigations	O
into	O
the	O
possible	O
food	O
source	O
of	O
an	O
outbreak	O
.	O

The	O
Government	O
of	O
Canada	B-Country
will	O
continue	O
to	O
update	O
Canadians	O
if	O
new	O
information	O
related	O
to	O
this	O
investigation	O
becomes	O
available	O
.	O

,	O
68	O
,	O

[	O

of	O

.	O

Crimean-Congo	B-Virus
hemorrhagic	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
virus	O
,	O
the	O
main	O
transmission	O
mechanism	O
of	O
which	O
is	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
_Hyalomma_	O
genus	O
tick	O

although	O

can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
patient	O
's	O
blood	O
or	O
fluids	O

which	O
can	O
occur	O
especially	O
in	O
healthcare	O
personnel	O
when	O
they	O
are	O
not	O
properly	O
protected	O
.	O

Bovine	B-Disease
tuberculosis	I-Disease
was	O

]	O

's	O

supposed	O
to	O
be	O
happening	O
did	O
happen	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
that	O
consumer	O
public	O
health	O
,	O
food	O
safety	O
is	O
protected	O
.	O
''	O

Bovine	O
TB	O
primarily	O
affects	O
cattle	O
,	O
but	O
can	O
be	O
spread	O
between	O
other	O

,	O

humans	O
.	O

The	O
[	O
bacterial	O
pathogen	O
]	O
primarily	O
affects	O
the	O
respiratory	O
system	O
of	O
infected	O

,	O

can	O

to	O

the	O

.	O

,	O
[	O

of	O
]	O

in	O

.	O

2	O

(	O

4th	O
of	O
July	O
party	O
)	O
became	O
a	O
thank-you	O
for	O
friends	O
and	O
family	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
we	O
had	O
customers	O
come	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
family	O
has	O
not	O
decided	O
whether	O
they	O
will	O
hold	O
the	O
picnic	O
next	O
year	O
.	O

Leningrad	B-Province
Oblast	I-Province
is	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
Russian	O
regions	O
which	O
has	O
the	O
highest	O
incidence	O
of	O
tick-borne	B-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
.	O

From	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
the	O
season	O
this	O
year	O
(	O
April	O
2015	O
)	O
,	O
16	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
registered	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
3.2	O
times	O
more	O
than	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
period	O
of	O
last	O
year	O
(	O
2014	O
)	O
.	O

Among	O
the	O
cases	O
is	O
one	O
14-year-old	O
child	O
.	O

Epidemiologists	O
carry	O
out	O
constant	O
monitoring	O
of	O
the	O
situation	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
1st	O
6	O
months	O
of	O
2015	O
,	O
there	O
were	O
5066	O
cases	O
of	O
tick	O
bites	O
,	O
including	O
1220	O
children	O
.	O

Compared	O
with	O
the	O
same	O
period	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2014	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
bites	O
increased	O
by	O
67	O
per	O
cent	O
.	O

Cases	O
of	O
chikungunya	O
and	O
dengue	B-Virus
are	O
being	O
registered	O
in	O
the	O
Gabonese	O
provinces	O
of	O
Haut-Ogooue	B-Province
and	O
Ogooue-Lolo	B-Province
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
director	O
general	O
of	O
Health	O
of	O
Gabon	B-Country
,	O
Mr	O
Khouilla	O
,	O
``	O

of	O
616	O

by	O
the	O

Centre	O
for	O
Medical	O
Research	O
(	O

)	O
,	O
[	O
there	O

]	O
84	O
cases	O
of	O
dengue	B-Virus
virus	O
and	O
15	O

of	O

with	O
both	O

[	O
viruses	O
]	O
.	O

So	O

,	O

since	O

of	O
these	O

in	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

,	O

have	O

country	O

for	O

in	O

.	O

Dr	O
Khouilla	O
has	O
also	O
said	O
that	O
awareness	O
campaigns	O
are	O
carried	O
out	O
actively	O
on	O
the	O
risks	O
people	O
face	O
by	O
these	O

and	O
how	O
to	O

.	O

He	O

,	O

of	O

2	O

[	O
viruses	O
]	O
.	O

Heyuan	B-City
Municipal	O
Government	O
's	O
website	O
stated	O
that	O
the	O
1st	O
chicken	O
sample	O
positive	O
for	O
H7N9	O
came	O
from	O
a	O
poultry	O

in	O
Gaopugang	O
of	O
Yuancheng	B-City
District	O
in	O
Heyuan	O
.	O

2	O
farmers	O
,	O
1	O
technician	O
,	O
and	O
1	O
driver	O
have	O
been	O
observed	O

up	O
by	O

for	O
4	O

Heyuan	B-City
disease	O

.	O

All	O

in	O
the	O

flock	O
were	O
shipped	O
out	O
to	O
Dongguan	O
[	O
central	O
Guangdong	B-Province
]	O
for	O
sale	O
on	O
22	O
Apr	O
2013	O
.	O

When	O

from	O

visited	O
the	O
farm	O
for	O

,	O

were	O
no	O

remaining	O
on	O
site	O
.	O

Separately	O
,	O
between	O
3-5	O
May	O
2013	O
,	O

in	O

were	O

.	O

From	O

to	O
2	O

2013	O
,	O
Heyuan	B-City
municipal	O

for	O
H7N9	O
outbreaks	O
and	O

no	O

.	O

Heyuan	B-City
municipal	O
forestry	O
agencies	O
monitored	O
wild	O
birds	O
for	O
epidemic	O
sources	O
and	O
disease	O
in	O
7	O
provincial-level	O
reserves	O
and	O
found	O
no	O
abnormalities	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
no	O
reports	O
of	O
suspected	O
human	O
cases	O
of	O
H7N9	O
avian	O
influenza	O
in	O
Heyuan	B-City
.	O

There	O
had	O
been	O
24	O
cases	O
of	O
cryptosporidiosis	B-Disease
reported	O
since	O
the	O
start	O
of	O
the	O
year	O
[	O
2013	O
]	O
compared	O
with	O
none	O
for	O
the	O
same	O
period	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2012	O
]	O
,	O
Dr	O
Jonathan	O
Jarman	O
said	O
yesterday	O
.	O

``	O
Cryptosporidium	B-Virus
is	O
not	O
normally	O
a	O
serious	O
disease	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
dangerous	O
for	O
people	O
with	O
lowered	O
immunity	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Diarrhoea	O
and	O
tummy	O
cramps	O
for	O
2	O
weeks	O
are	O
n't	O
much	O
fun	O
.	O
''	O

``	O
Some	O
of	O
the	O
cases	O
were	O
children	O
but	O
half	O
were	O
adults	O
,	O
and	O
similar	O
outbreaks	O
have	O
also	O
been	O
seen	O
in	O
other	O
parts	O
of	O
New	B-Country
Zealand	I-Country
.	O

``	O
The	O
main	O
symptoms	O
are	O
diarrhoea	O
,	O
often	O
watery	O
,	O
stomach	O
cramps	O
,	O
lack	O
of	O
appetite	O
and	O
weight	O
loss	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Jarman	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
may	O
last	O
2	O
weeks	O
or	O
more	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
treatment	O
except	O
for	O
making	O
sure	O
that	O
the	O
patient	O
does	O
not	O
become	O
dehydrated	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
tiny	O
parasite	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
guts	O
of	O
birds	O
,	O
fish	O
,	O
reptiles	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
geckos	O
and	O
turtles	O
)	O
,	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
such	O
as	O
cattle	O
,	O
sheep	O
,	O
cats	O
and	O
dogs	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
passed	O
on	O
in	O
the	O
faeces	O
of	O
infected	O
animals	O
and	O
humans	O
.	O

The	O
usual	O
risk	O
factors	O
for	O
cryptosporidiosis	B-Disease
are	O
living	O
on	O
a	O
farm	O
and	O
having	O
contact	O
with	O
farm	O
animals	O
.	O

``	O
However	O
,	O
some	O
cases	O
in	O
Taranaki	B-Province
became	O
unwell	O
after	O
recently	O
swimming	O
in	O
a	O
pool	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Jarman	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
is	O
important	O
that	O
people	O
with	O
recent	O
tummy	O
bug	O
symptoms	O
stay	O
away	O
from	O
swimming	O
pools	O
,	O
otherwise	O
they	O
may	O
spread	O
the	O
illness	O
to	O
others	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
bugs	O
are	O
excreted	O
by	O
sick	O
people	O
for	O
several	O
weeks	O
once	O
they	O
have	O
recovered	O
from	O
the	O
illness	O
.	O

People	O
should	O
not	O
go	O
swimming	O
in	O
a	O
pool	O
if	O
they	O
have	O
diarrhoea	O
.	O

Wait	O
until	O
at	O
least	O
2	O
weeks	O
after	O
the	O
symptoms	O
have	O
gone	O
.	O

See	O
a	O
doctor	O
if	O
the	O
symptoms	O
are	O
severe	O
,	O
if	O
worried	O
or	O
if	O
the	O
illness	O
does	O
not	O
get	O
better	O
after	O
2-3	O
days	O
.	O

Wash	O
hands	O
thoroughly	O
after	O
contact	O
with	O
animals	O
or	O
animal	O
faeces	O
,	O
after	O
caring	O
for	O
people	O
with	O
diarrhoea	O
,	O
after	O
going	O
to	O
the	O
toilet	O
,	O
and	O
before	O
and	O
during	O
food	O
preparation	O
.	O

Use	O
plenty	O
of	O
soap	O
,	O
clean	O
under	O
your	O
fingernails	O
,	O
rinse	O
your	O
hands	O
well	O
and	O
dry	O
them	O
on	O
a	O
clean	O
towel	O
.	O

A	O
3rd	O
case	O
of	O
meningococcal	O
[	O
serogroup	O
]	O
C	O
has	O
occurred	O
in	O
Sarlat	B-City
in	O
3	O
weeks	O
.	O

This	O
time	O
it	O
is	O
a	O
municipal	O
officer	O
in	O
the	O
city	O
of	O
Sarlat	B-City
.	O

She	O
was	O
admitted	O
to	O
hospital	O
in	O
Perigueux	O
on	O
Friday	O
.	O

3	O
of	O
her	O
close	O
colleagues	O
have	O
received	O
preventive	O
treatment	O
.	O

The	O
Institute	O
for	O
Public	O
Health	O
Surveillance	O
will	O
investigate	O
why	O
these	O
3	O
cases	O
have	O
occurred	O
in	O
such	O
close	O
proximity	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
case	O
was	O
a	O
19-year-old	O
girl	O
in	O
the	O

of	O
Saint	O
Cyprien	O
,	O
next	O
a	O
young	O
child	O
,	O
in	O
Sarlat	B-City
;	O
and	O
now	O
a	O
Sarlat	O
commune	O
employee	O
on	O
Thursday	O
.	O

The	O
Institute	O
for	O
Public	O
Health	O
Surveillance	O
acknowledges	O
that	O
Dordogne	B-Province
is	O
facing	O
an	O
unusual	O
situation	O
.	O

This	O
department	O
[	O
Dordogne	B-Province
]	O
usually	O
sees	O
between	O
1	O
and	O
5	O
cases	O
per	O
year	O
,	O
but	O
according	O
to	O
Patrick	O
Rolland	O
,	O
the	O
head	O
of	O
the	O
intelligence	O
unit	O
of	O
the	O
INVS	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reason	O
to	O
worry	O
.	O

First	O
,	O
because	O
the	O
disease	O
can	O
only	O
be	O
transmitted	O
after	O
close	O
contact	O
,	O
through	O
coughing	O
or	O
even	O
saliva	O
.	O

Second	O
,	O
.	O

In	O
November	O
2017	O
,	O
the	O
Kentucky	B-Province
Department	O
for	O
Public	O
Health	O
(	O
DPH	O
)	O
identified	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
acute	B-Disease
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
.	O

The	O
increase	O
in	O
cases	O
observed	O
in	O
Kentucky	B-Province
was	O
well	O
over	O
the	O
10-year	O
average	O
of	O
reported	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
cases	O
.	O

Several	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
with	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
virus	O
strains	O
genetically	O
linked	O
to	O
outbreaks	O
in	O
California	O
,	O
Utah	O
,	O
and	O
Michigan	O
.	O

Similar	O
to	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
outbreaks	O
in	O
other	O
states	O
,	O
the	O
primary	O
risk	O
factors	O
remain	O
illicit	O
drug	O
use	O
and	O
homelessness	O
.	O

A	O
contaminated	O
food	O
source	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
identified	O
,	O
and	O
transmission	O
is	O
believed	O
to	O
be	O
occurring	O
through	O
person-to-person	O
contact	O
.	O

total	O
of	O
9	O

were	O

to	O

a	O

reports	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

In	O

County	I-City
,	O
3	O

.	O

In	O

,	O
one	O

of	O

of	O
rabies	B-Virus
in	O
animals	O
so	O
far	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2014	O
]	O
.	O

Pets	O

to	O
the	O
virus	O

.	O

has	O

the	O
family	O

is	O
no	O

.	O

,	O
the	O
most	O
important	O

against	O
this	O

virus	O
is	O
through	O

.	O

DHEC	O
sponsors	O
rabies	B-Virus
clinics	O
across	O
the	O
state	O

in	O

.	O

A	O
very	O
unpleasant	O
disease	O
[	O
mumps	B-Virus
]	O
has	O
reared	O
its	O
ugly	O
head	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
,	O
and	O

to	O

it	O
's	O

stop	O

.	O

Health	O
department	O
officials	O
in	O
Texas	B-Province
have	O
announced	O
that	O
cases	O
of	O
mumps	B-Virus
have	O
surged	O
to	O
a	O
20-year	O
high	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
may	O
have	O
been	O
a	O

of	O

on	O
South	B-City
Padre	I-City
Island	I-City
where	O
spring-breakers	O
are	O
celebrating	O
.	O

State	O
health	O
officials	O
have	O
reported	O
221	O
cases	O
of	O
mumps	B-Virus
so	O
far	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
most	O
since	O
1994	O
when	O
there	O
were	O
234	O
cases	O
.	O

Mumps	B-Virus
results	O
in	O
swollen	O
salivary	O
grands	O
,	O
swollen	O
testicles	O
,	O
low	O
fever	O
,	O
tiredness	O
,	O
and	O
muscle	O
aches	O
,	O
with	O
symptoms	O
emerging	O
about	O
16	O
--	O
18	O
days	O
after	O
exposure	O
.	O

Infections	O
of	O
mumps	B-Virus
dived	O
99	O
percent	O
since	O
a	O
vaccine	O
was	O
developed	O
and	O
released	O
in	O
1967	O
.	O

The	O
mumps	B-Virus
vaccine	O
protects	O
88	O
percent	O
of	O
people	O
who	O
are	O
fully	O
vaccinated	O
,	O
although	O
some	O
vaccinated	O

can	O
still	O
get	O
sick	O
if	O
exposed	O
.	O

``	O

.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
commonly	O
infects	O
wild	O
and	O
domesticated	O
herbivorous	O
mammals	O
that	O
ingest	O
or	O
inhale	O
the	O
spores	O
while	O
grazing	O
.	O

Diseased	O
animals	O
can	O
spread	O
anthrax	B-Disease
to	O
humans	O
,	O
either	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
inoculation	O
of	O
infected	O
blood	O
to	O
broken	O
skin	O
)	O
or	O
by	O
consumption	O
of	O
a	O
diseased	O
animal	O
's	O
flesh	O
.	O

One	O
student	O
(	O

)	O

Measles	B-Virus
,	O
or	O
rubeola	O
,	O
is	O
a	O
viral	O
infection	O
of	O
the	O
respiratory	O
system	O
.	O

Measles	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
very	O
contagious	O
disease	O
that	O
can	O
spread	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
mucus	O
and	O
saliva	O
.	O

Measles	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
leading	O
cause	O
of	O
death	O
in	O
children	O
.	O

Of	O
the	O
114	O

in	O
2014	O
,	O

age	O
of	O
5	O
,	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
(	O
WHO	O
)	O
said	O
.	O

African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
virus	O
(	O

)	O
has	O
broken	O
out	O
in	O
Chinsali	B-City
and	O
Isoka	B-City
districts	O
of	O
Muchinga	B-Province
Province	O

about	O
1580	O
pigs	O
.	O

African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
highly	O
contagious	O
haemorrhagic	O
disease	O
with	O
a	O
high	O
mortality	O
rate	O
in	O
pigs	O
.	O

that	O

1st	O
human	O
case	O
of	O
eastern	B-Virus
equine	I-Virus

(	I-Virus
EEE	I-Virus
)	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
infection	I-Disease
this	O
year	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
.	O

DHS	O
and	O
Eau	O
Claire	O

are	O
outside	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
a	O
release	O
,	O

news	O
of	O
a	O

EEE	O

Wisconsin	B-Province

with	O
the	O
virus	O
.	O

Officials	O
say	O
EEE	O
is	O
a	O
rare	O
but	O
potentially	O
fatal	O
disease	O
,	O
that	O
can	O
affect	O
people	O
of	O
all	O
ages	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
be	O
spread	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O
mosquito	O
.	O

Mosquitoes	O
acquire	O
EEE	O
virus	O
by	O
feeding	O
on	O
infected	O
birds	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
not	O
spread	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
or	O
between	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
.	O

EEE	O
in	O
Wisconsin	B-Province
was	O

in	O
2017	O
.	O

.	O

.	O

_Aedes_	O

also	O

in	O

to	O

their	O
freezes	O
[	O
?	O
]	O

and	O
cooler	O
houses	O
clean	O
and	O
treat	O
water	O
to	O
remain	O

from	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
is	O
an	O
acute	O
febrile	O
disease	O
which	O
normally	O
occurs	O
in	O
the	O
tropics	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
break-bone	O
fever	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
life-threatening	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
tested	O
and	O
approved	O
vaccine	O
for	O
the	O
dengue	B-Virus
flavivirus	O
.	O

Prevention	O
of	O
dengue	B-Virus
mainly	O
is	O
in	O
mosquito	O
control	O
.	O

Dengue	B-Virus
may	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
via	O
infected	O
blood	O
products	O
including	O
blood	O
transfusions	O
,	O
plasma	O
,	O
and	O
platelets	O
.	O

Outbreak	O
of	O
bovine	O
anthrax	B-Disease
in	O
General	B-City
Belgrano	I-City
,	O
Province	O
of	O
Buenos	B-Province
Aires	I-Province

.	O

2014	O
.	O

There	O
has	O

a	O

bluetongue	B-Virus
disease	I-Virus
reported	O
in	O
France	B-Country
in	O

weeks	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O

from	O
the	O

Organisation	O
(	O

)	O
.	O

.	O

be	O

because	O
of	O
it	O
,	O
the	O
report	O
shows	O
.	O

Bluetongue	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
which	O
affects	O
ruminant	O
animals	O
,	O
but	O
humans	O
are	O
n't	O
affected	O
,	O
nor	O
are	O
animal	O
products	O
or	O
meat	O
.	O

The	O
reported	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
occurred	O
mainly	O
in	O
the	O
centre	O
of	O
France	B-Country
,	O
with	O
the	O
Allier	B-City
,	O
Puy-De-Dome	B-City
,	O
and	O
Loire	O
regions	O
of	O
the	O
country	O
most	O
affected	O
.	O

The	O
extent	O
of	O
the	O
restriction	O
zone	O
in	O
France	B-Country
has	O
not	O
changed	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
these	O
cases	O
and	O
has	O
been	O
the	O
same	O
since	O
April	O
2016	O
.	O

Clinical	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
1	O
.	O

In	O
cattle	O
(	O
the	O
main	O

of	O
bluetongue	B-Disease
)	O
.	O

Infected	O
cattle	O
generally	O
not	O

any	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
but	O
occasionally	O
signs	O
can	O
include	O
:	O
swelling	O
and	O
ulcers	O
in	O
the	O
mouth	O
;	O
nasal	O
discharge	O
;	O
red	O
skin	O
and	O
eyes	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
blood	O
collecting	O
beneath	O
the	O
surface	O
;	O
swollen	O
teats	O
;	O

.	O

2	O
.	O

In	O
sheep	O
.	O

main	O

of	O
bluetongue	B-Disease

of	O

The	O
leishmaniases	O
are	O
a	O
group	O
of	O
diseases	O
caused	O
by	O
protozoan	O
parasites	O
from	O
more	O
than	O
20	O
_Leishmania_	O
species	O
.	O

These	O
parasites	O
are	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
by	O
the	O
bites	O
of	O
the	O
infected	O
female	O
phlebotomine	O
sandfly	O
--	O
a	O
tiny	O
,	O
only	O
2-3	O
mm	O
long	O
,	O
insect	O
vector	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
3	O
main	O
forms	O
of	O
leishmaniasis	B-Disease
:	O
cutaneous	O
,	O
visceral	O
or	O
kala-azar	O
,	O
and	O
mucocutaneous	O
.	O

The	O
President	O
of	O
the	O
Bio-Bio	O
Cordillera	O
territory	O
called	O
that	O
rural	O
sectors	O
not	O
be	O
stigmatized	O
this	O
season	O
due	O
to	O
hanta	O
[	O
virus	O
]	O
cases	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
because	O
so	O
far	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2010	O
]	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
4	O
cases	O
,	O
3	O
of	O
which	O
were	O
fatal	O
,	O
and	O
one	O
not	O
at	O
risk	O
of	O
death	O
,	O
and	O
[	O
information	O
on	O
]	O
a	O
5th	O
suspected	O
was	O
released	O
in	O

hours	O
.	O
